story:
What is Peak District Through The Lens?

It's a photography guidebook that will guide you in and around the Peak District on how and where to take the most beautiful landscape photographs. The book was previously successfully funded on Indiegogo in April 2015 and went on to become the most reviewed Peak District publication on Amazon with over 80 five-star reviews. In just over 18 months, the book had completely sold out.

Why I need your help?

Peak District Through The Lens is my proudest achievement and I'm super happy it was such a success. I had considered to move on as I had more than achieved what I originally set out to. However, the demand for the book is still very high, with people emailing, asking me at talks and just in general where they can get a copy and when would I be reprinting it. However, the only way I can make this happen is with your help. As you can imagine, a book of this size is costly to print, especially at the high quality I require. So I've decided to set up this Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign to try and help raise some of the funds to allow a reprint to be ordered. 

Why choose my book:

The book has been very well received everywhere and I still hear so many comments about how it's the go-to book. The reviews speak for themselves (See down below) and it's no wonder the book sold out so quickly. You will be buying a product that is tried, tested and trusted. In fact, the only critique about the book that has been pointed out is it's size, somewhat of a tomb! This can only mean you're getting a super high-quality book jam packed with information.

Included in the book:

400 Pages

Over 300 viewpoints within 80+ locations. A comprehensive guide to photographing in and around the Peak District. Through the seasons and in all weather.

Over 350 high-quality photos showcasing stunning locations. 

Planning - Shooting - Processing, technical section to help improve your photography.

Tips and advice throughout.

Detailed, hill shaded OS styled mapping.

Detailed and clear directions, best times of year/day and accessibility information.

Key information panel to quickly provide you with the information you need to plan your trip.

Wheelchair friendly viewpoints marked.

Photographic Walks

Quick reference table to refer to so you can get out there as quick as you wish.

Photographer? Walker? Sightseer? The book is aimed at everyone. You can just be starting out in photography or you could be well into your game. It's designed to aid you from teaching photography to revealing some locations you may not realise exist. It really doesn't matter what camera you have, its about getting you out there to capture photographs as memories to keep. 

Photographic walks are also included, to allow you to make full days out with the camera or you may even just be a hill walker wanting to witness some of these awe inspiring views.

The man behind the book and camera:

James lives on the outskirts of the Peak District in the popular town of Matlock. He is an award winning & professional photographer with both 'A Kinder Wonderland' and 'The Last Push', two Peak District images winning major competitions. For years, James has explored the Peak District's nooks and crannies. Photographing the popular spots, through to the hidden gems he has sought out over the years. Now he wishes to share them with you. James has also worked for Blacks Outdoors, Monarch Airlines and Peter Storm.

Variety in The Peak District

The Peak District has an abundance of variety to offer. The book will take you to all the locations and show you the different types of photographs you can take. From grand landscapes to intimate landscapes, through sun, snow, rain, different kinds of subjects. Showing you hidden gems and all the classics.

The offers:

I have decided to keep the offers simple. For the first-time ever, I'll be discounting the book to £20. The RRP is £23.95. All books with all offers will be signed.

The second option is to buy the book as well as the eBook version (normally £13.95) for £22. This allows you to keep a copy on your phone/tablet to take into the field, while keeping your copy nice and fresh for you to peruse over at home. It certainly isn't known for being the lightest of books!

The third option is limited. I am running two day long group workshops in the Peak District for four people per course. Usually, the price of such a workshop alone is £95, but I will include the book and eBook for just £100. 

The last and final option is a 1-2-1 session with me in the Peak District, allowing you to pick my brains and visit some locations of the book. These are usually priced at £140, but I'll include the book and eBook for the same price. I will only offer 2 of these at this fantastic price.

All of the perks value work out greater than the value of the book!

The book and the layout:

Working with a professional Graphic Designer who is also a photographer, the design has been well thought out to provide both the best layout possible while also not restricting the images used. It was decided early on it had to be clear, well designed and with easy to read text. Visual information was key where possible along with class leading mapping. A conscious choice was made to ensure that the book adhered to a standard photographic ratio to ensure images would not be cropped, giving you the full experience. Most importantly of all was that the photographs would come first and the design would compliment them rather than being restrictive. We feel after many painstaking hours that we have come up with what we set out to achieve.

What has been done so far?

Having previously been printed. the book is ready to send to the printers. It has been updated in small amounts from the first run, with new, fresh images and a couple of corrections. 

When will it be released?

Providing funding is met, I aim to have the book delivered by the first week of September. However, choose the eBook deal and you'll receive a copy of the eBook as soon as funding is met, ensuring you can get out there as soon as possible!

Reviews:

 You can read the full range of Amazon reviews here.

“The book is a great overall guide to the Peak District. Very few books go into this much depth and if you’re visiting you’ll definitely find things of interest near you."

“Overall, this is the only book that a photographer interested in photographing the Peak District should need to buy.”

-------

Any further questions please do not hesitate to contact admin@jamesgphotography.co.uk

story:
I am an Autistic Photographer, I have completed an wide range of photographic qualifications including: 

July 2010 BETECH National Diploma in Art and Design (Photography) Distinction Distinction Distinction

June 2012 Foundation Degree in Lens Based Photo Media- University of Lincoln (place of study New College Stamford)

September 2012 HE Celebration of Excellence The Chair of Governess Award for Inclusiveness. 

June 2014 Bachelor of Arts in Contemporary Lens Media - University of Lincoln

November 2014 Associate of The Royal Photographic Society

Currently studying Masters of Photography - Falmouth University.

For My Final major project I am showcasing the experience as an autistic individual. I have enough good quality work to produce a limited run of photography book, from my project quite hour. However I need to raise the funds for this. This is why I am running this campaign. The idea is to raise the funds to pay for the book to be published.

story:
Photographic Excursions in Southern Africa.

I am busy with my next nature photography book project and require partial funding to make the project a reality.

The idea for this book project is to create a compilation of nature photography that I captured over more than a decade on my excursions into Southern Africa. I also want to return to the area where it all started many years ago, and capture additional photographs of one of the most beautiful places on earth.

Namaqualand and the Richtersveld.

Namaqualand is a semi-desert region situated inland on the West Coast of the Northern Cape Province in South Africa. It is known for its spectacular annual wild flowers in early Spring (August to September). 

The Richtersveld is situated above Namaqualand on the North Western border of South Africa and Namibia.

The Richtersveld Transfrontier Park is an UNESCO World Heritage site due to the biodiversity that is found in this unique Mountain Desert. Many species of succulent plants occur nowhere else on earth.

My background and experience:

I earn a living as a 3D Visual Effects Artist in the Film and Television Industry. My passion for photography started in Art School when I studied Graphic Design and had Photography as a subject. As I live in South Africa, unspoilt wide open spaces and breathtaking wildlife is always just a road trip away.

Even though photography is more of a passion than a job for me, my photographs are widely published Internationally. Companies and Organizations that published my photographs include National Geographic, The Smithsonian, UNESCO, Cambridge University, Princeton University, Oxford University, Kew Botanic Garden and many other mainstream publishers. My two previous books are currently on sale at Amazon, Apple iStore and Blurb.

   | National Geographic Magazine | NatGeo News | Amazon | iStore | Blurb | 

Due to my Graphic Design background, I am able to do the book Layout and Design myself. This will keep costs down and allow me complete creative control.

How the funds will be used:

As I've been going on photographic excursions in Southern Africa for many years, I am not new to planning this kind of trip. From experience I have learnt what is involved logistically when you take the road less travelled, and travel on the back routes in remote areas with hardly any infrastructure or people. This is actually part of the appeal and always leads to adventure, unexpected discovery and great photographic opportunities.

  • Fuel:

On trips of this nature over vast distances, fuel costs have become one of the largest cost contributing factors. As infrastructure is sparse, one needs to have additional fuel and other essential provisions with you.

  • Equipment Rental:

I have made substantial investments in camera equipment over the years, and experience has taught me that it is not wise to change lenses too often in these dusty desert environments. I usually take my older backup camera along with a different lens on. To keep costs down, I simply rent an additional lens for the duration of the trip.

  • Vehicle:

All the great photo opportunities are a bit off the beaten track. For most part my SUV is sufficient, but in some of the off-road mountain passes it is crucial to have a high clearance 4x4 vehicle with a low-range gearbox. I will need to rent a suitable vehicle to complete the last section of the trip through the rough terrain of the Richtersveld.

  • Pre-Print Costs:

At least two test prints of the book is required before final sign-off.

Estimated book completion:

  • Early 2015

High Quality Printing:

As with my previous books, I am planning to self publish via Blurb again. This has the added benefit of allowing me to use high quality printing techniques and photographic quality paper that is typically not an option when one takes the high volume mass printing route. High quality printing at lower volumes make the book more exclusive, but does add additional cost at the printing stage.

If a publisher of high quality books can persuade me otherwise, I will consider a more traditional publishing route as it will lower the book's selling price.

Book Format:

  • Low volume Hard Cover Coffee Table Book.
  • Signed Limited Edition Hard Cover Coffee Table Book.
  • eBook.

The role of Sponsors:

On these trips I "rough it" and camp when possible to keep costs down. There are great opportunities for Companies that supply Photographic and Outdoor Camping equipment to get involved. I am open to any form of sponsorship deal that will help make the project a success.


Time to get out of the city and go where the air is clean, and the streets have no names.

Martin P Heigan

story:
About/Mission:

Frontside SF is an independently owned publication that debuted in January 2013 with the goal of showcasing great skateboarding and amazing skateboard photography. Our mission is to promote up-and-coming skaters and photographers alike, and to enrich the already amazing Bay Area skate scene by introducing a high-quality publication, free of charge.

While it is true that established Bay Area talents like Jack Given, Tony Manfre, and Cody Chapman have all graced the pages of Frontside, it is important to note that we are a purely submission-based magazine; this is to ensure that local rippers, and the talented people who photograph and film them, have an accessible, high-quality platform from which they can display their images, broadcast their video edits, and share their stories.

As of now, we have several thousand readers online from all around the globe and printed copies are consumed within a week of distribution.

Why Indiegogo?

In order to keep the magazine free, while expanding to meet our overwhelming demands, we need your help. Our cost breakdown is simple: 83% of our funds go towards printing, and 17% go towards merchandise, shipping, and editorial costs. The more we raise, the more we print. With your help, we hope to expand to a healthy, sustainable size that will lower our per-unit printing costs, attract more advertisers, and ensure production.

Specifications:

The magazine is a perfect bound 8.25” square with a luster cover and a quality lightweight cardstock interior. It is printed in Santa Cruz, CA, a landmark in the history of skateboarding and a major hub of distribution for the magazine.

Each issue of Frontside SF is free to view and/or download from our website. Printed versions, though limited to a couple hundred copies per issue, are available for free in skateshops, bookstores, and art galleries in San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley, San Jose, Santa Cruz, and beyond.

Video Credits

Filmed and edited by the talented Luke Lasley. Original music by Zachary C.S. Titles by Patrick Sean Gibson. Skateboarders featured: Evan Collisson, Jarod Taber, Dan DeSanto, Charlie DiMascio, Robert Pawlikowski, Dan Harper, Ryan Abraham, and Nick Barwick.

story:
Short Summary

  Hey, my name is Guy Raivitz and I'm a photographer (among other things) from Israel. Currently I live in Canada where I did my MFA at Ryerson University. In the fall my family and I are going back home – hopefully with this book in full production.    

  Hard and Stubborn Love is a photographic journey in the turbulent Israeli reality of the mid 2000′s. It is my first book project and it took more then five year to complete it; in fact when I started working on this project I didn’t know it was going to be a book.

 At that time I was taking a lot of pictures however I was not satisfied, I felt I was doing the same thing all over again. My frustration grew even more because in my work as a photojournalist I was exposed to many aspects of the Israeli society but my personal work did not show my ideas and my thoughts in the face of these events and realities.

One day, on two color films I found new pictures; they were different from my previous work and interesting for me to look at. I continued to follow their line and with time I was able to understand the real issues that interested me. The conceptual aspect of the work also continued to develop and I could see my ideas reflecting in the work. After about a year the work has accumulated I realised I was working on a book. A year later, on my way to a wedding in the Galilee I stopped my car and got out to take a few pictures of a small valley, when I got back in the car I felt the work was done.   

You can see a selection of the work on my web site at: http://raivitz.com/a-decade-in-israel/hard-and-stubborn-love/hard-and-stubborn-love/#more-270

Or you can see a PDF of the book at: http://issuu.com/raivitz

Right now I have a proposal from Jovis-publishers to publish the book (in English) but I need to raise the money to make it happen. Design, preparation of digital files, lithography, copy-editing, pre-printing proofing, production, shipment and fees - 30K is the real number.

Purchasing one of the perks will help me to realize this book - if you want to help but can’t afford it right now please share this campaign with people you know.

Questions, coments, ideas and anything else please send me an email

Thank you, Guy

story:
Hello my name is Jodi-Tatiana Charles, and I am the host of Minding Your Business with Jodi-Tatiana (MYB), a podcast that empowers small businesses and startups to educate their peers via their personal stories and business journey as well as providing advice on how to grow in our new normal.

In 2020, the number of small businesses in the US reached 31.7 million, making up nearly all (99.9 percent) US businesses.

When the coronavirus​ hit, small business​ owners in the U.S. and the world over​ were forced to navigate new territory and make difficult decisions in order to stay relevant and productive – from downsizing and reducing staff, pursuing new revenue streams, and learning to move all operations online.

Innovators and entrepreneurs constitute the majority of small business owners that have been directly impacted by the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic.

An additional obstacle to the success of small businesses is the difficulty they have attaining earned media, i.e. publicity gained through media relation efforts as opposed to paid advertising – other than social platforms there are few avenues small businesses can pursue in order to grow consumer awareness in an in-depth format.

                   

Minding Your Business Podcast, A Pandemic Lifeline

MYB is an innovative podcast that provides a crucial resource for small businesses of all sizes at any stage in a variety of industries around the world that recognize the benefit of sharing their stories and strategies in order to adapt and stay ahead of the curve.

I launched this podcast at the start of the pandemic to empower this community to engage with a wider audience utilizing a platform that provides them with a voice that most traditional media does not provide.

In 15 months, I have interviewed over 175 small businesses globally with many more in que ready and willing to share how they have/are thriving during this historical period in our lives.

I interview owners, service providers, and creators, leveraging their insightful experiences in unique episodes ranging from 40 to 90 minutes in length, successfully connecting them with local, national and international listeners.

As of 8/2021 our guest have come from...

USA

California

Georgia

Illinois

Las Vegas

Louisiana

Maine

Maryland

Massachusetts

Montana

New Jersey

New York

North Carolina

Ohio

Oregon

Pennsylvania

Rhode Island

Texas

Virginia

Washington DC

 

 

COUNTRIES

Bulgaria

Cuba

Ethiopia

Ghana

Haiti

Iceland

Israel

Italy

Kenya

Mexico

Morocco

New Zealand

Nigeria

Poland

Portugal

Slovak Republic

Spain

Switzerland

United Arab Emirates

United Kingdom

United States of America

Zimbabwe

 

 

 

 

A Few Messages From Some Of Our Guest

 

 

  

Thanks, Jodi! This was one of my favorite interviews.

Elnaz Sarraf, Founder & CEO (California) ROYBI Robot | TIME Best Invention | Forbes Technology Council Official Member

Thank you again, Jodi! I appreciated our conversation. To that end, I encourage everyone to watch your other interviews as well. Great perspective on a wide variety of people in very interesting professions and businesses!

Mark Molloy, Principal (Massachusetts) Cascade Strategies, LLC

Jodi I enjoyed our conversation so much! Thanks for having me.

Oriana Turley, CMSRN, BSN, Founder (Montana) Medicine Mountain Scrub Company LLC

Thank you, Jodi, for taking the time to really dig deep into the personal story behind my journey.

Keith Kirkland, Cofounder (New York) WearWorks

Thank you so much for having me Jodi! It was an incredible opportunity to reflect, laugh and share a bit of this crazy journey of entrepreneurship! ?

Saron Mechale, Founder (Ethiopia) goTeff Superfoods, Inc.

Thanks for the nice and warmfull conversation, it was a pleasure to meet you again ?

João Melo, Co-Founder & Hardware/Firmware Developer (Portugal) Open Grow

Jodi, no one has ever given me this much time to talk. Thank you so much.

Karl Birgir Björnsson, ceo/co-founder (Iceland) Hefring Marine

 

Why MYB podcast and Why Now?

        

According to the World Trade Organization, small- and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) represent over 90% of total business population and 60-70% of its employment, in addition to constituting 55% of GDP in developed countries; they do not just contribute to the global economy – they ARE the economy (World Trade Report 2016/2020)

       

Nearly three out of every four podcast listeners in the US say they tune in to grow their knowledge base (Statista, 2019)

The Importance of Representation

Women represent roughly half of podcast listeners nationwide, but an overwhelming majority of the top-charting shows across the four major podcast platforms are hosted by men.

In fact, men hosted or co-hosted 79% of the most-downloaded or listened-to podcasts, according to an analysis by TheWrap.

Hosting MYB is a testament to the fact that women are closing the gap in podcasting. The increase in female listening is especially encouraging for podcasters since women podcast listeners tend to listen to more podcasts than guys. Women spend a lot more time with podcasts. The data shows they listen to podcasts for an average of 7.3 hours per week versus 5.9 for men.

Women, on the daily, spend more time than men making economic decisions for their families -- from consumer goods to services. Women hold crucial purchasing power. In fact, Women drive 70-80 percent of all consumer purchasing, through a combination of their buying power and influence.

          

Partner with Us and Join the Conversation

Your kind contribution to our campaign will allow us to reach our goal of $50K+, With these funds, we will be able to build a powerful team (talented producer, creative designer, and savvy public relations) dedicated solely to the podcast. allowing MYB to reach an additional 185 entrepreneurs and innovators for up to one additional year.

Any and all donations are appreciated to help us reach our mission of supporting small businesses! To thank you for your donation, some of our perks include an MYB T-shirt, mug, bucket hat, Yeti Tumbler, marketing consultation, Branding Package, and a sponsorship opportunity for your business. 

*** Introduce us to a potential sponsor that believes in the growth of small businesses and startups.


The Impact

With over 31.7 million small businesses in the United States as of 2020, you would think that small businesses are largely represented in the media. Unfortunately, that is not the case. The mass amount of small businesses never get their chance in the spotlight because other podcasts and media channels only interview those that are extremely successful. The smaller organizations, with their uncovered journeys and wisdom, are left in the dark with no representation. The Minding Your Business Podcast gives small business leaders the opportunity to share their stories, struggles, successes, advice, and perspective. 

If you tune in to the podcast, you can find a lesson in every episode through the variety of personalities and industries interviewed. Minding Your Business Podcast is all about supporting our small business owners, whether they are tuning in for guidance or getting their time in the spotlight from the interview. We have impacted many leaders in small businesses thus far, but we want to impact even more businesses. We have just scratched the surface of wisdom and lesson to be learned from the 31.7 million small businesses in the U.S. Help the MYB Podcast reach more businesses that need our support by donating today.

Risk and Challenges 

I have enjoyed so many aspects of starting this much needed podcast, being able to share so many amazing stories of resilience during the pandemic has been therapeutic. With all the good, also come the challenging. I never imaged what was entailed with the production of a proper podcast. Running anything alone can be overwhelming. Jodi -Tatiana has been interviewing strong leaders for over a year now, and with more innovators and entrepreneurs to interview every day, managing an entire podcast channel has become challenging. 

As the channel has expanded, guests on the podcast have expressed their gratitude for allowing them to share their stories and brand their business on the podcast. Many guests have even gained clients from their exposure on the channel. The COVID pandemic predominantly hit small businesses, so the MYB Podcast uses its platform to support and share the stories of the very people who prospered through tough times. Help us overcome our challenge of running the podcast alone, and allow us to enlighten even more listeners and promote more small businesses by donating to our campaign. 

                  

Support Us In More Ways Than One

Share this campaign with your personal and professional communities and submit the name of your favorite innovator, entrepreneur, and small business to be interviewed.

Exposure of this campaign is especially important in our mission to support small businesses and startups. With you by our side, we hope to reach many more businesses, supporters and achieve our financial goals to keep the stories of Minding Your Business podcast as a global resource of inspiration.

             

Download to listen on your podcast platforms

Subscribe and watch on Youtube

percent) US businesses.When the coronavirus​ hit, small business​ owners in the U.S. and the world over​ were forced to navigate new territory and make difficult decisions in order to stay relevant owners that have been directly impacted by the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic.An additional obstacle to the success of small businesses is the difficulty they have attaining earned media, story:
Bring Season 2 of

Death by Dying to life!

Why hello there. Welcome to our humble fundraiser. Stay a while, sip some pink moscato, feed your Button-Eyed Raven the tears of the innocent, and let us tell you a story...

~ NEW STRETCH GOALS ~

Chance to Have Your Fanfiction Read on Livestream ($9,000): The cast of Death by Dying will perform YOUR Death by Dying fanfiction on a one-of-a-kind livestream! If we hit this goal, you can submit your fanfiction for a chance to have it read by the voices of Crestfall. What have you always wanted to hear the Obituary Writer say? This is bound to be one heckuva doozy.

Special Backers-Only Episode ($10,000): Go on an exclusive adventure in Crestfall! Every backer, no matter how much they donate, will receive a copy of this special episode about Leroy Jones spilling sweet tea and hot gossip about his fellow townsfolk.

Hollywood Composer to Score Season 2 Two-Part Finale ($12,000): Meeting this goal means we’ll be able to get one of our favorite Hollywood composers to score our epic two-part finale. Being able to take our soundtrack to the next level would be a dream come true, and elevate our finale in true quirky Death by Dying fashion.

Bally-Go-Backward Boys Album (UPDATED: $13,000): It’s time to dance erratically! We will make an entire album of hit songs from the most popular and only band in Crestfall: The Bally-Go-Backward Boys. This album will have everything. Unnerving folksy anthems, upbeat but oddly threatening boogies, complete with chart-topping ominous bops like “I Love You, I Wanna Wear Your Skin” and “My Baby Poisoned Me By the Riverside”.

Winter Solstice Special Episode (UPDATED: $14,000): If you unlock this stretch goal, we will release a special Death by Dying episode for the holidays! Find out what happens in Crestfall when it’s time to celebrate the Winter Frolic and the terrifying Moose Mother comes to town to give presents to all the children of Idaho.

Valentine’s Day Special Episode (UPDATED: $15,000): Love is in the air! Severed hearts in jam jars will be beating faster than ever during this sweeping, romantic Crestfallen tale from dollar store romance novelist Janette Merriweather. Who is the Obituary Writer yearning for this time?

Podcast Collab Special Episode (UPDATED: $18,000): That’s right. You heard it here first. If you can get us to $25,000, we will release a Death by Dying episode written in collaboration with your favorite fiction podcast. Vote for what podcast you would love to see us collaborate with, and we’ll do our darndest to make it happen. A crossover, original story – The possibilities are endless!

Death by Dying Short Film (UPDATED: $20,000): Darkness! Camera! Action! If you loved our Indiegogo trailer, wait until we produce an entire short film featuring the cast of Death by Dying investigating a classic mystery in Crestfall, Idaho – now on the big screen. Or little screen, depending on where you’re watching it.

~ About ~

Death by Dying is an award-winning fiction podcast about the Obituary Writer of Crestfall, Idaho investigating a series of strange and mysterious deaths… when he is supposed to simply be writing obituaries. Season 1 was a whirlwind of murderous farmers, man-eating cats, and haunted bicycles. And yes, we even Kicked Ass for the Lord (cue guitar riff). Now we need your help to continue the adventure...

Now, the Obituary Writer is looking for Charlotte, but he isn’t the only one searching for answers. Mia Jasper, criminal law student, is following her own curious trail of clues surrounding the most recent string of deaths. From eldritch potato gods to a new pastor in town, this season is nothing short of a doozy. And who’s that mystery man making O.W. blush? It’s up to our beloved Crestfallens to uncover the truth.

~ Our Goal ~

We’d love a trip to the Bahamas. And Evan wants a golden 1932 portable Underwood typewriter. Oh, for the production? Right. Season 2 will consist of 8 episodes, with over 25 new characters joining the fun! To make this possible, we are asking for $7,000. As a team of two, we need your help to hit the ground running.

Our #1 goal is for all of our hard working cast and crew to be paid fairly for their time and talents. From coordinating remote recording sessions to keep things COVID-safe, to the countless hours we spend bringing this show to your earholes through writing and editing, we have quite the journey ahead of us. But with your help, new obituaries from Crestfall will be here before you know it. We pride ourselves in producing a professional audio fiction show independently. In order to make that a reality, we need the dubloons to keep the lanterns lit and our artists and performers fairly compensated.

If you're not in a position to donate to this fundraiser, help us by spreading the word. Tell someone who doesn't yet listen to the show about it. Let the world know there is a fundraiser. Retweet, share, or spread the word in your own way to help us make Season 2 possible.

~ We Love This Show ~

It has been a massive and meaningful part of our lives for the past three years, and we want to create this next season with the care that it deserves. 

We have traveled from coast to coast to meet audience members at conventions. We’ve been blown away by artwork and fanfiction inspired from our show. We have been overwhelmed by the support for these absurd obituaries, and are humbled by what our stories have meant to you all.
 

Death by Dying is here to bring you laughter, catharsis, and healing. It is a place to find joy in the absurd and comfort through grief and hardship. Thank you for everything. Let’s tell some more stories from the strange, little town of Crestfall, Idaho, and its modestly handsome Obituary Writer.

~ The Creators ~

Evan Gulock (left): Writer, Voice of the Obituary Writer, Social Media Manager, and Music Supervisor. Evan studied Film at Columbia College Chicago with a concentration in screenwriting. He has always been deeply inspired by dark whimsy, from the work of Edward Gorey to the delightfully grim tales of A Series of Unfortunate Events. His passion for Death by Dying came from a desire to tell a story that blended humor and horror while still having an emotional core to its characters. He enjoys long walks on the beach in the middle of a thunderstorm.

Niko Gerentes (right): Producer, Casting / Vocal Director, Recording Engineer, Sound Designer, The Man of a Thousand Voices. Since he was a spritely young man, Niko has been tinkering with digital audio workstations to create EDM and comedy rap songs about Pumpkin Spice Lattes. He created an Interdisciplinary degree between Radio, Sound For Cinema, Music Recording, and studied Voiceover at Columbia College Chicago. He currently works at a voiceover recording studio in Los Angeles helping out on video games like Gears 5, Astral Chain, and the Final Fantasy series.

story:
What is The ADHD Melly Show?

 

Let’s help millions of people living with neurodiversity to accept themselves and thrive!

 

I have ADHD, and I decided that it won't define me or my success. That’s why I created the ADHD Melly Show! I needed a safe space where I could share my successes as well as my daily struggles. But mostly I wanted to show the world that neurodiversity is a real, and success is possible all the same.

Each week, I have the pleasure to sit down and speak with people that have seen success, share their story, and hear their tips on how they made their dream life possible. I know that together, we can make a difference in this world.

I still can't believe how much I have grown during this process and just how many people we have inspired. I know that The ADHD Melly Show will improve greatly over time, and I do believe that together, we can inspire even more people.

Of course, we can't do it alone! That's why I created this Indiegogo campaign: we are stronger together.

I know that our show can succeed, and so far I have invested my time and money to make it work. But I'm reaching the point where the upkeep of the show isn't sustainable, so I need your help for the show to reach its full potential!

 

Where is your money going?

 

 

The T-Shirt

For each contribution of more than $75, we will send you a free unisex t-shirt!

The VIP Sponsorship

For contributions $350 or more, you'll receive the previous rewards (t-shirt and postcard), but we'll also shout out your services or product at the beginning of an episode, and your logo will visible on the overlay of the show!

 

How did we choose our goal?

 

The ADHD Melly Show is still a new online series, and we are learning the best way to share our stories with the world. We really want to be realistic when setting our goals!

Our goal amount will allow The ADHD Melly Show to cover the basic expense for the next 4 months. You will be a partner of our success and we will never be able to thank you enough! 

 

What if we don't reach our goal?

We do understand your concern! Firstly, remember that you are not donating, but contributing in the project.

Every donation, big or small, will be used to improve the show! We believe in this project and will continue to finance it as long as possible. With Indiegogo, we have the possibility to withdraw funds even if we don't meet the entire goal.

At the end of the day, our ultimate goal is to have your support on the project. Every penny counts.

What if we exceed our goal?

We have big dreams of renting a studio, using it invite our guests over to record and film the show. We will use the excess money to invest even more in the success of the show!.

 

Testimonial

 

Follow The ADHD Melly Show
story_txt:
What is The ADHD Melly Show?
 

Let’s help millions of people living with neurodiversity to accept themselves and thrive!
 
I have ADHD, and I decided that it won't define me or my success. That’s why I created the ADHD Melly Show! I needed a safe space where I could share my successes as well as my daily struggles. But mostly I wanted to show the world that neurodiversity is a real, and success is possible all the same.
Each week, I have the pleasure to sit down and speak with people that have seen success, share their story, and hear their tips on how they made their dream life possible. I know that together, we can make a difference in this world.
I still can't believe how much I have grown during this process and just how many people we have inspired. I know that The ADHD Melly Show will improve greatly over time, and I do believe that together, we can inspire even more people.
Of course, we can't do it alone! That's why I created this Indiegogo campaign: we are stronger together.
I know that our show can succeed, and so far I have invested my time and money to make it work. But I'm reaching the point where the upkeep of the show isn't sustainable, so I need your help for the show to reach its full potential!

 

Where is your money going?
 


 
The T-Shirt
For each contribution of more than $75, we will send you a free unisex t-shirt!


The VIP Sponsorship
For contributions $350 or more, you'll receive the previous rewards (t-shirt and postcard), but we'll also shout out your services or product at the beginning of an episode, and your logo will visible on the overlay of the show!
 
How did we choose our goal?
 
The ADHD Melly Show is still a new online series, and we are learning the best way to share our stories with the world. We really want to be realistic when setting our goals!
Our goal amount will allow The ADHD Melly Show to cover the basic expense for the next 4 months. You will be a partner of our success and we will never be able to thank you enough! 
 
What if we don't reach our goal?
We do understand your concern! Firstly, remember that you are not donating, but contributing in the project.
Every donation, big or small, will be used to improve the show! We believe in this project and will continue to finance it as long as possible. With Indiegogo, we have the possibility to withdraw funds even if we don't meet the entire goal.
At the end of the day, our ultimate goal is to have your support on the project. Every penny counts.
What if we exceed our goal?
We have big dreams of renting a studio, using it invite our guests over to record and film the show. We will use the excess money to invest even more in the success of the show!.
 
Testimonial

 

Follow The ADHD Melly Show

story:
Short Summary

What is Meteor City?

Meteor City is a sci-fi character-driven audio drama about a young woman’s return home. 

In Season 1, Bianca Diaz returns home to Detroit, Michigan 10 years after a freak meteor impact nearly leveled the city. A lot has changed since she’s been gone, including herself. No longer recognizing the city she once loved, Bianca is determined to help out those around as much as she can. But this comes at a price.

You can listen to Season 1 of Meteor City on Spotify, Google Play, Apple Podcasts, YouTube, or wherever you listen to podcasts. 

Who We Are:

Wrightwood Studios is a multimedia creative studio run by Madelyn, Ernesto, and Angel. 

At our core, we are a sibling team: a writer, composer, videographer but you see us as you want to see us, in the simplest terms and the most convenient definitions... a millennial nuisance, a snowflake, and a bad hombre (bonus points if you get the reference).

Together, we're creating art with truthful representation because it matters.

What We Need & What You Get:

We LOVE making this show and need your help to continue making it.  With funds raised we will:

  • Ensure that our incredible cast is compensated for their time and talent. 
  • Our funders (that’s you) receive dope perks and feel appreciated
  • Artists and musicians are compensated for their creative work including music featured in the show and commissioned art
  • We, the creators are fairly compensated for our creative efforts

The Impact:

When we created Meteor City, we did so for one reason and one reason only: to tell a story that many of us live. A story of navigating gentrification, the weight of trauma, and the desire to make a difference. With that, we set out to showcase the immense talent of BIPOC voices in the fiction space, and show that diversity and authentic representation SHOULD be the industry standard. We are committed to that mission. With funds raised will continue to tell this story and support BIPOC actors. 

Risks & Challenges:

Creating and producing this show brings us so much joy but it isn’t cheap to make. We value our wonderful cast and want to continue making a quality production that can be enjoyed by all.  This story is far from over and funds secured from this campaign will ensure that we can keep telling it. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

As indie creators, we understand times are tough and pennies gotta be pinched. We know our goal is large but we have no doubt we can reach it together. We’ve seen the power of this community when it shows up for one and another. If you can’t donate, no worries, you can always...

  • Share our campaign on social media 
  • Leave Meteor City a review
  • Recommend our show to someone who might enjoy it
  • Continue to advocate for BIPOC creators and donate to other campaigns

We appreciate your support in all of its forms.  Thank you for checking our campaign, and for your support. It means the world to us, and so do you. 

 

- Wrightwood Fam, Madelyn, Ernesto, and Angel

 

 

 

Praise for Meteor City:

"You'll want to stick with her through this tale."  - 1A, WAMU - NPR

 

4 Audio Verse Award Nominations  (2019):

  • Best Writing of a New Dramatic Production
  • Best Audio Engineering of a New Dramatic Production
  • Best Performance of a Leading Role in a New Production
  • Best Original Composition for a New Dramatic Production

story:
Thank you! We get to continue paying actors, editing audio, and having a website!

Anything extra goes to less exciting but necessary things like ads and insurance and phone bills! Let's fund the boring stuff!

 

Short Summary

Written by Kids is a podcast where short stories written by kids get performed by professional actors, and brought to life with music and sound effects!

You'll also hear inspiring interviews with the young authors.

These kids are already talented, unique, and just as important as adults - now we want to make them feel that way.

What We Need & What You Get

Your support will go directly to paying professional actors, audio software and hardware, and other subscriptions (like our website)!

We will produce 52 episodes over the next year.

We need

Voice actors: $1500

Website (where families submit their kids' writing): $300

Audio software and other subscriptions: $200

Total: $2,000

You get

In addition to a delightful podcast full of imaginative stories and poems from the brilliant young minds of tomorrow, we offer you perks!

$5 - We will personally thank you on our podcast.

$15 - You'll get a compliment on our podcast. And a great one too - you won't be dissappointed.

$25 - You'll get a handwritten thank-you note, complete with a silly dad-joke.

$50 - You'll get the cutest pictures of any cats you've ever seen, of Alec's cats - Puma Thurman and Stevie Kicks. AND you'll get amazing illustrations from Elora!

Why Donate

The Kids.

The impact of confidence on a child is immeasurable. We know that this project makes young authors feel talented, unique, and important; and we know it makes their families proud; because they tell us so!

The Writing.

Just wait 'til you hear it! They teach lessons of love, loss, and friendship. They are comedic, serious, and educational. These kids will surprise you.

The Fun.

Fun is our goal as much as anything else. And we have lots of it. That's why we also play trivia games with our young authors' families, and end each episode with a dad-joke. We're here to brighten your day.

The Biggest Risk

Although unlikely, we may not receive enough submissions to publish a story every weekend for another year.

We think it's unlikely for a few reasons:

1. We already have stories scheduled for publication through the end of 2021.

2. We've established great relationships with writing camps and workshops, and are receiving submissions from their students.

3. After we work with families, their young authors often submit more stories, so we get to publish multiple stories per child!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, we get it! You can still help!

Please.

Share this campaign.

Listen to Written by Kids. Rate it. Review it. Subscribe to it!

Thank you =)

 

 

Written by Kids is a production of MoonHouse Pictures LLC.

story:
LINER NOTES- a podcast that provides a jazz artist with a platform to speak about their process while giving the listener a window into the human being behind the music. Hosted by saxophonist David Bixler. That’s me and that is the tag line for my podcast.

LINER NOTES was initially conceived of to fulfill a gap in jazz education as well as to shine a light on artists that are working hard to produce great music. Each month I interview a different jazz artist to discuss their music, career, and life—information that formerly was found on the backs of album covers and in the notes of CDs but is sometimes hard to find in the era of downloadable and streamed music.

A review of my interviewees to date demonstrates an intention to give voice to people from the many cultures, ethnicities, and genders that make this music rich.

From the beginning of LINER NOTES I have relied on support from Vandoren and the institution where I teach. While I am grateful for the continued support form Vandoren, the institutional support is no longer available.

Improvising thrives on change and this change has gotten me excited about taking LINER NOTES to a different, and hopefully better place.

In order to fund the studio time, engineering, transcription services, etc-all the infrastructure necessary to keep this afloat I am seeking funding through this Indiegogo campaign.

The episodes in the last year and a half have been documenting how musicians are coping with the pandemic along with the racial and political turmoil that is defining this era.

If you have enjoyed any of the episodes and would like to hear them continue, I humbly ask that you consider financially supporting LINER NOTES.

story:
The Project

Strange Stories to Tell Yourself is a fictional podcast that twists horror and the absurd into a series of short stories, all told from the second person perspective. Through the blending of storytelling and production design, the listener will be brought into each story as the titular narrator “you”, immersed within the uncanny world described to them. We hope to achieve this strong connection to the listener through the use of narration, music, sound effects and other production design as well as the performance of local voice actors. 

The Team

We’re a team of writers, producers, and lovers of the strange and uncanny, based in Toronto, Canada. Leah Smith, our Creator, Producer & Writer, had long dreamed of creating a second-person, unsettling audio drama, and in February of 2020, she brought Adrian Muhajarine (Writer & Audio Lead) and Alice Gauntley (Writer) on board to bring this vision to life. We were soon joined by Lindsay Sadler (Writer & Artist) and Michal Heuston (Producer & Editor), and as the COVID-19 pandemic brought a sense of unreality to our world, we dove into planning and writing the first season of Strange Stories to Tell Yourself. 

We’re an interdisciplinary team with the skills to pull off a project like this: 

Leah Smith is a television development professional, writer and director, and a graduate of the RTA School of Media. She currently works in research and development at Go Button Media, and was the head writer of the indie horror series Winterbourne, which Michal created and produced.

Michal Heuston is a filmmaker and editor and also a graduate of RTA. Michal was the editor on Body So Fluorescent, a short film that premiered at this year's Inside Out Festival. They were also a co-editor and the post-production supervisor on Nancy's Workshop, a short documentary film for the CBC Short Docs program and an official selection at this year's Hot Docs Festival. 

Adrian Muhajarine is a writer and audio producer, originally from Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, and another RTA graduate. He’s currently exploring his love of podcasting as the Associate Producer of Entertainment One's Podcast Network. 

Alice Gauntley is a writer of stories that are literary, speculative, both, and neither. Her work has appeared in Plenitude, EVENT, and Grain magazines, among other publications. 

Lindsay is a writer and a recent graduate of the University of Guelph, graduating with honours from the English department with a minor in Creative Writing, where she was nominated twice for the Tompkins Essay Prize. 

The Budget

The majority of our funds raised from Indiegogo will go towards paying our actors, as you can see below in this pie chart: 

It’s important to us that those we hire outside of our team are compensated for their time! We strongly believe that artists should be paid for their work. The remaining portion of the funds will go towards covering the costs of distributing Strange Stories to Tell Yourself, to ensure that it’s readily accessible once fully released.

What happens if we don't meet our goal? Please don’t make us act! Unfortunately should we not be able to meet our goal, we will have to entertain the idea of performing ourselves. If you’ve made it this far, you should know that we are not trained actors. We would like to hire trained actors, however, so we would appreciate any amount that can be given! Additionally, not reaching our funding goal will set us back in our production schedule as we take the time we need to explore other avenues of financing.

Why should you back us?

Strange Stories to Tell Yourself comes to you from a team of young writers and creatives exploring a new, still developing medium of storytelling. As a group of mostly women and queer artists, our stories reflect our identities and experiences, bringing new perspectives to both podcasting and the horror/thriller genre.

At a time when more traditional forms of entertainment are struggling, it’s vital that we continue to innovate these new forms of storytelling! If you want to support the development of a group of young artists delving into an emerging form of entertainment, hear some spooky and surprising audio tales, and get some great perks along the way, please join us in bringing Strange Stories to Tell Yourself to your ears!

story:
Take Us Back to Proxima!

It's finally time to find out what happened after the Contact Day Incident. Will you help us tell the story?

About

Season One tells the story of a stratified –– both literally and figuratively –– Windfall City, where the wealthy live in luxury condos in towering skyscrapers and the poor reside far away from the sunlight on the ground of the planet Proxima. Lording over this great city is the mysterious Queen Wanda and her robotic advisor, Tin Man, who appeared in the sky twenty years ago. While our drama involves a large cast of characters, the story centers around three brothers –– Shaima, Cas and Argus –– and the ragtag group they befriend along the way.

The second season is set six months after the events of the Season One Finale, where a powerful alien force attacked Windfall City during its holiest festival, Contact Day. Forced into the sewers, the grounders have adapted to the occupation of Windfall City by remaining hidden. However, more and more Proximans arrive every day, creating a housing and food crisis among their ranks. Meanwhile, Queen Wanda’s worldview has been thrown into disarray as she learns more about the circumstances of her arrival in Windfall City when she was just a baby. At the same time, the attack on Windfall City has created a power vacuum on the ground floor into which Mila has happily taken over. In the midst of this chaos, Cas, Shaima and Gertie have one looming question: where is Argus?

Funding

Thanks to the generous donations from our backers on Patreon, we have enough funds to pay our talented cast of voice actors for this upcoming season, and we have new additions to the show we can’t wait to introduce!

For Season One of Windfall we brought our entire cast together to record in Syracuse, New York over the course of a single week. It was a blast! Unfortunately, with the ongoing coronavirus pandemic we aren’t comfortable asking our cast to get together this time around, and we don’t want to continue pushing the production of Season Two, so we’ve decided to record this season remotely.

While we’re excited to get back into recording this show we love so much, this style of recording will put a particular strain on our post-production crew. In an effort to bring this season to your ears as quickly as possible, we’re raising funds here on IndieGoGo to hire additional sound designers to help with dialogue editing and sound design for this season.

Our initial goal is $8,500, which breaks down as:

  • Dialogue Editing - $200 per episode (x12)
  • Sound Design - $200 per episode (x12)
  • Music Composition - $200 per episode (x12)
  • SAG Union Dues - $900
  • IndieGoGo Fees - $400

Who We Are:

Adam Raymonda is the sound designer, producer and composer behind Windfall. He is based in Syracuse, New York and has helped to produce podcasts like An Arm and a Leg; Breadcrumbs; A Bipolar, Schizophrenic, and a Podcast; Psych Central; and Unmapped, among others. In his free time, he produces music under the moniker Garbage Person.

Bob Raymonda is the creator of Windfall and co-writer/director. He's currently based in New Rochelle, New York. Bob founded the literary journal Breadcrumbs Magazine in 2015 and co-created its sister podcast, Breadcrumbs, the next year. He's also the co-writer/director on the audio drama Forgive Me! and has written for long-running podcasts such as The Truth and Greater Boston.

Christie Donato is co-writer/director and is based in Queens, New York, where she resides with her dog, Piper. Selections of her work can be found on Breadcrumbs Magazine, Syracuse Woman Magazine and Syndicated Magazine.

Jess Clark is a writer and producer in Syracuse, New York who you may recognize at the voice of Queen Wanda. Notable credits include producing and co-writing the script for Bruce, a comedy feature that screened at Nashville’s FILM-COM, the NYC Independent Film Festival, and the New York Film and TV Festival, garnering it a distribution deal with Comedy Dynamics. We’re excited to have her on the writing and production team for Season Two of Windfall. 

Stretch Goals

If somehow we're able to exceed our initial goal of $8,500, we have a lot of plans for what we could do with a bigger budget. Learn more about those below:

#1: $9,000 - The Annotation

Dig even deeper into season two with fully annotated scripts by series co-writers Bob Raymonda, Christie Donato, and Jess Clark. Each annotated script released in time with early episode releases.

 #2: $10,000 The Cover-Up

Follow one of the intrepid reporters from the Windfall City Broadcasting Company in this four-episode miniseries exploring the direct aftermath of the Contact Day Incident and the people who perpetrated the attack on the city. To be produced after season two is complete.

#3: 12,000 The Birth of an Icon

Meet Queen Wanda’s parents and follow them on their journey as they first crash land on the planet of Proxima. Witness the birth of the Queen, the birth of the Wolfpac, and the birth of the city as we know it in this special bonus episode. To be produced after season two is complete.

#4: 15,000 The Ophiuchus Disaster

Wonder where the humans have been all this time? Curious about where Admiral Timms and her band of invading mercenaries were, and why it took them 20 years to find Wanda, Tin Man, and Proxima? Find out in this feature-length special episode! To be produced after season two is complete.

We're so excited to tell this story...

And we're going to do it no matter what! But it would mean the world to us to be able to grow our team while also being able to compensate them for their work. And, whether or not we're able to do so will help us determine how long it takes before season two can finally premiere. 

That being said, we understand that sometimes money is tight! If donating is impossible for you right now, it'd be just as helpful for you to share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to help us get the word out to as many people as possible. 

Looking for other ways to support us in the long term? We have a monthly Patreon page that offers bonus content for every podcast we release. And it'd also help so much if you like anything we make if you'd consider leaving us a rating and a review on Podchaser or Apple Podcasts. And remember to always ask yourself:

What Would Wanda Do?

Season One tells the story of a stratified –– both literally and figuratively –– Windfall City, where the wealthy live in luxury condos in towering skyscrapers and the poor reside far away from the sunlight on the ground of the planet Proxima. Lording over this great city is the mysterious Queen Wanda and her robotic advisor, Tin Man, who appeared in the sky twenty years ago. While our drama involves a large cast of characters, the story centers around three brothers –– Shaima, Cas and Argus –– and the ragtag group they befriend along the way.
The second season is set six months after the events of the Season One Finale, where a powerful alien force attacked Windfall City during its holiest festival, Contact Day. Forced into the sewers, the grounders have adapted to the occupation of Windfall City by remaining hidden. However, more and more Proximans arrive every day, creating a housing and food crisis among their ranks. Meanwhile, Queen Wanda’s worldview has been thrown into disarray as she learns more about the circumstances of her arrival in Windfall City when she was just a baby. At the same time, the attack on Windfall City has created a power vacuum on the ground floor into which Mila has happily taken over. In the midst of this chaos, Cas, Shaima and Gertie have one looming question: where is Argus?


Funding
Thanks to the generous donations from our backers on Patreon, we have enough funds to pay our talented cast of voice actors for this upcoming season, and we have new additions to the show we can’t wait to introduce!
For Season One of Windfall we brought our entire cast together to record in Syracuse, New York over the course of a single week. It was a blast! Unfortunately, with the ongoing coronavirus pandemic we aren’t comfortable asking our cast to get together this time around, and we don’t want to continue pushing the production of Season Two, so we’ve decided to record this season remotely.
While we’re excited to get back into recording this show we love so much, this style of recording will put a particular strain on our post-production crew. In an effort to bring this season to your ears as quickly as possible, we’re raising funds here on IndieGoGo to hire additional sound designers to help with dialogue editing and sound design for this season.
Our initial goal is $8,500, which breaks down as:

Dialogue Editing - $200 per episode (x12)
Sound Design - $200 per episode (x12)
Music Composition - $200 per episode (x12)
SAG Union Dues - $900
IndieGoGo Fees - $400


Who We Are:


Adam Raymonda is the sound designer, producer and composer behind Windfall. He is based in Syracuse, New York and has helped to produce podcasts like An Arm and a Leg; Breadcrumbs; A Bipolar, Schizophrenic, and a Podcast; Psych Central; and Unmapped, among others. In his free time, he produces music under the moniker Garbage Person.
Bob Raymonda is the creator of Windfall and co-writer/director. He's currently based in New Rochelle, New York. Bob founded the literary journal Breadcrumbs Magazine in 2015 and co-created its sister podcast, Breadcrumbs, the next year. He's also the co-writer/director on the audio drama Forgive Me! and has written for long-running podcasts such as The Truth and Greater Boston.
Christie Donato is co-writer/director and is based in Queens, New York, where she resides with her dog, Piper. Selections of her work can be found on Breadcrumbs Magazine, Syracuse Woman Magazine and Syndicated Magazine.
Jess Clark is a writer and producer in Syracuse, New York who you may recognize at the voice of Queen Wanda. Notable credits include producing and co-writing the script for Bruce, a comedy feature that screened at Nashville’s FILM-COM, the NYC Independent Film Festival, and the New York Film and TV Festival, garnering it a distribution deal with Comedy Dynamics. We’re excited to have her on the writing and production team for Season Two of Windfall. 

Stretch GoalsIf somehow we're able to exceed our initial goal of $8,500, we have a lot of plans for what we could do with a bigger budget. Learn more about those below:#1: $9,000 - The AnnotationDig even deeper into season two with fully annotated scripts by series co-writers Bob Raymonda, Christie Donato, and Jess Clark. Each annotated script released in time with early episode releases. #2: $10,000 The Cover-UpFollow one of the intrepid reporters from the Windfall City Broadcasting Company in this four-episode miniseries exploring the direct aftermath of the Contact Day Incident and the people who perpetrated the attack on the city. To be produced after season two is complete.#3: 12,000 The Birth of an IconMeet Queen Wanda’s parents and follow them on their journey as they first crash land on the planet of Proxima. Witness the birth of the Queen, the birth of the Wolfpac, and the birth of the city as we know it in this special bonus episode. To be produced after season two is complete.#4: 15,000 The Ophiuchus DisasterWonder where the humans have been all this time? Curious about where Admiral Timms and her band of invading mercenaries were, and why it took them 20 years to find Wanda, Tin Man, and Proxima? Find out in this feature-length special episode! To be produced after season two is complete.We're so excited to tell this story...And we're going to do it no matter what! But it would mean the world to us to be able to grow our team while also being able to compensate them for their work. And, whether or not we're able to do so will help us determine how long it takes before season two can finally premiere. That being said, we understand that sometimes money is tight! If donating is impossible for you right now, it'd be just as helpful for you to share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to help us get the word out to as many people as possible. Looking for other ways to support us in the long term? We have a monthly Patreon page that offers bonus content for every podcast we release. And it'd also help so much if you like anything we make if you'd consider leaving us a rating and a review on Podchaser or Apple Podcasts. And remember to always ask yourself:What Would Wanda Do?

story:
Welcome to the Strangerverse

Lone Stranger is an immersive 8 part sci-fi western coming to Spotify and Apple Music this October. Come wander a post-apocalyptic desert world with only the audio diaries of a mysterious drifter for company.... 

Meet the ODDio team

Lone Stranger is the brainchild of three friends putting the ART in stARTup. It's fairly simple.

  • Matt, the wordsmith
  • Amber, the audiophile
  • Molly, the business brain

Together, we are ready to send you into a fictitious new audio dimension with our very first podcast. Our mission? Transport, inspire, inform and innovate for audiences of all ages.

So what have you done so far?

Our fundraising campaign isn't the only step we've taken to building a community of fantasy lovers online...

  • Check out our Tiktok Account @ODDiopresents for choose-your-own-adventure playable trailer content. 
  • We've hired talent worth following. Combined, our guest voiceover actors have an audience of over 800k subscribers we can't wait to meet...
  • Oh, and did we mention? Production is already in full swing. We drop Episode 101: The Cactus Cat on Friday, October 1st 2021

 

Time for Numbers.

It's super simple. Check out our visual below:

$1560 for Talent. Our people are pros, and don't work for free.

$1200 for Audio Engineering. Snag our Golden Sundrop Reward and see why our engineers are the best in the biz.

$373 for equipment and software-as-a-service (SAAS). This covers everything from microphones to recording platforms to hosting for our brand new website www.oddiostudios.com!

$558.25 for Digital Ad Design, just like those seen in our fundraising video!

$1500 for Tiktok Ads. Bids per click and controlled impressions in different geographic sectors help us understand who's listening now... and who else may want to in the future! 

$1500 for Youtube Ads. Same story, different platform.

$1000 for SEO Optimization will make our online infrastructure super searchable and sleek.

Total = $7,691.25 

 

Rewards?

Outlaws, White Hats and Bounty Hunters alike will be rewarded handsomely for their help (check out our perks page...) but mainly we just want to meet the folk out there who are interested in the tall tales we're spinning. 

If you donate ten dollars or ten thousand, we're all in this together. So don't be shy! Drop us a line and let us know how we're doing. Got a new kind of story you'd like to see ODDio tackle next time around? Let us know! Think our budget's cockamamie and care to take it up with the sheriff? Go for it. 

But in the meantime....

 

THANKS FOR JOINING US ON THIS INCREDIBLE ADVENTURE!

In the meantime, please share this campaign, visit our website www.oddiostudios.com or follow us on Tiktok @ODDiopresents !

We can't wait to welcome you to the Strangerverse.

story:
If you are from Michigan or Ohio, you may have been reading my work or listening to my radio or TV broadcasts for years.

Well, now I want to go on bringing you the story behind the stories behind the stories and do it with what is an exciting new medium for me, my podcasts.  You can view a number of them on my YouTube channel:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZvvBpEVH6aDSt...

Listen to my revealing interview with Geoffrey Fieger, the truth behind the new bill which is supposed to fix Michigan’s car insurance problems, and meet a young woman activist whose efforts to save Lake Erie were so impressive she was asked to speak before the United Nations. 

I have a vast and unique perspective on this state, this nation, and the world, and have covered everything from the fall of Marcos in the Philippines to the old Soviet Union.  I know a lot of stories that haven’t been told, at least in full, and want to go on telling you about things both fascinating and which you need to know.

But like any other kind of new venture, it takes funding to get this up and running and keep things rolling. That’s why I’m reaching to all of my friends to help me to keep doing what I do best by making a donation to this fundraising campaign.  You can do so either by name or anonymously. Any amount is welcome and appreciated – and I will be happy to mention anyone’s name on the podcast who pledges at least $100. For a donation of $500, we’ll have lunch and some great discussion together. If you’re feeling especially helpful and generous, for a donation of support of $1,000 or more, I’d be happy to speak to your group or organization followed by a Meet & Greet. 

If you're interested in supporting as a sponsor or benefactor on a longer-term basis, please contact me. bucca@aol.com

I’ve been doing noncompromising and award-winning journalism since 1977, and I hope you will take this opportunity to help me keep doing it. Thank you for your support!

story:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.

Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.

Si no nos conoces 

Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.

O suscribirte en iTunes.

O seguirlo en Spotify.

O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.

Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.

Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.

Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.

Y queremos que una de sus paradas sea la bella ciudad de Madrid, en España.

Qué es el No sé, dime tour MADRID

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Madrid, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de España para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.

Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.

A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.

Por qué nosotros

Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.

Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 

Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 

a los Shorty Awards...

Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.

Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.

Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.

Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.

Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.

Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.

No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.

El problema

Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.

Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...

Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.

Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Madrid nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.

Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 

Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.

Lo que nos hace falta

  • Al menos entre 600 y 850 superdiamantes en cada ciudad  que compren una entrada a un precio súper asequible.
  • Recaudar con la venta de esas entradas al menos $20,000 para ir a España.
  • Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
  • Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Cómo lo utilizaremos

  • Alquiler del Teatro (entre 30% y 50% de lo recaudado)
  • Merch
  • Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
  • Alquiler de equipos
  • Honorarios de producción
  • Mercadeo de la gira

Lo que ofrecemos

Además de entradas para que nos acompañes a dejar el corazón en un teatro de la hermosa ciudad de Madrid en un show que tú mismo crearás con nosotros, tenemos perks para superdiamantes que quieran y puedan contribuir con un poquito más para obtener desde cosas súper especiales como franelas que sólo van a estás disponibles si hacemos el tour, estar en los créditos de la serie como productores, o hasta ser invitados especiales en un podcast con nosotros (¡la pizza corre por nuestra cuenta!).

Por qué te necesitamos

Hemos estado haciendo encuestas. Sé qué nos hemos puesto fastidiosos, pero necesitamos estar 100% seguros de que en las ciudades a las que vamos hay suficientes de ustedes para hacer esto.  

Te necesitamos porque no sólo no tenemos dinero para pagar la gira de nuestro bolsillo, sino porque si no logramos que esta gira pase hay muchísimas cosas que muy probable tendremos que también dejar de hacer.

El reto

Queremos arrancar la gira oficialmente después del 15 de Septiembre, por lo que necesitamos producir todo durante el verano. Por eso debemos recaudar el dinero de cada ciudad en sólo 10 días. De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.

La idea es comenzar con una ciudad y si logramos la meta, hacer otra y otra y otra hasta que podamos llegar a la mayor cantidad de ciudades posibles.

Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.

Esto es lo que queremos: si logramos hacer al menos 5 ciudades podemos seguir haciendo el podcast.

Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.

Tal vez no vives en Madrid, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.

Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.

Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.

¿Contamos contigo?

Maiah y Gabriel
