Tal vez no vives en Madrid, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.
Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.
Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.
¿Contamos contigo?
Maiah y Gabriel

story:
Sobre los CrossFit Games 2019

Desde 2014 estamos trabajando por compartir este deporte entre la comunidad hispana. No sólo mi experiencia personal como crossfitera si no también cubriendo los eventos más destacados de este deporte.

Con los últimos cambios que se han sucedido en la marca CrossFit, todo apunta a que este año no habrá una retransmisión de los Games en español. Nuestro objetivo es una vez más, cubrir el evento para explicar en todo detalle qué sucede en la competición y que la comunidad hispana no se quede sin disfrutar de la fecha más grande del calendario crossfitero.

¿Qué posibilidades reales hay de que te expliquen en español qué pasa en cada una de las pruebas? ¿Quién se va a preocupar de seguir de cerca a nuestros atletas españoles/latinos?

Unamos fuerzas

Si conseguimos el respaldo económico que necesitamos para financiar un viaje de este tipo a Madison, nosotros cubriremos el evento con toda el cariño del mundo y todo el entusiasmo que hemos puesto hasta ahora:

  • Los costes del viaje son: billetes de avión, seguro del viaje al extranjero, visado electrónico, hotel en Chicago, autobús a Madison, hotel en Madison, comidas y transporte, entradas a los Games...
  • Pero nunca hemos sido de pedir así que en muestra de agradecimiento por creer una vez más en nosotros y en nuestro proyecto, nosotros queremos darte toda clase de gadgets crossfiteros. Creemos que es una bonita manera de recordar que te implicaste directamente en nuestro proyecto.

 Y esto es gracias a la generosa participación de Carlos de Pata Palo en el diseño de todos los productos que os ofrecemos en este crowdfunding. Confió en nuestro trabajo, aplaudió nuestro esfuerzo de contribución a la comunidad del CrossFit y siempre ofreció su ayuda desinteresada. 

La cifra que hemos propuesto de recaudación son 15000€. La verdad es que la cifra se ve muy abultada puesto que esperamos recibir aproximadamente la tercera parte tras cubrir los costes de la plataforma calculado sobre el total recaudado, los costes de las camisetas, los parches, las chaquetas, el embalaje y los envíos certificados. 

Nuestra aportación a la comunidad crossfitera hispana

Como seguidores de este deporte todos tenemos nuestras referencias en este ámbito. Con el paso del tiempo, hemos podido ir conociendo en persona a los atletas de élite de nuestros respectivos países: Alexander Anasagasti, Sara Alicia Fernández, Agustín Richelme, Santi Comba, Bryan Hernández, Darwin Pérez, Brenda Castro... Con todos ellos hemos tratado anteriormente y nos encantaría acompañarles en la gran aventura de los Games y compartirlo con vosotros.

¿Porqué merece la pena apostar por nosotros para que desarrollemos este trabajo?

  • Si os ha gustado la cobertura en nuestros medios durante los Open, las entrevistas a los atletas y la explicación de todas las novedades que ha ido aconteciendo en este deporte.
  • Si habéis disfrutado de las competiciones a las que hemos ido en primera persona como los pasados sanctioned events: Italia y Reykjavik.
  • Si quieres sentir que estás en los Games a través de nuestro relato personal.

Operación sin riesgos

Nuestra mayor ilusión es reunir suficientes fondos que nos ayuden a hacer frente a los costes que supone un viaje de esta magnitud. Una vez esto sea posible, nosotros estamos dispuestos como siempre a dar lo mejor de nosotros para que no os perdáis nada.

Llegar los primeros a la competición para coger buen sitio, enterarnos de todos los detalles y compartirlos, cubrir todos los eventos en las diferentes localizaciones, hacer el seguimiento de nuestros atletas más cercanos, editar sin descanso cada día para que tengáis el contenido fresco y antes de que arranque el día siguiente de competición.

En este sentido, este crowdfunding no supone ningún riesgo. Estamos seguros que entre todos podremos hacer este proyecto realidad. En el caso que no alcanzásemos la cifra, seguiríamos peleando para encontrar la manera. Porque nosotros no nos rendimos, no lo hemos hecho nunca en 5 años.

Si no puedes involucrarte económicamente 

Hay muchas maneras de ayudar y algunas son totalmente gratis. Si estás sacrificado con la causa y quieres ayudarnos a hacerla realidad sin desprenderte de un euro, estás son algunas sugerencias: 

  • Comparte la campaña entre más amigos amantes del CrossFit. Quizás alguno está en disposición de colaborar económicamente. 
  • Suscríbete a nuestro canal y sigue de cerca nuestra creación de contenido. Tu interacción con nosotros nos ayuda muchísimo a seguir.

Y una vez más, solo queremos daros las gracias por demostrarnos constantemente vuestro cariño. Sentimos que pertenecemos a una gran comunidad, que arropa, que comparte la pasión por este deporte y que valora la manera en la que nosotros queremos compartir todo lo que hace referencia a este deporte. Notamos vuestro apoyo y nos da energías para seguir cada día.

¡Gracias por estar ahí!

Medidas de las camisetas

Chico

Color Marble:  91% poliéster, 9% algodón ring-spun

Chica Larga

Color Marble:  91% poliéster, 9% algodón peinado ring-spun


 

Chica Crop

Color Marble:  91% poliéster, 9% algodón peinado ring-spun

Chaqueta Chica

Deep grey heather : Polyester / Viscose / Elastane Tech fleece 79/15/6 - 310  79%polyester / 15%viscose / 6%elastane 

Chaqueta Chico

Deep grey heather : Polyester / Viscose / Elastane Tech fleece 79/15/6 - 310  79%polyester / 15%viscose / 6%elastane

story:
What we need 

We loved our first season and loved making it but our budget was a challenge the whole way through. We want to have this season be bigger and better in every way and we are asking for your help to do that! In doing so we also will have the opportunity to offer you some really cool gifts along the way as well as access to a secret feed and discord server.

The Impact

Here's the thing, our whole first season operated on a shoestring budget. We had to make do with equipment that was only okay until we could upgrade, we couldn't launch a website, and we couldn't pay the people that helped us make Zoo what it is and we want to change that. Our top priority with this is paying our actors for their work as well as our composer. It's important for us to be ethical and do the right thing and the right thing is paying people for their art. Your contributions will help us make that a reality without us breaking ourselves entirely. The more this campaign makes the better we can afford to pay our people.

Risks & Challenges

Really? There are none. Whatever happens, this season is happening it's just a matter of how comfortably it is happening. We are forging ahead regardless!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you want to help but it's just not in the budget right now. Trust me, we get that. Fear not! You can do a whole lot for us just by sharing this campaign on social media, telling a friend about Zoo, or just dropping us a line to tell us you support what we are doing. (Seriously, we thrive on validation)

 

Thank you so much from the bottom of our weird little hearts. We couldn't make the thing we love without your support.

story:
Wyldwood Radio has returned!

In October 2011 there was an idea; to create a Pagan Radio station which played the music we liked, to as many people as we could, all day, every day. From this idea grew an international station, broadcasting 24 hours per day, 7 days a week and which gained 21,000 listeners worldwide.

In September 2016 the station closed, however in August 2017 the idea was rekindled by Herne Wyldwood and once again, people around the world can listen to Wyldwood Radio once again.

But.... Since last September we no longer have the equipment we need in order to broadcast live, to build the station up to what it once was and to take it even further.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to replace the equipment that we need to broadcast, to have access to software that is essential to the station and to secure a new host:

  • We need to raise £1500 in order to purchase the following:
  • A PC (Or laptop) to stream from and to act as our studio PC
  • A Suitable microphone (Blue Yeti or Blue Snowball) for live broadcast, interviews, jingles and much more
  • Subscription to Adobe Creative Suite for creation of images, photo processing, jingles, videos etc
  • Subscription to a new host (No other host is free)
  • For your support you will get (Depending on the amount):
  • Exclusive versions of the Wyldwood Radio T-shirt
  • Exclusive versions of the Wyldwood Radio Hoodie
  • Annual Subscription to Wyldwood Radio which includes our forthcoming newsletter

If we do not reach our goal, we will put what funds we do receive toward buying a simple mic to create jingles, however the stream will remain without live shows or themed shows.

The Impact

Currently Wyldwood Radio is streaming a limited amount of music to a limited amount of countries (our current host is geoblocked in several countries). We cannot create new jingles, hold interviews or perform live shows.

  • Your support will help bring back Wyldwood Live
  • We will be able to interview bands, artists and public figures in the studio and at events
  • We will be able to bring back a more polished, complete station with themed shows
  • We will be able to take Wyldwood Radio further than it has ever gone before!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help us financially, you can still help in other ways!

  • Please spread the word about our campaign, share it on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, anywhere you can!
  • You can even share directly from here on Indiegogo!

Thank you for your support and Bright Blessings!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kathlyn Carney. I created Connecting the Dots because I believe people need to know all the different ways that they can achieve health and wellness in our Western society. We have been conditioned to think that the Standard American Diet is good for our bodies and that Western medicine is the only answer when we are sick. However, in Connecting the Dots, I explore problems with the Standard American Diet and holistic solutions to take back your health like nutritious foods, exercise, sleep, meditation, yoga, herbs, and more!

My hope is that people learn the many options they have when it comes to health and wellness and that they take away tips and resources that they can implement in their daily routines. By making small lifestyle changes, people can prevent or manage the wide range of chronic illnesses that we are up against, like diabetes, obesity, and autoimmune conditions!

In this show, you'll hear stories such as...

  • What New York Times bestselling author, Marion Nestle, thinks are the top 3 health crises in America
  • How one of my good friends, Alexandra, healed from chronic illness.
  • How award-winning author and nutritionist, Julie Daniluk, found amazing replacements for addictive foods

You will love this show if you are interested in improving your own health and your community. When the people close to me faced challenges in their health, changing what they ate and their daily habits drastically improved their symptoms. With the support of myself, their family, partners, and friends, not only did their health and wellness improve, but so did their lives! Through the Connecting the Dots audio show and community, we will help you discover many quality products and connect with real people, which will help you feel prepared and supported throughout your wellness journey!

 

What is Connecting the Dots?

This show explores:
  • Healing foods and herbs such as mushrooms and ashwagandha
  • Best practices for weight loss like eliminating dairy and moving every day
  • How to make our communities healthier by joining health initiatives and supporting local farmers
  • Stress management like yoga and meditation
  • Holistic approaches to health and wellness such as acupuncture and total body modification


What We Need & What You Get

This audio show will be published with New Degree Studios. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my show. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The producer I will work with to revise my scripts and create a cohesive production schedule.
  • The post-production editor to bring all the audio and visual pieces together.
  • The logo designer for the creation of my show-specific logo.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately release episodes this fall.

Check out the package items to obtain perks such as...
  • Grocery lists with all of my favorite staples
  • Recipes to feed your family for a week
  • Access to an exclusive Facebook community that will grant you 24/7 ability to ask questions, communicate, reflect, and learn
  • A personalized diet analysis based on your daily eating habits and favorite foods to ensure you are getting adequate amounts of important vitamins and minerals
  • One-on-one meal planning session with Kathlyn where she will take your schedule, favorite foods, and cooking ability into account to help you plan delicious and nutritious meals

 

About the Creator

Kathlyn Carney is an educator, Master of Science Nutrition Education student, author, foodie, storyteller, activist, animal lover, and friend!

In her free time, she loves hosting dinner parties and showing her friends and family that eating healthy can and should be delicious. She also enjoys taking workout classes like Zumba, yoga, and spin with her friends. Her favorite ways to wind down are with a hot bath, glass of organic wine, and journaling.

For more information, you can connect with her on Instagram and TikTok at @kathlyncarneywellness or on LinkedIn and Facebook at Kathlyn Carney. You can also visit her website at www.kathlyncarney.com! Last, head over to Amazon and purchase Kathlyn’s book, We Can’t Change What We Don’t Know - How I Started to Think of Food as Medicine, and gain valuable knowledge about the impact that foods and products can have on our bodies!

 

Risks & Challenges

You may be able to find all of this information online or from different books, but it would take you so much time. I have spent the last three years learning about nutrition, holistic health practices, and optimal habits from dozens of books, audio shows, online courses, and graduate level classes at American University. Connecting the Dots combines my own research, well-respected experts’ advice, and success stories from people just like you. By listening to this audio show and gaining access to my carefully curated guides, you will save time and money by having a wealth of knowledge and so many resources at your fingertips.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #connectingthedots and #kathlyncarneywellness, and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my show with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Xo - Kathlyn

story:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.

Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.

Si no nos conoces 

Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.

O suscribirte en iTunes.

O seguirlo en Spotify.

O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.

Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.

Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.

Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.

Y queremos que una de sus paradas sea la bella ciudad de Barcelona, en España.

Qué es el No sé, dime tour BCN

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Barcelona, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de allá para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.

Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.

A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.

Por qué nosotros

Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.

Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 

Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 

a los Shorty Awards...

Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.

Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.

Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.

Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.

Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.

Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.

No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.

El problema

Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.

Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...

Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.

Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Barcelona nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.

Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 

Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.

Lo que nos hace falta

  • Al menos entre 600 y 850 superdiamantes en cada ciudad  que compren una entrada a un precio súper asequible.
  • Recaudar con la venta de esas entradas al menos $20,000 para ir a Barcelona.
  • Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
  • Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Cómo lo utilizaremos

  • Alquiler del Teatro (entre 30% y 50% de lo recaudado)
  • Merch
  • Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
  • Alquiler de equipos
  • Honorarios de producción
  • Mercadeo de la gira

Lo que ofrecemos

Además de entradas para que nos acompañes a dejar el corazón en un teatro de la hermosa ciudad de Barcelona en un show que tú mismo crearás con nosotros, tenemos perks para superdiamantes que quieran y puedan contribuir con un poquito más para obtener desde cosas súper especiales como franelas que sólo van a estás disponibles si hacemos el tour, estar en los créditos de la serie como productores, o hasta ser invitados especiales en un podcast con nosotros (¡la pizza corre por nuestra cuenta!).

Por qué te necesitamos

Hemos estado haciendo encuestas. Sé qué nos hemos puesto fastidiosos, pero necesitamos estar 100% seguros de que en las ciudades a las que vamos hay suficientes de ustedes para hacer esto.  

Te necesitamos porque no sólo no tenemos dinero para pagar la gira de nuestro bolsillo, sino porque si no logramos que esta gira pase hay muchísimas cosas que muy probable tendremos que también dejar de hacer.

El reto

Queremos arrancar la gira oficialmente después del 15 de Septiembre, por lo que necesitamos producir todo durante el verano. Por eso debemos recaudar el dinero de cada ciudad en sólo 10 días. De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.

La idea es comenzar con una ciudad y si logramos la meta, hacer otra y otra y otra hasta que podamos llegar a la mayor cantidad de ciudades posibles.

Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.

Esto es lo que queremos: si logramos hacer al menos 5 ciudades podemos seguir haciendo el podcast.

Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.

Tal vez no vives en Barcelona, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.

Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.

Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.

¿Contamos contigo?

Maiah y Gabriel

story:
Superligaens Største Øjeblikke

Mediano har siden juni 2016 udgivet digitalt indhold om fodbold i alle afskygninger. Det sker primært igennem forskellige podcastformater, hvor gæsterne får taletid og der ikke er grænse for hvor dybt eller nørdet indholdet bliver - snarere tværtimod.

Med podcastserien Superligaen Største Øjeblikke vil vi gå nye veje og fortælle nogle af de historier vi alle husker, og som er en del af den kollektive Superliga-hukommelse.

I foråret udgav vi første afsnit om Herfølges mesterskab i 2000. Den historie blev fortalt gennem træner John 'Faxe' Jensen, spillerne Gert Nodin, anfører Thomas Høyer, Tommy Schramm og Jakup Mikkelsen. Den kan du høre her:

Nu er vi klar til at give os i kast med yderligere fem afsnit henover efteråret 2018. Disse afsnit udkommer uanset, om vi når 50.000 kr. eller ej. Men vi vil enormt gerne fortsætte med at lave det her indhold, som vi finder både interessant, vigtigt og unikt, fordi det er hovedpersonerne selv, der fortæller om begivenhederne, som de husker dem. Bag hver af den type udsendelser ligger rigtig mange arbejdstimer i form af research, interviews og redigering, og det koster penge.

Målet er derfor at indsamle så stort et beløb som muligt, så vi kan fortsætte serien med yderligere fem afsnit i foråret 2019 og måske endnu længere ud i fremtiden. Det første del-mål er derfor 50.000 kr., det næste er 100.000, og skulle det gå over al forventning og beløbet bliver endnu større, så er hver en krone øremærket til at producere mere indhold om Superliga-historien.

Det indsamlede beløb går (foruden fem procent til Indiegogo) ubeskåret til produktionen af Superligaens Største Øjeblikke nu og i fremtiden.

De fem afsnit vil udkomme på følgende datoer:

  • 12. september – Brøndby IF's 12/13-sæson og den skæbnesvangre kamp i Horsens. Fortalt af Simon Makienok, Mike Jensen, Bent 'Turbo' Christensen, Auri Skarbalius og Martin Albrechtsen.
  • 10. oktober – Silkeborg IF's mesterskab i 1994. Fortalt af Bo Johansson, Morten Bruun, Peter Kjær og Keld Bordinggaard.
  • 7. november – Lyngby BK's amatører i 2002. Fortalt af Hasse Kuhn, Martin Birn, Johnny 'Sav' Laursen, Thomas Andersen, Klaus Lindholm og Christian Ulrik Hansen.
  • 5. december – Randers FC's mirakuløse overlevelse i 2010. De medvirkende afsløres senere.
  • 26. december – Sibusiso Zumas saksespark. De medvirkende afsløres senere.

Desuden vil vi afprøve live-formatet og inviterer derfor til en forpremiere på afsnittet om Silkeborg IF's mesterskab i 1994. Foruden at blive blandt de første til at høre udsendelsen, kan du på aftenen også møde Morten Bruun, Bo Johansson med flere, som vil fortælle røverhistorier om den sæson, hvor det hele gik op i en højere enhed i Søhøjlandet. Desuden vil journalisterne bag serien, Lasse Klinke og Anders Ryehauge, fortælle om deres arbejde med Superligaens Største Øjeblikke. Det arrangement kan du sikre dig plads til ved at støtte med 150 kr.


Hvad kan jeg gøre?

Du kan støtte os ved at bidrage til kampagnen, deltage i forpremieren på afsnittet om Silkeborg IF's mesterskab og ikke mindst ved at sprede budskabet om kampagnen. Lad dine venner og følgere på sociale medier vide, at kampagnen kører lige nu, eller at du har støttet, og tilskynd dem til at gøre det samme.

Og så kan du hjælpe os ved at komme med forslag til de forhåbentlig mange flere afsnit, vi skal producere i fremtiden. Skriv til ssø@mediano.nu, eller kommentér på vores opslag på Twitter eller Facebook, så tager vi alle idéer med i arbejdsværelset frem imod foråret.

Vi glæder os til at udvikle og genopleve Superligaens Største Øjeblikke sammen med jer!

story:
A Brief Summary of the Production

Greetings! My name is R. Lawson Cade, and thank you for taking the time to stop by and check out what this campaign is all about. This is an opportunity for folks to become an integral part in R-Cade Productions's first, official in-house production. "Smothered." An audio drama that is planned to be delivered in the format of an estimated 7-8 episode podcast series. The story will tell a highly intensive, nail-biting criminal investigation that will put the character's moralities in question. Join us in experiencing the tremendous joys that comes with the creation of something, while sharing the story's crucial lessons with the world. Becoming a vital asset to the creation of something, at a price completely self-determined? Trust me. The payoff will be priceless.   

What We Need

It may not seem it, but even a podcast series has its fair share of expenses that go with it...

We've managed to budget both a minimum, and maximum, estimated total cost for this. The minimum goal will certainly be enough to allow our team to get by, while the maximum goal will allow us the opportunity to invest in more robust gear, create some reserve funds should the unexpected happen, and provide us with a larger donation to CASA. These figures represent ever aspect of this piece's production from:

  • Actor Performances
  • Composers
  • Sound Designers
  • Story Consultants 
  • Editors
  • Gear
  • Marketing Materials
  • Scheduling & Coordination
  • Directors

Donations To A Charitable Cause

We have all intentions of making this product it's finest form possible. What we're asking of you, our potential backers, is the financial stability necessary to properly compensate our team for their time and efforts. Beyond that, we pledge to donate the remainder of the production's funds to the Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) for Children. The fact that humanity has been gifted with the ability to express ourselves artistically is a remarkable thing. However we, at R-Cade Productions, wish to take that luxury and use it as a platform to inspire change and betterment in our world. 

The Impact

Curious to know who you'll be directly affecting/ supporting by donating?

  • Providing artist with an opportunity to showcase their craft, while financially supporting them for their time and efforts. 
  • Being apart of a story with depth and poignancy.
  • Supporting a National Association that provides support systems and second chances to escape from their neglectful, or abusive, households. 
  • A message worth sharing.   

What You Get

R-Cade Productions is a modest sized production company. Aside from the satisfactions that comes with a donation to a great cause, I'm afraid we cannot offer too much to those interested in backing this campaign. What we can offer to you, should you feel inspired to donate, can be found listed below. We do sincerely apologize that there isn't more incentive for you folks to consider backing this cause. In the future, we pledge to remedy that.

  • Aural & Listed Credit - When you donate to this campaign, you become apart of it. Providing the stability necessary to sustain this product is crucial to it's creation, after all. We promise to credit each backer in the piece's credits. Beyond that, we want to encourage you folks to make an audio recording stating your name. Once you've made the recording, feel free to send the file to us at rcadeproductions@gmail.com and that recording will be featured at some point in one of the piece's installments.
  • Private Listening Party Invitation - Once the production has reached it's conclusion, backers will be contacted about an opportunity to experience the finished product before it goes live on all major streaming services. As of right now, the location, date, & time for the party are TBD, but we will share the official information with everyone with plenty of time to plan accordingly. We recognize that this perk cannot be extended to those contributors outside of the DMV area, unless they are willing to travel a greater distance, and do sincerely apologize for that.
  • Our Sincerest Gratitude - We pledge to personally thank each and every one of our backers, once the production has wrapped and published. 

Risks & Challenges

If anyone has ever been involved in production, or any form of collaboration, then you will know that the larger the involvement the greater the margin or error can become. This is why having folks who are experienced in communicating, scheduling, and coming up with contingency plans are of utmost importance. Dealing with intellectual properties, especially on a collaborative level, certainly comes with its challenges. For instances: meeting deadlines over striving for, "perfection," unexpected schedule changes with an actor, equipment troubleshooting, etc. I admit that the chances of these occurring during our production period are always present. This is why we intend to work with those who have tight track records. Many of the positions listed above have already been filled, as they've proven to get the job done on multiple occasions. With our infrastructure as optimized as possible, we promise that these risk will be significantly reduced.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that times can be financially difficult. We've all been in those situations where we want to contribute to a good cause, but the prospect of doing so isn't the most ideal. Not to worry! there are other ways to assist in our campaign. 

You can:

  • Share the campaign page on social media, with friends, family members, etc. The more folks are aware of this, the greater our chances of succeeding become!
  • Share with media companies. 
  • If you are more interested in assisting the in the creation of the piece itself, feel free to reach out to us at our email: rcadeproductions@gmail.com . Be sure to include positions you're interested in filling, along with any credentials you hold in your particular position of interested (portfolio, website, IMDb page, certifications, etc.)
story_txt:
A Brief Summary of the ProductionGreetings! My name is R. Lawson Cade, and thank you for taking the time to stop by and check out what this campaign is all about. This is an opportunity for folks to become an integral part in R-Cade Productions's first, official in-house production. "Smothered." An audio drama that is planned to be delivered in the format of an estimated 7-8 episode podcast series. The story will tell a highly intensive, nail-biting criminal investigation that will put the character's moralities in question. Join us in experiencing the tremendous joys that comes with the creation of something, while sharing the story's crucial lessons with the world. Becoming a vital asset to the creation of something, at a price completely self-determined? Trust me. The payoff will be priceless.   What We NeedIt may not seem it, but even a podcast series has its fair share of expenses that go with it...We've managed to budget both a minimum, and maximum, estimated total cost for this. The minimum goal will certainly be enough to allow our team to get by, while the maximum goal will allow us the opportunity to invest in more robust gear, create some reserve funds should the unexpected happen, and provide us with a larger donation to CASA. These figures represent ever aspect of this piece's production from:
Actor Performances
Composers
Sound Designers
Story Consultants 
Editors
Gear
Marketing Materials
Scheduling & Coordination
Directors
Donations To A Charitable CauseWe have all intentions of making this product it's finest form possible. What we're asking of you, our potential backers, is the financial stability necessary to properly compensate our team for their time and efforts. Beyond that, we pledge to donate the remainder of the production's funds to the Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) for Children. The fact that humanity has been gifted with the ability to express ourselves artistically is a remarkable thing. However we, at R-Cade Productions, wish to take that luxury and use it as a platform to inspire change and betterment in our world. The ImpactCurious to know who you'll be directly affecting/ supporting by donating?
Providing artist with an opportunity to showcase their craft, while financially supporting them for their time and efforts. 
Being apart of a story with depth and poignancy.
Supporting a National Association that provides support systems and second chances to escape from their neglectful, or abusive, households. 
A message worth sharing.   
What You GetR-Cade Productions is a modest sized production company. Aside from the satisfactions that comes with a donation to a great cause, I'm afraid we cannot offer too much to those interested in backing this campaign. What we can offer to you, should you feel inspired to donate, can be found listed below. We do sincerely apologize that there isn't more incentive for you folks to consider backing this cause. In the future, we pledge to remedy that.

Aural & Listed Credit - When you donate to this campaign, you become apart of it. Providing the stability necessary to sustain this product is crucial to it's creation, after all. We promise to credit each backer in the piece's credits. Beyond that, we want to encourage you folks to make an audio recording stating your name. Once you've made the recording, feel free to send the file to us at rcadeproductions@gmail.com and that recording will be featured at some point in one of the piece's installments.

Private Listening Party Invitation - Once the production has reached it's conclusion, backers will be contacted about an opportunity to experience the finished product before it goes live on all major streaming services. As of right now, the location, date, & time for the party are TBD, but we will share the official information with everyone with plenty of time to plan accordingly. We recognize that this perk cannot be extended to those contributors outside of the DMV area, unless they are willing to travel a greater distance, and do sincerely apologize for that.

Our Sincerest Gratitude - We pledge to personally thank each and every one of our backers, once the production has wrapped and published. 
Risks & ChallengesIf anyone has ever been involved in production, or any form of collaboration, then you will know that the larger the involvement the greater the margin or error can become. This is why having folks who are experienced in communicating, scheduling, and coming up with contingency plans are of utmost importance. Dealing with intellectual properties, especially on a collaborative level, certainly comes with its challenges. For instances: meeting deadlines over striving for, "perfection," unexpected schedule changes with an actor, equipment troubleshooting, etc. I admit that the chances of these occurring during our production period are always present. This is why we intend to work with those who have tight track records. Many of the positions listed above have already been filled, as they've proven to get the job done on multiple occasions. With our infrastructure as optimized as possible, we promise that these risk will be significantly reduced.  Other Ways You Can HelpWe completely understand that times can be financially difficult. We've all been in those situations where we want to contribute to a good cause, but the prospect of doing so isn't the most ideal. Not to worry! there are other ways to assist in our campaign. You can:
Share the campaign page on social media, with friends, family members, etc. The more folks are aware of this, the greater our chances of succeeding become!
Share with media companies. 
If you are more interested in assisting the in the creation of the piece itself, feel free to reach out to us at our email: rcadeproductions@gmail.com . Be sure to include positions you're interested in filling, along with any credentials you hold in your particular position of interested (portfolio, website, IMDb page, certifications, etc.)

story:
Overview

  • Hi there! So I am Wesley Ryan Keene and I am incredibly excited to launch this new podcast! As a small-town kid who grew up struggling with depression, anxiety, and my sexual orientation, the lessons I learned from my favorite films, comics, music, and TV shows literally helped save my life. As an openly-gay adult whose finally found happiness in Los Angeles, nothing makes me happier than using my 15 years of experience in psychology and education to explore the positive messages and inspiration we can find in the pop culture phenomena we all know and love.
  • Your contributions will help fund the recording, production, and distribution of the first 25 episodes of the show! I love interacting with and collaborating with my listeners and I've created some fun perks that will hopefully allow all of you to be a part of the show in some way. Make sure ya check 'em out!
  • The negativity on social media and in our world today can be overwhelming, and I truly think we can come together over the things we love; not just through laughter and fun memories, but also through the actual psychological messages we can find in them to better our lives and the lives of those around us. After interviewing members of En Vogue, 'NSync, Lifehouse, and so many other great artists in 100 episodes of The Positive Psychology of Pop Music podcast and radio show, I'm excited to broaden the scope of our positivity movement in this new podcast!
  • Thanks so much for your support and whatever you are able to contribute. If you can copy and paste the link for this page and help spread the word through Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, emails, conversations, carrier pigeons, or however you can, I will be forever grateful!

Thanks!

Wesley Ryan Keene

www.wesleyryankeene.com

story:
Trade Stocks, Forex, Gold, Cryptos, etc. 

Use Our Proprietary Trading Indicators!

Videos and charts below show just how easy it is to trade

No Experience Required

Trade on Desktop or Mobile

Get Our Pro Indicator Package and Start Trading Today!

 

Trade Example - Merck (MRK)

Trade Example - Foot Locker (FL)

 
 

Alexander Berger is our resident Renaissance Man. He has been a nervous beginner; an arrogant novice; and a confident, mature trader. Whatever stage you find yourself at, Alexander has been there. Under his tutelage, novice technical traders get to skip the costly rookie mistakes; and seasoned ones level-up their game! 

With Indiegogo, Alexander will continue to expand www.MasterChartsTrading.com blog, MarketRecap videos, and #EveryoneCanTrade training library. Backers will also fund his ongoing collaboration with Alec, in producing PriceAction Indicators 2.0 for the TradingView platform, and in adapting the Indicators to new trading platforms.

Alexander (Alec) Sadovsky, is the ace mathematician, and our technical lead. He can formulate the question, solve the problem, and explain the solution in plain English. Alec verified and fine-tuned Alexander’s largely intuitively derived Indicators; created the blueprint for adapting them to other platforms; and is hard at work on PriceAction Indicators 2.0 for the TradingView platform.

With Indiegogo, Alec will adapt PriceAction Indicators, which are now available for TradingView, to MetaTrader, and other popular platforms. He will also be able to dedicate more time to providing technical and educational assistance to subscribers.

 


Taking the stock market conditions and www.MasterChartsTrading.com trading strategies and putting them into precise mathematical systems.

 

 

Prototype product for MetaTrader 4 - Help us build it!

story:
Decision Science

We all make decisions all the time. About everything. We think that qualifies us to make good decisions. It does not. We all have legs and can walk but in order to run marathons or sprint we have to be trained: Good running technique has to be learnt, coordination has to be improved,  emotions and feelings need to be managed. Thinking is no different. Neither is decision making. This course gives you everything you need to become more focused and analytical. When your choices are better, your decisions are better and so are the outcomes you achieve in your life and business.

I wrote The Sniper Mind. It was a three-year long, deep dive into the world of neuroscience, elite athletes, pilots and snipers. Creating a highly structured course based on the science behind book and all the extra real-life practical material that arose from the research and the interviews is the next step in a journey that has already changed the life of many people around the world. It's also a step for which I really need your help.   

A course that helps anyone who has an internet connection and a device improve their decision making and gain greater control of their life is transformational. It becomes the building block of greater change across the world. This is why with your help this online course will be completely free, available to everyone for a guaranteed minimum period of at least five years. 

What It Costs & What You Get

The breakdown of the costs of the project is as follows:

  • Approx. $8,000 will buy the time necessary to create the structure, do the writing, create the videos, write the supporting manual and create the necessary website text and other course materials.
  • The rest of the cost, will go into buying studio time for a professional setting to the video material, the rental of decent sound equipment and a video camera, professional video editing, a book editor who will need to proof and edit the manual and support materials that accompany the videos and the design and set up of the website from which the course will be available. Should we raise anything beyond that level I will put it towards improving the course materials, ensuring hosting costs are covered long-term and, if possible, advertising the course so as many people benefit from it as possible. 
  • There are different levels you can be part of all this starting with a mention and a link on the website and going all the way up to personalized, signed copies of "The Sniper Mind" and "Intentional" a follow-up book that's being written which will come out next year. All of this is described in the Perks section of this project. 

Every day that passes and every email I get from current readers of "The Sniper Mind" make me realize just how much a course like this is of direct benefit to many people. I am committed to doing it regardless. Should we not reach the target funding I will see where corners can be cut and what I can reduce on to still make it happen. 

The Impact

What would the world be like if most people in it acted intentionally and exercised non-linear thinking in their decision-making? I believe that it would be a world that's more considerate, more thoughtful and more equitable than the one we are currently in. 

That world can only come about through awareness, self-development and better management of our inner resources and talents, at individual level. 

The books I write ("The Sniper Mind" included) help tens of thousands of individuals improve themselves, upgrade their skills, increase their knowledge and work and behave in better ways. I have a proven track record of delivering complex books that demystify difficult subjects to the reader, on time. This project has more moving parts (video, audio and a manual) but it's no different in scope and structure. 

Help me complete it and we all benefit. You, as contributors will get the course plus the perks listed in the Perks section. Individuals from all over the world will have access to a means through which they can improve themselves and make better decisions and choices at a time when these skills are needed most. The world only changes because we do. 

Risks & Challenges

The scale of the project is broader than a book. The manual will have to support the video, the video will have to fit in with the audio files. There is a lot to manage and there are external factors (studio rental and outside professionals who will contribute) which I don't control completely. 

My role will not be just content planner and creator but project manager. While I have tried to think of everything I don't know what unknown unknowns lie ahead. I have built time into the estimated delivery date to take into account any eventualities that may surprise me.

Regardless I will keep you all informed every step of the way and also let you know of the progress being made.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now but have seen this and know that this course, once completed, will be available free to you regardless there are other ways you can help: 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and help draw as much attention to this as possible.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. Help make this campaign appear everywhere.

Thank you!

story:
Dear Whetstone supporters, 

As parts of the world enter a season of emergence, our longing to connect and to explore is stronger than ever. Many of us stayed connected to the world this past year through media and technology. More than ever, media and technology play a central role in shaping our beliefs. The stories reflected back through these means can either give power or diminish it. 

Knowledge has shaped who we are and how we see the world. It’s at the core of what Whetstone is—a Black-owned media company working to uplift underexplored stories and experiences with empathy and curiosity. We ask big questions, hold space. We listen, process, and share. As Chef Michael Adé Elégbèdé shared with us in Point of Origin episode 11, whoever tells the story, owns the story. So what does that imply for a Black-owned media company, the only one of its kind? It means our survival is essential. 

You’ve supported us in creating a successful print magazine, launching a digital publishing platform, and developing our award-winning Point of Origin podcast. 

Your trust has allowed us to make these strides, and now we’re asking for you to trust us when we say to you that the Whetstone Radio Collective is going to revolutionize food media. But it won't be possible without you. Please continue below for more details on how you can support this new venture.

Adrienne Maree Brown said it best: “The stories we tell can either reflect the society we are a part of or transform it. If we want to bring new worlds into existence, then we need to challenge the narratives that uphold current power dynamics and patterns.” 

Podcast companies, like most media companies, are overwhelmingly white-owned and culturally homogeneous. For Whetstone Radio Collective, diverse storytelling and storytellers are native to the brand — it’s not a pivot. 

Please help us birth the largest audio collective in the world dedicated to the story of food. 

 

Say hello to Whetstone Radio Collective! 

 

Whetstone Radio Collective will launch in Fall 2021 with a dozen shows, hosted by 12 exceptional womxn bringing you the very best ideas, insight, and stories from the world of global gastronomy. 

Asking for money is a painstaking process that requires some courage and humility. But we’re here today because we believe that Whetstone Radio Collective has the capacity to take you back to the land, and around the world. It has the capacity to teach us about food, and teach us about what food teaches us about ourselves. 

If you’re able, we thank you for helping build the Whetstone Radio Collective. (There are some perks, too!). 

Here’s what you get when you donate!

  • $50 —  Early access to Whetstone Radio Collective content 
  • $100 —   Personal signed copy of Whetstone Magazine, Vol. 7 
  • $250 —  A limited-edition, 6x8 print from Whetstone
  • $500 — 1-year subscription to Whetstone Magazine (Vols. 7 to 10) or Vol. 7 & [limited edition] Whetstone organic cotton tee
  • $1,000 — 100% oxblood organic cotton Whetstone hoodie
  • $5,000 — Includes all of the above, plus a shoutout on Whetstone Radio Collective 
  • $7,500 —  Help produce a story feature or advertisement feature on Whetstone Radio Collective

story:
About Philosophy2u

If you've wanted a world in which humans were more engaged, curious, and civil(!) when conversing about life, then Philosophy2u is the cultural engine to help get us there! 

As a once successful academic philosopher and public orator, I've created various forums through which people of different backgrounds can be inspired and engaged by deep and meaningful ideas and debates. The aim of Philosophy2u is to inspire people to get philosophical in order to make their lives richer and more deeply attuned. I offer blogs, vlogs, stories, podcasts, consultation, and coaching. 

My writing and work are unique, well-crafted, and original. Please find out for yourself: a blog on hard conversations or a podcast interviewing Hollywood editor Alan Bell (The Hunger Games, 500 Days of Summer) on life lessons.

Philosophy is not just an academic discipline, its ideas, theories, and discussions can be brought to life for a wide range of people who only need to be inspired by ideas and questions presented in a medium that speaks to them.

 

Funding Goal

Campaign Goal: Funding for two years of operation to grow the project ($4032)

Your donation will be crucial in funding the operation and marketing costs of my website, podcasts, and vlogs:

  • Annual website: $300 per year (account, domain name, email service)
  • Podcast account: $216 per year (unlimited upload and storage)
  • Zoom account: $200 per year (unlimited hosting)
  • Advertisement: $1100 per year (targeted ads on Facebook, Amazon, various podcasting apps)
  • Misc: $200 per year (hard equipment maintenance, replacement, or upgrade)

 

What will you get? 
Socrates once spoke of something called "internal goods"--or those things that are virtuous for their own sake. Contributing to a project that aims to weave philosophical reflection into the fabric of our daily lives is such a thing.

So is it too much to suggest that those who donate will get the joy and satisfaction of supporting and helping to drive a project aiming to make the world a more civil place, where we can learn about new ideas and take what we can from them to transform the way we live?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate money, you can provide suggestions: 

  • I am always interested in interviewing people (for my podcast) who have excelled at their work or made significant and meaningful contributions. 

Or, help spread the word! Whether it's

  • forwarding a podcast link to friends;
  • responding to a blog on social media;
  • connecting me with another person (e.g. literary agent, reporter, editor) . . .

Contributing to a project that aims to weave philosophical reflection into the fabric of our daily lives is such a thing.So is it too much to suggest that those who donate will get the joy and satisfaction of supporting and helping to drive a project aiming to make the world a more civil place, where we can learn about new ideas and take what we can from them to transform the way we live? Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are not able to donate money, you can provide suggestions: I am always interested in interviewing people (for my podcast) who have excelled at their work or made significant and meaningful contributions. Or, help spread the word! Whether it's
forwarding a podcast link to friends;
responding to a blog on social media;
connecting me with another person (e.g. literary agent, reporter, editor) . . .

story:
IRIS - About the Project

The year is 2054, and in the midst of rising temperatures, methane fires, and overpopulation, one young private detective named Iris Ignatius is hired to investigate a series of death threats against a renewable energy corporation. It is a different place: police as an instrument of law enforcement have been abolished and replaced with the 'temporary' measure of Ballast, a chip placed at the top of the spine that makes you faint before you commit a crime. It is hypothesized that once we develop community responses to crime, Ballast will become unnecessary and can be removed.

(...)

Artistic rendition from Episode 1: The Runner and the Drone- by Amelia Ross

About IRIS

As is the case for most mysteries, IRIS was born from a question. How could we, as theatre artists, extend the experience for our audiences beyond the theatre’s physical space? How could we introduce them to the characters, evoke investment in the narrative, and raise the stakes of the story before they had even purchased a ticket or set foot within a stage lobby? For us, the answer was a podcast. The intersection of technology and live stage performance is a key part of Wunderdog Theatre’s mandate and this project became Wunderdog’s first real foray into mixed media.

IRIS is a twelve-episode fictional podcast that will be released bi-weekly and culminate in a thirteenth live performance episode that will also be professionally recorded for remote listeners. It is a futuristic mystery that takes place in a world similar to our own, yet distinctly unfamiliar. It addresses issues that we face as a society today while framing them in a question: what will the world look like if we fail to act now?

The script, written by C.R. Packer, features a set of characters that represent a diverse cross section of marginalized voices. Our hope for IRIS is that it reaches folx of all persuasions, political alignments, and identities; that it challenges its listeners, and that, beyond everything it captures the hearts of those simply looking to immerse themselves in a captivating story.

(...)

Artistic rendition from Episode 6: The Code and the Wooden Animal - by Amelia Ross

Episode 1: The Runner and the Drone

Episode 2: The Symbol and the Body

Episode 3: The Tribunal

Episode 4: The Elite and the Cold Hope

Episode 5: The House and the Garden

Episode 6: The Code and the Wooden Animal

Episode 7: The Shot and the River

Episode 8: The Desert and the Sea

Episode 9: The Deal and the Discovery

Episode 10: The Meeting Room and the Operatives

Episode 11: The Cell

Episode 12: The Ending and the Beginning

Episode 13: LIVE (AND recorded for remote listeners) - MORE INFO TO BE ANNOUNCED

Artistic rendition from Episode 15 The House and the Garden- by Amelia Ross
 

(...)

About Wunderdog Theatre

Wunderdog Theatre is Canadian production company that seeks to explore the relationship between storyteller and audience on the twenty-first century stage. Integrating new technology with traditional theatrical conventions, Wunderdog is all about finding new ways to tell stories and examining the way we consume narrative in a digital era. Comprised of professionals in the Vancouver area, all graduates from Vancouver theatre programs, Wunderdog Theatre has a strong mandate to provide creative opportunities for emerging artists of all persuasions.

(...)
 

What We Need

We are looking to raise $7,500.00 CAD to get this project off the ground. This will be enough to get us started, but if we hit our target we may increase our goal so that we can do even more- more immersive bonus content, more elaborate sound and stage designs, and a longer run for the live show!

Creating a podcast isn't cheap, and neither is producing a live show; we're hoping to do both. With the money raised in this campaign, our team here at Wunderdog hopes to do the following:

  • Pay our team! Our writer has poured countless hours into this project, and we anticipate countless more hours will be poured into it by our actors, sound designer, social media and marketing leads, and our own Wunderdog team by the time everything is finished, not to mention the team tackling the live show! We want to make sure our people are paid fairly for their time. 
  • Purchase recording equipment (zoom recorder, microphone, windscreen, editing software, SFX library, etc.)
  • Rent rehearsal/recording studio and alternate locations/ live performance venue(s)
  • Purchasing + commissioning graphic design + marketing materials
  • Generate creative and immersive bonus material to expand the world of IRIS
  • Rent ad space
  • Host our podcast and our website
  • Create stage, prop, lighting and sound designs for the live production
  • Other unforeseen costs associated with the project (transportation, communication, etc.)

 

EVERY little bit helps!

(...)
 

What You Get


Here's what you get for contributing!

Anything at all: You make the podcast happen. You bring Iris into the world. And you get Wunderdog's love forever! Honestly, it's people like you who are generous enough to contribute in the name of art that lets people like us do what we do, and we are so unbelievably grateful. 

$5: A Thank You on the Website

$25: Access to exclusive backer-only bonus content + everything above.

$50: Signed Postcard from the Team + everything above.

$75: A Personalized Recorded Note + everything above

$100: A Shout Out on the Podcast + everything above.

$200: Cameo in Bonus Content + everything above.

$500: Custom Sketch by Artist + everything above.

$1000: Producer Credit + everything above.

$2000: Executive Producer Credit + everything above.

(...)
 

Other Ways You Can Help

And whether or not you can contribute monetarily, there are still ABSOLUTELY ways you can help us out. 

MAKE SOME NOISE: Share this campaign (using Indiegogo's share tools), Share @irispodcast and @wunderdogtheatre on instagram, repost anything WE share, talk about Iris to your friends. Get the word out- we can't do this without you!

LISTEN TO THE PODCAST: When it's out, plug those earphones in and come along for the ride. We want you there. And when all is said and done and the live show happens, we would LOVE to see your face in the audience. 

(...)
 

IRIS' Impact - A Note from Writer CR Packer

IRIS is a rare opportunity for a playwright. Wunderdog Theatre asked for pitches for a 12-episode narrative podcast that ended in a cliffhanger, with the concluding episode being a live theatre show - what a gift for the imagination to run wild. At the intersection of science fiction and speculative fiction, Iris is the story of a detective in a climate-changed future in which the United States has abolished the police. As a playwright, I have taken quite a bit of direction from the Wunderdog team, including from dramaturg/lead actor Sarah Harrison. Many voices shape this story; for this writer it has been an instructive and formative experience holding space for everyone's intentions for Iris. Writing a play is always collaborative and this process has truly embodied that.

The main theme of this story, naturally, is state violence - not only the damage it causes, but also how it continues to exist once the police have been removed. In this sense, the power of state control over private citizens is a main feature. The films Gosford Park and In the Heat of the Night both utilize the detective story to talk about some other social issue, and IRIS uses it to explore not only state violence but climate change. I am sensible of the fact that state violence affects me very little as a white person. In writing this material, I have endeavoured to strike a balance between speaking of this truthfully while not speaking for it.

(...)
 

Risks & Challenges

The episodes are written, the leads are cast, we have a killer creative, production, audio and marketing team, and we're ready to make this happen. However, in the pathos of full transparency, this is Wunderdog's first podcast. 

We are already premiering a live and fully produced reading of IRIS Episode 1: The Runner and the Drone, at the 2020 rEvolver festival, hosted by Upintheair Theatre, so that gives us a hard and fast deadline. That said, we don't anticipate this to be anything but a steep and exciting learning curve for us, and we know that we're up to the challenge. 

All of the music, all of the content and all of the audio we are using is either fully original or sourced and purchased. 

Wunderdog and its team is not new to producing content, and we never stop until a project is completed. Between us outside of Wunderdog, we've produced TED Conferences around the world, award-winning theatrical works and international improv comedy conferences. We've written songs and plays and novels. We're up to this challenge, and utterly thrilled to be combining our forces like the Avengers themselves to take this one on. 

In order to prepare to create this podcast we've attended podcasting conferences, done endless hours of research, cornered podcast creators in coffee shops for in-depth talks and made sure to create a team that truly knows what they're doing. We're not about cutting corners. We're about making, as Neil Gaiman says, Good Art. Good Art that makes our pulses quicken and keeps us up at night because we can't stop thinking about it. That's our jam. 

We hope you'll join us for the journey.

(...)

story:
For nearly two years, Scott Dworkin and the team at the Democratic Coalition have worked to lead the Resistance, providing key information and analysis that has stood in the way of Donald Trump and his destructive agenda at every step. From exposing links between Trump and Russia, to diving deep into campaign finance reports to find connections no one’s noticed, we've led the charge to expose Trump and his comrades for the con artists they really are.

To begin, Scott will be hosting the podcast twice a week with episodes lasting 20–30 minutes. Each discussion will feature an insightful guest, most likely a celebrity, elected official or an activist. We will go over key topics including Trump-Russia connections, reactions to the latest political events, Democratic elections to keep an eye on in 2018, and the state of The Resistance. You will also hear more about how we investigate & we will keep you informed on the progress of each investigation into Trump & the Republican Party. You will also hear more about the inner workings of how we investigate.  Our podcast will keep you updated-in real time, on the progress of the investigations into Trump, his cronies and the Republican Party.



The money from this campaign will be used to buy  equipment for the podcast (such as: microphones, a dedicated computer for the podcast, a mixer, audio processor, etc.) and to soundproof the new studio. The funds will also allow us to  hire a research and  production assistant to help with the recordings.






Contributing to this campaign will help us put together all of the items we need to host a fully equipped podcast-studio, where we can provide monthly, weekly, and daily content for listeners. A contribution ensures state-of-the-art production value along with the resources necessary to continue conducting the important research that informs thoughtful, impactful discussions. With your help, we will be able to provide analysis of the latest political events, detail our research into the Trump Administration and Members of Congress, and let everyone in on the Washington insider’s info network.


Episode 1: Joy Reid is the host of AMJoy on MSNBC, author of Fracture: Barack Obama, the Clintons, and the Racial Divide​, and is a political columnist at The Daily Beast.



Episode 2: Michael Rapaport is an American actor, podcast host, writer, director, comedian, and media personality. He has appeared in over sixty films since the early 1990’s; Scott’s favorites being Higher Learning & Cop Land.



Episode 3: Alyssa Milano is an actress, activist, producer, and singer. She has starred in Who’s The Boss, Melrose Place, Charmed, My Name is Earl, and most recently, Wet Hot American Summer: 10 Years Later.


 
Episode 4: Chelsea Handler is Chelsea Handler. (Comedian, actress, writer, television host, and producer)



Thank you for taking the time to consider donating to our podcast. With your contribution, it allows us to keep pushing back against Trump, his administration, and the Republican Party. With your support, we will make The Dworkin Report Podcast a reality. We’d love it if you would make a contribution and share our crowdfund link with your networks. Thanks again!

story:
There's an old saying that says 'If you're doing something you love you'll never work a day in your life'. Unfortunately I HAVE worked many days in my years, toiling away at bigger corporations, sitting in meetings that talk about 'driving for results' and 'is there any value added' and other random leadership terms the bosses have read in books. Meanwhile I see change to be made all of the time but I can't enact any of it because there has to be a meeting about a meeting about a meeting for the change or I'm told by someone that doesn't know anything about the job that I'm wrong and need to 'close these skill gaps'. Well...I've had enough.

My name is Steve and I've been into games since the first time I held an Atari controller and played the bad version of Pac-Man at my aunt's house. Since then I've played everything I could get my hands on: I saved Zelda from Ganon in A Link to the Past, I've braved the horrors of Silent Hill, I've brought an end to the Lich Kings' reign, and so on. I'm a husband and a father now and I'm doing my best to impart my many (MANY) years of gaming knowledge on my kids and raising them right. 

My kids all really enjoy watching game streamers on YouTube. For the most part I can enjoy these however it seems there is a trend of lots of screaming, nonsensical talk or annoying people talking nothing but trash. There doesn't seem to be anything out there that's really aimed at my age group or experience. I'm never going to climb the competitive ranks in Overwatch but I do love to play around in it. That's when I realized my future.

I'm not suited for the corporate world. I'm a natural born entertainer. I'm the most comfortable with a crowd of people laughing and clapping and interacting with me. That's what made me think of 'Dad Games Strong'. I will produce and live stream content that I would want to watch: weekly live gaming chances to play with my community, how-to videos, new game playthroughs chosen by my community, and so much more.

What I'm turning to Kickstarter for the funds for a good streaming setup. I will mostly stream from my PS4 however I want to have the most optimal PC setup as well. These funds will allow me to purchase the following:

A High-End PC
An Elgato Capture Card
A high-quality microphone
A high-quality webcam

WIth this setup I feel I will producing high-quality content in no time, thus creating my ideal channel and brand for the other dads and moms out there that while they may have to pick the kids up at school in the afternoon they still like to stay up late playing some Dead by Daylight.
