story:
The Women Who Dare project

After reading the back of a Clif Bar, Kerry was left wondering, "where are all the awesome women?" Knowing that awesome women must live all over the US, Kerry made it her mission to bike across the country and meet as many inspirational women as possible. Not wanting to keep the experience for herself, Kerry devised Women Who Dare as a way to share the stories of these inspirational women with the world. 

With a background in in-depth interviewing and a love for the spoken word, it is natural that Kerry would share these women's stories through a podcast. So as to ensure a quality listening experience, she'll focus on riding and interviewing this spring and summer and on editing this coming fall. The podcast can be expected during late fall of 2017. 

While riding, in addition to interviewing inspirational women for the podcast, Kerry will be sharing photos on Instagram and posting updates to her website. If you'd like to see Women Who Dare come to life, please consider supporting the project!

 

    The timeline

    The brainchild of summer 2016, Kerry hits the road during early summer 2017. The Women Who Dare podcast is due to drop late fall 2017.

    • August 2016: That fateful reading of a Clif Bar which set Women Who Dare in motion
    • September through December 2016: Completion of other obligations to make time for the Women Who Dare project
    • January, February, and March 2017: Gathering suggestions of inspirational women and financial support
    • April 2017: Organizing a route based on suggested women, planning logistics, and setting off!  
    • May through August 2017: On the road, interviewing Women Who Dare, sharing photos on Instagram, and writing updates about the experience
    • Fall 2017: Back in Maine, editing interviews and launching the Women Who Dare podcast!

    When it's all said and done, the Women Who Dare project will have spanned more than a year and 5,000 miles. A small price to pay for the chance to share the stories of strong, courageous women who sometimes get left in the shadows. 

     

     

    The budget

    To make Women Who Dare a success, Kerry expects to incur the following costs. 

     

    Pre-Departure Expenses

    $2,000

    Bike Outfitting: $800

    Configure a  Salsa Mariachi  for touring or find a used touring bike.

    Touring Gear: $650

    Panniers, lightweight sleeping bag and pad, stove, and  maps from the Adventure Cycling Association.

    Audio Recording Equipment: $550

    Two  TASCAM DR-10L  portable recorders, miniSD cards, and case for recorders and cards.

     

    Story Gathering Expenses

    $3,525

    Weekly Expenses: $105 x 17 weeks = $2,805

    Food ($15/day), campgrounds ($20/night -- est. 3 nights per week),  and the generosity of others ($0/night -- est. 4 nights per week).

    Bike Maintenance: $720

    Per 1,000 miles: 4 new tubes ($24), new tires ($50), lube and other misc ($20), and major bothers ($50).

     

    Podcast Development Expenses

    $1,000

    1-2 Months of Editing: $1,000

    Time and space at the end of the ride to craft a valuable podcast sharing the stories of Women Who Dare.

     

    Total Project Expenses

    $6,525 + 10%  fees  = $7,187.50

     

    In addition to all funds raised through this campaign, Kerry will be adding her own savings to make Women Who Dare possible. From her time in graduate school, she's learned that peanut butter and bananas are not only delicious and nutritious, they also keep pennies in the bank for important adventures. Should the Women Who Dare project still not reach its goals for financial support, Kerry will find ways to further decrease expenses and still tell the stories of inspirational women.

     

    Three ways to help

    1. Suggest a Woman ​​​- You're inspired by a woman who's done awesome things. You'd love to hear her story in her own words. Tell Kerry so she can try to find her for inclusion in Women Who Dare! 
    2. Spread the Word - You know people. You even know people who would be interested in the Women Who Dare project. How about telling them about suggesting a woman, feeding the ride, or listening to the podcast?
    3. Feed the Ride - Women Who Dare will be as financially efficient as possible, but it still needs some support to get off and rolling. Plus, in addition to listening to the podcast (free for the world), your support could get you a postcard from the trip, an awesome leather coozie, or a shoutout on the project website or podcast!

     

    A word of thanks from Kerry

    Sharing the stories of Women Who Dare has been my driving ambition for many months. Through training for adventure racing and finishing graduate school my internal refrain was "Soon, I can make Women Who Dare a reality."

    Now, the time has come for me to put the Women Who Dare project in motion. I'm excited about the prospect of biking across the country in search of women who've inspired my friends, family, and many others beyond. By sharing my experiences and the stories of Women Who Dare, I hope to do my small part in strengthening the standing of women around the world. 

    Thank you for all your support.
story_txt:
The Women Who Dare project
After reading the back of a Clif Bar, Kerry was left wondering, "where are all the awesome women?" Knowing that awesome women must live all over the US, Kerry made it her mission to bike across the country and meet as many inspirational women as possible. Not wanting to keep the experience for herself, Kerry devised Women Who Dare as a way to share the stories of these inspirational women with the world. 
With a background in in-depth interviewing and a love for the spoken word, it is natural that Kerry would share these women's stories through a podcast. So as to ensure a quality listening experience, she'll focus on riding and interviewing this spring and summer and on editing this coming fall. The podcast can be expected during late fall of 2017. 
While riding, in addition to interviewing inspirational women for the podcast, Kerry will be sharing photos on Instagram and posting updates to her website. If you'd like to see Women Who Dare come to life, please consider supporting the project!
 

The timeline
The brainchild of summer 2016, Kerry hits the road during early summer 2017. The Women Who Dare podcast is due to drop late fall 2017.


August 2016: That fateful reading of a Clif Bar which set Women Who Dare in motion

September through December 2016: Completion of other obligations to make time for the Women Who Dare project

January, February, and March 2017: Gathering suggestions of inspirational women and financial support

April 2017: Organizing a route based on suggested women, planning logistics, and setting off!  

May through August 2017: On the road, interviewing Women Who Dare, sharing photos on Instagram, and writing updates about the experience

Fall 2017: Back in Maine, editing interviews and launching the Women Who Dare podcast!

When it's all said and done, the Women Who Dare project will have spanned more than a year and 5,000 miles. A small price to pay for the chance to share the stories of strong, courageous women who sometimes get left in the shadows. 
 

 
The budget
To make Women Who Dare a success, Kerry expects to incur the following costs. 
 
Pre-Departure Expenses
$2,000
Bike Outfitting: $800
Configure a  Salsa Mariachi  for touring or find a used touring bike.
Touring Gear: $650
Panniers, lightweight sleeping bag and pad, stove, and  maps from the Adventure Cycling Association.
Audio Recording Equipment: $550
Two  TASCAM DR-10L  portable recorders, miniSD cards, and case for recorders and cards.
 
Story Gathering Expenses
$3,525
Weekly Expenses: $105 x 17 weeks = $2,805
Food ($15/day), campgrounds ($20/night -- est. 3 nights per week),  and the generosity of others ($0/night -- est. 4 nights per week).
Bike Maintenance: $720
Per 1,000 miles: 4 new tubes ($24), new tires ($50), lube and other misc ($20), and major bothers ($50).
 
Podcast Development Expenses
$1,000
1-2 Months of Editing: $1,000
Time and space at the end of the ride to craft a valuable podcast sharing the stories of Women Who Dare.
 
Total Project Expenses
$6,525 + 10%  fees  = $7,187.50
 
In addition to all funds raised through this campaign, Kerry will be adding her own savings to make Women Who Dare possible. From her time in graduate school, she's learned that peanut butter and bananas are not only delicious and nutritious, they also keep pennies in the bank for important adventures. Should the Women Who Dare project still not reach its goals for financial support, Kerry will find ways to further decrease expenses and still tell the stories of inspirational women.
 
Three ways to help


Suggest a Woman ​​​- You're inspired by a woman who's done awesome things. You'd love to hear her story in her own words. Tell Kerry so she can try to find her for inclusion in Women Who Dare! 

Spread the Word - You know people. You even know people who would be interested in the Women Who Dare project. How about telling them about suggesting a woman, feeding the ride, or listening to the podcast?

Feed the Ride - Women Who Dare will be as financially efficient as possible, but it still needs some support to get off and rolling. Plus, in addition to listening to the podcast (free for the world), your support could get you a postcard from the trip, an awesome leather coozie, or a shoutout on the project website or podcast!

 
A word of thanks from Kerry
Sharing the stories of Women Who Dare has been my driving ambition for many months. Through training for adventure racing and finishing graduate school my internal refrain was "Soon, I can make Women Who Dare a reality."
Now, the time has come for me to put the Women Who Dare project in motion. I'm excited about the prospect of biking across the country in search of women who've inspired my friends, family, and many others beyond. By sharing my experiences and the stories of Women Who Dare, I hope to do my small part in strengthening the standing of women around the world. 
Thank you for all your support.

story:
Summary

Hello, I'm theHighHeeledGamer (AKA Katherine Rollins). I have started Stay Nerdy Productions which houses 3 podcasts, the Drunken Hungry Nerd, The Hero Without a Cape, and All Up in Your Geek which launches later on this year, it also produces the webshow the Late Night Nerd Show on YouTube, along with coordinating charity events and E-Sports League. Stay Nerdy Productions will help others create their podcasts and web series as well.

I have launched this campaign because the production company is growing and needs more equipment and the company has created a gaming/comic book convention, the Stay Nerdy Con, and equipment is needed for that as well.

Contributions will help a great deal. Stay Nerdy Productions will be able to continue helping others make their dreams a reality. 

What We Need 

$7,600 is what is needed to achieve Stay Nerdy Productions goal. This will help pay for two recording cameras, lapel and computer microphones, tripods, and backdrops. The equipment for the convention are flyers, banners, tables, chairs, consoles, t.v.s, and cleaning supplies.

story:
A Brief Summary of the Production

Greetings! My name is R. Lawson Cade, and thank you for taking the time to stop by and check out what this campaign is all about. This is an opportunity for folks to become an integral part in R-Cade Productions's first, official in-house production. "Smothered." An audio drama that is planned to be delivered in the format of an estimated 7-8 episode podcast series. The story will tell a highly intensive, nail-biting criminal investigation that will put the character's moralities in question. Join us in experiencing the tremendous joys that comes with the creation of something, while sharing the story's crucial lessons with the world. Becoming a vital asset to the creation of something, at a price completely self-determined? Trust me. The payoff will be priceless.   

What We Need

It may not seem it, but even a podcast series has its fair share of expenses that go with it...

We've managed to budget both a minimum, and maximum, estimated total cost for this. The minimum goal will certainly be enough to allow our team to get by, while the maximum goal will allow us the opportunity to invest in more robust gear, create some reserve funds should the unexpected happen, and provide us with a larger donation to CASA. These figures represent ever aspect of this piece's production from:

  • Actor Performances
  • Composers
  • Sound Designers
  • Story Consultants 
  • Editors
  • Gear
  • Marketing Materials
  • Scheduling & Coordination
  • Directors
  • Donations To A Charitable Cause

We have all intentions of making this product it's finest form possible. What we're asking of you, our potential backers, is the financial stability necessary to properly compensate our team for their time and efforts. Beyond that, we pledge to donate the remainder of the production's funds to the Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) for Children. The fact that humanity has been gifted with the ability to express ourselves artistically is a remarkable thing. However we, at R-Cade Productions, wish to take that luxury and use it as a platform to inspire change and betterment in our world. 

The Impact

Curious to know who you'll be directly affecting/ supporting by donating?

  • Providing artist with an opportunity to showcase their craft, while financially supporting them for their time and efforts. 
  • Being apart of a story with depth and poignancy.
  • Supporting a National Association that provides support systems and second chances to escape from their neglectful, or abusive, households. 
  • A message worth sharing.   

What You Get

R-Cade Productions is a modest sized production company. Aside from the satisfactions that comes with a donation to a great cause, I'm afraid we cannot offer too much to those interested in backing this campaign. What we can offer to you, should you feel inspired to donate, can be found listed below. We do sincerely apologize that there isn't more incentive for you folks to consider backing this cause. In the future, we pledge to remedy that.

  • Aural & Listed Credit - When you donate to this campaign, you become apart of it. Providing the stability necessary to sustain this product is crucial to it's creation, after all. We promise to credit each backer in the piece's credits. Beyond that, we want to encourage you folks to make an audio recording stating your name. Once you've made the recording, feel free to send the file to us at rcadeproductions@gmail.com and that recording will be featured at some point in one of the piece's installments.
  • Private Listening Party Invitation - Once the production has reached it's conclusion, backers will be contacted about an opportunity to experience the finished product before it goes live on all major streaming services. As of right now, the location, date, & time for the party are TBD, but we will share the official information with everyone with plenty of time to plan accordingly. We recognize that this perk cannot be extended to those contributors outside of the DMV area, unless they are willing to travel a greater distance, and do sincerely apologize for that.
  • Our Sincerest Gratitude - We pledge to personally thank each and every one of our backers, once the production has wrapped and published. 

Risks & Challenges

If anyone has ever been involved in production, or any form of collaboration, then you will know that the larger the involvement the greater the margin or error can become. This is why having folks who are experienced in communicating, scheduling, and coming up with contingency plans are of utmost importance. Dealing with intellectual properties, especially on a collaborative level, certainly comes with its challenges. For instances: meeting deadlines over striving for, "perfection," unexpected schedule changes with an actor, equipment troubleshooting, etc. I admit that the chances of these occurring during our production period are always present. This is why we intend to work with those who have tight track records. Many of the positions listed above have already been filled, as they've proven to get the job done on multiple occasions. With our infrastructure as optimized as possible, we promise that these risk will be significantly reduced.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that times can be financially difficult. We've all been in those situations where we want to contribute to a good cause, but the prospect of doing so isn't the most ideal. Not to worry! there are other ways to assist in our campaign. 

You can:

  • Share the campaign page on social media, with friends, family members, etc. The more folks are aware of this, the greater our chances of succeeding become!
  • Share with media companies. 
  • If you are more interested in assisting the in the creation of the piece itself, feel free to reach out to us at our email: rcadeproductions@gmail.com . Be sure to include positions you're interested in filling, along with any credentials you hold in your particular position of interested (portfolio, website, IMDb page, certifications, etc.)

Share with media companies. 
If you are more interested in assisting the in the creation of the piece itself, feel free to reach out to us at our email: rcadeproductions@gmail.com . story:
Inspiring People to Change the World

Arc Benders is inspired by the Martin Luther King Jr. quote “The Arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice.” What we must realize is that WE have to be the ones to bend the arc. 

Our goal is to interview 100 people that have used their talent to change the world by the end of the year.  Our hope is that these interviews will inspire more people to make a difference and celebrate so many amazing individuals driving change.

With your help, we're going to travel to meet Arc Benders in different communities and bring together social impact leaders along the way.  Here is our plan: 

We're also going to work to build an online community that Arc Benders can use to seek advice, share stories,  post job opportunities, and support each other in inspiring work.

What We Need & What You Get

We'll be using the funds raised to travel to different locations and meet with Arc Benders across the country and host events to bring social impact leaders together.  Also, with your support, the insight gained from these interviews and this trip will be used to develop tools and resources that will help social impact leaders scale their impact. 

When we surpass our goal, additional funds will go towards visiting more Arc Benders and bringing these stories to a wider audience.

We can honestly not thank you enough for support.  As a small expression of our gratitude, here are the rewards you'll receive:

  • At minimum, you'll get a thank you hug for any contribution amount! It can be in-person or virtual, if we don’t get a chance to meet in person... and it can also be a high-five if hugs aren't your thing.
  • An Arc Benders Sticker & hand written thank you note as for a $25 contribution or more.
  • Digital Album with photos from the road trip for a $50 contribution or more. The images can be used however you'd like, from creating prints for your home to using them for stock photography. Christina is super excited about planning to take photos that capture the beauty and personality of the places she's visiting.
    • Here is one print-worthy photograph that will be included from a recent trip to the Outer Banks:

  • 1-hour coaching session and/or hang out with Christina - by phone or in-person if you’re in one of the cities we’re visiting for a $100 contribution.
    • Here are things we can help with: marketing strategy advice, career coaching, personal brand, real talk on changing the world, and/or just someone to talk to. 

If you're in the Triangle, we can grab coffee at A Place at the Table, our favorite pay-what-you-can cafe! For other locations, we can decide what makes most sense. 

  • Amazing deals on photography sessions with Christina are offered at 2-different levels, based on what you're looking for & slots are limited! 
    • A 1-hour photography session with Christina is great for updated family photos or headshots for a $275 contribution.
    • A 1.5-hour session is best for engagement photos, commercial photos for your business, or a variety of new headshots with multiple locations and outfit changes for a $375 contribution.

To see Christina's photography portfolio, you can checkout www.christinanoelphotography.net. Please note, these sessions are only available if you live in NC or one of the locations we’re visiting. You can reach out to us at wearethearcbenders@gmail.com to confirm availability before pledging.

Also, we are willing to accept a 50% deposit through the campaign now to book a date & then you can just bring a check at the session and we will honor the discounted rate! 

  • For $1,000 you can be a road trip sponsor!
    • You’ll get your brand exposed to Arc Benders at events and meetups at every stop, as well as a shout out across Arc Benders’ social media platforms.
    • We estimate the total exposure from this project will be to get your brand in front of approximately 1,000 mission-driven individuals! It could be a great way to get your brand exposed to mission-driven organizations and to attract talent with purpose to your organization.
    • Feel free to reach out to us at wearethearcbenders@gmail.com if you’d like to learn more. 
  • You can bring Arc Benders to your city for $2,000!
    • Christina will book a flight to your town or city for, at minimum, 2-days to interview Arc Benders & host an event for social impact leaders in your community.
    • We will collaborate to create an event format that will best serve the needs of your community. 
    • If sponsored by a company or club, Christina is also happy to come speak on the following topics: innovative ways to build customer relationships, B Corps, social entrepreneurship, finding your purpose, and building a company that builds the world.
    • Your organization will also be featured as a road trip sponsor! 

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to email us at wearethearcbenders@gmail.com! 

The Impact

With your help, these are the types of stories we're able to tell:

Kristine shares her journey to building the future of leadership in her interview. Click here to read her full story.

Esther has spent the last 25 years working in roles with an opportunity to make a social impact, including serving as a United Nations Humanitarian Officer and leading a university in Africa with nearly 4,000 students. You can read her full story & learn from her expertise here.

Danny turned what started as a joke in high school into what ultimately became a national program to help make kids happy with Operation Smile. Since then, he has spent his entire life mixing trouble, fun, and altruism to drive change.  To learn his story & hear his amazing examples of how 'fun' can be a force for good, checkout his article here.

Kresse set out to solve England's waste problem and, along with her co-Founder Elvis, built a top luxury brand that donates 50% of its profits per year to firefighter charities while diverting 10 tons of waste from firehoses every year. To hear her insight on social impact & learn her story click here.

The insight and advice from these four interviews alone can change your life... now imagine the impact 100 interviews can make! 

Building a Community

Christina has a history of building communities to drive positive change.  She has been a leader within the B Corp movement for the last 5 years. In 2014, she received the B Corp MVP award, given annually to the person that has made the greatest impact on the global B Corp movement.

With her leadership, Arc Benders will become a platform to bring together social impact leaders, and create the support they need to scale their change.  

We believe that every single person has the ability to be the Arc Bender. We're here to give you the inspiration to start the journey & the tools needed to succeed once you've found your path.

Risks & Challenges

Christina will continue to work towards her goal of completing 100 interviews by the end of the year, but if we don't meet our funding goal we may have to shorten the road trip.

We really want to use this trip to celebrate what makes each social impact community unique, so we need your help to achieve our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, we'd be grateful if you helped us by sharing our campaign & helping us build awareness that www.wearethearcbenders.com exists as a resource for people that want to make an impact.

Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to help us spread the word!

When we surpass our goal, additional funds will go towards visiting more Arc Benders and bringing these stories to a wider audience.
We can honestly not thank you enough for support.  As a small expression of our gratitude, here are the rewards you'll receive:

At minimum, you'll get a thank you hug for any contribution amount! It can be in-person or virtual, if we don’t get a chance to meet in person... and it can also be a high-five if hugs aren't your thing.
An Arc Benders Sticker & hand written thank you note as for a $25 contribution or more.

Digital Album with photos from the road trip for a $50 contribution or more. The images can be used however you'd like, from creating prints for your home to using them for stock photography. Christina is super excited about planning to take photos that capture the beauty and personality of the places she's visiting.Here is one print-worthy photograph that will be included from a recent trip to the Outer Banks:




1-hour coaching session and/or hang out with Christina - by phone or in-person if you’re in one of the cities we’re visiting for a $100 contribution.Here are things we can help with: marketing strategy advice, career coaching, personal brand, real talk on changing the world, and/or just someone to talk to. 

If you're in the Triangle, we can grab coffee at A Place at the Table, our favorite pay-what-you-can cafe! For other locations, we can decide what makes most sense. 

Amazing deals on photography sessions with Christina are offered at 2-different levels, based on what you're looking for & slots are limited! 
A 1-hour photography session with Christina is great for updated family photos or headshots for a $275 contribution.
A 1.5-hour session is best for engagement photos, commercial photos for your business, or a variety of new headshots with multiple locations and outfit changes for a $375 contribution.


To see Christina's photography portfolio, you can checkout www.christinanoelphotography.net. Please note, these sessions are only available if you live in NC or one of the locations we’re visiting. You can reach out to us at wearethearcbenders@gmail.com to confirm availability before pledging.
Also, we are willing to accept a 50% deposit through the campaign now to book a date & then you can just bring a check at the session and we will honor the discounted rate! 

For $1,000 you can be a road trip sponsor!
You’ll get your brand exposed to Arc Benders at events and meetups at every stop, as well as a shout out across Arc Benders’ social media platforms.
We estimate the total exposure from this project will be to get your brand in front of approximately 1,000 mission-driven individuals! It could be a great way to get your brand exposed to mission-driven organizations and to attract talent with purpose to your organization.
Feel free to reach out to us at wearethearcbenders@gmail.com if you’d like to learn more. 


You can bring Arc Benders to your city for $2,000!
Christina will book a flight to your town or city for, at minimum, 2-days to interview Arc Benders & host an event for social impact leaders in your community.
We will collaborate to create an event format that will best serve the needs of your community. 
If sponsored by a company or club, Christina is also happy to come speak on the following topics: innovative ways to build customer relationships, B Corps, social entrepreneurship, finding your purpose, and building a company that builds the world.
Your organization will also be featured as a road trip sponsor! 



If you have any questions, don't hesitate to email us at wearethearcbenders@gmail.com! 

The Impact
With your help, these are the types of stories we're able to tell:

Kristine shares her journey to building the future of leadership in her interview. Click here to read her full story.

Esther has spent the last 25 years working in roles with an opportunity to make a social impact, including serving as a United Nations Humanitarian Officer and leading a university in Africa with nearly 4,000 students. You can read her full story & learn from her expertise here.

Danny turned what started as a joke in high school into what ultimately became a national program to help make kids happy with Operation Smile. Since then, he has spent his entire life mixing trouble, fun, and altruism to drive change.  To learn his story & hear his amazing examples of how 'fun' can be a force for good, checkout his article here.

Kresse set out to solve England's waste problem and, along with her co-Founder Elvis, built a top luxury brand that donates 50% of its profits per year to firefighter charities while diverting 10 tons of waste from firehoses every year. To hear her insight on social impact & learn her story click here.
The insight and advice from these four interviews alone can change your life... now imagine the impact 100 interviews can make! 
Building a Community
Christina has a history of building communities to drive positive change.  She has been a leader within the B Corp movement for the last 5 years. In 2014, she received the B Corp MVP award, given annually to the person that has made the greatest impact on the global B Corp movement.
With her leadership, Arc Benders will become a platform to bring together social impact leaders, and create the support they need to scale their change.  
We believe that every single person has the ability to be the Arc Bender. We're here to give you the inspiration to start the journey & the tools needed to succeed once you've found your path.

Risks & Challenges
Christina will continue to work towards her goal of completing 100 interviews by the end of the year, but if we don't meet our funding goal we may have to shorten the road trip.
We really want to use this trip to celebrate what makes each social impact community unique, so we need your help to achieve our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, we'd be grateful if you helped us by sharing our campaign & helping us build awareness that www.wearethearcbenders.com exists as a resource for people that want to make an impact.
Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to help us spread the word!

story:
PodernLove is the evolution the Facebook podcast community Podcasts We Listen To, created by Jeremy Collins.  Every day over 13,000 members talk about the podcasts they love and we believe it’s time we come together and talk face to face about this entertainment and education medium we all love.  Brook Vandeford, self-described “podcast junkie,” conceived the brand PodernLove.  We are so grateful for her creativity and her willingness to share the PodernLove name with all of us.  Special thanks to Steve from Thinking Sideways for creating the final PodernLove logo designs!

PodernLove: The Convention

This event will be a blast! Join us for two and half days in one of the most exciting, culturally diverse, romantic and historic cities in the country - New Orleans, LA.  We are planning thrilling events where you will learn from and about your favorite hosts.  Your feedback in PWLT is directly influencing how we build this convention to bring YOU the experiences you've asked for

Whether you love history, comedy, pop culture and current events or audio dramas, true crime, movies or sports, there will be something for every podlover.  For our inaugural convention, ticket sales are limited to 700 attendees. ​

PodernLove: Planning, Fundraising & Ticket Sales

The PodernLove planning committee is a group of hosts, listeners  and event planning professionals.   One of the most important steps in getting an event like this off the ground is booking the venue, and we are thrilled to announce PodernLove 2018 will be held  at the Intercontinental Hotel, a premiere, contemporary French Quarter hotel on St. Charles Ave.  

And here’s where we need your help.  The Indiegogo site provides you the opportunity to buy your tickets in advance, with a limited time discount as our way of saying thank you!  Advanced ticket sales ensure we can secure the venue and begin coordinating all of the fantastic events for PodernLove.  Advanced discounted ticket prices are only available for the next 30 days during the Indiegogo campaign.

Since this is a flexible campaign, all funds raised through the Indiegogo site will be used to pay for the PodernLove convention regardless of whether or not we hit our $200,000 goal within 30 days.  In addition to ticket sales there are opportunities to donate to the convention budget and receive great little perks for your donation.  

Ticket prices reflect advanced sale discount via Indiegogo.  Ticket prices will increase after the introductory Indiegogo campaign.  Once the Indiegogo campaign ends, tickets will be available via the PodernLove website.  

PodernLove: The Hotel

PodernLove 2018 will be held  at the Intercontinental Hotel, a premiere, contemporary French Quarter hotel on St. Charles Ave.

The special room rate for PodernLove attendees is only $129/night plus tax.  The hotel only requires a one night minimum deposit when you book your reservation.  Reservations can be made by calling the hotel at (504) 525-5566 or via their website at http://www.icneworleans.com/

And yes, the hotel does have a rooftop pool!

PodernLove: The Podcasts

Of course you want to know which shows will be participating.  And although it’s early, we have a few names we can share!  Keep checking back because we'll be updating this page, and our website which is under construction, with even more podcasts as the planning continues.

              

                  

       

      

               

We will be announcing more podcasts and special guests throughout 2017 and 2018 here and on our social media pages: Twitter @PodernLove  Facebook PodernLove 2018

PodernLove: Sponsorship Opportunities

The PodernLove convention provides terrific sponsorship opportunities for organizations and associations to expand their brands at a variety of options to fit any budget.  Plus, we can customize a sponsorship package to fit your unique needs.  Please contact us at podernlove@outlook.com for more information about Sponsorship Opportunities. 

 

PodernLove: Frequently Asked Questions

Who should attend PodernLove? 

Anyone and everyone! Do you love listening to podcasts? If you do, PodernLove is for you. This is an event organized by podlovers, for podlovers. We want to create an event that celebrates the joy of listening to podcasts and connecting with your favorite hosts in one of our favorite cities in the country!

Can I still get tickets if I don’t buy now on Indiegogo?

Yes. Tickets will be available on our website, which is currently under construction. There will be an increase over the current introductory rate once the Indiegogo campaign ends, however that is the only ticket price increase. We will not be raising ticket prices beyond the increase after the Indiegogo advance order period so you can still attend PodernLove at a reasonable price.

What happens if Indiegogo doesn’t raise your goal?

That’s the great thing about Indiegogo – they’re flexible. Whatever we raise will go to convention expenses, whether we hit our goal within 30 days or not. People can still buy tickets over the next 12 months, however to provide  hotel and event planning deposits, we need to begin ticket sales as soon as possible.

How much are hotel rooms?

The New Orleans Intercontinental hotel is offering significantly discounted room rates for PodernLove attendees of $129/night. The number of rooms at this rate is limited and we encourage you to make your reservations early. A minimum one night deposit is required.

Do I have to stay in the convention hotel?

No. New Orleans is filled with beautiful hotels and you can stay anywhere. It’s only a few minutes to get from most locations in the French Quarter to the Intercontinental Hotel where we’re hosting PodernLove.

What podcasts will be at PodernLove?

 We will have hosts from comedy podcasts, pop culture, current events, sports, movies, books and TV, health and wellness, storytellers, history, true crime, audio drama and so many other categories. There will be so much for everyone to enjoy because like you, we also love a variety of shows and topics.

My question isn't in this list.

Send us an email and we'd be happy to speak with you one on one and answer any questions you migh thave.

story:
We're all about people and energy

Achieving universal access to energy is a massive challenge on multiple levels: any entrepreneur will attest that finding technical solutions is only the start. But seeing how electricity access, cleaner stoves or a tap that delivers fresh water can transform lives, even in a small community, is a huge reward at the end of the long haul.  

This is what fascinates EnAct: the personal stories about who is changing whose life, and how. Time and again, we've seen our stories make the abstract concept of 'energy poverty' strikingly (even shockingly!) real. Hospital staff doing night rounds by the light of a cell phone. University students sharing batteries so they can study in dorms with no electricity.  An entire city--Kathmandu, Nepal no less--disappearing due to load-shedding. (Photo: P. Dicampo)   

We believe 'seeing' these lived realities is far more compelling than 'reading' global statistics and academic reports. Thus, a media outlet dedicated to the energy access story can play a key role in prompting others to take action. 

12 new stories for 2018

With space secured in relevant magazines and online media, EnAct needs support to send journalists and photographers into the field. To the greatest degree possible, we work with locals to keep costs down and also build capacity in energy reporting. 

Our cost to produce and place each article is about $2,500 - covering research, interviews, writing/editing, photography, graphic design, posting on our website and adapting for other outlets. 

We've set our goal of $7,500 to secure funds for the first quarter of 2018, and will leave the campaign open until we hit the $30,000 needed for the full year. If we don't reach the goal, we'll still dedicate what we have to energy access reporting. 

Can storytelling accelerate action?

EnAct has already proven it can! In December 2016, we wrote about the SELCO Foundation adding solar-powered motors to treadle sewing machines, substantially boosting productivity of women tailors in India. Our readers donated more than $2000 to get 10 more machines fitted and distributed through the Foundation's micro-credit scheme. As initial loans are repaid, more women will benefit. (Photo: SELCO Foundation)

Being different is our greatest asset, and our biggest challenge

A key challenge for EnAct is that we are unlike the usual 'actors' in this space. We don't deliver solutions to needy communities; rather, we deliver solution stories to audiences with vested interests. We don't want to compete for investment in or support for energy solutions, but we believe raising awareness is critical to helping secure such engagement.

As media business models collapse around us, we also face the challenge of creating an alternative future. But we believe our unique approach of bringing together experts and award-winning storytellers has a clear benefit: the natural cross-training that occurs boosts knowledge on both sides, and builds trust across these two communities

Importantly, EnAct's approach delivers huge value to energy access actors. Beyond the broad media exposure, we also deliver high-quality images entrepreneurs can use for their own outreach, marketing and communications activities.

Finally, photos can be purchased by individuals who want to show colleagues, friends and family their personal commitment to improving energy access. (Photo: M. Smith) 

More ways to support EnAct & energy actors

EnAct and the energy innovators behind these great stories know that financial contributions are not always possible. Equally valuable to us help in two other ways: 

  • Tell us your story! If you are active in energy access, drop us about what you do. We'll see how we can help others learn about it.
  • Spread the word!  Share these stories through your own social media channels and encourage your colleagues, friends and family to help out. You can follow us here: 
  • Facebook: The Energy Action Project 
  • Twitter: @EnActNow
  • Instagram: @everyday_energy

We believe it's time for everyone to 'get' energy. Hope you'll give us a hand!

story:
Why the F should I give Liz Grant ca$h?

  •  Liz Grant has a proven track record of solvently running businesses and producing successful comedy shows. She's a very unique comedic talent that knows how to write about herself in third person. 

  • Hi! I'm an SF based stand up comedian, who was a massage therapist in the best health clubs for a few decades. I did hard time in the meat mines. I can no longer do massage  for a living due to multiple injuries. To give you a just small example (literally):  I fractured my thumb on a gentleman's big ole sleep apnea neck. Neck won, thumb sad. 
  • Stand up has paid my bills! Until all my gigs got canceled for the unforeseeable future due to The Virus. Instead of staying sad and scared, I'm moving forward with my video series, podcast and eventual product line. 

What's the dealy, LG? (Big lie in third bullet point!)

I'm sourcing my crowds to assist me with producing a podcast and series of videos. The money will be used for:

  • Hiring help: production assistance  (technical help filming, editing, uploading videos/podcast, social media marketing, website, SEO etc.) .
  • Equipment: a video camera, audio equipment, lighting kit, and massage equipment. The massaging other comedians part will have to wait until we get clearance, Clarance because it requires 1) touching a human 2) eventually inhaling each other's droplets.
  • For my helpful, funny massage demos such as Massage Do's and Don'ts, I will be purchasing an articulating medical mannequin. That's a lie. I tried to keep it all clinical but the best deal is a silicone sex doll on eBay (unused, Thank God) and she's $519.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds donated will go to income replacement, low-production value videos shot on my phone, grassroots social media and YouTube marketing.

The Deeper Tissues at Hand (get it!?:)

  • When I get to massage/interview comedians, the podcast and videos will be an archive of  how each comic maneuvers through stress, stays healthy in all areas, their insights about the art of comedy and the human experience,  
  • Laughter is good for the immune system! It releases fell good endorphins. True!
  • Watching Liz massage a respectable silicone doll releases calming serotonin and oxytocin (I mean, I'm pretty sure). 

Risks & Challenges

  • My challenges have always been lack of capital to hire A Team. While I certainly can film, edit, promote/post to a zillion places, SEO optimize, etc. I have severe ADHD (formerly just diagnosed as "Annoying"), so focusing on my comedic writing and performing talents rather than the operations side is sensible. 
  • Being spread too thin was my main challenge when I solvently owned my massage center for six years, InnerCalm. A client once said to me "Shouldn't it be called 'Outer Mania'?". I was the owner/lead massage therapist/hiring manager/trainer/receptionist/marketing team/laundry lady and janitor. When I have the resources to hire help and delegate tasks, I don't get wrung out in the myriad of moving parts. Then I  am an extremely effective COCO (Chief Comedy Operating Officer). 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would love it if you would post about this to your networks. And Indiegogo has easy share tools! 

 

Thank you for your consideration!

Love to you and yours now and always,

Liz

story:
Who We Are

Arts District is a Dallas made podcast hosted by Sterling Shea. It's all about talking to creators, connecting artists, and sharing tips. 

What We Need & What You Get

The COVID19 pandemic has brought a loss of income and a lot of uncertainty about the future of the podcast. Our fundraising goal is $750. This support covers marketing materials, editing and sound mixing, hosting memberships, and the time that goes in to produce quality episodes for 3-4 months.

WE'RE ALSO OFFERING BENEFITS TO DONORS!

  • $20 or more: Special "Thank You" on our Instagram stories
  • $50 or more: Logo sticker sent to you by mail and a special "Thank You" on our Instagram stories
  • $100 or more: Custom audio ad for your business*, a logo sticker sent to you by mail, and a special "Thank You" on our Instagram stories

* if applicable. Eligible for 2 episodes. Ad will be up to one minute in length.

The Impact

People are listening now more than ever. While cleaning, walking the dog, commuting to work, exercising, etc... This podcast serves to keep people inspired and excited while live events are on hiatus. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Subscribe to Arts District, we're probably on your preferred platform.
  • Tell a friend about us! Share this link or suggest an episode to a friend. A personal recommendation goes a long way.

Stay safe and keep creating, y'all!

What We Need & What You Get

story:
Quick FAQ :

How to donate? - Click on the "Back It" button near the top of the page. This will lead you to another page that will ask for your donation amount and form of payment. 

Donor Hall Of Fame? - All donors will be entered into our "Donor Hall Of Fame." This will be promoted on our social media, website and also displayed in our station headquarters for everyone to see. 

What are Perks? - Perks are another way you can donate to our campaign. Perks allow us to give you a little something extra for helping us out. Also, we have some cool perks with signed memorabilia from our amazing friends who support our vision. Perks are located on the right side of the page.

How can I share? - Use the Facebook and Twitter icons on the right side of the page, under the funding timeline and to the right of the Follow button. This will create a post about NEWHD's campaign that you can share with your friends and followers on social media. 

Do you want to learn more about us? Continue scrolling down to learn more about who we are, why we need funding and to meet our awesome sponsors/partners who believe in what we are trying to achieve. 

Email us at newhdcampaigninfo@gmail.com for any questions.

 

Update 2: 

New Perks - 

Our good friend and world renowned artist Ed Heck has donated some cool limited edition merchandise featuring his artwork. There are 4 new perk packages that include a 13x9 signed poster, face mask and pouch. There are only 5 available for each package. Thank you Ed Heck for supporting NEWHD.

 

Update 1:

Preview NEWHD's Online Radio -

Hey everyone! Hope you are staying safe out there. We wanted to give you a preview of our Online Radio Platform. It's early in development and we still need funding to finish it up, but we are excited to share this early beta version with you.  Click the "Launch Radio" button below to check it out. Hope you enjoy it!

Launch Radio

 

Chris Zweig (CJ @ the Movies) talks Film Criticism and living with Autism.

Our friend and soon to be NEWHD radio personality Chris Zweig (CJ @ the Movies) took the time to tell us about being a Film Critic, living with Autism and his desire to be successful. Chris's message is very eye opening and we are grateful to have him be a part of our NEWHD team. Check out Chris's movie reviews a www.cjatthemovies.com

 

 

Who is NEWHD Media?

NEWHD is our vision of a new Online and HD Radio Broadcast Platform that will be headed by founder Zach Martin and his team. NEWHD is a playground for the artist and our goal is to bring you the best mix of current and classic rock along with a variety of entertaining shows. We need funding to help us complete development of our Online Radio Platform and to begin producing content that will be free to all listeners. That means no subscription costs or monthly fees. Once we complete this initial goal, we will seek to acquire HD signals in major cities in order to broadcast NEWHD over the airwaves. We will produce a variety of high quality content including podcasts, radio talk shows, sports talk shows and music radio. All of this amazing, quality entertainment at no cost to the listener. We will also use this platform to create jobs for unique, creative people with special needs, disabilities and people living on the spectrum, who are struggling to find opportunities in today's workforce. We can help spread awareness and let the most important voices be heard. Our first step will be to bring on board Autism Self Advocate Rachel Barcellona as one of our first NEWHD hosts and to be our voice for Autism awareness. 

 

Model, Singer, Autism Advocate - Rachel Barcellona & NEWHD Founder - Zach Martin

 

Who Is Zach Martin

Zach has been a fixture in New York radio for over 3 decades, and his voice is a familiar one. Not only did Zach work together with the Legendary Scott Muni for almost a decade, he cut his teeth in rock radio. If you were to ask Zach which of the interviews he did with Rock Legends was his favorite, he would tell you, “They were all special. It’s hard to pick when you interview the greats like Ringo Starr, Robert Plant, Jimmy Page or Yoko Ono, just to name a few, but my favorite bands are the Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd, AC/DC and a whole bunch of Country Artists.”

 

Zach Martin's Mission

Zach's mission is to utilize the platform of broadcast radio and media to accomplish the following goals:

1. To give you, the audience, Music Radio with Passion! With the best mix of current and classic music along with a variety of entertaining on air shows. This will include music based radio shows, sports radio and podcasts. NEWHD will be accessible to listeners through an online radio platform and radio broadcast at no charge to the listener.

2. To use this platform to create jobs for people with special needs and disabilities. Jobs will include radio hosting, podcasts, social media operations, website operations and marketing.

3. To constantly evolve in finding new ways of using our platform to help people in need. For example, one of our many goals is to air Recovery Radio every Sunday night. Recovery Radio is an on-air broadcast which provides guidance and help lines to people who are recovering from addiction. 

Welcome To The Studio

How do we plan on brining you the best Radio possible? 

NEWHD will first launch it's website and Online Radio Platform to our listeners for no monthly subscription or fees. All the listener has to do is visit our website, launch the Online Radio, and experience all of the great content NEWHD has to offer. 

NEWHD's vision is to provide exciting and innovative audio programming to a potential Worldwide Audience utilizing emerging remote radio technology while taking  advantage of low cost lease HD signals in Major Markets. The goal is to have a presence in New York City, Los Angeles, Las Vegas and various other Top 25 Markets. 

NEWHD will be the playground for your favorite artist, streaming the best mix of current and classic Rock. We maintain viable relationships with many of the World's greatest talents including The Beatles, Pink Floyd, The Rolling Stones and many of today's artists on major and independent labels.

NEWHD will also be the home of emerging sports, gaming and New York's Official Radio Home of NASCAR. Listeners will experience Play by Play at 200 MPH!

NEWHD will use it’s platform to create jobs and benefits for those living with various disabilities and special needs. Jobs will include radio hosts, podcasts, social media operations, website operations and marketing.

 

Here is a special message from Ron Blomberg and Tiki Barber:

 

 

Helping People With Special Needs, Disabilities & People Living On The Spectrum.

Saint Sophia's is a 501c3 Organization that works hand in hand with NEWHD Media to develop opportunities for people living with various disabilities, special needs and people on the spectrum. Saint Sophia's Mission is dedicated to providing Faith, Hope and Charity for people who need it the most. We aim to create job opportunities for people living everyday with special needs and disabilities. 

How exactly you ask? Current broadcasting technology has made it possible for people in radio and podcasting to work from the comfort and safety of their home. Thats right! All you need is a USB mic, a pair of headphones, and a reliable computer to record right into NEWHD's easy to use broadcasting software. This is one of many ways we will strive to create job opportunities for creative people who deal with the challenges of their disabilities everyday. We give them the platform to express and share their creativity. Additional opportunities where people with disabilities can work from home can be social media marketing, web development/marketing, and graphic design. That is why we believe NEWHD is the perfect platform to achieve this vision.

NEWHD Media & Rachel Bercellona 

"I'm here today to tell you that NEWHD Media is going to help people with Autism like myself"

" We are going to help spread the messages that we have to everybody in a fun and very, very happy environment as well"

- Rachel Barcellona

We are very excited to begin working with our amazing partner and Autism Self Advocate Rachel Barcellona. Rachel was diagnosed with Autism at the age of 3 and had to face many difficult obstacles in her life. Despite these obstacles, Rachel has managed to achieve many great things through hard work and with help from her family. Rachel is a Pageant Winner, Singer, Model, Author and an important voice for Autism Awareness. We are honored to be partnered with such an amazing talent, and to help Rachel spread awareness and positivity through the NEWHD platform.

Please feel free to email us at newhdcampaigninfo@gmail.com if you have more questions.

 

NY Yankees Community Consultant & NY Times Best Selling Author Ray Negron supports NEWHD Media

 

"It's a new wave, a new plateau from the standpoint of entertainment" 

"The thing I love the most about NEWHD Media is the fact that they're going to be helping kids with disabilities, kids with autism, kids that need a chance"

"With NEWHD Media, we're going to be a winning team! Just like my boys (NY Yankees) from the 70's"

 - Ray Negron

FUNDING 

$12,500 is the minimum amount of funding needed to enable us to complete our development of NEWHD's online radio station platform, and hire our partner, Autism Self Advocate Rachel Barcellona. Currently we have a beta version of the online platform up on our website for preview, but we need funding to complete this and to also bring on Rachel to host her own show. The minimum amount is a great start, but we don't want to stop there. Once we reach our minimum goal, we hope that everyone who visits our campaign page will continue donating to help us build and grow into the amazing platform we know NEWHD Media can be.  

For questions or information regarding funding needs after reaching our minimum goal, please email us at newhdcampaigninfo@gmail.com

 

"I'm really excited about a new opportunity in radio that NEWHD Media is looking to jump into" 

"New technologies have made it possible to produce and broadcast right from home"

"We'll be creating jobs for individuals living with disabilities and on the Autism spectrum"

Former NY Giant - Tiki Barber

 

PERKS

Donor Hall Of Fame -

All donors will be entered into our "Donor Hall Of Fame." This will be promoted on our social media, website and also displayed in our station headquarters for everyone to see. 

Perks - 

We have laid out different tiers of perks to reward you for your generous donation to our vision and cause.  Perks are available on the right side of the page. 

On Air Perks will be delivered after the campaign is over. Please refer to our FAQ section for more information about the perk you donated to. 

For specific questions and information about Perks, please email us at newhdcampaigninfo@gmail.com

 

"I've been fortunate through the years to help a lot of special kids, many with Autism. I love to help these kids and give back to them."

"NEWHD will have a platform for those with special needs"

"Please join me and donate to our cause to ensure the success of our vision, thank you"

Former NY Yankee - Ron Blomberg

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Help us make some noise through social media. Use the links at the top right of this page to share with your friends on Facebook and Twitter. 
    • Tell everyone you know about our vision and our desire to help our community. Text or call your friends, your family and tell them to donate to our cause. 
    • Spreading the word about us and letting the world know who we are is extremely helpful to our cause. The more people know who we are, the better our chances are of having a successful campaign.

    We are truly grateful for your support, because of you we will achieve great things!

story:
Summary

I am David Billson, CEO of rTraction - a London, Ontario B Corporation. I have created this campaign to raise funds to create a video + podcast series to tell the story of us, The Story of London Ontario. Join in and help shift the thinking on what London's story will be for the future.

Below, we have outlined:

  1. What You Get & What We Need
  2. Risks & Challenges
  3. Other Ways You Can Help
  4. Content Outline (for the first season)

I have lived in London for over 15 years and constantly hear about how our city is lacking, insufficient, or inadequate compared to other cities. I believe our city does amazing things and does not need to look to other cities for inspiration - our own population can supply all the inspiration that we need.

At the end of our project  we will be able to have co-created a narrative to be proud of - I’m sure our story will revolve around our community’s support, investment, and commitment to opportunity. Our excellence in health care, digital media, social innovation and collaborative problem solving meets in our Community Innovation.

Please help me to tell the story of our city!

What We Need & What You Get

I’ll start by saying this project will go forward regardless of the results of this campaign, however; this project is important and deserves the investment of quality that comes from working with community partners that we will pay. I have set a flexible target of $25,000 - this is the amount required to put together an experience that will properly tell the story. I intend to use three storytelling techniques:

  1. Live video interviews with stakeholders in the project
  2. A narrative podcast that collects the prescient points from the interviews to create a comprehensive story
  3. A "B-Roll" podcast where the interviews recorded in step 1 are available for future consumption.

The $25,000 covers the costs of production work with our partner at web.isod.es - I anticipate rTraction contributing $15,00-20,000 of in kind work to backbone the project. We will also use some of the funds to promote the podcast and material once it has been finished.

If we don't reach the goal, we will use the funds to produce the best product possible with the funds available as we can get with our various partners and in-kind contributions.

I've created some unique perks to help you participate and feel included in joining me with this narrative. I look forward to having you along on the journey. If you have any feedback please reach out to david.billson@rtraction.com.

Risks & Challenges

The primary risk to this project is that I am wrong - that there is no primary narrative that exists in London, Ontario - or that if there is one it has nothing to do with Human Innovation. A secondary risk is that I can't line up the participants or research to be able to create the content in a timely manner. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can help but we appreciate other ways you could help:

  1. Share this campaign with your friends
  2. Suggest topics or people we should interview to david.billson@rtraction.com
  3. Continue to be awesome in London Ontario!

Content Outline

This is the current season outline for the show - subject to change as we begin our exploration.

Episodes:

  1. What is social innovation? Human Innovation? What is Happening in London?
    ​Purpose: Inform the audience that social innovation is happening here in London, and accelerating - generate excitement around what’s happening and pique curiosity as to why:  
    1. Innovation Works
    2. Solutions Lab
    3. Verge
    4. London Community Foundation funds
  2. Understanding London’s Roots in Innovation
    ​Purpose: Start to explore the history of our region and its relationship to charitable giving and working together
    1. Agrarian history
    2. Sisters of St. Joseph
    3. Brescia College / Ursiline Sisters
    4. Libro
  3. Other Innovative History in London
    Purpose: Explore the tie-ins between the social innovation that happens here as a cross-section of subset of the general innovation spirit that exists within London
    1. Cross content with Towards London
    2. Medical innovation 
    3. Arts innovation (regional movement)
    4. Digital media innovation
  4. The Three Pillars of Innovation:
    ​Purpose: Acknowledge and better understand the interrelationship and interdependence of the 3 pillars of a community and how they intersect to foster social innovation
    1. Government
    2. Non profit
    3. Business
  5. Formation of Pillar & Other Collective Impacts
    ​Purpose:What unique conditions existed to form Pillar & other collective impacts- why are we only starting to see these types of organizations form in other communities when London had it 16 years ago
    1. Pillar’s unique voice in the community
    2. Founding / Willy Van Klooster
  6. Collective Impact
    ​Purpose: Look at London success stories around using the CI model - why were these projects successful in London
    1. CYN
    2. ESC
    3. Innovation Works
  7. The Advancement of Social Impact at Large
    ​Purpose: Explore the global movements around social innovation, and how does London fit in?
    1. B-Corps
    2. Conscious Capital
    3. Flourishing Business Model
  8. Global Meets Local - Innovation Hotspots
    ​Purpose: Tell the story of a few “movers and shakers” in the innovation sphere in London
    1. Verge Capital
    2. Fast 50 companies
    3. Others?
  9. The City of Missed Opportunities
    ​Purpose: Explore how London has missed opportunities to embrace diversity (or behaved downright racist) and look forward to a future where London benefits from an inclusive lens vs. a dismissive one 
    1. London's national stage for racism 
    2. The untapped potential of immigrants
    3. Trends towards adaptive employment - skills over credentials 
  10. Telling our story - What is London's Story? What is our ‘Brand Identity’?
    Purpose: How our ability to tell the story of our community provides further advancement and collective impact.
    1. Pillar Community Innovation Awards
    2. Towards London
    3. London Business Hall of Fame
    4. Canadian Medical Hall of Fame
  11. Looking to the Future: What’s Next?​
    ​Purpose: Look towards the future of human innovation - we’re at the beginning of something here in London - where is that journey going to take us?
    1. Social Innovation
    2. Medical Innovation
    3. Digital Media Innovation
story_txt:
SummaryI am David Billson, CEO of rTraction - a London, Ontario B Corporation. I have created this campaign to raise funds to create a video + podcast series to tell the story of us, The Story of London Ontario. Join in and help shift the thinking on what London's story will be for the future.Below, we have outlined:
What You Get & What We Need
Risks & Challenges
Other Ways You Can Help
Content Outline (for the first season)
I have lived in London for over 15 years and constantly hear about how our city is lacking, insufficient, or inadequate compared to other cities. I believe our city does amazing things and does not need to look to other cities for inspiration - our own population can supply all the inspiration that we need.At the end of our project  we will be able to have co-created a narrative to be proud of - I’m sure our story will revolve around our community’s support, investment, and commitment to opportunity. Our excellence in health care, digital media, social innovation and collaborative problem solving meets in our Community Innovation.Please help me to tell the story of our city!
What We Need & What You Get
I’ll start by saying this project will go forward regardless of the results of this campaign, however; this project is important and deserves the investment of quality that comes from working with community partners that we will pay. I have set a flexible target of $25,000 - this is the amount required to put together an experience that will properly tell the story. I intend to use three storytelling techniques:

Live video interviews with stakeholders in the project
A narrative podcast that collects the prescient points from the interviews to create a comprehensive story
A "B-Roll" podcast where the interviews recorded in step 1 are available for future consumption.

The $25,000 covers the costs of production work with our partner at web.isod.es - I anticipate rTraction contributing $15,00-20,000 of in kind work to backbone the project. We will also use some of the funds to promote the podcast and material once it has been finished.
If we don't reach the goal, we will use the funds to produce the best product possible with the funds available as we can get with our various partners and in-kind contributions.
I've created some unique perks to help you participate and feel included in joining me with this narrative. I look forward to having you along on the journey. If you have any feedback please reach out to david.billson@rtraction.com.

Risks & Challenges
The primary risk to this project is that I am wrong - that there is no primary narrative that exists in London, Ontario - or that if there is one it has nothing to do with Human Innovation. A secondary risk is that I can't line up the participants or research to be able to create the content in a timely manner. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everyone can help but we appreciate other ways you could help:

Share this campaign with your friends
Suggest topics or people we should interview to david.billson@rtraction.com

Continue to be awesome in London Ontario!

Content OutlineThis is the current season outline for the show - subject to change as we begin our exploration.Episodes:

What is social innovation? Human Innovation? What is Happening in London?​Purpose: Inform the audience that social innovation is happening here in London, and accelerating - generate excitement around what’s happening and pique curiosity as to why:  
Innovation Works
Solutions Lab
Verge
London Community Foundation funds



Understanding London’s Roots in Innovation​Purpose: Start to explore the history of our region and its relationship to charitable giving and working together
Agrarian history
Sisters of St. Joseph
Brescia College / Ursiline Sisters
Libro



Other Innovative History in LondonPurpose: Explore the tie-ins between the social innovation that happens here as a cross-section of subset of the general innovation spirit that exists within London
Cross content with Towards London
Medical innovation 
Arts innovation (regional movement)
Digital media innovation



The Three Pillars of Innovation:​Purpose: Acknowledge and better understand the interrelationship and interdependence of the 3 pillars of a community and how they intersect to foster social innovation
Government
Non profit
Business



Formation of Pillar & Other Collective Impacts​Purpose:What unique conditions existed to form Pillar & other collective impacts- why are we only starting to see these types of organizations form in other communities when London had it 16 years ago
Pillar’s unique voice in the community
Founding / Willy Van Klooster



Collective Impact​Purpose: Look at London success stories around using the CI model - why were these projects successful in London
CYN
ESC
Innovation Works



The Advancement of Social Impact at Large​Purpose: Explore the global movements around social innovation, and how does London fit in?
B-Corps
Conscious Capital
Flourishing Business Model



Global Meets Local - Innovation Hotspots​Purpose: Tell the story of a few “movers and shakers” in the innovation sphere in London
Verge Capital
Fast 50 companies
Others?



The City of Missed Opportunities​Purpose: Explore how London has missed opportunities to embrace diversity (or behaved downright racist) and look forward to a future where London benefits from an inclusive lens vs. a dismissive one 
London's national stage for racism 
The untapped potential of immigrants
Trends towards adaptive employment - skills over credentials 



Telling our story - What is London's Story? What is our ‘Brand Identity’?Purpose: How our ability to tell the story of our community provides further advancement and collective impact.
Pillar Community Innovation Awards
Towards London
London Business Hall of Fame
Canadian Medical Hall of Fame



Looking to the Future: What’s Next?​​Purpose: Look towards the future of human innovation - we’re at the beginning of something here in London - where is that journey going to take us?
Social Innovation
Medical Innovation
Digital Media Innovation

story:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.

Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.

Si no nos conoces 

Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.

O suscribirte en iTunes.

O seguirlo en Spotify.

O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.

Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.

Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.

Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.

Y queremos que su siguiente parada sea la hermosa ciudad de Bogotá, en Colombia.

Qué es el No sé, dime tour BOGOTÁ

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Bogotá, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de Colombia para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.

Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.

A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.

Por qué nosotros

Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.

Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 

Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 

a los Shorty Awards...

Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.

Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.

Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.

Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.

Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.

Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.

No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.

El problema

Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.

Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...

Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.

Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Bogotá nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.

Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 

Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.

Lo que nos hace falta

  • Al menos entre 600 y 850 superdiamantes en cada ciudad  que compren una entrada a un precio súper asequible.
  • Recaudar con la venta de esas entradas al menos $20,000 para ir a Bogotá.
  • Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
  • Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Cómo lo utilizaremos

  • Alquiler del Teatro (entre 30% y 50% de lo recaudado)
  • Merch
  • Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
  • Alquiler de equipos
  • Honorarios de producción
  • Mercadeo de la gira

Lo que ofrecemos

Además de entradas para que nos acompañes a dejar el corazón en un teatro de la hermosa ciudad de Bogotá en un show que tú mismo crearás con nosotros, tenemos perks para superdiamantes que quieran y puedan contribuir con un poquito más para obtener desde cosas súper especiales como franelas que sólo van a estás disponibles si hacemos el tour, estar en los créditos de la serie como productores, o hasta ser invitados especiales en un podcast con nosotros (¡la pizza corre por nuestra cuenta!).

Por qué te necesitamos

Hemos estado haciendo encuestas. Sé qué nos hemos puesto fastidiosos, pero necesitamos estar 100% seguros de que en las ciudades a las que vamos hay suficientes de ustedes para hacer esto.  

Te necesitamos porque no sólo no tenemos dinero para pagar la gira de nuestro bolsillo, sino porque si no logramos que esta gira pase hay muchísimas cosas que muy probable tendremos que también dejar de hacer.

El reto

Queremos arrancar la gira oficialmente después del 15 de Septiembre, por lo que necesitamos producir todo durante el verano. Por eso debemos recaudar el dinero de cada ciudad en sólo 10 días. De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.

La idea es comenzar con una ciudad y si logramos la meta, hacer otra y otra y otra hasta que podamos llegar a la mayor cantidad de ciudades posibles.

Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.

Esto es lo que queremos: si logramos hacer al menos 5 ciudades podemos seguir haciendo el podcast.

Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.

Tal vez no vives en Bogotá, pero conoces a alguien que vive en Bogotá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.

Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.

Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.

¿Contamos contigo?

Maiah y Gabriel
