story:
Short Summary

We are artists - Writers, Directors and Actors - who have been creating and performing for the public our entire careers.  Many of us have worked together and supported each other for decades.  Passionate about our work and committed to the performing arts, we have come together to bring this serialized podcast - a relatively young art form - to life.  Through downloads, a podcast has the potential to reach many more people than a live performance.  In this way, we can bring the arts to a wider population.

The Chronicles of Wallace Sprague, Dog Psychiatrist, was created and written by Cate Allen, an award-winning playwright and directed by Eric Nightengale who has been involved with theater productions for more than 30 years.  Together with David Arrow, another experienced theater professional in the dual role of producer and actor, this team has logged countless hours to assemble a talented group of professional actors and oversee the recording, sound effects and editing.

We need to raise money to continue creating Season 1 and Season 2.  The money we raise will go directly to record, edit and pay our talent.  By contributing you help keep the episodes coming and support the arts.  You can contribute at any level, but if you contribute at a minimum level ($25), we will express our gratitude on our show website, WallaceSprague.com.  For higher contribution levels you will have the opportunity to receive a beautiful set of show logo coasters, a show logo t-shirt, a mention at the end of an episode (or two) and an autographed script of the pilot episode by the creator and writer, Cate Allen.  So please contribute if you can and we will strive to bring you the highest quality storytelling podcast out there!

If you cannot contribute, that's OK, too.  There are other ways you can help us to keep the episodes coming.

 - Forward this Indiegogo campaign to someone you think might be interested in subscribing to The Chronicles of Wallace Sprague Dog Psychiatrist, or contributing.  Use the Indiegogo "share" tools on this website.

- Subscribe to The Chronicles of Wallace Sprague, Dog Psychiatrist. Visit our show website at www.WallaceSprague.com for more information and fun, behind-the-scenes extras.

Thank you!  We hope you enjoy The Chronicles of Wallace Sprague, Dog Psychiatrist.

story:
The Fury Podcast

The Fury is an upcoming queer fiction audio drama, set in a world that unfairly discriminates against people of color, the queer community, women, the poor, and the disabled. Like we said … fiction.

Luckily, The Fury gang was formed to combat these wrongs with some good old fashioned vigilante justice! 

After her girlfriend is revealed to be an undercover cop, Alecto, the Boss of the vigilante group, The Fury, is fighting to make sure her empire doesn’t crumble around her. The Fury's recent troubles have put a target on their backs, and it’s up to Alecto and her trusted inner circle to ensure the gang’s empire survives. But in such a tense situation, is there also room to love again?

 

Behind The Scenes

The Fury was created by Amara Augustine, a queer black woman who happens to be a survivor of sexual abuse. It’s clear to see why I wanted to create a show where there are numerous people of color, where perpetrators of heinous crimes are severely punished, where regardless of your background you can form your own family, and where, after all the blood and guts and fear and anger ... you can still find love.

 

Where This Money Going

Image of Pie chart: VA Costs 50.7%, Website Costs 9.3%, Hosting Costs 7.9%, Sensitivity Reading Costs 9.9%, Writing / Sound Design Costs 17.2%, Indiegogo Fees 5%

Most of our funds are going to our voice actors, with the rest split between upkeeping our website, hosting our podcast, and paying the individuals who helped make The Fury a reality! 

 

How Else You Can Help

We realize that not everyone has the funds to donate, and that’s totally okay! You can also show your support by spreading the word about our campaign, and following @thefurypod on Twitter, IG, or Tumblr.

story:
It's Time We Make Our Children The Stars of Their Own Stories! 

Let’s show our kids television characters who look like them doing happy, positive, and powerful things every day. Help CHOZEN MEDIA Kids launch a revolution in children’s programming now. Become one of our founding subscribers and be a children’s hero too.

 

“Children across all races associate positive characteristics more with the White characters they see on television and negative characteristics more with the minority characters.”  - A Different World: Children's Perceptions of Race and Class in Media

 

I’m Liberty White of CHOZEN MEDIA Kids, a digital entertainment platform for children grades K-5. Creating content where Black kids see themselves as the leaders, heroes, and stars of their own stories will help improve their confidence, career aspirations and provide critical learning experiences for them at an early age through entertainment. 

 

The Impact

Children believe what they see, and research shows that a lack of representation in media can lead to negative psychological outcomes for those with identities that are underrepresented or negatively portrayed (Tukachinsky, Mastro, & Yarchi, 2017). 

 CHOZEN MEDIA Kids lets Black children see themselves succeeding as the heroes, leaders, and stars they were born to be.

We’re creating a world of content that builds children’s self-esteem and empowers their potential. Our programming will feature the positive values parents teach and want for their children such as self-respect, confidence, accountability, manners, educational excellence, and social skills. 

 

 

CHOZEN MEDIA Kids content tears down stereotypes and builds a foundation where all children of every culture can see and believe the best about one another.

  • Children between the ages of 8-12 years old consume around 5 hours of on-screen media daily
  • We have produced over 50 live stream shows this year
  • Do we really have to wait for another Black Panther to celebrate the culture?

 

We believe in this vision and our children are directly impacted by this content. We’ve already started production and the launch plan for CHOZEN MEDIA Kids with our funds, but your support will enable us to take this platform so much further. If we can hit our initial fundraising goal of $50,000, we can provide significantly more incredible children’s programming.

 

 

Your donations and support will help us with critical resources such as:

The Team

  • Executive Director: N. Liberty White

  • Director of Photography: Darius Hill

    Darius Hill aka Twin is a Content Creator with expertise in writing, shooting, and publishing videos for the web, tv, and cinema

  • Creative Director:  Kescheler Nix Powell

    Experienced creative producer and digital marketing project manager with a background in tech, consumer goods, and entertainment, Kescheler brings her content creation expertise to the CMK team. Having worked with companies like the Atlanta Braves, Cartoon Network, and CURLBOX, Kescheler is up for the challenge.

  • Project Manager: Stacey McCalmon

    Stacey keeps the train moving at CMK. Passionate about Education, Fashion, and helping people, she is a "School @ Home" project manager with Varsity Tutors, Stacey is experienced in the art of the pivot assisting in the creation of a whole new program that allows students to be homeschooled using the company's software.

  • Marketing Strategist: T. Adeola Osinubi

    From the City that birthed flight, funk music, and the classic literature of Paul Laurence Dunbar; T. Adeola is the next classic to hail from Dayton, OH.

  • Digital Marketing Assistant: Tawana Lewis
    Born and raised in the peach state she holds true to the southern values. Tawana loves to learn and experience new adventures. A member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporation, she brings her community service and Master’s degree in Public Administration skills to the team.

 

Advisors

  • Chidi Afleulzi (redKola digital labs)
  • Don Dodds (M16 Marketing) 
  • Bridget Lewis (Mouthpiece Communications)

 

Risks & Challenges

The challenge of representation in online media isn’t new, but CHOZEN MEDIA Kids presents an innovative solution for children’s programming. 

Our team has decades of experience in content creation, but we did not foresee launching this endeavor in the midst of a pandemic. Thanks to our partnership with Content GA, we have an incredible studio to shoot and produce episodes. And we have been extremely mindful in production to provide as safe an environment as possible for our team and crew. 

However, the pandemic and virtual schooling also highlights the immediate need for CHOZEN MEDIA Kids programming.

Together with our outstanding team of education and mental health consultants, we continue to take the necessary steps to produce impactful experiences.

 

Other Ways You Can Support

Help us spread the word and share this campaign! Volunteer with CHOZEN MEDIA Kids. Become a CMK Champion! 

  • Volunteer with CHOZEN MEDIA Kids
  • Become a CMK Champion (Ambassador)
  • Share this campaign with 2-3 friends!
story_txt:
It's Time We Make Our Children The Stars of Their Own Stories! 

Let’s show our kids television characters who look like them doing happy, positive, and powerful things every day. Help CHOZEN MEDIA Kids launch a revolution in children’s programming now. Become one of our founding subscribers and be a children’s hero too. “Children across all races associate positive characteristics more with the White characters they see on television and negative characteristics more with the minority characters.”  - A Different World: Children's Perceptions of Race and Class in Media I’m Liberty White of CHOZEN MEDIA Kids, a digital entertainment platform for children grades K-5. Creating content where Black kids see themselves as the leaders, heroes, and stars of their own stories will help improve their confidence, career aspirations and provide critical learning experiences for them at an early age through entertainment. 
 
The Impact
Children believe what they see, and research shows that a lack of representation in media can lead to negative psychological outcomes for those with identities that are underrepresented or negatively portrayed (Tukachinsky, Mastro, & Yarchi, 2017). 
 CHOZEN MEDIA Kids lets Black children see themselves succeeding as the heroes, leaders, and stars they were born to be.We’re creating a world of content that builds children’s self-esteem and empowers their potential. Our programming will feature the positive values parents teach and want for their children such as self-respect, confidence, accountability, manners, educational excellence, and social skills. 
 

 
CHOZEN MEDIA Kids content tears down stereotypes and builds a foundation where all children of every culture can see and believe the best about one another.

Children between the ages of 8-12 years old consume around 5 hours of on-screen media daily
We have produced over 50 live stream shows this year
Do we really have to wait for another Black Panther to celebrate the culture?

 
We believe in this vision and our children are directly impacted by this content. We’ve already started production and the launch plan for CHOZEN MEDIA Kids with our funds, but your support will enable us to take this platform so much further. If we can hit our initial fundraising goal of $50,000, we can provide significantly more incredible children’s programming.

  Your donations and support will help us with critical resources such as:

story:
Hello and thank you for considering supporting Techgrlz!  Techgrlz is a Podcast about Girls and Women in Technology.  I am Trisha Walsh, Techgrlz founder and host, and I’ve worked as a Technology manager for over 15 years.  I’ve overseen the technology and people supporting business applications and infrastructure.  I am also a podcast junkie.  I’m actively subscribed to 25 podcasts.  Some weeks I run out of podcast content, so I go explore others I may want to add to my repertoire.  But in all my searching I have not been able to find a podcast telling the personal stories of today’s Girls and Women in Technology and how they got there.

 

  • We want to iterate and learn, we will use whatever we raise to promote and drum up interest in the Podcast so it can become self sustaining through the business model of ad revenue.
  • We are asking for a total of $4,000 in funding, all of the funds will be supporting the Podcast – website, social media marketer (a person, so supporting someone's income), equipment and associated fees
    • Daily – Twitter, Facebook, Email, Pinterest, Instagram at $500-$1,000/month
    • Weekly – website vlogs/blogs at $100-$200/month
    • Monthly/Ongoing – website updates, refresh equipment, subscriptions at $250-$500/month
    • With funding we hope to keep the Podcast running 4 – 6 months while we increase listener audience to get us self sustaining

Our perks are designed with the Podcast in mind, to preserve funding we’ve opted to more content specific perks like Bonus Content, cross posts on Social Media or to be a Guest on an episode!

 

  • Currently our data is only anecdotal, but what we’ve heard is that men and women are interested in the personal stories we are looking to tell.
  • We believe that allowing Girls and Women to tell their own story in their own way is another method of empowering them and instilling the confidence in them that they can do anything they set out to accomplish.

 

Our goal is to launch a podcast and reach as many listeners we can to bring these stories to life. We need your help to find them.  By funding a social marketer we will have the skills to find our listening audience.

 

  • Share our pages on your social media
  • Tell your friends about us, especially the ones you know listen to Podcasts
  • Think good thoughts for us!  Any positive energy sent our way is a good thing, thanks!

story:
Since LA Forwards & Backwards launched six months ago, we’ve taken Los Angeles by storm, with more than 30,000 downloads already! 

Each episode allows you to enter the mind of a Californian on the cutting edge of the social justice issues that touch our lives every day.  These policy experts and community organizers dive deep into the work they’re doing with the help of host David Levitus, a long time organizer whose Ph.D. in History gives listeners a deeper understanding of the news and sense of what they can do personally to work towards justice and sustainability. 

The podcast doesn’t shy away from complicated subjects and doesn’t “dumb” down difficult issues. Instead, each hour unravels the issues by avoiding jargon and asking questions that get to the heart of the matter. 

California can lead the charge on progressive issues. LA Forwards & Backwards is where that discussion is happening. Subscribe for the anti-soundbite – the antidote to the current political climate.  

We have BIG plans for a full season of new episodes and live events.

With $20,000 in funding, we will be able to create 20 episodes over the next year and promote them so they'll be downloaded 50,000 times! Our costs include audio production, staff, hosting, marketing, and publicity.

With these resources, we'll replicate our successful April 12 LIVE PODCAST EVENT three times in the next year. 

TODAY we need $8,000 from progressive Angelenos like you so we can unlock the rest from sponsors, foundations, and big donors!

And while we always appreciate your donations to LA Forward, this campaign is DIFFERENT –it comes with all kinds of PERKS!​

After you chip in, tell your friends and followers on social media to triple your impact.

Every share brings in an average of $100 to keep the podcast going and growing.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

LA Forwards & Backwards is a sure bet.  

Our 12 episodes have been downloaded 30,000 times, and our audience is hungry for more. We've shown we can make this happen.

However, if we don’t raise $8,000, we will need to scale back our plans to release two episodes per month.

Less money = fewer episodes = sad subscribers.

Keep a smile on the face of our subscribers with a generous donation today! 

 

Thanks for contributing and sharing.

See you soon!

story:
The Project

Hello! I'm Joia, and I'm a writer, teacher, and consultant based out of the NYC-metro area. Last year, I developed a new 10-session workshop course that combines teaching meditation, writing, and critical thinking skills. It's called 'The Power of Thought: How to Think More Logically, Creatively, and Compassionately.'   

The course -- and this new project -- are aimed for Thinkers, people who value reason, logic, and creativity, who want to improve these skills to make a greater productive impact on the world and improve their social relations.

One of the skills I examine in the course is 'Understanding People On Their Own Terms.'  "Terms" refers not only to the specific words and concepts that individuals use to understand themselves and the world, but more broadly to their basic motivations and values and underlying premises and ideas.

I realized it would be useful to demonstrate this approach to interactions in the concrete form of an interview conversation.  And further, if these conversations were shared widely they could spark further conversations and exercises in critical and compassionate thinking.

The basic format of the show will be this:

  1. The Story: I begin by asking the guest (thought-leaders from various fields, potentially representing a range of diverse views) to describe their life-story journey, the significant steps leading them to develop the particular ideas they've come to promote.
  2. The Content: We discuss the ideas they're advocating, exploring not only the what, but the how's and why's, the arguments and motivations behind the ideas.
  3. The Meta-Level Reflection: Most significantly, we then take a step back and look explicitly at the method and approaches to thinking they've used, trying to identify any explicit take-away's.
  4. Guest Recommendations: And we'll end by having the guest mention any specific recommendations  they may have for the audience to improve their knowledge, skills, and thought.

I expect that in each of these interviews, I will probably agree with the guests on some points and disagree on others.  But the purpose will be for the guests to have an opportunity to express themselves on their own terms, and for me (and you, the audience!) to thus understand their perspective as a basis for any further interactions. 

My hope is these conversations inspire and provoke further conversations and exercises in civil discourse as we each try to better our own thinking.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal in this Indiegogo campaign is to try to raise enough funds to at least produce a prototype/pilot episode of the show. Based on my research, this should cost around $2,500.

I firmly believe this show will be most effective if it is produced with the craft and care of high production values. (Note: the current photos are what I can get for free from a smartphone, and don't convey the clarity and production quality that I believe would make this show truly worthwhile).  For example, TED Talks consistently put out video produced at high standards, and it is a critical component to their success in spreading ideas.

To produce a high-quality film will involve:

  • Space rental here in New York City
  • Lighting and high quality filming
  • Video-editing and graphics
  • Web development

When completed, the one-hour interview will be posted free on YouTube for easy sharing.  We'll also make the audio available for those who prefer a podcast format. Contributors can also receive exclusive bonus footage and other perks.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share the word about this campaign with anyone you think may be interested.
  • If you have any advice or ideas, I'd love to hear your feedback!

Thank you for reading!

story:
ABOUT ME

B.1993 Da'Niro Elle is an socially engaged curator, arts professional, and transdisciplinary artist her work explores the black experience. An experience grounded in both the Western media’s manipulation of black imagery and the nostalgic images that decorated our homes and amused us. Through the use of the body as medium, multiple bodies, multiple diverse bodies, text, rhythm, objects, and curated sound to create a physical spaces, Da’Niro Elle’s work offers a unique perspective on the future of humanity, while assertively commenting on present day society. Working through notions of conflict and trauma, the core of my work reveals my obsession with the construction of identity. She received her BFA from The School of the Art Institute of Chicago. Da’Niro Elle has shown work recently at The Museum of Modern Art, The Gene Siskle Theater, and Golden Thread Gallery. She is currently based in Brooklyn, NY.

visit my site at www.daniroelle.me 

ABOUT THE SHOW

A podcast & visual channel named after a novel, written by art critic and activist Kellie Jones in 2011. Eyeminded seeks to continue Jones’s efforts, bringing attention to works created by artist belonging to underrepresented communities and work that challenges established institutional models. This channel aims to not only continue the conversation but to also generate new dialogue and propose new questions surrounding the current state of the contemporary art world. Eyeminded covers current exhibitions, art academia, and current political and cultural events and conversations focused in the arts. The purpose of this channel is to make art more accessible to communities of people that don’t have the same resources to take in art in institutional settings. Discussing everything from the LA Rebellion, to the Afro Futurist Movement, Eyeminded aims to illuminate voices belonging to emerging and mid career artists, curators, critics, gallerist and other art professionals of color. Through lively and unfiltered conversations with these special guest we discuss the world of art as well as their practices. Eyeminded is an arts and culture podcast and show that discusses different topics each episode, and with each episode the show breaks down language exploring new narratives within the arts, setting a stage for people of color to discuss things in a true, raw form.

Eyeminded will be available on all streaming and viewing services including Spotify, Itunes, Youtube, and Soundcloud. 

Add Eyeminded on Instagram, Twitter, and Youtube coming soon. 

ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN?

This campaign was started to provide Eyeminded with the proper start it deserves.

And as a young femme and creative of color with no financial assistance, this is an open call for support and help from those who appreciate my work and want to support my practice. This channel is something that has now grown and expanded past my own artistic narrative, which is why I am raising this money to establish a foundation and proper platform for Eyeminded to be developed up to the rigorous standards I hold for myself and all of my work. I did not and do not want to cut any corners when it comes to the production of this project. 

With your support of Eyeminded  you will help us raise money for so many important elements that help start a new self-funded media project. Contributions will go towards the purchasing of professional grade equipment for the recording and documentation of each episode. These supplies include camera, a led light kit, tripod, mics, and other audio equipment. Along with the rental cost for the shooting location which will happen bi-weekly as we begin production, this campaign will also go towards the support of our small but mighty crew, all creatives of color looking to be contribute to the conversation and the change we seek. Your contributions to this campaign will help also provide a comfortable and welcoming set and environment, feeding the crew during shoot days and will provide a stipend for each crew member, including two camera operators, one audio & sound engineer, and one production assistants.

If given the opportunity and your support I know Eyeminded will help completely transform the landscape of media focused on artists and and other emerging creatives of color all over the world.

WHY WE CAN'T DO IT ALONE.

As mentioned earlier I face many obstacles including the constant financial battle of day to day life living in Brooklyn New York. My move to New York was a important decision for my artistic practice and its growth. I wanted to continue to bet on myself bet on my talent, bet on my drive, bet of my ability to seize the moment and it has been challenging, but it has also generated some of the best moments of my life. I also have to factor in my health, as I am currently battling a chronic illness called Lupus which is something that also limits my abilities and poses a daily challenge to my survival as an artist. In consideration of this, I have come to understand without all of your support I will not be able to hold Eyeminded  to the standard I see for it promising future. But with your help and support I will be able to devote more of my time to Eyeminded, as this project is not only something I see as an outlet for artist and other emerging art professionals representing underrepresented communities, but also a platform to teach and welcome new conversations and allies who are looking to truly understand what it means to be a person representing the other and learning how we all share the responsibility to do better.

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO?

Add us on all social Media Platforms and she this campaign link bby. 

And that's all there is to it.

I wanted to continue to bet on myself bet on my talent, bet on my drive, bet of my ability to seize the moment and it has been challenging, but it has also generated some of the best moments of my life. I also have to factor in my health, as I am currently battling a chronic illness called Lupus which is something that also limits my abilities and poses a daily challenge to my survival as an artist. In consideration of this, I have come to understand without all of your support I will not be able to hold Eyeminded  to the standard I see for it promising future. But with your help and support I will be able to devote more of my time to Eyeminded, as this project is not only something I see as an outlet for artist and other emerging art professionals representing underrepresented communities, but also a platform to teach and welcome new conversations and allies who are looking to truly understand what it means to be a person representing the other and learning how we all share the responsibility to do better.
WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO?Add us on all social Media Platforms and she this campaign link bby. And that's all there is to it.

story:
Thank you for helping us reach our goal!

Your generosity is overwhelming and your continued donations will make this the best project it can be. 

The STORY:

The Bystanders is not just a regular audio drama, we’re bringing the rich belly laughing goodness of dark comedy into the Podcast realm. The Bystanders is the crooked tale about a group of neighbors who witness one of their own get stabbed to death in the courtyard of their apartment complex, and do absolutely nothing to stop it. Or did they? 

Just to paint the picture, we are a keen group of women writers and producers coming together to create a comedic dark comedy podcast during a time that we believe our world so desperately needs to have a good laugh. Look at it in the realm of HBO's Search Party meets Gimlet Media's Homecoming, its a dash of campy humor sprinkled into the true crime podcast algorithm. Our hope is to mix all our magic and talent together and create a truly hysterical audio comedy, so that one day we'll be able to turn this into a live action, Television Mini-Series...all with your help! 

The TENANTS:

Apt 1 Sara Fatbottom, 32, even with a last name like that this girl is the coolest in the complex. So cool that she's a social media influencer. When Bunny threatens the thing Sara loves most, her chinchilla named Pasta, she snaps.

Apt 2 Kyle Shyttles, 33, a young Paul Rudd type, adorably dorky and eager to please. He’s the night manager at The Five N’ Grab with nothing to hide but his undying love for his neighbor, Sara. Bunny will do what it takes to get him to herself. 

Apt 3 Tim & Lexi Hades, 27, madly in love, these two are your quintessential dumb and dumber. Think Wyoma and Derald in Forgetting Sarah Marshal. Stressed about their first baby on the way, this couple teaches Sunday School where they “borrow” a little from the kids’ offerings to the church. 

Apt 4 Phil Absconder, 46, dry, not here to make friends. This single dad will do ANYTHING for his daughter, including kidnap her and start a new life to avoid going to jail and leaving her in the foster system.

Apt 5 Hop & Fan he, 80 sweet and innocent couple with a dream to one day retire they’ve had their eye on for some time. They’ve been saving up quickly by selling their excess prescription meds aka illegal amphetamines to college students.  

Apt 6- Bunny Bell Pascht. Dead

GOALS & STRETCH GOALS:

Our goal for our project is roughly $20,000. Working in our industry for the last 14 years, we know not only do we want top quality sound but we are attaching A List actors. In addition, we want our cast and crew to feel like we have their best interest in mind during these uncertain times. Let us kindly explain how you’re contribution can help make The Bystanders the best it could be:

Audio Engineer- As you heard from our teaser, we’re creating our sound from the ground up. From actors sound levels to personally recording the sound effects, an audio engineer will produce an entire world where we can just sit back, relax and listen to the seamless audio drama unfold.  

Actors- We’re producing an audio drama with some of Hollywoods top quality comedic actors. As with any job, we ensure our actors will be taken care of during the COVID crisis with social distancing, safety guidelines and paying them scale rates. 

Equipment- Audio equipment is relatively inexpensive, but talent is required to social distance and has opted to not share mics. Therefore, we’re packaging the production to talent by sending each their own mic set up.

story:
I'm still alive and I'm on Mars! F*ck you, outer space!

- Commander Jacki O'Rania

Marsfall is a science-fiction radio drama following Earth's first colonists on Mars. A high-stakes adventure told in the style of classic pulp science-fiction, each member of the colony does their best to find humor during the struggle for survival on this harsh frontier. As the mysteries of the Red Planet unfold around them, we follow the stories of several different characters including the fearless High Commander Jacki O'Rania (Shannon Lovley), repair technician Chip Heddleston (Sam Boase-Miller), military commander Lieutenant Melissa Walker (Aba Woodruff), medical doctor Keila Levy (Anya Zicer), spiritual guide Ani Mateo Alvirez (Aramis Martinez), Director of Colonial Finances Geoff Thomassen (James Fouhey), and of course ANDI (Dan Lovley), the colony's all-connecting artificial intelligence system. Want an idea of what this show sounds like? If you haven't already listened to the prelude episode of Marsfall, you can check it out for free here: https://bassbonebyfbo.podbean.com/e/marsfall-pr...

THE SHOW

Marsfall is doing for science-fiction what Welcome to Night Vale did for H. P. Lovecraft fans.

- Jamin Morden, teacher Washington DC public schools

The first full episode of Marsfall will launch to the world on the autumnal equinox, September 22, 2017. Season One consists of eight half-hour long episodes, which we will continue to release every 2 weeks.

As creators, we (Erik Saras, Sam Boase-Miller, and Dan Lovley) founded a production company based in friendship so we can support the great artistic talents of our many colleagues. This project is a culmination of a year and a half of brainstorming, writing, composing, recording, and sound mastering. We are so humbled we get to work with an amazing team of actors, musicians, and recording engineers who believe in this show.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Marsfall has better sound quality than 99% of podcasts that I've ever listened to.

- Leif Kolt, One Thing Straight Podcast, Producer

We are asking for your help in raising money to pay these talented artists what they deserve. This show stars eight actors hailing from New York City, Los Angeles, Boston, and Michigan. They prepared these scripts for weeks in advance and ran the gauntlet of a three day recording session to capture our first five episodes. Engineers Owen Shearer and Brian Goodheart of Sonic Union studios in New York City bring the highest quality in sound mastering to every single episode, and we want to make sure every future episode maintains this standard of quality. As creators, the three of us are forgoing any salary for our work as writers, directors, and composer/music supervisors. We want to do what's right, and make sure the people who believe in us are paid what they deserve for their dedication to this project.

Your donation will also help us recoup business expenses required to create this project. In order to  host a three day recording session in New York City, our company paid for all travel and lodging expenses incurred by our actors, while also providing meals, water, and snacks for the complete session. Following the union guidelines outlined by SAG, our commitment as producers is to always support our talent and make sure they are treated with the highest dignity and respect.

To express our gratitude, Marsfall will thank you for your contribution by sending you some cool stuff after the first episode premieres. Our soft white tee shirts sport the Marsfall logo and will keep you comfortable in style for only $30. We're also offering the soundtrack to the complete first season via digital download for only $20, so you can keep jamming out to these awesome tunes. For limited edition high-end donations, you can voice a minor character on our show, easily recording from the comfort of your home. We are also offering individual episode sponsorship or entire season sponsorship, which will entitle you to a verbal ad for your company played in our episode, or a special donor thank you during our final credits. But hey, if you can only contribute $5 to help make this show a reality, you'll still get a really cool thank you email from the three of us. 

OUR PLAN FOR THE SHOW

I love every character's unique voice. The adventure and emotional story elements are perfectly balanced.

- Shana Mlawski, author of Hammer of Witches

The first season of Marsfall will premiere over the fall and winter of 2017 and 2018. We already recorded the first five episodes and have plans to record the remaining three episodes later this year. Hopefully the exposure we receive will entice more donations and corporate sponsorship, as we have plans for three more seasons to premiere over the next three years. We can't stress enough how impressed we are by the talent who have joined us, and we want to enrich all of their careers through this project.

OUR COMMITMENT

Exciting pulp science-fiction that reminds me of the classics.

Michael Fischetti, director of Bruises

We believe art and the Internet can contribute to a positive cultural change. Often times our society does not place a high enough value on artistic skills. Music, drama, and art programs are being cut at every level of education, further stifling creative thinking in young people. Every human being was at one point inspired by the amazing books we read, movies and television shows we watched, and radio shows and podcasts we listened to at a young age. Now it's time for all of us to give back, and hopefully inspire another generation of young people to pursue their creative passions. Marsfall also aims to educate the general public on the newest developments in various scientific fields, including artificial intelligence evolution, planetary terraformation and colonization, and biomedical enhancements to the human body. Yes, this is a science-fiction drama, but we have taken the time to consult with astronomers, doctors, and engineers in order to confirm the facts behind the science presented in this show.

People told us that using actors from all over the country would be impossible for recording. We overcame that challenge because we recognized their talents and knew we would get the best performances from these specific artists. People told us we should engineer all of the sounds in-house to save money. We overcame that challenge by finding two great sound engineers who were as equally excited about the project as us. People gave us criticism that pushed the show in directions we never considered. We applied it to our story, improving it at every step of the way, in order to make it the highest quality possible. There is no hurdle we can't overcome, because our dedication to creating art will carry us through the worst of times. We are committed to making this project a reality, and even if our fundraising goal is not met we will still premiere the first episode on September 22nd, and continue to release episodes every two weeks. We are committed to making this project happen no matter what.

THANK YOU

If you like what you hear in the prelude episode, please contribute to this project so we can continue to support the wonderful artists working on this show. Even if you can only contribute a few dollars, it definitely makes a difference. Not sure if you want to contribute yet or just can't commit to it right now, but still like what you hear? Then please spread the word to other people using the Indiegogo share tools, and/or posting this campaign to your social media pages. We can't thank you enough for doing everything you can to make this project a reality.

Best Wishes,

Erik, Sam, and Dan

story:
Why Truest?

"All you have to do is write one true sentence.
Write the truest sentence that you know."
—Ernest Hemmingway, A Moveable Feast

When I first read this line in A Moveable  Feast it really hit me. I've pondered this question for myself, and wonder often how others would answer this question. This podcast is a way to find out.

What do I get?

Everyone that pledges any amount will get early access to episodes before they are published.

Starting at $5 you get your name on the website.  For just $15 I'll buy your first beer at the launch party (to be held in Seattle, WA). Sponsorships are available for as little as $25.

Honestly, at this point, sponsorship is more about helping me out than getting tons of people through your door. I'm imagining friends and family will sponsor just to get me to read something silly.

I'm keeping rewards simple to focus on the product.

What's the plan?

I have the first guest lined-up and have experience interviewing and producing podcasts. But I want this one to sound professional so I need some gear. Here's where your support is going:

  • A logo, everything needs a logo and I have the amazing Tracy Apps working on one
  • New gear, specifically an audio interface, some microphones, cables, and stands
  • One year of podcast audio hosting
  • Some walking around money to help with production

When is this going to happen?

The goal is to have Episode 1 ready in January of 2019 and then release one episode a month. I know that's slow for a podcast, but I want to make sure I can meet the commitment I'm making to each and every backer.

There is also an interesting "twist" to the podcast that will mean the production schedule will have to be variable.

What are the risks?

Time. I'm going to do this one way or the other. But depending on my time, episodes may come out more or less frequently. But I'm committed to 12 episodes for this initial season.

story:
Short Summary

As you might have guessed, my name is Deyan. 

I produce written board game content on a daily basis. Sometimes I shoot videos. But videos cost money. So... yeah. Let's not focus on those. 

If you have been following me you also know that i write my articles only in Bulgarian. So this being in English is weird, i guess. Am i being weird? I am weird. That's why you love me though!

I have been doing this kind of weird board game related stuff for more than six years and the popularity of the blog has raised significantly. Also, I often participate in Bulgarian board game conventions and try to be informed of anything board game related not only in my country but world wide as well. 

However, its not easy blogging about stuff if you are only staying at home and never meet with publishers, designers and other content creators. Is Antoine Bauza a real person? I don't know. Never met him. Can Tom Vasel kick my ass? Probably. What is the difference between the Brunos?  Which publisher smells the best? All the vital info a blogger needs.

The problem is that all the hard work put in the blog does not pay the bills. Apart from receiving review copies I am not being paid in any way. Plus, blogging is still a hobby that fuels on pure maniacal enthusiasm. 

So what I am asking is to be able to go to Germany, meet cool guys, buy games and party on your expense. Simple as that.  

Alright, alright!  It's actually really important for me. Going to Essen has been a dream for years and not being able to go hurts my reviewer's soul and I really feel guilty each time i miss a con and all the opportunities it gives a blogger. To be honest, last year I did manage to visit the Spiel for the first time, but that happened because stars were perfectly aligned in the Crit goddess was kind to be. I don't see that happening this year, unfortunately. 

What do I need money for exactly? 

Your money will be used for:

  • Tickets (convention and airplane)
  • Rent-a-car expenses
  • Accommodation
  • For food and stuff
  • For paying my cameraman, illustrator and editor

If we manage to raise a few extra bucks, there will be some for buying games but lets not get that far ahead. 

Why help Deyan in the first place?

Well, I don't know. Cause you're a crazy person? Or you like throwing money in random dudes' faces. 

The truth though is that I really need this for boosting my blogging confidence and in helping me achieve this, you are actually prolonging the life of Bigboxgamers. And I will love you forever.

Sooo Rewards...

Items

My romantic voice 

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 5 dollars
  • 9 dollars

I love the sound of my own voice, but why keep it only to myself. For 5 dollars, you will get a surprise call in the middle of night from me. You will get to hear my deep sexy voice in your ear, whispering gently for your (dis)comfort, assuring you that you are a wonderful person. Mmm.

Selfie with me in Essen

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 9 dollars
  • 19
  • 49 dollars
  • 99 dollars

Let’s face it. You need me. You need me to be with you. You need me to game with you. That is why you can receive a picture with me and a portrait of you playing a game at the Spiel.

Celebrity picture

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 49 dollars
  • 99 dollars

Remember that portrait of yours I talked about a while ago? Well, if I am not enough for you I will find a celebrity in the board game community and try to convince him/her to hold you tight like a long lost friend while a take a picture of you two love birds.

Now for the tangible stuff

Meeple Keychain

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 19 dollars 
  • 49 dollars
  • 99 dollars

I somehow managed to con my way into marrying a beautiful and smart woman, who always goes along with my wtf ideas. She is a master crafts artist and she will be making a classic board game themed keychain for some of you lovely supporters. Awesome!

Big ol’ handmade six-sided large die

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 49 dollars
  • 99 dollars

Yeah, my wife again. She will be making you an artsy-fartsy unique die just for you. Not for me though – if that will make you feel better.

Geeky T-shirt from 'Patka'

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 49 dollars
  • 99 dollars

Listen. I have friends, you know. They are awesome and they work for ‘Patka’. They will make a special board game themed T-shirt for you. You will choose from one of those two designs. I love ‘Patka’. You will love ‘Patka’. Take a ‘Patka’.

Large crochet baby dragon

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 99 dollars

My wife has done it again. For some reason she agreed to make you an awesome handmade dragon if you guys decide to back a the Ultimate Hug perk. I promise, if you guys send me to Essen I will leave her alone for a while. Actually she does count on that.  

And then this...

You can find it at these Perks:

  • 99 dollars

That’s it. I will come to your house unannounced and just hug you. Be ready.

Buuut... If you do not live in Bulgaria, you will get to hear my fabulous voice on the phone instead.

 

What people are saying

Never met him. Can Tom Vasel kick my ass? Probably. What is the difference between the Brunos?  Which publisher smells the best? All the vital info a blogger needs.
The problem is that all the hard work put in the blog does not pay the bills. Apart from receiving review copies I am not being paid in any way. Plus, blogging is still a hobby that fuels on pure maniacal enthusiasm. 
So what I am asking is to be able to go to Germany, meet cool guys, buy games and party on your expense. Simple as that.  


Alright, alright!  It's actually really important for me. Going to Essen has been a dream for years and not being able to go hurts my reviewer's soul and I really feel guilty each time i miss a con and all the opportunities it gives a blogger. To be honest, last year I did manage to visit the Spiel for the first time, but that happened because stars were perfectly aligned in the Crit goddess was kind to be. I don't see that happening this year, unfortunately. 

What do I need money for exactly? 
Your money will be used for:

Tickets (convention and airplane)
Rent-a-car expenses
Accommodation
For food and stuff
For paying my cameraman, illustrator and editor

If we manage to raise a few extra bucks, there will be some for buying games but lets not get that far ahead. 
Why help Deyan in the first place?
Well, I don't know. Cause you're a crazy person? Or you like throwing money in random dudes' faces. 
The truth though is that I really need this for boosting my blogging confidence and in helping me achieve this, you are actually prolonging the life of Bigboxgamers. And I will love you forever.
Sooo Rewards...
Items 
My romantic voice 
You can find it at these Perks:

5 dollars
9 dollars


I love the sound of my own voice, but why keep it only to myself. For 5 dollars, you will get a surprise call in the middle of night from me. You will get to hear my deep sexy voice in your ear, whispering gently for your (dis)comfort, assuring you that you are a wonderful person. Mmm.
Selfie with me in Essen
You can find it at these Perks: 

9 dollars
19
49 dollars
99 dollars


Let’s face it. You need me. You need me to be with you. You need me to game with you. That is why you can receive a picture with me and a portrait of you playing a game at the Spiel.
Celebrity picture
You can find it at these Perks: 

49 dollars
99 dollars


Remember that portrait of yours I talked about a while ago? Well, if I am not enough for you I will find a celebrity in the board game community and try to convince him/her to hold you tight like a long lost friend while a take a picture of you two love birds.
Now for the tangible stuff
Meeple Keychain
You can find it at these Perks: 

19 dollars 
49 dollars
99 dollars


I somehow managed to con my way into marrying a beautiful and smart woman, who always goes along with my wtf ideas. She is a master crafts artist and she will be making a classic board game themed keychain for some of you lovely supporters. Awesome!
Big ol’ handmade six-sided large die
You can find it at these Perks: 

49 dollars
99 dollars


Yeah, my wife again. She will be making you an artsy-fartsy unique die just for you. Not for me though – if that will make you feel better.
Geeky T-shirt from 'Patka'
You can find it at these Perks: 

49 dollars
99 dollars


Listen. I have friends, you know. They are awesome and they work for ‘Patka’. They will make a special board game themed T-shirt for you. You will choose from one of those two designs. I love ‘Patka’. You will love ‘Patka’. Take a ‘Patka’.
Large crochet baby dragon
You can find it at these Perks: 
99 dollars

My wife has done it again. For some reason she agreed to make you an awesome handmade dragon if you guys decide to back a the Ultimate Hug perk. I promise, if you guys send me to Essen I will leave her alone for a while. Actually she does count on that.  
And then this...
You can find it at these Perks: 
99 dollars

That’s it. I will come to your house unannounced and just hug you. Be ready.
Buuut... If you do not live in Bulgaria, you will get to hear my fabulous voice on the phone instead.
 What people are saying

story:
Out past the edge of town, past the rock outcroppings where the highway disappears. You’ll see a tree. She’ll be there.

Null/Void is a story about finding your place in the world and all the aggravations and heartbreak that come with growing up. It is a Black, Queer, modern science fiction audio drama podcast that follows a young woman, Piper Lee, whose life is saved by a mysterious voice named Adelaide. After uncovering a malicious plot, Piper and her friends must defend their small town from a family of ruthless billionaires who wish to exploit and destroy it. The season premiers April 7th, 2020 and will have 13 episodes, released every two weeks.

You can listen to the show now by going to our website or by clicking here for a direct link.

You can go subscribe to our RSS feed by clicking here.

Cole Burkhardt is the writer and creator of Null/Void. They are a queer, mixed folk living just outside of D.C. They have been in a variety of podcasts, including Godshead Incidental, Unplaced and Lavender Ladies. When they're not voice acting or editing audio, they are going to conventions across the East Coast, discussing gender and sexuality in media. Null/Void is a Piece of Cake Podcasting Production. The Piece of Cake Podcasting Network was created in 2018 in order to help people of color, as well as other marginalized content creators find their voice within the podcasting community. Our mission is to assist marginalized artists in the production of their podcasts and other audio mediums. We want to create unique networking opportunities for a large minority of voice actors, audio producers, and other podcasting content creators.

Who’s Involved

Null/Void was written by Cole Burkhardt and edited by Sterling Rae and Amber Holtz.

Sound Design by Donald Guzzi and Jonesy Jones

Music composed by Benny James

Our voice actors include:

  • Winona Wyatt as Piper
  • Danyelle Ellett as Adelaide
  • Azul Nova as Dodger
  • Evan Saft as Chris
  • Sena Bryer as Niki
  • PJ Kanis as Kyron
  • Kara Bruntz as Isobella
  • Marcie Hobbs as Hurley

Plus a few other surprise voice actors!

What We Need From You

So! Let’s get down to brass tack. What is we need from you?

Well, in terms of funding, our goal is to raise $3300 total for the Season.

Let’s break that down a little more. We want to pay the amazing folks who help to bring this story to life!

  • Main Cast: $25 x episode = $1,520
  • Ensemble actors: $15 x episode = $75
  • Sound and Story Editors: $25 x episode = $1300
  • Artists, Composers: $150

Total = 3105

We're setting aside $295 (or about 9%) to cover some of our basic production costs like hosting our RSS feed, Sensitivity Consultants, maintaining our website, and the pesky 5% that IndieGoGo charges for hosting our campaign!

Total: $3,300

Perks

We have a wide variety of perks in exchange for your monetary support!

We've reached our first 10%!  With this, we released a new $50 tier, revealed our new Album Art and the design for new buttons/stickers/posters. Plus! A very special character playlist!

When we hit every 10% milestone, we'll be releasing more playlists as well as some other fun surprises!

If we reach our total goal, the Cast and I will celebrate by live streaming a viewing of Office Space.

Office Grunt ($5)- At this tier, you’ll be listed as a supporter on our website!

Office Manager ($15)- At this tier, you’ll receive the previous rewards, as well as a sticker AND/OR Button AND a digital wallpaper.

Senior Director ($25)- At this tier, you’ll receive the previous rewards, as well as a poster of our Logo and behind the scenes recordings of our readthroughs.

Executive Vice President ($50)- At this tier, you’ll receive the previous rewards, as well as a handwritten thank you postcard as well as both posters, the white and the starry night album art.

Executive President ($75)- At this tier, you’ll receive the previous rewards, as well as a personalized Cease and Desist Letter as well as physical copies of the original scripts with authors notes and commentary.

Chief Executive Officer ($100)- At this tier, you’ll receive the previous rewards as well as Producer Credit for the Season and an AMA Video Chat with the Creator, Cast and Crew.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money is tight and not everyone is able to donate as much as they’d like. Thankfully, there are a few ways you can support us, outside of monetary donations. In the meanwhile, you can help us spread the word! Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your coworkers! Even just retweeting our stuff on Twitter is immensely helpful. You can find us on Twitter @nullandvoidpod and share our announcement. You can check out our website by clicking here! You can also listen to the show! Our Trailer is out now and the show is set to premier in April 2020.

story:
Short Summary

I started a podcast because I love movies and tv shows, and I want to get my work to be experienced in the most accessible way possible. I started an Indiegogo to help with the operating expenses for the media company I’m building called BetweenUsTwo.

Chaka and Lani is a narrative podcast about two women fighting to keep their business sailing, their friendship together and their family united. They run a studio for artists which allows for comedic characters with playful personalities. The main theme is outgrowing our trauma and creating room for good things to come.

A “talk show” is also in development. The first episode talks about death, plastic surgeries, emotional well being, Doja Cat’s ass, and God. I pull from my love of punk & hip hop aesthetics and structure.

This is the beginning for Between UsTwo. Once the podcast is sustaining, next is books and then animation. The biggest goal is to craft a universe. The immediate goal is to get the work out there!


What We Need 

  • a 3 year membership with SimpleCast for distribution
  • a 3 year reserved web domain with GoDaddy
  • a 3 year membership with Wix website builder 
  • afford filing fees for the LLC paper with my state county 
  • bonus would be a stipend for the cast, composer & audio engineers
  • left over budget will pay for other operating expenses

Miki Argwal said it took 2 1/2 years for her businesses to be profitable. I’m insuring for 3.

 

What You Get

  • invitations and thank you letters will be sent through email
  • i will send an email regarding when and where I’ll do the shoutouts

No gift? No problem, you can stay in the loop by subscribing to my newsletter (it’s a link.) Check back on this Indiegogo page for updates regarding the podcasts. Any amount contributed adds up?

If you can’t donate, share this campaign and spread the news word of mouth. I’m grateful for everyone’s help. 

 

The Impact

As a company it’s going to amplify values such as self discovery, and healing. The mission to produce works that make a diverse group of people feel included. It’s going to give back to the listeners through shout outs, thoughtful interactions, and building fun spaces. As the company expands so will ideas on how to give back.

This is my second independent project. In 2019 I wrote and produced a short film called Closer, which was accepted into the San Diego Film Week Festival. You can check it out on this featured article -> TheLightLeaks.com (it’s a link.)

 

The Progress

Oh this is very much real! The script for Chaka and Lani has been through many table reads. So far I’ve cast 1 student from the Yale school of drama student, 1 underground pop artist from New York, and 1 YouTuber with 4k+ subscribers, and I’m still looking for more. We finished the first draft of the music score. It still has some ways to go but it’s moving as much as it can given the circumstances in the U.S. 

All of the artwork in this campaign was created by @sapzuu on instagram for me. 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is my first crowdfunding campaign! So I will be sure to keep an active, clear and open communication with all of you. If you have any questions I encourage you to leave them. I will check my Indiegogo page at least biweekly.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this on social media, and stay in the loop with BetweenUsTwo, even as a listener you're valued!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
There is a large and growing population of First Generation Millennials and Generation Z’s of color in the Midwest (e.g., Somali, Latino, African American, Indigenous, Black, and Hmong.) These communities do not have a digital source of news and entertainment that caters to their unique perspectives and ideologies. WePod is a digital news and entertainment media project that engages perspectives on current and political events while unapologetically challenging dominant conventional thinking. 

Down with the cause? Great!

What do we need from you? Financial Support. 

We need startup funds! So, why not help us out? All donations go directly to WePod for immediate use. In fact, we are going to be instantly using the funds for our Kick-Off event coming up on June 8th, 2018 (yes, you are invited).  

Here’s what we plan to do. 

PHASE ONE
We're going to lay down the dopest podcasts covering political topics pertinent to millennials of color. What's extra cool about our podcasts is that we will be breaking barriers by broadcasting in several languages. 

PHASE TWO
We are inspired by our communities. That's super important to us, so we want to stay rooted by creating novel outreach programs that help steer our programming in the right direction.

Along with this, we are going to open a syndicated blog to make room for community voices. Think along the lines of Blavity or Medium.

PHASE THREE
We're busting out into other facets of millennial culture like art, music, fashion, thanks to our sponsor, National Speaking Society.  

Save the Date for Minneapolis Fall Fashion Week.  

DID WE CONVINCE YOU?

WE COULD NOT DO THIS WORK WITHOUT YOUR SUPPORT!

Warm regards,  

WePod Crew 
info@wepod.co 
www.wepod.co

story:
We're all about people and energy

Achieving universal access to energy is a massive challenge on multiple levels: any entrepreneur will attest that finding technical solutions is only the start. But seeing how electricity access, cleaner stoves or a tap that delivers fresh water can transform lives, even in a small community, is a huge reward at the end of the long haul.  

This is what fascinates EnAct: the personal stories about who is changing whose life, and how. Time and again, we've seen our stories make the abstract concept of 'energy poverty' strikingly (even shockingly!) real. Hospital staff doing night rounds by the light of a cell phone. University students sharing batteries so they can study in dorms with no electricity.  An entire city--Kathmandu, Nepal no less--disappearing due to load-shedding. (Photo: P. Dicampo)   

We believe 'seeing' these lived realities is far more compelling than 'reading' global statistics and academic reports. Thus, a media outlet dedicated to the energy access story can play a key role in prompting others to take action. 

12 new stories for 2018

With space secured in relevant magazines and online media, EnAct needs support to send journalists and photographers into the field. To the greatest degree possible, we work with locals to keep costs down and also build capacity in energy reporting. 

Our cost to produce and place each article is about $2,500 - covering research, interviews, writing/editing, photography, graphic design, posting on our website and adapting for other outlets. 

We've set our goal of $7,500 to secure funds for the first quarter of 2018, and will leave the campaign open until we hit the $30,000 needed for the full year. If we don't reach the goal, we'll still dedicate what we have to energy access reporting. 

Can storytelling accelerate action?

EnAct has already proven it can! In December 2016, we wrote about the SELCO Foundation adding solar-powered motors to treadle sewing machines, substantially boosting productivity of women tailors in India. Our readers donated more than $2000 to get 10 more machines fitted and distributed through the Foundation's micro-credit scheme. As initial loans are repaid, more women will benefit. (Photo: SELCO Foundation)

Being different is our greatest asset, and our biggest challenge

A key challenge for EnAct is that we are unlike the usual 'actors' in this space. We don't deliver solutions to needy communities; rather, we deliver solution stories to audiences with vested interests. We don't want to compete for investment in or support for energy solutions, but we believe raising awareness is critical to helping secure such engagement.

As media business models collapse around us, we also face the challenge of creating an alternative future. But we believe our unique approach of bringing together experts and award-winning storytellers has a clear benefit: the natural cross-training that occurs boosts knowledge on both sides, and builds trust across these two communities

Importantly, EnAct's approach delivers huge value to energy access actors. Beyond the broad media exposure, we also deliver high-quality images entrepreneurs can use for their own outreach, marketing and communications activities.

Finally, photos can be purchased by individuals who want to show colleagues, friends and family their personal commitment to improving energy access. (Photo: M. Smith) 

More ways to support EnAct & energy actors

EnAct and the energy innovators behind these great stories know that financial contributions are not always possible. Equally valuable to us help in two other ways: 

  • Tell us your story! If you are active in energy access, drop us about what you do. We'll see how we can help others learn about it.
  • Spread the word!  Share these stories through your own social media channels and encourage your colleagues, friends and family to help out. You can follow us here: 
    • Facebook: The Energy Action Project 
    • Twitter: @EnActNow
    • Instagram: @everyday_energy

      We believe it's time for everyone to 'get' energy. Hope you'll give us a hand!

story:
I've always been committed to local news but especially as it relates to redevelopment, mainly because so many decisions are made long before shovels go into the ground. RahwayRising.com has been a hobby that I started in November 2007, spending some nights at municipal meetings and writing stories in my spare time. It's funny to see those early posts and experiments!

To commemorate 10 years, this crowdfunding campaign aims to raise $1,000, namely to sustain the technical aspects of the site, like expenses associated with web hosting, domain registration, state registrations and other future costs involved in running the site.

I offer some advertising on the site for local businesses but this is just a one-man operation. I experimented with a campaign last year and was humbled by -- and grateful for -- the generous support I received. The site is free to read but this is an opportunity for loyal readers to support the site, especially as the site approaches its 10th year!
story_txt: I've always been committed to local news but especially as it relates to redevelopment, mainly because so many decisions are made long before shovels go into the ground. RahwayRising.com has been a hobby that I started in November 2007, spending some nights at municipal meetings and writing stories in my spare time. It's funny to see those early posts and experiments!To commemorate 10 years, this crowdfunding campaign aims to raise $1,000, namely to sustain the technical aspects of the site, like expenses associated with web hosting, domain registration, state registrations and other future costs involved in running the site.I offer some advertising on the site for local businesses but this is just a one-man operation. I experimented with a campaign last year and was humbled by -- and grateful for -- the generous support I received. The site is free to read but this is an opportunity for loyal readers to support the site, especially as the site approaches its 10th year!

story:
I'm William Sutphin, an audio drama creator, and filmmaker, based in Los Angeles. I began my career in New York City, where I was an award-winning film student at Columbia. Taking home a DGA award for my short film, "Uncle Killa". 

Lately, my interests have shifted towards audio dramas and I am working on my second, a multi-episode work of historical fiction called "Booker and Olivia Build A School." I have long wanted to tell this story of the founding of one of our great HBCUs and the incredible, largely unknown, story of how Olivia Davidson played a leading role in the partnership that created Tuskegee. 

Our community needs to hear inspirational stories like these. We'll need your help though, to do it right.

My last audio drama "Hoodwinked", a 6 episode dramedy, came in at just under $6000, it can be found on most audio platforms. "Booker and Olivia" is a more ambitious undertaking and thus our goal of raising $7500 or more is appropriate for the scale of professionalism and talent that will participate in bringing this story to your ears.

You can be sure that you will be included every step of the way in the progress of "Booker and Olivia Build A School" and the anticipated launch is Black History Month 2022.

It's important that we tell our stories, our way and with me, you can look forward to a narrative that celebrates and respects our struggle and history.

For your generosity in helping bring this story to life, I thank you most heartedly.

story:
JOM on the GO

Ever wanted to get up and go; travel without limits or time constraints? Have you yearned to make the whole world your home? Well so have we. Meet Jo and OM or better known as JOM:

  • We are partners looking to adapt our lifestyle into a digital nomad experience. We are both artists with backgrounds in film, television, modeling/print as well as holistic practices including life/relationship coaching, yoga, and reiki to name a few.
  • This campaign is focused around freedom, and that’s what you are contributing to when you donate. Your funds will allow us to purchase and outfit a van to travel and live in.
  • Your contribution will secure a strong positioning for us to be successful in transitioning into van life and will provide space time for us to focus on what we love; artistry and helping people to become their greatest selves.

So whether you’re an artist, an adventurer or simply want to live vicariously, you’ll definitely want to take a look at our perks and support where you can.

Check out some of the Van Lifers that inspired us:

https://youtu.be/b7LTzRGSyiQ

https://youtu.be/dlg89GHwVyg

https://youtu.be/EQ1n3qwhNFA

https://youtu.be/P3tf_Jm48Vw

https://youtu.be/xdhXBYUa1UI

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a van to convert into a home to provide shelter and travel:

  • The funding you provide will go towards purchasing a solid vehicle in addition to making the necessary modifications to the van to make it home appropriate. This includes but is not limited to: sink, stove, shower/bathroom, bed, and solar. The goal is off-grid autonomy.
  • Our perks are as diverse as we are. From original artwork, to concerts, to one on one sessions, to an actual home visit anywhere in the US! We wanted to offer something we’ve never come across on Indiegogo
  • Regardless of if we hit our goal (and with your help and dedication we are certain to do so) the funds will be used the same no matter the outcome: which is to purchase a van and home fit it.

The Impact

Your impact will turn this dream into a reality. It will allow us to reach and help more people, and for us to grow as individuals and a unit through our travels and interactions:

  • In these times it is evident that the world needs healing and change. We are healers quite literally; bringing about change, healing, positivity and up lifting all we come into contact with.
  • In the past we have produced successful multiple city tours with a standard sedan. This provided valuable experiences and lessons. One major take away was how efficient these travels would be if our vehicle was our home. 
  • We aren’t backed by any major corporations or sponsorships, which is why your support goes along way. We are simply two humans looking to live an alternative existence for a healthier, happier, and more enjoyable life. 

Risks & Challenges

We are keenly aware that this lifestyle isn’t for everyone, which is why we are living it. Whether you’re inspired by our journey or could never and think we’re sheer entertainment, we invite you to come along. Van life isn’t as simple or glamorous as Instagram makes it out to be. It requires resilience, durability, and adaptability. If we come up short with this campaign, that means we have no bathroom, which has a great impact on our day to day functioning. Also living in a van does keep us bit more “exposed” and police harassment is a real risk. The more equipped we are, the safer we are, the better experience this transition will be.  

  • Having traveled internationally, living in all major markets (New York, Chicago, LA, and Atlanta) has provided life experience and adaptability. It’s because we’ve moved so many times and are already so nomadic that we figured instead of fighting it, we’d fully embrace it.
  • The best way to solve a problem is being solution oriented. This is a habit that we’ve practiced for over a decade now. There’s no value in being stressed and emotional over unfortunate circumstances. That energy is better used towards figuring out how to change those circumstances and leveraging them to your advantage.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can support us in many ways. Follow us on Instagram @jomonthego, @justchatwithjo, and @om.the.mystic as well as visiting our websites www.justchatwithjo.com & www.omthemystic.com and subscribe to our YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCK1E_y902SMbvi...

  • Other ways you can support is letting everyone know about this campaign. We’re looking to build a community of awesome likeminded people.
  • You can share through all social media outlets. Texts and emails work just as well!

And that's all there is to it.
