story:
​Pagan.World Mission: Pagans connecting Pagans, Witches, Wiccans, Druids and Heathens
Finding your local Pagan, Wiccan, and Witch groups, shops, services, and resources, anywhere in the world.  Your comprehensive guide to the magickal side of life.




Welcome to the Pagan World Project, your access to the Pagan Community, local to global. - A Message from Oberon Zell

I’m Oberon Zell, and I’m speaking to you on behalf of the exciting Pagan World Project, which I’m proud to represent.  As a Founding Father, and the first person to adopt the identity of Pagan for the nascent movement—in 1967—I love this community, with its unique potential to lead our wounded world into a healing—and an Awakening.  

Our scattered People want to connect to the greater Pagan community—to come Home. The Internet today allows us to connect and share our communities in ways never before possible—or even imaginable! Pagan World will provide a central directory for you to discover your local and global groups, shops, services and events. We intend to provide access to teachers, guides, classes and circles for as many seekers as possible. And as a lover of great festivals—many of which I attend—for them to be better listed and even more accessible to our growing community.

Pagan World is the next generation of Pagan directories, like those once put out by my Green Egg magazine, Selena Fox’s Circle Guide to Wicca and Pagan Resources, and Wren and Fritz Walker’s online WitchVox, which closed last year. Pagan World is a new way to bring together our widely dispersed Pagan community, who now number upwards of 4 million in the United States alone!

Join us today! 

What will You Receive as Perk?
You will receiving a Membership Account on Pagan.World Portal, receive a profile, and begin to look for and list local resources. You will be able to register at the end of this campaign, for our February , 2021 Beta opening. 

Pagan.World has added 6 year-long Workshops, for supporting members and above. 
Click this Update to find out more. 


How to Engage! 
You will sign up as a Seeker member creating a profile.
Each profile is private, the member decides what can be publicly disclosed and shared.
This profile will allow each individual to engage with our listings.
The member will be able to create listings for the site, including their profile, group, shop, events and other forms.  
Once completed, the Journey Begins. 
You will receive a email to register your account at the end of this Indiegogo campaign.
You can preregister before Beta at: The Ultimate Directory for Pagans - Pagan World​

By Supporting us now, You go First!
As a Perk supporter, at any level, you will be the first to be able to sign up. The Beta Test, which we expect to last three months begins February, 2021. All Perks are for memberships through May 31st, 2022. 

Seeker Membership allows the individual to be able to engage with listings, and the community behind them. They can create a listings for the directory on their behalf. This is a free service, and foundational to Pagan.World project.  We will be opening this to our supporters first. We will open Seeker Memberships, for everyone to register, in late February 2021. 

To help finance the site, we will have Supporting Membership and Sponsoring Members.
 - Supporting members, will have increased ability to do listings, share, and access content. This will allow enhancement for group pages etc.
 - Sponsoring members, will have services to share their products, services, and other projects. This will be to help to share information.

The Witchvox Legacy
Local Directories have always been a major path which we find each other, from listings in Green Egg Magazine,  Circle’s Guide to Pagan and Wiccan Resources, and WitchVox online.  Witchvox was an amazing website that offered quality connections on a local to global basis. Operated by Wren and Fritz Walker, from 1997 until the end of 2019, offered meaningful connections that helped create the online community. The shock of the end of WitchVox and its erasure from the web has left a painful hole as well as a myth and legacy, leaving the community to its own resources.  In 2020, the sense of loss of this wonderful tool to community building has grown.

Pagan. World is New! 
Pagan.World is a new project that will allow us to reconnect, relink, and redevelop a new directory, with the goal of developing community tools. Pagan. World seeks to continue the work that Witchvox has shown that is so desperately needed by the Pagan community. Pagan.World in not affiliated, endorsed or in any way connected to the WitchVox site, but they have our respect.

Pagan.World will be the next level of community directory, on a local to global basis. We thank Witchvox Legacy as our inspiration.

Membership Perks:
Beta Feb 2, 2021
Open May 1st 2021
This subscription ends May 31st, 2022


Basic Profile: Includes User Name, Legal Name (hidden) Address, city, state zip (private or public) contact. Include Bio, Historical Pictures, if author a place to list your books, musicians their music.  This is building block of Pagan.World ability to help connect to your community. 
Basic Listings: Groups, Shops, Events, Services, News, Announcements. 
Enhanced Listings: Appear in highlighted area, above open listings, increased key words
Priority Listings: Appear at top highlighted area, prominence in other site areas.
Community Profile: Creates a page to share more than listings, giving more information. List all items.
Shop Profile: Creates a page that allows sharing a range of information, including products, services and more.
Workshop Access: This allows access to our Pagan World Workshop Network, where you can access workshops for free and fee.
Workshop Hosting: Access to Pagan World Workshop Network to offer free or fee workshops.
Social Broadcasting: Access to Pagan World Zoom, Podcasting, and multiplatform broadcasting, to reach out and make connections as part of this membership. 

Why are We Fundraising?

To answer the question, which is “What will you use my money for?”, is important. In this case, we are raising the needed money, to create and extend this project.  Every dollar raised will be invested into the site, to create and host directory, services, maintenance, and growth. We do have a tremendous and growing volunteer staff.

$3000 which is our minimum ask, will provide domain, basic hosting, and memory for basic accounts and minimal services for 15 months. This is the Minimum Viable Project (MVP).  Ongoing fundraising will continue to be required.

$10,000 is our first comfort plateau, where we can provide all services mentioned, for 15 months. Once we reach this level, we have enough funding for Social Broadcasting, Workshops, and Festival Services for 15 months.  This will remain a volunteer run organization.

Help us reach our first goal of $3000 by pledging to a perk today.

Referral Rewards: Online Festival
  
Pagan.World Project is offering a referral reward of providing so your group, community or shop can receive a bonus. Become a Sponsor and Host your own Festival or Conference online. 
Our online hosting of festivals is part of our social broadcasting. 
Each day of the festival, you will be able to create up to four tracks of programming, moderated, and can be offered for free or for admission. All tools will be available through Pagan World site. 



When you Login to Indiegogo, you use the sharing and linking tools from this page, it contains your unique code. As you share it, your people pledge through your link and it is recorded. We run this until campaign ends, and you will be able to access by May 1st, 2021.
Here is the best way to understand how to participate. 
How to Participate in a Referral Contest – Indiegogo Help Center​

Pagan.World as a Community Development Site

As Pagan.World develops with profiles, listings, and contact pages, we will be developing directories that include more information. This will be inclusive of Social Media, and to help create connections with the hundreds of thousands of Pagan Websites, thousands of Podcasts, thousands of video creators on Youtube, and millions of connections to social networks.  Instead of hours and hours of searching search engines and social media, Pagan.World will help you reach our community faster, allowing you to learn and engage quickly.

As Pagan.World improves, it will offer tools, including podcasting, zoom, and social broadcasting. Services that allow for virtual festivals, conferences and workshops.  Ways of reaching audiences for musicians, podcasters, video creators, and creative arts. Developing access to markets for Pagan shops, services, products and business. Online ways to have meaning connections.  By sharing tools at scale, we can offer more groups even better access to the world community.

The Team behind Pagan.World

Oberon Zell, A founding father of the Modern Pagan Movement,  has agreed to be the spokesperson for our project, being advisor,  and user of the first account.  

Project Leader is CEM Broadcasting, led by Ed Hubbard. This team has dedicated developers and large volunteer leadership, including a new committee of 35 individuals, to work particularly on Pagan World Project.  Ed has more than 25 years of online experience, including WitchSchool.com, The Daily Spell, Pagans Tonight Radio, Magick.Tv and countless smaller projects.  His team builds to last on the web.
Correllian Education Ministry is a 501c3 United States.

story:
// Descrizione del progetto in italiano più sotto //

// Présentation détaillée du projet en français ci-dessous après la version italienne //

 

Who am I?


My name is Florence, half Italian, half Nigerian, born and raised in Florence, Italy. For the past five years I have been living in Paris. Before settling down in France, I have visited 20 countries between 2004 and 2011. I am the editor and photographer behind Florence Out Loud blogzine-to-be ;)

In a nutshell, Florence Out Loud is:

- a blogzine, where you will find different categories of articles of interest: photography, video, storytelling,.... Why have we to choose, right? It is a multi-faceted space where you can find articles about responsible travelling, ecotourism, conscious lifestyle, free-plastic life reflections, stories and portraits from all around the world…

- a mapping of existing eco, responsible accommodations, travel operators and community-based tourism addresses all around the world, to help you choose the tourism professionals to contact for your next solo/couple travel, family vacation, friends trip, and so on…

- an interactive web-documentary where I will gather photographs, videos, sounds and interviews like you were with me in the journey  (created with Klynt App/ klynt.net)

Discover the potential of Klynt application here:  https://player.vimeo.com/video/59979665

Why this project? Why now?

Like many others I decided that 2017 will be the year of great changes in my life and I committed myself to start living my life on my own terms!

After a great experience last summer in Malaysia and Singapore, I decided to take some time to explore the other world’s wonders and bought a Round-The-World ticket.

Even if I really appreciated that trip, I somehow feel that I missed a bit the contact with local people. That’s why I started to search how to maximize the positive impact and minimize the negative one of travelling!

 I came across a lot of websites about community-based tourism, responsible travel and so on but sources were multiple. I therefore thought that maybe it coul be useful to assemble all information available on the net in one space, adding stories from people who obtained benefits from responsible travelling. 

Last but not least, United Nations has designated 2017 as International Year of Sustainable Tourism for Development, proving that tourism can be a real measure of empowerment for local communities able to fight poverty and social exclusion, fostering cross-cultural understanding and mutual solidarity among people. 

The purpose of the blogzine is simply to show that, near or far, anyone can and should be a responsible traveller and citizen capable of making conscious choices.

Why do I need IndieGoGo?

And here is where you can help me out!

Of course, while I have already have covered many of the costs for the project, I still need your help to get my companion of adventures: I would need to update my photo gear buying a new camera, light, discreet and performing enough, to better capture all inspiring stories! Moreover I will need to pay the license to use the Klynt App and the Adobe Creative pack for photographers (including Photoshop and Lightroom).

A part of my budget has to cover the productions of the perks + Indiegogo fee and bank charges. 

Funds raised as a part of this campaign will cover:

  • Purchasing the camera (2200€)
  • Purchasing the Adobe Creative Cloud for photographers (144€)
  • Purchasing the Klynt App license (499€)
  • Perks shipping and distribution (+/-500€)

  • Campaign costs (Indiegogo fees and credit card fees) (+/-175€)

After the Round-The-World, what will happen?

Once at home, I will spend the end of January and February 2018, creating the interactive platform via Klynt App, editing all good pictures and making videos… I will also be pleased to attend informal meetings and events with interested fellow travellers in Paris.

Other ways you can help

If you are not interested in any of the rewards and I couldn't convince you to give it a try until now, there are still a few ways you can help me!

  • Donate! If you'd like to support me without claiming a reward, you can do that as well! Simply click on "Back it" and you can put in any amount you'd like to donate. 
  • Spread the love for photography and responsible travel! I am sure you know a friend that knows a friend of friends (LOL!!!) that you think would be interested in supporting this project. Forward them this website, tell them all about me and ask them to back the project! 
  • Post about it! On Instagram, on Facebook, on your website, in the comments of your favourite travel website - share this page and let people know that this project exists and I need your help. 
  • Talk about the project! If you have a travel podcast, I'd LOVE it if you talked about the project and shared the love with your followers!
  • If you know local associations, community-based tourism networks, bloggers or creative people in one or more of the countries I visit, please share your address book with me!
  • Share, share, share. If in doubt, share once more.

Thank you in advance for all of your help and encouragement! 

To address the elephant in the room - yes, there is no compensation for me in here. Everything up to 3500€ will be used to cover the costs mentioned above.

So, what happens in case I don't hit the funding goal?

What if I surpass the target? 

The target is 3500€. Every little bit helps! If the goal is not reached, I plan however to take whatever is raised and put it towards advancing the project because I believe wholeheartedly in creating something inspiring for  responsible travelers of tomorrow and will continue to do that in whatever way I can.

It is possible you have chances of knowing someone who loves photography and the idea of deep connection with local communities when traveling and might be looking for something exactly like this.

If we reach our objective of course it's high-fives all around! Follow along, and become a part of the journey!

If I can raise more than 3500€, then I will:

  • Buy an additional external hard disk in order to secure more all the work and an additional portable charger
  • Pay a professional video-maker to create an even better web-documentary
  • Think about creating a photozine with my best shots or about holding a photography exhibition (another dream of mine!).

Whether it is financial or moral, your support means the world to me!

ITALIANO

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Mi chiamo Florence, nata e cresciuta nella bellissima Firenze. Vivo a Parigi da cinque anni; prima di stabilirmi in Francia, ho visitato 20 paesi tra il 2004 e il 2011.
Sono la redattrice e la fotografa del blog FlorenceOutLoud.com che sarà lanciato prestissimo !

 

Cosa è FlorenceOutLoud.com?


In poche parole, Florence Out Loud è: 
- un blogzine (un misto tra il blog e la rivista online), dove troverete diverse categorie che potrebbero interessarvi: fotografia, video, narrazione (storytelling).... Perché dovreste visitare il blog? È un spazio sfaccettato dove trovare articoli sul viaggio responsabile, sull’ ecoturismo, su un modo di vita più consapevole, riflessioni su uno stile di vita libero dalla plastica e senza rifiuti, storie e ritratti di persone da tutto il mondo;

- una mappatura delle strutture ricettive eco-responsabili esistenti, degli operatori turistici e degli indirizzi di turismo comunitario, per aiutarvi a scegliere i professionisti del turismo da contattare per il vostro prossimo viaggio in solitario / in coppia, la vostra prossima vacanza con la  famiglia o con gli amici, e così via...

- un web-documentario interattivo dove raggrupperò fotografie, video, suoni ed interviste come se foste in viaggio con me (lo creerò con l’applicazione Klynt / klynt.net)

Scoprite tutte le potenzialità  di Klynt qui: https://player.vimeo.com/video/59979665

Perché questo progetto? Perché ora?

Come molte altre persone ho deciso che il 2017 sarebbe stato l'anno dei grandi cambiamenti nella mia vita, che voglio vivere secondo le mie regole!

Dopo una grande esperienza la scorsa estate in Malesia e a Singapore, ho deciso di prendere un po 'di tempo per esplorare le meraviglie del mondo e ho comprato un biglietto aereo per fare il giro del mondo.

Anche se ho apprezzato quel viaggio, in qualche modo ho sentito la mancanza di un contatto più lungo con la popolazione locale,così che ho iniziato a cercare su internet come fare esperienze migliori nei viaggi!

Mi sono imbattuta in un sacco di siti web sul turismo comunitario, sul  turismo responsabile e così via. Ma le fonti erano molteplici, così ho pensato: forse potrebbe essere utile raggruppare tutte le informazioni su internet in un unico spazio e aggiungervi le storie di tutti quegli uomini e quelle donne che hanno avuto benefici dal turismo responsabile?

Un ultimo punto ma non meno importante, le Nazioni Unite hanno designato il 2017 come l’Anno Internazionale del turismo sostenibile per lo sviluppo, dimostrando che il turismo può essere una vera misura di « empowerment » per le comunità locali e per la lotta contro la povertà e l'esclusione sociale, uno strumento di promozione della diversità culturale e di solidarietà reciproca tra i popoli.

Lo scopo del mio blog è quello di mostrare semplicemente che, vicino o lontano, chiunque può e deve essere un viaggiatore e un cittadino responsabile  semplicemente facendo scelte consapevoli.

Perché ho bisogno di IndieGoGo?

E qui tocca  a voi!

Naturalmente, ho già coperto molti dei costi per realizzare il mio viaggio, ma ho ancora bisogno del vostro aiuto per acquistare il mio compagno di viaggio: una macchina fotografica leggera, discreta e performante, per catturare le storie più stimolanti e i momenti migliori della mia avventura! Inoltre ho bisogno di pagare la licenza per utilizzare l'applicazione Klynt e il pacchetto creativo di Adobe per i fotografi (che include Photoshop e Lightroom).

Una parte del mio budget deve coprire la creazione delle ricompense e delle commissioni Indiegogo.

Altri modi per aiutarmi

Se non siete interessati a una qualsiasi delle ricompense o non sono riuscita fino ad ora a  convincervi a fare una donazione, ci sarebbero altri modi per aiutarmi!

• Donate! Se volete sostenere il progetto senza ricevere una ricompensa, potete farlo cliccando su "Back it" e scegliere la somma della vostra donazione.

• Condividete! Sono sicura che conoscete un amico che conosce un amico e cosi via, che potrebbe essere interessato a sostenere questo progetto. Trasmettete loro il link della campagna, parlate del progetto e chiedete di sostenerlo!

• Condividete il progetto! Su Instagram, su Facebook, sul vostro sito web, nei commenti del vostro sito di viaggio preferito - Condividete il link della campagna e fate sapere che questo progetto esiste e che ho bisogno dell' aiuto di tutti. 

• Parlate del progetto! Se avete un podcast di viaggio, sarebbe importante parlare del progetto e condividere l’interesse per il viaggio responsabile con i vostri ascoltatori!

• Conoscete delle associazioni locali, delle reti di turismo comunitario, dei blogger o delle persone creative nei paesi che visiterò? Se si',  condividete la vostra rubrica con me, mi sarà utile!

• Condividete, condividete, condividete. In caso di dubbio, condividete una volta di più.

Grazie in anticipo per tutto il vostro aiuto e incoraggiamento!

Quindi, cosa succede nel caso in cui non riesco a raggiungere l'obiettivo di finanziamento?

Cosa succede se supero l'obiettivo? 

L'obiettivo è di 3500€. Ogni piccolo aiuto conta! Se l'obiettivo non viene raggiunto, ho intenzione di prendere tutto ciò che è stato raccolto e riversarlo per continuare il progetto. Credo con tutto il cuore nella creazione di qualcosa di stimolante per i viaggiatori responsabili di domani e continuerò a farlo in qualunque modo possibile.

È probabile che conoscete qualcuno che ama la fotografia e viaggiare in maniera più profonda  e potrebbe essere alla ricerca di qualcosa esattamente come questo.

Se l'obiettivo è raggiunto, naturalmente, give me five! (datemi il cinque!). Continuate a seguire il progetto, e diventatene una parte importante!

Se riesco a raccogliere più di 3500 €, allora ecco cosa farò:

• acquistare un disco rigido esterno aggiuntivo (per salvare ancora meglio tutto il lavoro) e una batteria aggiuntiva

• assumere un realizzatore video professionista per creare un web-documentario ancora migliore

• pensare a creare un libro fotografico con i miei migliori scatti o organizzare una mostra fotografica (un altro mio sogno!).

Sia finanziario che morale, il vostro supporto significa molto per me!

FRANCAIS

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Qui suis-je?

 

Je m'appelle Florence, moitié italienne, moitié nigériane, née à Florence, en Italie. Je vis à Paris depuis cinq ans. Avant de m'installer en France, j'ai visité 20 pays entre 2004 et 2011. Je suis l'écrivain et la photographe derrière le blogzine FlorenceOutLoud.com que sera lancé très prochainement ;)

 

Qu’est-ce Florence Out Loud ?

 

En un mot, Florence Out Loud est:

- un blogzine, où vous trouverez différentes catégories qui pourraient vous intéresser: la photographie, la vidéo,  le récit de voyage, .... Pourquoi avons-nous à choisir, non? C'est un espace à multiples facettes où vous trouverez également des articles sur le voyage responsable, l'écotourisme, des réflexions sur une vie zero déchets, les histoires et les portraits des habitants du monde entier ...

- une cartographie des hébergements responsables, des adresses de tourisme communautaire basés partout dans le monde, pour vous aider à choisir les professionnels du tourisme à contacter pour votre prochain voyage en solo / en couple, vacances en famille, voyage d'amis ...

- un documentaire web interactif où je rassemblerai des photographies, des vidéos, des sons et des interviews; ce sera comme si vous étiez avec moi dans ce voyage (créé avec Klynt App / klynt.net)

Découvrez le potentiel de l'application Klynt ici: https://player.vimeo.com/video/59979665

Pourquoi ce projet? Pourquoi maintenant?

 

Comme beaucoup d'autres, j'ai décidé que 2017 sera l'année de grands changements dans ma vie! Après une grande expérience l'été dernier en Malaisie et à Singapour, j'ai décidé de prendre un peu de temps pour explorer les merveilles du monde et j'ai acheté un billet tour du monde.

Même si j'ai vraiment apprécié ce voyage, j'ai, d'une certaine façon, senti d'être rentrée peu en  contact avec les locaux, c'est pourquoi j'ai commencé à chercher comment je pouvais maximiser l'impact positif de mon voyage et minimiser celui négatif. 

J'ai trouvé beaucoup de sites internet sur le tourisme communautaire, les voyages responsables et ainsi de suite. Mais les sources étaient multiples, alors j'ai pensé: peut-être pourrait-il être utile de rassembler toutes les informations disponibles sur le net dans un seul espace et d'ajouter les histoires des femmes et des hommes qui pourraient bénéficier véritablement du tourisme responsable ?

Enfin, l'Organisation des Nations Unies a désigné 2017 comme l'Année internationale du Tourisme Durable pour le Développement, démontrant que le tourisme peut être une véritable mesure d'autonomisation des communautés locales et de lutte contre la pauvreté et l'exclusion sociale, favorisant la compréhension interculturelle et la solidarité mutuelle entre les peuples.

Le but du blogzine est de simplement montrer que, de près ou de loin, n'importe qui peut et doit être un(e) voyageur(euse) et un(e) citoyen(ne) responsable juste en faisant des choix conscients.

 

Pourquoi ai-je besoin d'IndieGoGo?

Et voilà où vous pouvez m'aider!

Bien sûr, même si j'ai déjà couvert une grande partie des coûts pour le projet, j'ai encore besoin de votre aide pour obtenir mon compagnon d'aventures: je devrais mettre à jour mon appareil photo actuel et en acheter un nouveau léger, discret et assez performant pour capturer toutes les histoires les plus inspirantes ! De plus, je devrai payer la licence pour utiliser l'application Klynt et le pack Adobe Creative pour les photographes (qui comprend Photoshop et Lightroom).

Une partie de mon budget doit couvrir les productions des contreparties, les frais d’Indiegogo et les frais bancaires.

 

Les fonds recueillis dans le cadre de cette campagne permettront:

  • d'acheter l’appareil photo (2200 €)
  • d'acheter le pack Adobe Creative Cloud pour les photographes (144 €)
  • d'acheter la licence Klynt App (499 €)
  • de livrer vos contreparties (+/- 500 €)
  • de couvrir le coûts de campagne (Indiegogo et frais de carte de crédit) (+/- 175 €)

Principaux arrêts de mon tour du monde:

- Mexique / Péninsule du Yucatan (Avril-Mai)

- Guatemala (Mai)

- Costa Rica (Mai-Juin)

- Colombie (Juin)

- Équateur (Juin)

- Chili (Juillet)

- Argentine (Juillet-Août)

- Australie (Août-Octobre)

- Indonésie (Octobre)

- Cambodge (Octobre-Novembre)

- Vietnam (Novembre-Décembre)

- Laos (Décembre)

- Myanmar (Décembre-Janvier)

Le voyage a déjà commencé: suivez les mises à jour sur les réseaux sociaux :

- Compte Instagram personnel: https://www.instagram.com/florence_3f

Après le tour du monde, qu'arrivera-t-il?

Une fois rentrée en France, je travaillerai à partir de fin Janvier 2018 à la création de la plateforme interactive avec l'appli Klynt, à l'édition de toutes les bonnes photos et à la réalisation des vidéos... Je serai également heureuse de participer à des événements à Paris avec d'autres voyageurs passionnés.

- Mai: envoi premières contreparties digitales

- Jusqu'à fin Janvier: en voyage/ envoi contreparties digitales

- à partir de Février : travail sur le documentaire web/ envoi des autres contreparties

€ 5 Carte de remerciement / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Je vous dirai également un “énorme merci” sur la page Facebook du blogzine et vous recevrez une carte de remerciement digitale avec une de mes photos réalisées au cours de mon voyage.

€ 15 Pack Antigua / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous recevrez un message sur la page Facebook du blogzine et vous recevrez une carte postale personnalisée 10x15cm (avec une des mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres.

€ 25 Pack Valparaiso / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous recevrez un message sur la page Facebook du blogzine et vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres.

€ 50 Pack Sydney / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous serez mentionnés sur le documentaire interactif créé avec Klynt App, vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres et un petit sac à vrac 26gr. en coton biologique réutilisable créé par Mamie Colette (dimensions /  largeur 23,5 cm / hauteur 20,5 cm).

€ 100 Pack Bali / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous serez mentionnés sur le documentaire interactif créé avec Klynt App, vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres, un sac bento petit modèle créé en France et un tirage* photo 20x30cm exclusif à cette campagne.

€ 200 Pack Hanoi / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous serez mentionnés sur le documentaire interactif créé avec Klynt App, vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres, un lot de 12 mouchoirs réutilisables en popeline de la marque Mamie Colette modèle "Pop & Duck" et deux tirages* photo 20x30cm exclusifs à cette campagne.

€ 300 Pack Yangon / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous recevrez le pack Hanoi et 2 heures de formation sur la création d'un blog de A à Z (formation à Paris ou par conférence Skype).

* Les tirages seront produits professionnellement et soigneusement une fois rentrée en France.

Les personnes habitant Paris pourront aussi choisir de récupérer les contreparties en main propre: une belle occasion pour moi de vous saluer en personne !

 

D'autres façons dont vous pouvez m’aider

 

Si vous n'êtes pas intéressé(e)s par aucune des contreparties ou je n’ai pas réussi à vous convaincre de me suivre dans ce projet,  vous pouvez toujours m’aider de différentes manières !

  • Faire un don ! Si vous souhaitez me soutenir sans contrepartie, vous pouvez le faire aussi ! Il suffit de cliquer sur «Back it» et vous pouvez choisir le montant que vous souhaitez.
  • Diffuser l'intérêt pour la photographie et le voyage responsable ! Je suis sûre que vous connaissez un ami qui connaît un ami (LOL !!!) qui serait intéressé à soutenir ce projet. Parlez leur de cette campagne et demandez leur de soutenir le projet !
  • Poster sur le projet ! Sur Instagram, sur Facebook, sur votre site web, dans les commentaires de votre site de voyage préféré - partagez cette page et faites savoir que ce projet existe.
  • Parler du projet ! Si vous avez un podcast de voyage, j’adorerais que vous parliez du projet et que vous le partagiez avec vos auditeurs !

  • Connaissez-vous des associations locales, des réseaux de tourisme communautaire, des blogueurs ou des personnes créatives dans un ou plusieurs des pays que je visite, n'hésitez pas à partager votre carnet d'adresses avec moi ! Il me sera très utile !!!

  • Partager, partager, partager. En cas de doute, partagez encore une fois !

Merci d'avance pour toute votre aide et votre encouragement !

Pour répondre à la question de l’utilisation des fonds, tout jusqu'à 3500€ sera utilisé pour couvrir les coûts mentionnés ci-dessus.

Alors, que se passe-t-il si je ne touche pas l'objectif ?

Et si je le dépasse ?

 

L'objectif est de 3500€. Chaque petit geste compte ! Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, je prévois de mettre tout ce qui aura été récolté entièrement au profit de ce projet. Je crois sincèrement pouvoir créer quelque chose d'inspirant pour les voyageurs responsables de demain et je continuerai à le faire de la façon dont je peux.

Il y a des chances pour que vous connaissiez des personnes qui aiment la photographie et l’idée de partage et de connexion étroite avec les communautés locales en voyageant, et qui seraient à la recherche d’un blog comme celui-ci.

Si l'objectif est atteint, alors bien sûr give me five! Continuez à suivre le projet et à prendre part à l’aventure!

Si je peux atteindre plus de 3500€, alors je vais:

  • Acheter un disque dur externe supplémentaire afin de mieux sécuriser tout le travail et un chargeur portable supplémentaire
  • Payer un vidéo-maker professionnel pour créer un web-documentaire encore meilleur
  • Penser à créer un photozine avec mes meilleurs photos ou à organiser une exposition de photographies (un autre de mes rêves !).

Que ce soit financier ou moral, votre soutien c'est très important pour moi !

Restons en contact !

Si vous avez une question au sujet du projet et que vous souhaitez me contacter, n'hésitez pas à:

  • me laisser un commentaire sur IndieGoGo
  • me contacter directement à: hello@florenceoutloud.com.
  • m’envoyer un message sur https://www.facebook.com/FlorenceOutLoud/
 

Merci !
story_txt:
// Descrizione del progetto in italiano più sotto //
// Présentation détaillée du projet en français ci-dessous après la version italienne //
 
Who am I?
My name is Florence, half Italian, half Nigerian, born and raised in Florence, Italy. For the past five years I have been living in Paris. Before settling down in France, I have visited 20 countries between 2004 and 2011. I am the editor and photographer behind Florence Out Loud blogzine-to-be ;)




In a nutshell, Florence Out Loud is:
- a blogzine, where you will find different categories of articles of interest: photography, video, storytelling,.... Why have we to choose, right? It is a multi-faceted space where you can find articles about responsible travelling, ecotourism, conscious lifestyle, free-plastic life reflections, stories and portraits from all around the world…
- a mapping of existing eco, responsible accommodations, travel operators and community-based tourism addresses all around the world, to help you choose the tourism professionals to contact for your next solo/couple travel, family vacation, friends trip, and so on…
- an interactive web-documentary where I will gather photographs, videos, sounds and interviews like you were with me in the journey  (created with Klynt App/ klynt.net)
Discover the potential of Klynt application here:  https://player.vimeo.com/video/59979665

Why this project? Why now?
Like many others I decided that 2017 will be the year of great changes in my life and I committed myself to start living my life on my own terms!
After a great experience last summer in Malaysia and Singapore, I decided to take some time to explore the other world’s wonders and bought a Round-The-World ticket.
Even if I really appreciated that trip, I somehow feel that I missed a bit the contact with local people. That’s why I started to search how to maximize the positive impact and minimize the negative one of travelling!
 I came across a lot of websites about community-based tourism, responsible travel and so on but sources were multiple. I therefore thought that maybe it coul be useful to assemble all information available on the net in one space, adding stories from people who obtained benefits from responsible travelling. 
Last but not least, United Nations has designated 2017 as International Year of Sustainable Tourism for Development, proving that tourism can be a real measure of empowerment for local communities able to fight poverty and social exclusion, fostering cross-cultural understanding and mutual solidarity among people. 

The purpose of the blogzine is simply to show that, near or far, anyone can and should be a responsible traveller and citizen capable of making conscious choices.

Why do I need IndieGoGo?
And here is where you can help me out!
Of course, while I have already have covered many of the costs for the project, I still need your help to get my companion of adventures: I would need to update my photo gear buying a new camera, light, discreet and performing enough, to better capture all inspiring stories! Moreover I will need to pay the license to use the Klynt App and the Adobe Creative pack for photographers (including Photoshop and Lightroom).
A part of my budget has to cover the productions of the perks + Indiegogo fee and bank charges. 


Funds raised as a part of this campaign will cover:

Purchasing the camera (2200€)
Purchasing the Adobe Creative Cloud for photographers (144€)
Purchasing the Klynt App license (499€)
Perks shipping and distribution (+/-500€)
Campaign costs (Indiegogo fees and credit card fees) (+/-175€)


Key Stops of my Round-The-World journey:
- Mexico/ Yucatan peninsula (April-May)
- Guatemala (May)
- Costa Rica (May-June)
- Colombia (June)
- Ecuador (June)
- Chile (July)
- Argentina (July-August)
- Australia (August-October)
- Indonesia (October)
- Cambodia (October-November)
- Vietnam (November-December)
- Laos (December)
- Myanmar (December- January)

 

The journey already started! Follow along via social networks:
- Facebook page of the blogzine: https://www.facebook.com/FlorenceOutLoud/
- Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/florence_3f
 
After the Round-The-World, what will happen?
Once at home, I will spend the end of January and February 2018, creating the interactive platform via Klynt App, editing all good pictures and making videos… I will also be pleased to attend informal meetings and events with interested fellow travellers in Paris.
Timeline of the project
- March/April : start of Indiegogo campaign
- May : sending first digital rewards
- 'till January : travelling / sending digital rewards
- from February on :  working on web documentary / sending all other rewards




I want you to be part of this! I couldn’t have imagined all of this some months ago, so… I want to thank you in my own way for your kind donations and support:
€1 Shout Out / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! Your contribution will help me promote #FlorenceOutLoud. I will also give you a thank you shout out on the Facebook page of the blogzine. Please share the campaign link on your social networks.
€5 Thank you card / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! You will get a shout out on the Facebook page of the blogzine and you will be sent an awesome digital thank you card with a photograph of mine sometime during my journey.
€15 Pack Antigua / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! You will get a shout out on the Facebook page of the blogzine and you will be sent a customized (with a photograph of mine) postcard 10x15cm straight to your mailbox sometime during my journey.
 €25 Pack Valparaiso / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! You will get a shout out on the Facebook page of the blogzine and you will be sent two customized (with photographs of mine) postcards 10x15cm straight to your mailbox sometime during my journey.
 €50 Pack Sydney / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! You will be acknowledged on the blogzine interactive documentary created with Klynt App, you will be sent two customized (with photographs of mine) postcards 10x15cm straight to your mailbox sometime during my journey and a reusable organic cotton bulk bag "French bulldog" 26gr. by Mamie Colette, made in France (Dimensions /  width 23,5 cm / height 20,5 cm).
 €100 Pack Bali / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! You will be acknowledged on the blogzine interactive documentary created with Klynt App, you will be sent two customized (with photographs of mine) postcards 10x15cm straight to your mailbox sometime during my journey and a reusable small size bento organic cotton bag and one 20x30cm print* exclusive to this campaign.
 €200 Pack Hanoi / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! You will be acknowledged on the blogzine interactive documentary created with Klynt App, you will be sent two customized (with photographs of mine) postcards 10x15cm straight to your mailbox sometime during my journey, poplin handkerchief "Pop & Duck" by Mamie Colette (pack of 12) and two 20x30cm prints* exclusive to this campaign.
 €300 Pack Yangon / Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project! You will get the Pack Hanoi and 2-hours training on how I set up my blog from A to Z (training in Paris or by conference call).
*Prints will be professionally and carefully produced once I return to France.
People living in PARIS: you can choose to receive your rewards in person, a nice opportunity to meet each other!

 
Other ways you can help
If you are not interested in any of the rewards and I couldn't convince you to give it a try until now, there are still a few ways you can help me!


Donate! If you'd like to support me without claiming a reward, you can do that as well! Simply click on "Back it" and you can put in any amount you'd like to donate. 

Spread the love for photography and responsible travel! I am sure you know a friend that knows a friend of friends (LOL!!!) that you think would be interested in supporting this project. Forward them this website, tell them all about me and ask them to back the project! 

Post about it! On Instagram, on Facebook, on your website, in the comments of your favourite travel website - share this page and let people know that this project exists and I need your help. 

Talk about the project! If you have a travel podcast, I'd LOVE it if you talked about the project and shared the love with your followers!
If you know local associations, community-based tourism networks, bloggers or creative people in one or more of the countries I visit, please share your address book with me!


Share, share, share. If in doubt, share once more.

Thank you in advance for all of your help and encouragement! 
To address the elephant in the room - yes, there is no compensation for me in here. Everything up to 3500€ will be used to cover the costs mentioned above.
So, what happens in case I don't hit the funding goal?
What if I surpass the target? 
The target is 3500€. Every little bit helps! If the goal is not reached, I plan however to take whatever is raised and put it towards advancing the project because I believe wholeheartedly in creating something inspiring for  responsible travelers of tomorrow and will continue to do that in whatever way I can.
It is possible you have chances of knowing someone who loves photography and the idea of deep connection with local communities when traveling and might be looking for something exactly like this.
If we reach our objective of course it's high-fives all around! Follow along, and become a part of the journey!
If I can raise more than 3500€, then I will:

Buy an additional external hard disk in order to secure more all the work and an additional portable charger
Pay a professional video-maker to create an even better web-documentary
Think about creating a photozine with my best shots or about holding a photography exhibition (another dream of mine!).

Whether it is financial or moral, your support means the world to me!
Connect With Me
If you have a question about the project and would like to get in touch, feel free

to leave me a comment on IndieGoGo 
contact me directly: hello@florenceoutloud.com.
send me a message on https://www.facebook.com/FlorenceOutLoud



Thank you!
--------------------------------------------------------------------
ITALIANO
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Mi chiamo Florence, nata e cresciuta nella bellissima Firenze. Vivo a Parigi da cinque anni; prima di stabilirmi in Francia, ho visitato 20 paesi tra il 2004 e il 2011.Sono la redattrice e la fotografa del blog FlorenceOutLoud.com che sarà lanciato prestissimo !

 
Cosa è FlorenceOutLoud.com?
In poche parole, Florence Out Loud è: - un blogzine (un misto tra il blog e la rivista online), dove troverete diverse categorie che potrebbero interessarvi: fotografia, video, narrazione (storytelling).... Perché dovreste visitare il blog? È un spazio sfaccettato dove trovare articoli sul viaggio responsabile, sull’ ecoturismo, su un modo di vita più consapevole, riflessioni su uno stile di vita libero dalla plastica e senza rifiuti, storie e ritratti di persone da tutto il mondo;
- una mappatura delle strutture ricettive eco-responsabili esistenti, degli operatori turistici e degli indirizzi di turismo comunitario, per aiutarvi a scegliere i professionisti del turismo da contattare per il vostro prossimo viaggio in solitario / in coppia, la vostra prossima vacanza con la  famiglia o con gli amici, e così via...- un web-documentario interattivo dove raggrupperò fotografie, video, suoni ed interviste come se foste in viaggio con me (lo creerò con l’applicazione Klynt / klynt.net)
Scoprite tutte le potenzialità  di Klynt qui: https://player.vimeo.com/video/59979665

Perché questo progetto? Perché ora?
Come molte altre persone ho deciso che il 2017 sarebbe stato l'anno dei grandi cambiamenti nella mia vita, che voglio vivere secondo le mie regole!
Dopo una grande esperienza la scorsa estate in Malesia e a Singapore, ho deciso di prendere un po 'di tempo per esplorare le meraviglie del mondo e ho comprato un biglietto aereo per fare il giro del mondo.
Anche se ho apprezzato quel viaggio, in qualche modo ho sentito la mancanza di un contatto più lungo con la popolazione locale,così che ho iniziato a cercare su internet come fare esperienze migliori nei viaggi!
Mi sono imbattuta in un sacco di siti web sul turismo comunitario, sul  turismo responsabile e così via. Ma le fonti erano molteplici, così ho pensato: forse potrebbe essere utile raggruppare tutte le informazioni su internet in un unico spazio e aggiungervi le storie di tutti quegli uomini e quelle donne che hanno avuto benefici dal turismo responsabile?
Un ultimo punto ma non meno importante, le Nazioni Unite hanno designato il 2017 come l’Anno Internazionale del turismo sostenibile per lo sviluppo, dimostrando che il turismo può essere una vera misura di « empowerment » per le comunità locali e per la lotta contro la povertà e l'esclusione sociale, uno strumento di promozione della diversità culturale e di solidarietà reciproca tra i popoli.

Lo scopo del mio blog è quello di mostrare semplicemente che, vicino o lontano, chiunque può e deve essere un viaggiatore e un cittadino responsabile  semplicemente facendo scelte consapevoli.

Perché ho bisogno di IndieGoGo?
E qui tocca  a voi!
Naturalmente, ho già coperto molti dei costi per realizzare il mio viaggio, ma ho ancora bisogno del vostro aiuto per acquistare il mio compagno di viaggio: una macchina fotografica leggera, discreta e performante, per catturare le storie più stimolanti e i momenti migliori della mia avventura! Inoltre ho bisogno di pagare la licenza per utilizzare l'applicazione Klynt e il pacchetto creativo di Adobe per i fotografi (che include Photoshop e Lightroom).
Una parte del mio budget deve coprire la creazione delle ricompense e delle commissioni Indiegogo.
Dettaglio dei costi

I fondi raccolti per questa campagna copriranno:
• l'acquisto della fotocamera (2200€)
• l'acquisto di Adobe Creative Cloud per i fotografi (144€)
• l'acquisto della licenza dell’ applicazione Klynt (499€)
• la distribuzione delle ricompense (+/-500€)
• i costi della campagna (tasse di IndieGoGo e commissioni carta di credito) (+/-175€)

Tappe del mio giro del mondo
 - Messico/ Penisola Yucatan (Aprile-Maggio)
- Guatemala (Maggio)
- Costa Rica (Maggio-Giugno)
- Colombia (Giugno)
- Ecuador (Giugno)
- Cile (Luglio)
- Argentina (Luglio-Agosto)
- Australia (Agosto-Ottobre)
- Indonesia (Ottobre)
- Cambogia (Ottobre-Novembre)
- Vietnam (Novembre-Dicembre)
- Laos (Dicembre)
- Birmania (Dicembre- Gennaio)

Il viaggio è già iniziato: seguite gli aggiornamenti attraverso i social network!
- Pagina Facebook del blog: https://www.facebook.com/FlorenceOutLoud
- Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/florence_3f
Che cosa accadrà dopo il giro del mondo?
Una volta rientrata, passerò i mesi di gennaio e febbraio 2018, a creare la piattaforma interattiva attraverso l’applicazione Klynt, a ritoccare le foto e a montare i video... inoltre sarò contenta di partecipare a Parigi ad eventi dove scambiare esperienze di viaggio con altri appassionati. 
Cronologia del progetto
- Marzo/Aprile: campagna IndieGoGo
- Maggio: invio prime ricompense digitali
- Fino a Gennaio: in viaggio/ Invio ricompense digitali
- a partire da Febbraio : lavoro su documentario web/ invio di tutte le altre ricompense

 
Ricompense per il vostro contributo

Non avrei potuto immaginare tutto questo alcuni mesi fa, quindi... dal profondo del mio cuore, voglio ringraziarvi a modo mio per le vostre donazioni e per il vostro supporto :
€1 Shout Out / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Questo contributo mi aiuterà a promuovere #FlorenceOutLoud. Vi ringrazierò sulla pagina Facebook del blog. Per favore, condividete il link della campagna sui social network.
€ 5 Carta di ringraziamento / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Vi ringrazierò sulla pagina Facebook del blog e riceverete un biglietto di ringraziamento digitale con una mia fotografia scattata durante il mio viaggio.
€ 15 Pacco Antigua / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Vi ringrazierò sulla pagina Facebook del blog e riceverete una mia fotografia (sotto forma di cartolina 10x15cm ) direttamente al vostro indirizzo di casa.
€ 25 Pacco Valparaiso / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Vi ringrazierò sulla pagina Facebook del blog e riceverete due mie fotografie personalizzate (sotto forma di cartolina 10x15cm) direttamente al vostro indirizzo di casa.
€ 50 Pacco Sydney / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Vi ringrazierò sul documentario interattivo creato con Klynt App. e riceverete due mie fotografie personalizzate (sotto forma di cartolina 10x15cm ) direttamente al vostro indirizzo di casa e un sacchetto 26gr. riutilizzabile in cotone biologico della marca Mamie Colette, fabbricato in Francia (dimensioni /  larghezza 23,5 cm / altezza 20,5 cm).
100 € Pacco Bali / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Vi ringrazierò sul documentario interattivo creato con Klynt App. e riceverete due mie fotografie personalizzate (sotto forma di cartolina 10x15cm ) direttamente al vostro indirizzo di casa, una borsa riutilizzabile stile bento in cotone biologico fabbricato in Francia e una stampa* 20x30 esclusiva per questa campagna.
200 € Pacco Hanoi / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Vi ringrazierò sul documentario interattivo creato con Klynt App. e riceverete due mie fotografie personalizzate (sotto forma di cartolina 10x15cm ) direttamente al vostro indirizzo di casa, un set di 12 fazzoletti riutilizzabili in popeline della marca Mamie Colette modello "Pop & Duck" e due stampe* 20x30cm esclusive per questa campagna.
300 € Pacco Yangon / Grazie mille per aver trovato il tempo per sostenere questo progetto! Riceverete il Pacco Hanoi e 2 ore di formazione su come ho creato il mio blog dalla A alla Z (formazione a Parigi o via conferenza Skype).
* Le stampe saranno realizzate professionalmente e con cura una volta rientrata  in Francia
Per coloro che abitano a Parigi: avete la possibilità di scegliere di ricevere le vostre ricompense a mano, una bella occasione di incontrarci in persona!


 
Altri modi per aiutarmi
Se non siete interessati a una qualsiasi delle ricompense o non sono riuscita fino ad ora a  convincervi a fare una donazione, ci sarebbero altri modi per aiutarmi!
• Donate! Se volete sostenere il progetto senza ricevere una ricompensa, potete farlo cliccando su "Back it" e scegliere la somma della vostra donazione.
• Condividete! Sono sicura che conoscete un amico che conosce un amico e cosi via, che potrebbe essere interessato a sostenere questo progetto. Trasmettete loro il link della campagna, parlate del progetto e chiedete di sostenerlo!
• Condividete il progetto! Su Instagram, su Facebook, sul vostro sito web, nei commenti del vostro sito di viaggio preferito - Condividete il link della campagna e fate sapere che questo progetto esiste e che ho bisogno dell' aiuto di tutti. 
• Parlate del progetto! Se avete un podcast di viaggio, sarebbe importante parlare del progetto e condividere l’interesse per il viaggio responsabile con i vostri ascoltatori!
• Conoscete delle associazioni locali, delle reti di turismo comunitario, dei blogger o delle persone creative nei paesi che visiterò? Se si',  condividete la vostra rubrica con me, mi sarà utile!
• Condividete, condividete, condividete. In caso di dubbio, condividete una volta di più.
Grazie in anticipo per tutto il vostro aiuto e incoraggiamento!
Per affrontare la questione dell’utilizzazione dei fondi : tutto fino a 3500€ verrà utilizzato per coprire i costi di cui sopra.
Quindi, cosa succede nel caso in cui non riesco a raggiungere l'obiettivo di finanziamento?
Cosa succede se supero l'obiettivo? 
L'obiettivo è di 3500€. Ogni piccolo aiuto conta! Se l'obiettivo non viene raggiunto, ho intenzione di prendere tutto ciò che è stato raccolto e riversarlo per continuare il progetto. Credo con tutto il cuore nella creazione di qualcosa di stimolante per i viaggiatori responsabili di domani e continuerò a farlo in qualunque modo possibile.
È probabile che conoscete qualcuno che ama la fotografia e viaggiare in maniera più profonda  e potrebbe essere alla ricerca di qualcosa esattamente come questo.
Se l'obiettivo è raggiunto, naturalmente, give me five! (datemi il cinque!). Continuate a seguire il progetto, e diventatene una parte importante!
Se riesco a raccogliere più di 3500 €, allora ecco cosa farò:
• acquistare un disco rigido esterno aggiuntivo (per salvare ancora meglio tutto il lavoro) e una batteria aggiuntiva
• assumere un realizzatore video professionista per creare un web-documentario ancora migliore
• pensare a creare un libro fotografico con i miei migliori scatti o organizzare una mostra fotografica (un altro mio sogno!).
Sia finanziario che morale, il vostro supporto significa molto per me!
Restiamo in contatto!
Se avete  una domanda sul progetto e volete contattarmi, non esitate a

lasciare un commento su IndieGoGo  
contattarmi direttamente a: hello@florenceoutloud.com
scrivermi un messaggio sulla pagina Facebook del progetto: https://www.facebook.com/FlorenceOutLoud/


Grazie!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
FRANCAIS
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Qui suis-je? Je m'appelle Florence, moitié italienne, moitié nigériane, née à Florence, en Italie. Je vis à Paris depuis cinq ans. Avant de m'installer en France, j'ai visité 20 pays entre 2004 et 2011. Je suis l'écrivain et la photographe derrière le blogzine FlorenceOutLoud.com que sera lancé très prochainement ;)


 
Qu’est-ce Florence Out Loud ? En un mot, Florence Out Loud est:
- un blogzine, où vous trouverez différentes catégories qui pourraient vous intéresser: la photographie, la vidéo,  le récit de voyage, .... Pourquoi avons-nous à choisir, non? C'est un espace à multiples facettes où vous trouverez également des articles sur le voyage responsable, l'écotourisme, des réflexions sur une vie zero déchets, les histoires et les portraits des habitants du monde entier ...
- une cartographie des hébergements responsables, des adresses de tourisme communautaire basés partout dans le monde, pour vous aider à choisir les professionnels du tourisme à contacter pour votre prochain voyage en solo / en couple, vacances en famille, voyage d'amis ...
- un documentaire web interactif où je rassemblerai des photographies, des vidéos, des sons et des interviews; ce sera comme si vous étiez avec moi dans ce voyage (créé avec Klynt App / klynt.net)
Découvrez le potentiel de l'application Klynt ici: https://player.vimeo.com/video/59979665

Pourquoi ce projet? Pourquoi maintenant? Comme beaucoup d'autres, j'ai décidé que 2017 sera l'année de grands changements dans ma vie! Après une grande expérience l'été dernier en Malaisie et à Singapour, j'ai décidé de prendre un peu de temps pour explorer les merveilles du monde et j'ai acheté un billet tour du monde.
Même si j'ai vraiment apprécié ce voyage, j'ai, d'une certaine façon, senti d'être rentrée peu en  contact avec les locaux, c'est pourquoi j'ai commencé à chercher comment je pouvais maximiser l'impact positif de mon voyage et minimiser celui négatif. 
J'ai trouvé beaucoup de sites internet sur le tourisme communautaire, les voyages responsables et ainsi de suite. Mais les sources étaient multiples, alors j'ai pensé: peut-être pourrait-il être utile de rassembler toutes les informations disponibles sur le net dans un seul espace et d'ajouter les histoires des femmes et des hommes qui pourraient bénéficier véritablement du tourisme responsable ?
Enfin, l'Organisation des Nations Unies a désigné 2017 comme l'Année internationale du Tourisme Durable pour le Développement, démontrant que le tourisme peut être une véritable mesure d'autonomisation des communautés locales et de lutte contre la pauvreté et l'exclusion sociale, favorisant la compréhension interculturelle et la solidarité mutuelle entre les peuples.

Le but du blogzine est de simplement montrer que, de près ou de loin, n'importe qui peut et doit être un(e) voyageur(euse) et un(e) citoyen(ne) responsable juste en faisant des choix conscients.

 
Pourquoi ai-je besoin d'IndieGoGo?
Et voilà où vous pouvez m'aider!
Bien sûr, même si j'ai déjà couvert une grande partie des coûts pour le projet, j'ai encore besoin de votre aide pour obtenir mon compagnon d'aventures: je devrais mettre à jour mon appareil photo actuel et en acheter un nouveau léger, discret et assez performant pour capturer toutes les histoires les plus inspirantes ! De plus, je devrai payer la licence pour utiliser l'application Klynt et le pack Adobe Creative pour les photographes (qui comprend Photoshop et Lightroom).
Une partie de mon budget doit couvrir les productions des contreparties, les frais d’Indiegogo et les frais bancaires.


 
Les fonds recueillis dans le cadre de cette campagne permettront:

d'acheter l’appareil photo (2200 €)
d'acheter le pack Adobe Creative Cloud pour les photographes (144 €)
d'acheter la licence Klynt App (499 €)
de livrer vos contreparties (+/- 500 €)
de couvrir le coûts de campagne (Indiegogo et frais de carte de crédit) (+/- 175 €)


Principaux arrêts de mon tour du monde:
- Mexique / Péninsule du Yucatan (Avril-Mai)
- Guatemala (Mai)
- Costa Rica (Mai-Juin)
- Colombie (Juin)
- Équateur (Juin)
- Chili (Juillet)
- Argentine (Juillet-Août)
- Australie (Août-Octobre)
- Indonésie (Octobre)
- Cambodge (Octobre-Novembre)
- Vietnam (Novembre-Décembre)
- Laos (Décembre)
- Myanmar (Décembre-Janvier)

Le voyage a déjà commencé: suivez les mises à jour sur les réseaux sociaux : 
- Page Facebook du blogzine: https://www.facebook.com/FlorenceOutLoud/
- Compte Instagram personnel: https://www.instagram.com/florence_3f
Après le tour du monde, qu'arrivera-t-il?
Une fois rentrée en France, je travaillerai à partir de fin Janvier 2018 à la création de la plateforme interactive avec l'appli Klynt, à l'édition de toutes les bonnes photos et à la réalisation des vidéos... Je serai également heureuse de participer à des événements à Paris avec d'autres voyageurs passionnés.
Calendrier du projet
- Mars/Avril: campagne IndieGoGo
- Mai: envoi premières contreparties digitales
- Jusqu'à fin Janvier: en voyage/ envoi contreparties digitales
- à partir de Février : travail sur le documentaire web/ envoi des autres contreparties

 
Les contreparties

Je veux que vous fassiez partie de ceci ! Je n'aurais pas pu imaginer tout cela il y a quelques mois, donc ... pour vous remercier à ma façon pour votre don et soutien:
€ 1 Shout Out / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous contribuerez à la promotion de #FlorenceOutLoud. Je vous dirai également un “énorme merci” sur la page Facebook du blogzine. Et s’il vous plaît, n’hésitez pas à partager le lien de la campagne sur vos réseaux sociaux.
€ 5 Carte de remerciement / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Je vous dirai également un “énorme merci” sur la page Facebook du blogzine et vous recevrez une carte de remerciement digitale avec une de mes photos réalisées au cours de mon voyage.
€ 15 Pack Antigua / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous recevrez un message sur la page Facebook du blogzine et vous recevrez une carte postale personnalisée 10x15cm (avec une des mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres.
€ 25 Pack Valparaiso / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous recevrez un message sur la page Facebook du blogzine et vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres.
€ 50 Pack Sydney / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous serez mentionnés sur le documentaire interactif créé avec Klynt App, vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres et un petit sac à vrac 26gr. en coton biologique réutilisable créé par Mamie Colette (dimensions /  largeur 23,5 cm / hauteur 20,5 cm).
€ 100 Pack Bali / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous serez mentionnés sur le documentaire interactif créé avec Klynt App, vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres, un sac bento petit modèle créé en France et un tirage* photo 20x30cm exclusif à cette campagne.
€ 200 Pack Hanoi / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous serez mentionnés sur le documentaire interactif créé avec Klynt App, vous recevrez deux cartes postales personnalisées 10x15cm (avec mes photos du voyage) directement dans votre boîte aux lettres, un lot de 12 mouchoirs réutilisables en popeline de la marque Mamie Colette modèle "Pop & Duck" et deux tirages* photo 20x30cm exclusifs à cette campagne.
€ 300 Pack Yangon / Merci de prendre le temps de soutenir ce projet ! Vous recevrez le pack Hanoi et 2 heures de formation sur la création d'un blog de A à Z (formation à Paris ou par conférence Skype).
* Les tirages seront produits professionnellement et soigneusement une fois rentrée en France.
Les personnes habitant Paris pourront aussi choisir de récupérer les contreparties en main propre: une belle occasion pour moi de vous saluer en personne !


 
D'autres façons dont vous pouvez m’aider Si vous n'êtes pas intéressé(e)s par aucune des contreparties ou je n’ai pas réussi à vous convaincre de me suivre dans ce projet,  vous pouvez toujours m’aider de différentes manières !


Faire un don ! Si vous souhaitez me soutenir sans contrepartie, vous pouvez le faire aussi ! Il suffit de cliquer sur «Back it» et vous pouvez choisir le montant que vous souhaitez.

Diffuser l'intérêt pour la photographie et le voyage responsable ! Je suis sûre que vous connaissez un ami qui connaît un ami (LOL !!!) qui serait intéressé à soutenir ce projet. Parlez leur de cette campagne et demandez leur de soutenir le projet !

Poster sur le projet ! Sur Instagram, sur Facebook, sur votre site web, dans les commentaires de votre site de voyage préféré - partagez cette page et faites savoir que ce projet existe.

Parler du projet ! Si vous avez un podcast de voyage, j’adorerais que vous parliez du projet et que vous le partagiez avec vos auditeurs !
Connaissez-vous des associations locales, des réseaux de tourisme communautaire, des blogueurs ou des personnes créatives dans un ou plusieurs des pays que je visite, n'hésitez pas à partager votre carnet d'adresses avec moi ! Il me sera très utile !!!
Partager, partager, partager. En cas de doute, partagez encore une fois !

Merci d'avance pour toute votre aide et votre encouragement !
Pour répondre à la question de l’utilisation des fonds, tout jusqu'à 3500€ sera utilisé pour couvrir les coûts mentionnés ci-dessus.
Alors, que se passe-t-il si je ne touche pas l'objectif ?
Et si je le dépasse ? L'objectif est de 3500€. Chaque petit geste compte ! Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, je prévois de mettre tout ce qui aura été récolté entièrement au profit de ce projet. Je crois sincèrement pouvoir créer quelque chose d'inspirant pour les voyageurs responsables de demain et je continuerai à le faire de la façon dont je peux.
Il y a des chances pour que vous connaissiez des personnes qui aiment la photographie et l’idée de partage et de connexion étroite avec les communautés locales en voyageant, et qui seraient à la recherche d’un blog comme celui-ci.
Si l'objectif est atteint, alors bien sûr give me five! Continuez à suivre le projet et à prendre part à l’aventure!
Si je peux atteindre plus de 3500€, alors je vais:

Acheter un disque dur externe supplémentaire afin de mieux sécuriser tout le travail et un chargeur portable supplémentaire
Payer un vidéo-maker professionnel pour créer un web-documentaire encore meilleur
Penser à créer un photozine avec mes meilleurs photos ou à organiser une exposition de photographies (un autre de mes rêves !).

Que ce soit financier ou moral, votre soutien c'est très important pour moi !
Restons en contact !
Si vous avez une question au sujet du projet et que vous souhaitez me contacter, n'hésitez pas à:

me laisser un commentaire sur IndieGoGo
me contacter directement à: hello@florenceoutloud.com.
m’envoyer un message sur https://www.facebook.com/FlorenceOutLoud/

 Merci !

story:
Hi! My name Chris, and I’m starting a podcast network! Why? Because I love & believe in podcasts! A few podcasts that have meant alot to me over the years have been StartUp (by Gimlet Media), The Liturgists, WTF w/ Marc Maron, The Fantasy Footballers, Revisionist History by Malcolm Gladwell… the list goes on! 

I want to create and support the creation of more podcasts — because B.T. Harman convinced me a few years back that the world needs more stories and voices to be heard. I’ve personally grown alot by trying to understand my own voice as I’m sharing it, and I want to pursue that knowing venture more and do it alongside others! 

It started in 2017 when I decided I wanted to identify as a "creative" -- even though I'm not great at music, drawing, photography, etc. But I love podcasts, so that became my creative outlet! I jumped in and started 2 podcasts right away with some friends about two of the things I'm most passionate about -- the Church (Church Over Cofee) and podcasts (Super Meta)!

From there I started 3 others, including an internal podcast with my company for our 500+ employees (NBA Fan Podcast, West Friends, Booster Leader Podcast)! And as others around me had ideas to start their own podcasts, I loved being involved, helping however I could.

Super Team Media is the podcast network work that now officially embodies these two ideas:

1. Creating original podcasts, and 

2. Supporting independent podcasters in various ways!

 

Check out superteammedia.com for more info on each podcast!

story:
When we set out to start our business, we were the quintessential example of the entrepreneurial team most would say couldn’t succeed. So we called ourselves “Two Blind Marketers” and succeeded anyway. Our name isn’t just a name. We are actually both blind. We’re also raising a special needs child named Mandy. She is the reason we work so hard doing what we do.

Like all entrepreneurs, we face our share of challenges. One thing we have learned over the years is that community and the mutual support we get from people who not only want to see us succeed, but who have gone out of their way to help us do just that are the keys to getting anything done, regardless of what obstacles might be in our way.
That’s why we’ve come to the community today.

We know from all our research how important it is for us to maintain a strong channel of communication with our audience. We’ve learned this is true of any business, and we’ve seen how effective this kind of communication can be in so many other companies. Good communication makes us authentic. It makes us more accessible to our customers and partners. It makes us look and sound better. We want that for our company, which is why we are going to be speaking at the Podcast Movement in 2017.
Podcast Movement is the premier west coast event for anyone interested in recording, listening to or marketing with podcasting. For us, it is a first-rate opportunity for us to network with numerous experts, colleagues and even potential customers. We want to meet as many people as we can, tell them our story and show them what we’ve built together as entrepreneurs. But that’s not the only reason we’re attending this year.

We’ve been invited to speak at this year’s Podcast Movement convention!
If simply attending the show were a gold-plated opportunity for us to advance our business and do an even better job of providing for our daughter, a chance to address the entire convention attendance and tell our story is like finding a trunk full of diamonds. I believe we have a lot to offer those who attend this convention. I think our story will be inspiring to them and I believe we can use this opportunity to launch a new initiative that will grow our business far beyond our dreams. That’s why we’ve come to the community with this crowdfunding project. We’ve been given complimentary admittance to this year’s Podcast Movement convention. Now we just need to get there.

We're certain everyone reading this understands the expense and challenge of traveling. It’s even tougher when you are on your way to a potentially life-changing and business-changing event. This truly is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for us and we want to make the best of it.

We would like to invite you to join our efforts to make our appearance at this convention a reality. In exchange, we have a wide variety of fun and interesting rewards provided both by our event itinerary and our business. We want you to be a part of what we’re doing. We pledge to make you feel like you are a member of the large and growing community of people who have made our business what it is today.

Your generous contributions will help us cover the costs of airfare, lodging, travel and meals during our trip to and from the Podcast Movement 2017 event. Before, during and after the event we will be distributing the many gifts and rewards we have for our contributors. We hope you join us and we thank you for your continued support!

story:
Summary

Our team consists of four young black women driven by our passion to build community and uplift media for and by women of color. Each of us has had vastly different relationship experiences that contribute to the diversity of our content. In addition, our technical skills in content development, marketing, graphic design, operations management, and fundraising position us to build and sustain a thriving business model that will exceed most personal blogging sites. We work predominately with women of color in media including, but not limited to, photographers, videographers, writers, content producers, and digital tech experts.

What We Need 

We are working to raise $20,000 for our first year of business.

Web Hosting - $300

Our Director of Marketing is designing our website using a popular web host. To maintain the website for one year, this host requires an annual subscription payment.

Social Media Promotion - $1,800

We understand the power of social media and its ability to connect us to women beyond our personal networks. We will use social media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram to share content and engage our audience. We will utilize the promotional tools provided by each channel to reach our specified target markets.

$150 x 12 months = $1,800

Payments to Media Makers - $6,000

We work predominately with women of color in media including, but not limited to, photographers, videographers, content producers, and digital tech experts. We do not believe in asking for discounts or undercutting the services of our media partners. We want to uplift women of color by supporting their freelance businesses at their full asking price.

It is our goal to hire at least 12 women of color during our first year of business with project rates ranging from $100 - $500.

Launch Event and Workshops - $7,000

The purpose of our launch event and workshops are to raise awareness of BlackHoneyCollective.com. This will be an opportunity for us to gather media makers and influencers as well as women looking to contribute content to our site. Theses events will be planned and facilitated by our team and will feature a panel of artists and change makers from the Twin Cities.

Contingency Fund - $4,900

This fund exists to provide a safety net should any unexpected costs emerge.  

The Impact

By contributing to Black Honey Collective, you support the courageous voices of women wanting to share their stories on our emerging publication. These stories are intended to teach lessons, encourage critical conversations, and most importantly, facilitate healing and healthy practices for long lasting relationships and quality self-care. We believe that by sharing honest, culturally affirming content, we will uplift a network of women to heal themselves and one another through life experiences that usually go untold. 

Risks & Challenges

We know that we are not the first blogging site catered to women of color. We are entering a sea of personal blogs and publications. However, we stand out because we are creating a collaborative platform . The four of us at Black Honey Collective have started personal blogs in the past. We acknowledge the reward in venting our challenges through storytelling on our own digital platforms. In the same breath, we recognize the value in sharing our journey amongst a supportive group of women that identify with our struggles. Through our own planning meetings as a team, we have held conversations that have facilitated our personal healing. We look forward to meeting every week, knowing that we will be met with love and understanding and we want to expand this experience to our readers. We want women to share their stories and receive the same love and affirmation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, we encourage you to follow us on social media! We are currently on Facebook and Instagram @BlackHoneyCollective. 

Please share this campaign with your networks using the Indiegogo share tools!
