story:
RISE & SHINE was set up at the start of 2019 after my tweet offering to teach people audio gained a lot of attention. Originally it consisted of just monthly talks/panels/workshops but in the last year, we've run a festival, started writing website features and have set up a podcast promo club. Everything is free, it's about opening the doors to the audio industry for everyone regardless of income. I run everything and operate on a budget of £0. Events used to be run in Kings Place but since lockdown, it's moved into online panels and talks. I've also started offering donation tickets along with free tickets so speakers can get paid the base fee and then a cut of any donations/sales too.

Since February 2019 we have:

-Ran over 20 sessions (that's at least 48 hours of audio advice)

-Had mentions in Hot Pod, Pod Bible and Podnews

-Held a 2 day festival with 16 sessions in total

-Ran a series of sessions at London Podcast Festival

-"Sold" over 1000 free tickets

And loooooads more.

TO THE CELEBRATIONS! ? :

When coming up for a birthday plan for next year, I wanted to achieve two things-

1. Shine (hence the name innit) a light on the amazing talent within the RISE & SHINE community.

2. Bring diverse storytelling to as many ears and eyes as possible

Here's the project:

Budding audio makers will submit their ideas for a short audio piece. 

The submissions will be judged by a committee of audio professionals from across the industry.

Successful candidates will be paid to work with approved production companies for 1-2 days (in total) on 30 second to 1 minute 30 second audio pieces.

The pieces will reflect the person behind them, from the style of production to the content.

Podcasters from across the industry can then insert one (or all!) of the pieces in their show as a pre, post or mid rolls with details of the piece and the person behind it in their show notes.

I have several production companies signed up to the project so now I need to raise funds in order to make sure that I can pay the makers a decent day rate, that's where this comes in! The goal is to be able to pay a minimum of 5 makers £200 a day for two days work spread over several weeks and cover some associated fees so the minimum we need to get this project up and running is £2200. Anything over that will go towards helping more people be part of the project.

More details here
story_txt: RISE & SHINE was set up at the start of 2019 after my tweet offering to teach people audio gained a lot of attention. Originally it consisted of just monthly talks/panels/workshops but in the last year, we've run a festival, started writing website features and have set up a podcast promo club. Everything is free, it's about opening the doors to the audio industry for everyone regardless of income. I run everything and operate on a budget of £0. Events used to be run in Kings Place but since lockdown, it's moved into online panels and talks. I've also started offering donation tickets along with free tickets so speakers can get paid the base fee and then a cut of any donations/sales too.Since February 2019 we have:-Ran over 20 sessions (that's at least 48 hours of audio advice)-Had mentions in Hot Pod, Pod Bible and Podnews-Held a 2 day festival with 16 sessions in total-Ran a series of sessions at London Podcast Festival-"Sold" over 1000 free ticketsAnd loooooads more.TO THE CELEBRATIONS! ? :When coming up for a birthday plan for next year, I wanted to achieve two things-1. Shine (hence the name innit) a light on the amazing talent within the RISE & SHINE community.2. Bring diverse storytelling to as many ears and eyes as possibleHere's the project:Budding audio makers will submit their ideas for a short audio piece. The submissions will be judged by a committee of audio professionals from across the industry.Successful candidates will be paid to work with approved production companies for 1-2 days (in total) on 30 second to 1 minute 30 second audio pieces.The pieces will reflect the person behind them, from the style of production to the content.Podcasters from across the industry can then insert one (or all!) of the pieces in their show as a pre, post or mid rolls with details of the piece and the person behind it in their show notes.I have several production companies signed up to the project so now I need to raise funds in order to make sure that I can pay the makers a decent day rate, that's where this comes in! The goal is to be able to pay a minimum of 5 makers £200 a day for two days work spread over several weeks and cover some associated fees so the minimum we need to get this project up and running is £2200. Anything over that will go towards helping more people be part of the project.More details here

story:
About Me:

Hi, I'm Aura! I'm an actor and writer who has also worked In podcasting and radio for over a decade.  I'm passionate about the medium of audio to create new and exciting experiences and tell stories that don't normally make it into the mainstream. I was one of the first people to bring an independent arts and entertainment podcast to New Orleans when I launched Backstage on the Bayou back in 2009. At the time, there wasn't anything quite like it locally.  After that, I went on to contribute to special one-off projects like the Audio Filé for Nola Defender and The Sticky for Dirty Coast. I would later go on to volunteer at Clocktower Radio in New York City and consults on various other podcasts. 

In NYC, people always wanted to know what "life in the Big Easy" was like. I told them it was more like the Small Complicated. When I moved back home this spring, I realized most of our regular conversations here are about the ridiculous circumstances that happen when we're just trying to do normal things.

On each episode of the podcast, you'll hear a Small Complicated story from a local or former local New Orleanian. We keep it real and we keep it really weird. 

Our inaugural season will include 6 episodes. If people like it enough, hopefully it will become an ongoing series! 
 

Your Contributions Help Pay for:

  • New laptop
  • Audio editing software
  • USB Mixer 
  • Extra Mics, headphones, cables
  • Hosting Services
  • Print Ad(s)
  • Launch Party

What You Get: 

  • First-season contributors get early access to New content, promotions, and news
  • Invites to the VIP Launch Party & other special events
  • A chance to be on the show! 
  • Swag, TBD 

Risks & Challenges

A podcast is only as successful as the community that surrounds it. Podcasts become most successful through word-of-mouth, social media, and crossover/cross-promotion. 

  • I have a strong network of friends and colleagues from 17+ years in arts, entertainment
  • Having the right equipment will ensure I present the best quality content in a reasonable timeline.
  • Show guests will include a well-balanced mix of household names and everyday people

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have cash? That's okay!

  • Be sure to add us on Soundcloud, twitter, Instagram & facebook! Don't forget to like and share our new posts when you see them!
  • Share our IndieGogo campaign on social media! 
  • Email us about being a guest on the show, or recommending a guest you want on the show. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
It's a universal truth, known for thousands of years – each and every story happens in our mind. From the bedtime stories to the modern audio books – they are all designed to trigger our imagination. Nothing is as powerful as our imagination.

Beyond Your Eyes is the first ever real audio series platform, powered by immersive cinema sound and designed to bring the cinema surround dynamics to your headphones. It combines the magic of a film with the power of a book and it aims to provide a whole new experience to the visually impaired as well.

The idea for “audio movie” was born years ago when Dimitar - our lead sound designer, who also happens to be a dire fan of Manowar, heard the everlasting "The Warriors Prayer". It inspired him to start making different audio scenes, using immersive sound, designed for regular headphones. The tipping point of the idea though, came when our whole team attended the premiere of a movie, whose post production was done by our studio. There was this blind man at the cinema, who had decided to enjoy the magic of the film, although unable to actually see it. We didn’t know if he was comfortable or how much he enjoyed it (We hoped he did) but we said to ourselves, what if we could improve this emotion and bring it into his own house?

Now, many restless nights later, having achieved the result and seeing the reaction of everyone who listens to it we’ve decided to create a platform for the first-ever real audio series (in immersive cinema sound for headphones) that is also optimized for visually impaired.

Beyond Your Eyes will push the boundaries of your imagination one step further. It will challenge it and charge it in a way you’ve never felt before. We invite you to take a leap of faith, put your headphones on and experience the sensation for yourself with the trailer of our first audio series “Into The Dark”.  

 

All of the BYE Platform's content has been specially designed for Headphones use - in order to fully experience the following trailer, Please put your headphones on. Enjoy!

 

 

Story concept

After losing his life while saving his younger brother Will, our protagonist Stuart Brown returns as a ghost. He teams up with his brother, helping Stuart complete his divine mission of helping lost souls - ghosts trapped in this world - to find their way back to the afterlife. The story takes the two brothers on many wild and exciting adventures ranging from solving murders to journeys to exotic countries, learning new languages, and all other kinds of marvelous excitement.

Starring: Atanas Srebrev, Johnas Talkington

Screen writer: Еthаn Miсhaеl Cartеr

Music: Victor Stoyanov

Sound design: Dimitar Rusev

 

What We Need & What You Get

We truly believe that everyone who likes what we do can support us and make a difference allowing us to develop more amazing content for our platform. Reaching our goal of £64,000 will allow us to launch the “Beyond Your Eyes” platform with 4 complete and ready to be enjoyed series.

For us quality matters most! That’s why we've chosen very carefully all the products we will give you in return as a big Thank you! Our desire was to give you an unique sound experience and after testing dozens of different headphones we were extremely impressed with how our content sounds through the new REMAX TWS-3 headphones, also our t-shirts are made of the highest quality cotton, both products are tailor branded with BYE logo, so you can make the statement that you are as extraordinary as the BYE project is.

The sound design and the mix in the Pro Packages will be made in our own studio complex from professionals with extensive experience in the audio post-production.

No matter if we reach our goal or not do not be afraid for your investment – we’ve put into our perks list only products we already have and we strive to continue working on producing more and more content for all of you who believe and support us in this unique adventure! 

      

The Impact

“BYE” is not a name, chosen by chance – we want to say BYE to conventional entertainment content and say HELLO to a brand new experience that will test the limits of our fantasy. BYE is created for busy people that are keen on series and movies, but don’t have enough time for watching them. You can listen while you are commuting, jogging or working out in the Gym, you can even enjoy it while you’re doing your daily job, or during your coffee break.

We took this project very seriously, because highly ambitious goals stay behind it:

· To take the next step in the entertainment business, offering brand new consumer experience.

· To create an extraordinary product, accessible for the visually impaired as well, that combines the magic of a film with the power of a book.

 

Risks & Challenges

Yes, there are always risks & challenges with creating and delivering something pioneering. We've minimized both by having the entire process in-house. We have both a wealth of knowledge and years of experience in the TV and cinema industry. As a result of our expertise, we have completed the “proof of concept” - the prototype of our product – the first ever audio series „Into the Dark” and we’ve set the timetable step by step towards our final goal – launching the Beyond Your Eyes platform - an app-based solution for audio series that is also optimized for the visually impaired. We took this project very seriously because it will create an opportunity for the visually impaired to enjoy this new sensation and to participate in the process of its creation, showing the world their talent and creativity.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also support us by sharing our campaign with your friends.

story:
TWO FLAT-EARTHERS KIDNAP A FREEMASON: AN AUDIO DRAMA

“Two Flat-Earthers Kidnap a Freemason,” is an Audio Fiction Dark Comedy from Good Pointe Podcasts, the team behind the fiction podcasts, The Subjective Truth, and The One Stars.

Via personal sacrifices, overtime hours, and side gigs we were able to squirrel away enough money to fund our first two podcasts and we remain incredibly proud of the work we were able to create on a shoestring budget, but with that being said, in order to grow Good Pointe and to be able to compensate our Voice Actors a higher rate we’re going to need some assistance. And that’s where you can help us!

ABOUT THE PROJECT

Two Flat-Earthers Kidnap a Freemason, is a dark comedy about information, security, and freedom. We plan to deliver on exactly what the title promises. A satirical skewering of internet conspiracy culture and self-aggrandizing echo chambers. It's also a love story, a story about cats, and a story about family, but mostly its a story about how Two Flat-Earthers Kidnap a Freemason and that's only the beginning...  But with that being said, we are aware of the hateful places that these rabbit holes can sometimes lead and we want to assure everyone that we will not give voices of hate or intolerance any space in this production. 

Two Flat Earthers Kidnap a Freemason, will be a limited series consisting of 10-12 episodes. 

Casting for this project will begin sometime after the IGG Campaign is completed and our budget is set. 

WHAT ELSE HAVE YOU DONE? 

Our first podcast, The Subjective Truth, is an exploration of legacy and lineage through the lense of True Crime & High Strangeness. Despite being our first foray into the Audio Fiction landscape, The Subjective Truth has proven to be a bit of a small-breakout indie hit and is closing in on 70K downloads as it approaches the one year anniversary of the show’s premiere in October.

Our second podcast, The One Stars, is a comedic look at the absurdity of One Star Reviews from “all across the multiverse.” The series advanced to the Second Round of The Austin Film Festival Fiction Podcast Script Competition. The One Stars premiered just a few months ago on July 2, 2020.   

MEET THE TEAM

Jeremy Ellett

At the helm both writing and sound designing Two Flat Earther’s Kidnap a Freemason will be Jeremy Ellett, the head of Good Pointe Podcasts. Jeremy was also the writer and sound designer for The Subjective Truth and The One Stars. (he/him)

Danyelle Ellett

Directing the project will be Audio Fiction Voice Acting rising star, Danyelle Ellett. Danyelle directed and starred in The Subjective Truth and co-produced The One Stars. (she/her)

Bajio Alvarado

Returning as our composer will be the one and only Bajio Alvarado. If you’ve listened to The Subjective Truth then you already know the synth bangers Bajio will be bringing with him. Bajio has also composed music for video games like ShadowCore. (he/him) 

GOODIE GOODIES: Rewards

We have a variety of rewards available at different levels to thank you for your support. From Merch to Zoom Watch Parties to Enamel Pins, Autographed Scripts, and Promotional Ads on the Show. 

$5 USD - THE TAPE MEASURE
At this tier, you'll be listed as a supporter on our website! You’ll get access to an exclusive discord for the show. And the show account will follow you on Twitter and shout you out so that everyone knows you helped make this happen! 

$10 USD - THE TROWEL
At this tier, you’ll receive all the rewards from the Tape Measure levels, along with a personalized video thank you from our production team and early access to the first two episodes of the series before they hit the public feed! 

$25 USD - THE BRICKS I
At this tier, you'll receive all the rewards from the Tape Measure and Trowel levels, an exclusive sticker based upon our show art, and a ticket to a ZOOM watch party where you’ll be able to ‘enjoy’ a ‘way too long’ youtube conspiracy video with our director Danyelle.  

$25 USD - THE BRICKS II
At this exclusive tier, you'll receive all the rewards from the Tape Measure and Trowel levels, and 2 minutes of promotional AD space to promote your own creative project on Two Flat-Earthers Kidnap a Freemason! (subject to approval)

(Selecting “The Bricks II” reward tier is the only way to receive the promo ad slot. The promo ad reward is not available on any other levels or as part of any higher rewards.)

$50 USD - THE GAVEL
At this tier, you'll receive all the rewards from the Tape Measure and Trowel and The Bricks I levels, along with a limited edition Enamel Pin and a 3D Printed Collectible both based upon our show art. 

$100 USD - THE BRUSH 
At this tier, you'll receive all the rewards from the previous levels (except for the promo ad slot), along with a T-Shirt featuring our show art and an autographed copy of an episode script. 

$250 USD - THE SQUARE AND COMPASS
Wow. You get it! At this tier, you'll receive all the rewards from the previous levels (except for the promo ad slot), along with having your name listed in all of the episode credits as an Associate Producer for the series. 

What We're Hoping to Get 

Our funding goal is to raise $4000 to cover the production costs for the series. The jobs we're able to handle in-house will represent a smaller percentage than what's standard for the workload because we're not as worried as personally getting paid to make this project as much as we're hoping to be able to compensate the talented folks who collaborate with us on this series. So when you see only 15% is allotted for Writing, Editing, Sound Design, and Directing the project just know it's because those are the roles we'll be handling ourselves. 

The 4K goal will split into:

55% for Voice Actors ($2200)
15% for Reward Fulfillment and RSS Feed ($600)
15% for the Writer, Director, Sound Designer, Editor [in-house] ($600) 
10% for our Composer Bajio Alvarado ($400) 
5% for IGG Hosting Fees ($200)

If we don't reach our goal we'll still split whatever we do raise along these same percentages. If we fall FAR below our goal more will be shifted away from our personal 15% to help cover our fees and maximize the compensation we're able to offer our collaborators. 

The Impact

Is this podcast important to the world? No, there's no possible way I can justify this show as being important to the world. But it is a fun story that might have the chance to be important or entertaining to a few folks around the world, and that's all I can ever ask of my art. Especially a project with a ridiculous name like, "Two Flat-Earthers Kidnap a Freemason."

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to help us monetarily we'd still love your help with getting the word out about this project and about this fundraising campaign. Nothing moves the needle like word-of-mouth so whether it's plugging us on Twitter, telling a friend, or kidnapping someone and forcing them to watch youtube videos about our campaign until they're convinced its a good idea, we'd love your help!

story:
We need you to make the Audio Verse Awards

Since 2013, the Audio Verse Awards have worked tirelessly to bring together the Audio Fiction Community every year.

We run the AVAs out of pocket, operating at a loss, relying on unpaid volunteers to code the website, build the forms and spreadsheets, verify the validity of each submission, splice and upload the showcases episodes, and create graphics and certificates for winners. 

We are incredibly thankful for all of the support we have received, but we need you to make the awards possible.

What are the Audio Verse Awards?

The Audio Verse Awards are an annual celebration, dedicated to the greatest people and productions in immersive audio fiction around the world, whether it's an audio play, improvised, or spoken word production.

Since 2013, we have opened every September to ask the Audio Fiction community for nominations, and to vote on who should be recognized.

Every award season we:

  • Open to ask the Community for Nominations. If we receive three identical nominations from different people, it proceeds to our list of nominees.
  • Request nominees to submit an episode for our curate nominees showcase, which we assemble and release for voter consideration.
  • Craft a preferential voting ballot for the community to rank nominees.
  • Tally and verify the votes to ensure fair results.
  • Recognize the winners in each of our categories.
  • Create graphics and certificates for the winners.

Each of these tasks occupies the members of our team every year from July until the end of the awards. Every year, we are blessedly swamped by the sheer amount of enthusiasm the community displays for storytelling in audio.

Who is behind the Awards?

The Audio Drama Awards is staffed by a board currently consisting of the following members and headed by a chairperson. They act as facilitators and take a scientific approach to our data. If a member of the team chooses to vote in the awards, it has the same weight as any other vote.

Our team consists of: 

  • Landon Beall – Webmaster Landon sees value in a great story. And for him, the Audio Verse Awards are where great audio stories get the spotlight they deserve.
  • Colin J. Kelly – Chair Colin’s first love is Audio Fiction, and loves talking about it, and what makes audio great.
  • Alexandra Pal – Data Scientist Alexandra Pal can usually be found bringing cheer to anything she does, be it programming, drawing or just enjoying a good story.
  • Erin Sellars – Nominee Showcase Erin truly loves audio fiction and can’t think of a better way to express that than by helping the amazing AVA team recognize the incredible work of the community.
  • Dan Whitelaw – Graphic Design The most patient and professional graphic designer we could find, Dan is constantly improving and creating better graphics for the website, or other media things.

What We Need & What You Get

The AVAs are fully independent and autonomous. We do not run ads, nor do we charge the nominators, nominees, or voters in order to participate. In order to pay for hosting, the technical systems to ensure fair and preferential voting, not to mention compensating the people who are constantly working to make these awards are as great as they can be, we need your help.

  • Our hosting costs due to the number of visitors we receive.
  • Ranked voting and survey system to ensure fair and accurate voting.
  • Our graphic artist creates 40+ unique graphics.  
  • Our two data specialists overlook all data for accuracy and validity.
  • Our nominee showcase director communicates, assembles and schedules our podcast.
  • Our webmaster constantly fixes and optimizes our site.

Raising $1,500 would allow us to fulfill those perks, and give us funds to keep the lights on, and pay each member of the team for four months worth of work. More than that, and we might be able to pay our people a living wage for their time and effort.

Supporting the Audio Verse Awards does not affect the results of the Audio Verse Awards, outside of enabling the awards to operate. We do have these perks to thank the people who support at the following levels:

  • Any Amount, early access to our nomination form, which allows us to test our nomination automation system.
  • $5 Personal AVA Postcard
  • $10 AVA Sticker
  • $15 AVA Pin
  • $25 Personal AVA Postcard, Sticker, and Pin.
  • $40 AVA Unisex T-shirt
  • $50 Your chosen winner, which could be yourself, will receive a poster of their award certificate, thanks to you
  • $75 Your chosen winner, which could be yourself, will receive a framed poster of their award certificate, thanks to you.

And each of those is available as individual add-ons perks

We've chosen those perks at a level of support which allows us to provide you a physical reward and raise funds for our operation while factoring in factors such as international shipping. We will fulfill all rewards after the conclusion of the Indiegogo campaign.

Why are the Audio Verse Awards important?

It is hard to create art, and harder still to give it value. By asking the community to take the time and consider what art they have heard, they collectively show what art connects with them. Art is an expression of human creative skill and imagination, and art which resonates has the greatest value. We simply do our best to measure the resonance of art in stories told through audio.

We are not juried awards. The members of our committee serve as facilitators, observing the results and working to ensure the results are fair and accurate. We are content creators and listeners; members of the audio fiction community ourselves. We operate democratically under a chair to observe, reflect and change based upon the community and feedback we receive.

Now in our seventh year, we have come back and done our best to build up this community. We are incredibly thankful for the help we have received along the way. We are proud of our part in helping to recognize the greatness we have been hearing. We love finding new favorites every year.

Risks & Challenges

Every year the same challenges present themselves.

  • How do put people and productions on an even playing field with their peers?
  • What ways are we hearing audio used to create art?
  • What artistic disciplines are audible to listeners?
  • Where can we improve to recognize and reflect our community better?
  • How do we make advancing in our awards show the value of our nominees and winners?

The current awards are our solution to these questions and reflect our current philosophy.

The risk every year is that we can get this horribly wrong, that cheaters may manage to circumvent our methods, and that we could fail to reflect the community as best as we can. We are incredibly open to community feedback and change in response to the passion we find ourselves overwhelmed by every year.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to help us financially, which is why participation in these awards are free to everyone.

If you can take the time to share this, that helps us make the awards reach more listeners and creators so they can participate, in addition to helping us raise funds.

If you take the time to nominate a production, or person on a production, you help us recognize the art and artists for their work.

If you are able to vote on the ballot, each ranking you make gives a better picture of who is the greatest in immersive audio fiction.

If you find something new to listen to, please tell the show and tell us. Never forget the value of a kind word of support.

story:
Why Magic of the Mind?

The human brain is the most complex thing known to mankind. While there's still plenty of mysteries to be discovered, a multitude of fields are uncovering secrets every day. Magic of the Mind explores the science of the mind through a radical new lens: audio fantasy. 

Part 1: The Fantasy Story

Each episode follows the story of Eve, a sixteen-year-old scribe traveling the Forgotten Realms of Dungeons and Dragons in search of a place to call home. Written into the plot of each episode is a different topic in cognitive science, that is explored in detail in Part 2.

Part 2: The Interview

Released simultaneously with developments in the fantasy story are interviews with female scientists who study the topics explored in each episode. In the interviews, the writer explains the theories she wove into the narrative, and the scientists expand on what these look like in the real world.

Why is this important?

This show was created as a way to help reconnect scientists and the citizens who actually fund scientific research. We're taking a different approach than most science education and communication outlets by making a story we think people will actively engage with, and using the power of narrative to amplify the excitement of scientific discovery. Not only are we trying to show the role science can play in everyday life, we're also trying to demonstrate the true nature of science, as an approach instead of a steadfast body of knowledge. 

What does my contribution do?

On a fundamental level, your contribution expresses your support for a future where science is a dynamic process that is open to a larger number of people from a wider demographic. On a more pragmatic level, your contribution supports the people who are making this podcast possible. Between writing, editing, composing music, hiring voice actors, recording equipment, editing software, website hosting, and graphic design, it takes a village to run a show, and each person deserves to be paid for their time. 

What else can I do?

Sometimes it's easy to feel like we're creating in a vacuum. Reaching people who like what we're doing is truly why we do this! If you could share the podcast with others who you think might enjoy the show, that would make us feel truly fulfilled, like our work is really going somewhere. Any support you can give truly means the world to us, whether a donation or a kind word.

story:
Introduction - Help Us Tell the African Story

My name is Isaac Aboah, an entrepreneur based in Accra, Ghana. Over a month ago, I launched the Change Africa Podcast to bring up-close and personal conversations with the change-makers leading Africa’s transformation to people across the world. 

Change Africa podcast is a weekly 1-hour conversational style dialogue where I focus on humanizing the leaders we bring on the podcast, sharing the stories that made them; their passions, upbringing, individual journeys to self-growth, careers and the change they have made (or are making) through their work.

Through the podcast, we showcase the stories of African doers and thought-leaders across business, technology, social enterprise, non-profits, academia, and civil service.  

Already we have built a social media audience of more than 2,000 people, have launched. 

We have interviewed or have confirmed upcoming interviews with

Carl Manlan, COO Ecobank Foundation 
Elizabeth Bintliff, CEO Global Village Project 
Charles Moyela,  Board Chairman Junior Achievement Africa, 
Viola Llewelyn, CEO Ovamba Tehnologies
Efosa Ojomo, Top 50 Global Thinker, Member Harvard Admissions Board
Lucy Mbabazi, Better than Cash Alliance, UN
Acha Leke, Chairman, McKinsey Africa. 
Amaduo Gall Fall, President, Basketball Africa 
Adejoké Babington-Ashaye, Senior Counsel, QWorld Bank, International Law Expert. 
Josh Adler, VP, Africa Leadership Academy 
Cina Lawson, Minister of Posts, Digital Economy, and Technological Innovation of Togo.
Amini Kajunju, Executive Director, IUGB Foundation 

 

Why this Fundraiser

Our 3 published episodes have already been played more than 1,000 times. With such growth levels comes a demand to create a better listening experience. Until now, our episodes have been done without microphones or any professional gear. As a result, unfortunately, we have had to discard some previously recorded episodes as a result of the poor sound quality and interruptions. We want to raise this fund to build an efficient home studio as part of serving our listeners with a better overall experience. 


Items sought:

Rode NT1KIT Cardioid Condenser Microphone Package
Mackie Mix Series Mix5 5-Channel Compact Mixer
Stedman Proscreen XL Pop Filter
Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 (3rd Gen) USB Audio Interface
Audio-Technica ATH-M30x Headphones 
Gator Frameworks Book Stand
Sony A6000 Camera


About the Founder of Change Africa Podcast 

I am an action-oriented individual with a passion for tackling some of Africa’s biggest challenges. I’m currently working on launching an urban mobility startup in Ghana (ridewithvielly.com). I spent the past two years scaling entrepreneurial education programs at one for the continent’s most impactful non-profits, Junior Achievement Africa. 

I have mentored over 1,000 founders and startups in Ghana and beyond through initiatives I’ve been involved in. I also started Ghana for Startups (www.ghanaforstartups.com) an entrepreneurial community with over 300 active members in Ghana. In return, I've been selected to be part of prestigious global programs like the Young Leaders Access Program by MCW, Global Advancement Youth Leader at Michigan State University. I have also participated in and won several startup competitions including UNICEF’s Generation Unlimited, Hult Prize, amongst others. 

I have a passion for storytelling and writing with experience working as a journalist in Ghana for a year. This passion is what has culminated into the Change Africa Podcast.

For more information, you can connect with me at isaacaboah@gmail.com and through LinkedIn at
https://www.linkedin.com/in/isaac-Kojo-yedonu-aboah/


Perks: 

Donating to the fundraiser means you’re part of our Change Africa family and we would want the world to know about it. As donors, you would get: 

- Special Acknowledgements section on the podcast (“with Special Thanks to”) 
- Early access to podcast episodes 
- Join conversations as moderators in our exclusive Clubhouse room. 
- A special handwritten note mailed to you
-10 episode sponsorship for $100 donor

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond financial commitment, I'll be happy if you help share my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ChangeAfricaPodcast and tag me so you can help amplify our efforts.

You can easily share my Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy listening to the podcast. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Isaac Aboah

story:
Why sponsor D.R.E.A.M.?

Thank you for considering supporting the D.R.E.A.M. team! D.R.E.A.M. is an audio drama podcast series about a group of young adults living together while participating in a study testing the effects of virtual reality on the human body and mind. The first season is already drafted and production is underway, but we need the help of generous donors like you with funding so we can bring the episodes to you! 

We are also semifinalists and have reached the top 10 (top 2%!) in the Austin Film Festival's Fiction Podcast competition, which is an awesome accomplishment we're proud of and will hopefully help us reach a wider audience when production starts!

What Do We Need?

We are asking for $1,000 in funding to cover our expenses such as:

  • Operating our website and social media accounts
  • Music, art, and sound production 
  • Some of the sound equipment expenses

$1,000 will be enough to help us begin production on season 1, after which we hope to increase our audience and be self-sustaining. 

The Story

The D.R.E.A.M. project (Disconnected Reality Exploration and Monitoring) is an experiment designed to test the human body’s ability to withstand prolonged exposure to virtual reality environments. It is run by a company called Visillico, which currently offers augmented reality workforce training programs. They have also released augmented reality games with some success. They have recently registered an exclusive patent on a new virtual reality technology and plan to develop fully virtual training programs to replace the augmented reality ones they currently offer, but are looking into the possibility of producing virtual reality simulations and games that would last longer than the usual thirty-minute simulations used in workforce training.

 

D.R.E.A.M. researchers and representatives from their sponsors, including Whitmore Laboratories, a large pharmaceutical conglomerate, have selected four participants chosen for their eccentricities to participate in a six-month study measuring their mental and physical wellbeing after prolonged (upwards of two hours) exposure to virtual environments. The story follows those four participants and the researcher assigned to conduct interviews with them after each “dream,” or trip into the virtual realm programmed by Visillico. At first, the trips are short and relatively pleasant, but as time goes on, the dreams become more like nightmares. When sounds and images from dreams begin to leak into the real world, the subjects find themselves unable to escape their contracts and forced to continue as the line between reality and virtual reality becomes nothing but a dream itself.

Risks & Challenges

Because the first season's scripts are drafted and recording is currently underway, the risks are minimal at this time.

If we do not meet our funding goals, our actors may not be able to purchase the necessary sound equipment to make the podcast a success. This could delay production considerably. In addition, there are always risks involved in the production of any audio drama, but we have taken measures to ensure we will complete the project within 3 seasons.

Don't have money? You can still help!

It's okay if you can't contribute right now! You can help us by getting the word out. Tell your friends and family! Follow us on social media! And if you have money later and like our series, you can always become a patron of ours on Patreon. Our Hashtag is #LifesaDREAM.

You can also join our non-production Discord server here: https://discord.gg/eUpyteD The production team is not involved in this server, but you can chat with other listeners!

Because the first season's scripts are drafted and recording is currently underway, the risks are minimal at this time.
If we do not meet our funding goals, our actors may not be able to purchase the necessary sound equipment to make the podcast a success. This could delay production considerably. In addition, there are always risks involved in the production of any audio drama, but we have taken measures to ensure we will complete the project within 3 seasons.

Don't have money? You can still help!
It's okay if you can't contribute right now! You can help us by getting the word out. Tell your friends and family! Follow us on social media! And if you have money later and like our series, you can always become a patron of ours on Patreon. Our Hashtag is #LifesaDREAM.
You can also join our non-production Discord server here: https://discord.gg/eUpyteD The production team is not involved in this server, but you can chat with other listeners!

story:
Please Contribute to "The Big Gay Roadtrip" Part Deux

My Name is Scott Fullerton.  As the Producer and Host of the "Left of Str8 Show," I have been creating LIVE radio and podcasting to the LGBT Community and our Allies for almost 4 years now.  I have interviewed Celebrities, Personalities and Advocates in the areas of Entertainment, Foodies, Books, and Organizations, trying to inform, educate, and entertain my listeners and have some fun along the way.  I was the Chairman of the local Pride Center for 3 successful years and am a strong advocate of our Community.  The show was started as a hobby when I moved home to take care of my ailing dad, who has since passed away and I do the show in his honor ever since, with the small contribution he set aside for the show, while I now take care of my 80 year old mother.  

Last year I was invited to bring the show to the INNdulge Resort in Palm Springs, CA, to broadcast LIVE From the Resort for the month of August.  It was an amazing and literally HOT time had by all in the warm desert sun, getting to interview most of my favorite guests in person for the very first time, as opposed to the usual phone interviews with my guests calling in here to NE Ohio.  I have never tried to make any money for myself off my radio show and I paid all expenses last year to the Resort and back out of my own pocket.  I cannot afford to do that again this year and am asking for YOUR help.  Your contributions will assist primarily in helping me add a Third LIVE Show at the local Pride Center, where I can feature our favorite Ally and Women, who will need a separate hotel to stay in, as well as Gas Money, Lodging on the drive to the Resort in Palm Springs and back to NE Ohio, and meal and expenses while staying in Palm Springs.  I also will be trying to record the journey along the way, stopping in cities and exploring their LGBT presence and sharing it with my listeners.  I love bringing LGBT Personalities and Allies on the air and showing the strength of our Community from big cities to small.

Your contributions to the "Big Gay Roadtrip Part Deux," can make all of this happen and help me continue to live my dream of bringing exposure to our LGBT Community and the Allies that support us.  In return, I am offering some fun perks and I have some fun stretch goal perks if we make it that far.  I would really appreciate your support and would be very grateful if you could contribute and if not, if you would please share this with your friends.

What I Need & What You Get

  • Last year, I spent approximately $9,000 that included gas, lodging, meals for the 4 days and more than 2,300 miles each way, food and expenses for myself and mom in Palm Springs, and expenses for the show and guests who came to be interviewed on the show.
  • This year I am hoping to defray at least $8,000 towards the trip, and spend a little on shining a light on LGBT life in the communities I am driving thru along the way.  In return, I am trying to offer some innovative and fun perks, including from some of the Celebrities and Personalities that have been on my radio show and may be LIVE in Palm Springs.
  • If I do not make the entire amount, each dollar raised will go towards the top priorities of gas and lodging for the round trip.  Any money raised above and beyond the Goal, will go towards LGBT non-profits I will highlight along the Roadtrip or in Palm Springs.

Risks & Challenges

Who Am I?  I feel blessed, according to my stats to have approximately 10k listeners, which is okay in the podcasting arena, but not the numbers a lot of celebrities and better known personalities have listening in and following them, and not being a celebrity myself, I can only offer my best job I can do as a Radio Host to compel people to want to listen in to my shows and contribute to this campaign.  A lot of people that listen to my show, are quite honestly there to be loyal to and to follow my guests, I am just the conduit it is humbling, and I definitely realize that.  I understand that may make some people hesitant to contributing to an "unknown" person.  I just ask that you go listen to a couple shows and hope that you can get to know me a little and want to support this 'Big Gay Roadtrip.'  I promise to make the trip fun and be a careful steward of the funds you have entrusted to me.  You can listen to some of this years season of shows by going to Spotify:  https://open.spotify.com/show/4AzPnHfmjLt5ZwIVP...  or on Apple Podcasts:  https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/left-of-str...

Other Ways You Can Help

I am so glad you have read all the way to this point, because of course, a lot of people just don't have the money to contribute to someone else's dream, and I would never want you to make a donation that would be a financial burden to yourself.  There ARE non-monetary ways I would really appreciate if you may consider however...........

  • Share this campaign to others in the LGBT Community and our Allies that you have relationships with, or on your own social media.
  • Indiegogo provides ways to share this campaign right here, look for them in the top right corner above the perks!!
  • Send me a message of possible sponsors that I might want to get in touch with to see if they could contribute.
  • Start listening to the "Left of Str8 Show" and follow the show on social media.

Indiegogo provides ways to share this campaign right here, look for them in the top right corner above the perks!!
Send me a message of possible sponsors that I might want to get in touch with to see if they could contribute.
Start listening to the "Left of Str8 Show" and follow the show on social media.

story:
Our Story

If you know anything about us, it's probably A: we are best frahnds, 2: we love Disney, and lastly: we have some THOUGHTS.

In an effort to feel like artists who are actually doing something between jobs, we've toyed around with the idea of our own podcast for a while now. After too much time talking about it, we have now decided to take the plunge and just make this thing, come what may. 

So what is Poor Unfortunate Podcast? 

It is a lovingly irreverent Disney comedy podcast. It seems like there is a podcast for everything these days. But what is lacking out there is a pod that shoots the shit about Disney in the way that we proud adult Disney lovers do. We plan to cover it all, the good and the bad. Popular opinions like the majesty of the New Fantasyland expansion in Disney World, and unpopular opinions like the train-wreck of a live-action remake that folks try to call "Beauty and the Beast." Each week, we will take any particular topic from the vast array of Disney material out there and alternate ranting and raving about them (in the most fun way possible).

Hopes & Dreams

Our dream is to be invited to the media day ahead of the opening of Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge in Disney. Our more realistic goal is that we might encounter someone listening to the first five minutes of the podcast on a late night 2/3 train.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need to get this podcast off the ground. We're not in the habit of wasting time or money so we are sticking to the basics for now. It's important to us that we are supporting other artists like us so our goal is to commission original music and artwork from independent artists. More specifically, this is what your donation will go toward:

  • Microphones and Audio Equipment
  • Audio Mixing Software
  • Commissioning Original Artwork for our Logo Design 
  • Commissioning Original Theme Music
  • Building and Maintaining our Website 

Risks & Challenges

Ok, so Indiegogo wants us to put risks and challenges here that we may face but honestly we're golden. It's just smooth sailing ahead. No problems whatsoever. Except for like the fact that we've never done this before and are doing this on our own. So yeah. I guess the biggest risk is that we chicken out of doing this, but we already have the social media handles and whatnot so this would probably be a pretty safe investment on your part. :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't find a couple bucks to contribute to this campaign, WE SO GET IT! As struggling artists ourselves we can appreciate that sometimes you gotta hang onto that cash for a slice of dollar pizza as your one meal of the day. If that's you, we'd so appreciate it if you can help out in these other ways:

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign on social media! 
  • Drop us a message of support so we don't feel like idiots pursuing a hopeless dream!
  • Listen to the Podcast when it comes out and share it with all your friends!

story:
What is #JEMsGuide?

The story behind Jason Everett Miller's Guide to Being HUMAN entailed costs I willingly paid, even though it negatively impacted those closest to me in numerous ways. I'm starting this journey as my heartfelt way of saying I'm sorry. Any errors, omissions or misunderstandings of thoughts and deeds are purely on me. Mea culpa!

#JEMsGuide is a multi-year, multimedia effort first focused on an autobiography I wrote for my soon-to-be newborn son in case I got hit by a bus, and then self-published on Amazon before pulling it off that platform recently as part of divesting from their services. They still haven’t removed it all the way, so I am reconnoitering instead.

Time to finish that written conversation with my son via a more fluid and tactile medium. Time to involve other voices and experiences for a fuller picture of what it means to be human in the 21st Century.

#JEMsGuide LIVE are biweekly video podcasts streaming live on Facebook with final productions posted to Youtube a day later. Rinse and repeat until I’ve rewritten all 634 pages of the original manuscript into Jason Everett Miller's Guide to Being HUMAN, Volume I – Midnight Son. A living, breathing document freely available on the Internet, though all donations are greatly appreciated.

Part spoken word of the three chapters being published for that episode, part manifesto on the chaotic nature of humans being, and every bit irreverent social media talk show with zero fucks to give and rather large axes to grind.

#JEMsGuideLIVE airs every other Sunday at 2100, eastern, starting February 24, 2019. Second show is March 10, 2019, and so on. In between shows, I'll tape special Indiegogo supporter updates where I deliver all promised perks (some might say quirks) and continue the discussion in an unscripted form. The "Supporter Perks & Quirks" show premieres March 3 at 2100, eastern, with my mom, my first Level 4 supporter!

I look forward to continuing this journey together. Viva la Evolución!

Pebbles in the Pond

Every story has the chance to make an impact. That's where you come in. 

  • Ten years in the Navy as a broadcaster and photojournalist gives me the skills necessary to complete the mission I have laid out ahead.
  • As Earth transitions into whatever comes next, it's important for storytellers to focus their words on humanity's race toward extinction.
  • I hope to extend my creative runway by making #JEMsGuide a living, breathing entity supported by dreamers and realists alike. 

If you have a few bucks to donate and/or can share this campaign with your friends, any support you're inspired to give is greatly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone has the funds to contribute, but every piece of mindshare and support creates a zeitgeist moment. Drastic and sustainable human change is possible with enough positive energy inputs turned toward the task.

  • Please like and share my Indiegogo page with your networks wherever they are. Should be buttons near the top of the page.
  • Like and Follow our Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/jemsguide) and Twitter (https://twitter.com/jemsguide) pages.
  • Stay current with the online manuscript, non sequiturs and past video podcast episodes at https://jemsguide.com.

    Thanks so much for your love and support!

story:
Operazione Hayk

La leggenda narra che nel 2492 a.C. un mitico condottiero di nome Hayk unificò le tribù armene e le guidò in guerra contro gli invasori assiro-babilonesi comandati dal potente re Nimrod.

Gli Armeni riuscirono a sconfiggere gli eserciti nemici presso il lago di Van, e da allora quelle terre presero il nome di Hayots Dzor: la Valle degli Armeni.

A partire da quel momento nulla è stato facile per la nazione fondata da Hayk: gli Armeni dovettero affrontare 4500 anni di invasioni, massacri, genocidi e guerre, ma non si arresero mai.

Nonostante le avversità, gli Armeni prosperarono e svilupparono una cultura raffinata. Contribuirono allo sviluppo della scienza, della musica, della religione, della letteratura, del commercio e dell’arte in tutta l’Eurasia.

Oggi i figli di Hayk sono chiamati a superare una nuova sfida: il 27 settembre 2020 è riesplosa una vecchia guerra che li vede per l’ennesima volta contrapposti all’Azerbaijan.

La posta in palio di questo conflitto è un fazzoletto di terra chiamato Artsakh (ex Nagorno Karabakh), un piccolo stato etnicamente armeno che la comunità internazionale considera parte dell’Azerbaijan, ma che di fatto è sempre stato abitato dagli Armeni e che si autogoverna da quasi 30 anni.

I confini odierni dell’Artsakh vennero plasmati nel 1994 sul campo di battaglia al prezzo di 30.000 morti ed 1 milione di sfollati. La guerra vide gli Armeni trionfare sugli Azeri, ma la comunità internazionale non riuscì a negoziare efficacemente, ed i due contendenti non firmarono mai un trattato di pace definitivo.

Terminato il drammatico conflitto, gli Armeni dovettero fronteggiare una profonda crisi demografica ed economica dovuta al collasso del sistema sovietico ed alla conseguente deindustrializzazione, mentre l’economia azera iniziò a decollare grazie alle esportazioni di idrocarburi.

Sull’onda di questa pioggia di denaro, Baku si rifece il trucco: a ridosso della città vecchia spuntarono lussuosi centri commerciali ed imponenti grattacieli. Miliardi di dollari vennero riversati nello sport, nei grandi eventi, ed in qualsiasi cosa servisse a proiettare nel mondo l’immagine di un paese moderno, ricco e vincente.

La capitale azera cambiò faccia, ma presto emerse l’incongruenza tra la narrazione e la realtà: mentre gli Aliyev edificavano grattacieli scintillanti e sbandieravano i mirabolanti successi del nuovo Azerbaijan, milioni di cittadini vivevano sotto la soglia di povertà ed i livelli di produzione industriale restavano fermi dai tempi dell’URSS.

Come avviene in ogni dittatura, i soldi rimasero attaccati alle mani del presidente-padrone dell’Azerbaijan, ed al popolo rimasero solo le briciole. Presto emerse che la famiglia Aliyev si trovava al vertice di un torbido vortice corruttivo, e che spostava miliardi di dollari nei paradisi fiscali caraibici.

Il malcontento iniziò timidamente a serpeggiare tra la popolazione, ed il regime decise di affrontare il problema con metodi drastici: represse ogni forma di dissenso ed imbavagliò i media.

Fu probabilmente in questo frangente che il regime comprese la rinnovata importanza dell’irrisolto conflitto dell’Artsakh: la guerra offriva la possibilità di indirizzare le frustrazioni di milioni di cittadini verso un nemico esterno da additare a colpevole di ogni male.

Nacque così una propaganda martellante che mirava a disumanizzare gli Armeni ed insinuare un subdolo messaggio nella mente della popolazione: se non hai il pane, la colpa è degli Armeni che te l’hanno rubato. Se non hai una casa, la colpa è degli Armeni che ti hanno sottratto il Nagorno Karabakh.

Ma non basta la propaganda per fare una guerra, ed il regime lo sapeva bene. Il governo azero stanziò miliardi di dollari per rinnovare il suo arsenale bellico ed iniziò a fare shopping di aerei, elicotteri, missili a lungo raggio, droni ed artiglieria pesante in Russia, Israele, Turchia ed Italia.

L’Armenia non riuscì a tenere il passo della sfrenata corsa agli armamenti azera, ed in pochi anni i rapporti di forza tra i due eserciti si ribaltarono.

Così il 27 settembre, forte del suo grande potenziale bellico e sospinto dalle nuove ambizioni imperialiste della Turchia, l’Azerbaijan abbandonò definitivamente la strada della diplomazia e decise di concedere sfogo all’ormai incontenibile odio anti-Armeno che covava in patria.

L’esercito azero attaccò all’alba. Il fuoco dell’artiglieria iniziò a martellare incessantemente sulle postazioni nemiche e migliaia di uomini si scagliarono con forza contro le difese dell’Artsakh.

Le bombe giunsero più rapidamente delle notizie: i civili Armeni si svegliarono sotto i colpi dei droni, dei missili e dell’artiglieria azera. La capitale Stepanakert venne sventrata in pochi giorni, e lo scempio continua tuttora.

Da quel maledetto 27 settembre la guerra non si è più fermata: si combatte incessantemente lungo l’intero perimetro dell’Artsakh, mentre i missili continuano ad abbattersi sulle abitazioni dei civili e devastano la capitale.

Armeni ed Azeri, civili e militari, stanno morendo come mosche. Ma potrebbe andare anche peggio di così. I pochi specialisti focalizzati su questo conflitto, indifferentemente dalla loro posizione ideologica, concordano su un punto: se l’esercito armeno dovesse perdere il controllo dell’Artsakh, se centinaia di migliaia di civili Armeni dovessero finire nelle mani dell’esercito azero, si rischierebbero massicci episodi di pulizia etnica.

Mentre l’Occidente si compiace da tanti anni nel ripetere che certi orrori non potranno più accadere in Europa, una nuova grottesca riedizione del Genocidio Armeno si sta preconfigurando alle sue porte.

Nella sostanziale indifferenza del mondo, il popolo dell’Artsakh è strenuamente impegnato a perseguire un solo scopo: sopravvivere all’efferata aggressione azera.

Per contribuire ad infrangere il vergognoso silenzio dell’Europa, nell’ottobre 2020 ho deciso di lanciare un progetto divulgativo dal nome evocativo: Operazione Hayk.

In estrema sintesi, il fine ultimo dell’Operazione Hayk è quello di utilizzare i giornali, le radio ed i social network per far conoscere a migliaia di italiani la guerra dell’Artsakh, denunciare i crimini di guerra commessi dal regime azero e raccontare le drammatiche sfide che il popolo armeno sta affrontando nell’indifferenza dell’Occidente.

L’Operazione Hayk ambisce ad essere più di una semplice campagna mediatica: si prefigge l’obiettivo di contribuire a risvegliare gli italiani dal torpore e far arrivare nelle loro case la voce di un popolo martoriato ed ignorato.

Per dirlo con il più abusato degli ossimori, il silenzio dell’occidente è assordante, e noi vorremmo provare a romperlo.

Il silenzio è complice di questa carneficina. Noi non vogliamo esserlo.

 

Raccolta fondi

L’Operazione Hayk è un progetto che si basa totalmente sul lavoro offerto a titolo di volontariato da parte di Gianluca Alex Proietto e dei suoi collaboratori, ma non è esente da costi.

In primo luogo dovremo acquistare dell’equipaggiamento tecnico specifico che servirà a produrre e montare contenuti audio/video di buona qualità nel difficile contesto dell’Artsakh.

In seconda battuta, dovremo far fronte ad ingenti costi operativi: biglietti aerei, affitto delle basi operative, rimborso delle spese quotidiane dell’operatore sul posto (spostamenti, cibo, varie ed eventuali).

Dopo esserci interrogati a lungo su come reperire i capitali necessari a far partire il progetto, abbiamo deciso di lanciare una campagna di raccolta fondi.

Abbiamo quantificato in 9000€ il tetto minimo per affrontare tutte le spese inerenti all’acquisto del materiale tecnologico necessario, e per coprire i costi operativi di circa 3 mesi di lavoro (due mesi in Armenia ed Artsakh per raccogliere materiale, un mese a fare conferenze in giro per l’Italia).

Tuttavia la nostra ambizione è quella di raccogliere fondi sufficienti per restare in Armenia ed Artsakh per molto più di 3 mesi: per questo motivo vorremmo attivare una piattaforma Patreon e trovare degli sponsor che dal quarto mese ci aiutino a coprire almeno parzialmente i costi operativi. Al termine del conflitto, l’Operazione Hayk resterà attiva con la finalità di promuovere la cultura armena in Italia e di lanciare nuove iniziative di supporto al popolo dell’Artsakh.

Come verrebbero spesi i soldi qualora venisse raccolta una cifra superiore a 9000€?
Questa circostanza garantirebbe fin da subito di poter operare sul territorio dell’Artsakh e portare avanti le attività informative/divulgative per un periodo di tempo maggiore dei 3 mesi preventivati. In base agli importi raccolti, inoltre, potrebbe concretizzarsi la possibilità di affrontare ulteriori investimenti in termini di attrezzature tecnologiche, nonché di fornire dei piccoli rimborsi-spese ai volontari.

Cosa accadrebbe se venisse raccolta una cifra inferiore?
Qualora venissero raccolte donazioni pari o superiori a 4000€, vi sarebbe la possibilità di avviare l’Operazione Hayk in formato ridotto. Con una simile cifra, infatti, sarebbe possibile affrontare i costi di un parziale upgrade tecnico, ma non sarebbe possibile coprire le spese operative derivanti dalla presenza fissa di un inviato in Armenia ed Artsakh. In caso di raggiungimento di una cifra pari o superiore ai 4000€, dunque, vi sarebbero le risorse necessarie all’attivazione della piattaforma divulgativa. Verrebbero dunque attivati e gestiti i canali social, verrebbe postato molto materiale divulgativo/informativo e verrebbero pubblicati articoli sui giornali disposti a fornire spazio al progetto, ma non vi sarebbe modo di mandare il nostro inviato a raccogliere materiale in prima persona in Artsakh.

 

Chi sono

Sono Gianluca Alex Proietto, un giovane italiano dedito allo studio della storia e della cultura dei paesi che sorgono lungo la famosa Via della Seta.

Ho trascorso gli ultimi anni lontano dal suolo italico. Ho affrontato viaggi estremi in bicicletta attraverso le terre selvagge del Kazakistan, della Mongolia e della Siberia, ho vissuto a Tbilisi per 3 anni lavorando come guida storica, ho fatto volontariato in Mongolia e Corea del Sud, ed ho esplorato per anni l’intera Via della Seta con ogni mezzo di trasporto immaginabile.

Dal 2012 il focus del mio studio è sulla storia della Georgia, dell’Armenia, dell’Artsakh e dell’Iran. In particolare coltivo un profondo legame con la nazione armena, nella quale mi reco costantemente e sulla quale ho organizzato conferenze divulgative aventi per tema la storia dell’Armenia, il Medz Yeghern ed il conflitto del Nagorno Karabakh.

Nel 2020 ho iniziato a concepire un progetto chiamato Barbaristan che ha la finalità di divulgare tematiche storiche, culturali e geopolitiche su due aree geografiche ancora poco conosciute dal pubblico italiano: il Caucaso e l’Asia Centrale.

Il progetto Barbaristan si pone come obiettivo quello di promuovere la conoscenza di paesi e territori prossimi all’Europa tanto storicamente quanto culturalmente, ma poco noti alle nostre latitudini.

Allo stato attuale Barbaristan sta lanciando la sua prima campagna di divulgazione su larga scala: Operazione Hayk.

 

Come aiutarmi

  • Facendo una donazione, anche piccola
  • Parlando di questo progetto ai tuoi amici
  • Condividendo questa campagna sui tuoi profili social
  • Seguendo le nostre pubblicazioni sui social
story_txt:
Operazione Hayk
La leggenda narra che nel 2492 a.C. un mitico condottiero di nome Hayk unificò le tribù armene e le guidò in guerra contro gli invasori assiro-babilonesi comandati dal potente re Nimrod.
Gli Armeni riuscirono a sconfiggere gli eserciti nemici presso il lago di Van, e da allora quelle terre presero il nome di Hayots Dzor: la Valle degli Armeni.
A partire da quel momento nulla è stato facile per la nazione fondata da Hayk: gli Armeni dovettero affrontare 4500 anni di invasioni, massacri, genocidi e guerre, ma non si arresero mai.
Nonostante le avversità, gli Armeni prosperarono e svilupparono una cultura raffinata. Contribuirono allo sviluppo della scienza, della musica, della religione, della letteratura, del commercio e dell’arte in tutta l’Eurasia.
Oggi i figli di Hayk sono chiamati a superare una nuova sfida: il 27 settembre 2020 è riesplosa una vecchia guerra che li vede per l’ennesima volta contrapposti all’Azerbaijan.
La posta in palio di questo conflitto è un fazzoletto di terra chiamato Artsakh (ex Nagorno Karabakh), un piccolo stato etnicamente armeno che la comunità internazionale considera parte dell’Azerbaijan, ma che di fatto è sempre stato abitato dagli Armeni e che si autogoverna da quasi 30 anni.
I confini odierni dell’Artsakh vennero plasmati nel 1994 sul campo di battaglia al prezzo di 30.000 morti ed 1 milione di sfollati. La guerra vide gli Armeni trionfare sugli Azeri, ma la comunità internazionale non riuscì a negoziare efficacemente, ed i due contendenti non firmarono mai un trattato di pace definitivo.
Terminato il drammatico conflitto, gli Armeni dovettero fronteggiare una profonda crisi demografica ed economica dovuta al collasso del sistema sovietico ed alla conseguente deindustrializzazione, mentre l’economia azera iniziò a decollare grazie alle esportazioni di idrocarburi.
Sull’onda di questa pioggia di denaro, Baku si rifece il trucco: a ridosso della città vecchia spuntarono lussuosi centri commerciali ed imponenti grattacieli. Miliardi di dollari vennero riversati nello sport, nei grandi eventi, ed in qualsiasi cosa servisse a proiettare nel mondo l’immagine di un paese moderno, ricco e vincente.
La capitale azera cambiò faccia, ma presto emerse l’incongruenza tra la narrazione e la realtà: mentre gli Aliyev edificavano grattacieli scintillanti e sbandieravano i mirabolanti successi del nuovo Azerbaijan, milioni di cittadini vivevano sotto la soglia di povertà ed i livelli di produzione industriale restavano fermi dai tempi dell’URSS.
Come avviene in ogni dittatura, i soldi rimasero attaccati alle mani del presidente-padrone dell’Azerbaijan, ed al popolo rimasero solo le briciole. Presto emerse che la famiglia Aliyev si trovava al vertice di un torbido vortice corruttivo, e che spostava miliardi di dollari nei paradisi fiscali caraibici.
Il malcontento iniziò timidamente a serpeggiare tra la popolazione, ed il regime decise di affrontare il problema con metodi drastici: represse ogni forma di dissenso ed imbavagliò i media.
Fu probabilmente in questo frangente che il regime comprese la rinnovata importanza dell’irrisolto conflitto dell’Artsakh: la guerra offriva la possibilità di indirizzare le frustrazioni di milioni di cittadini verso un nemico esterno da additare a colpevole di ogni male.
Nacque così una propaganda martellante che mirava a disumanizzare gli Armeni ed insinuare un subdolo messaggio nella mente della popolazione: se non hai il pane, la colpa è degli Armeni che te l’hanno rubato. Se non hai una casa, la colpa è degli Armeni che ti hanno sottratto il Nagorno Karabakh.
Ma non basta la propaganda per fare una guerra, ed il regime lo sapeva bene. Il governo azero stanziò miliardi di dollari per rinnovare il suo arsenale bellico ed iniziò a fare shopping di aerei, elicotteri, missili a lungo raggio, droni ed artiglieria pesante in Russia, Israele, Turchia ed Italia.
L’Armenia non riuscì a tenere il passo della sfrenata corsa agli armamenti azera, ed in pochi anni i rapporti di forza tra i due eserciti si ribaltarono.
Così il 27 settembre, forte del suo grande potenziale bellico e sospinto dalle nuove ambizioni imperialiste della Turchia, l’Azerbaijan abbandonò definitivamente la strada della diplomazia e decise di concedere sfogo all’ormai incontenibile odio anti-Armeno che covava in patria.
L’esercito azero attaccò all’alba. Il fuoco dell’artiglieria iniziò a martellare incessantemente sulle postazioni nemiche e migliaia di uomini si scagliarono con forza contro le difese dell’Artsakh.
Le bombe giunsero più rapidamente delle notizie: i civili Armeni si svegliarono sotto i colpi dei droni, dei missili e dell’artiglieria azera. La capitale Stepanakert venne sventrata in pochi giorni, e lo scempio continua tuttora.
Da quel maledetto 27 settembre la guerra non si è più fermata: si combatte incessantemente lungo l’intero perimetro dell’Artsakh, mentre i missili continuano ad abbattersi sulle abitazioni dei civili e devastano la capitale.
Armeni ed Azeri, civili e militari, stanno morendo come mosche. Ma potrebbe andare anche peggio di così. I pochi specialisti focalizzati su questo conflitto, indifferentemente dalla loro posizione ideologica, concordano su un punto: se l’esercito armeno dovesse perdere il controllo dell’Artsakh, se centinaia di migliaia di civili Armeni dovessero finire nelle mani dell’esercito azero, si rischierebbero massicci episodi di pulizia etnica.
Mentre l’Occidente si compiace da tanti anni nel ripetere che certi orrori non potranno più accadere in Europa, una nuova grottesca riedizione del Genocidio Armeno si sta preconfigurando alle sue porte.
Nella sostanziale indifferenza del mondo, il popolo dell’Artsakh è strenuamente impegnato a perseguire un solo scopo: sopravvivere all’efferata aggressione azera.
Per contribuire ad infrangere il vergognoso silenzio dell’Europa, nell’ottobre 2020 ho deciso di lanciare un progetto divulgativo dal nome evocativo: Operazione Hayk.
In estrema sintesi, il fine ultimo dell’Operazione Hayk è quello di utilizzare i giornali, le radio ed i social network per far conoscere a migliaia di italiani la guerra dell’Artsakh, denunciare i crimini di guerra commessi dal regime azero e raccontare le drammatiche sfide che il popolo armeno sta affrontando nell’indifferenza dell’Occidente.
L’Operazione Hayk ambisce ad essere più di una semplice campagna mediatica: si prefigge l’obiettivo di contribuire a risvegliare gli italiani dal torpore e far arrivare nelle loro case la voce di un popolo martoriato ed ignorato.
Per dirlo con il più abusato degli ossimori, il silenzio dell’occidente è assordante, e noi vorremmo provare a romperlo.
Il silenzio è complice di questa carneficina. Noi non vogliamo esserlo.
 

Raccolta fondi

story:
We understand that even those who are really supportive and into a project are not always able to actively lend financial assistance. We’ve all been living through the same trying times. If you want to help out with Veronica: Season One and help us keep going overall—supporting our passion and love for stories well told—give us a share on social media, tell a friend, pass this campaign on. The more visibility we have, the more likely we are to succeed in reaching our goal, and the more likely we are to fulfil our dreams of sharing this story with the world.

You can also show your support for us, and what we do at Unbrandable Media by checking out our currently releasing short form horror project The Living Fears (August 24th) at www.unbrandablemedia.com/thelivingfears or on the project’s Facebook page http://www.facebook.com/TheLivingFears or our supporting videos on YouTube like this one http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6zZFmWxdVc8 and as always, liking, commenting, and sharing are always a big help.

Any support you have to offer means more to us than we can express. Thank you so much for your support. We want nothing more than to share our stories with you… you make it all worthwhile.

 

-The Unbrandable Media production team,

Dennis, Pam, and Kate

story:
Our Creepy Story

Up until now, the Creeping Wave Radio audiodrama has been fortunate enough to have an all volunteer cast and crew. We are proud to have featured some of the finest independent musicians and performers on our show throughout the years. However, with the closures of performance venues brought on by Covid-19, many of our talented artists are now without a spotlight.

We feel that during these dark times its important to shine our own light of appreciation on every actor, musician and score artist who has participated in our little passion project. We want to thank everyone who has joined us on this ride for the past  3.5 seasons with a small cash reward. The money will be given to the artists, or to a charitable cause specified by the artist specifically.

We've been saving up towards out goals, and are contributing $1667 of our own, to let you know we are devoted to the cause- but we need your help. We have accumulated a sizable cast throughout these 3.5 years, and we want to make sure everybody, from day one on, is rewarded for their efforts.

When you donate, you'll be rewarded yourself with exclusive creepy goodies, celebrating the show!

The Breakdown

We have three goals marks, depending on the funding we are able to achieve. If we don't make our goals in full, the money we do earn will be split up and distributed to our talent regardless.

The full cast list for all 3.5 seasons is available at the bottom of the page under "Cast" (the legal names of actors are not featured for privacy reasons).

Roles portrayed by myself (Napoleon Doom) or my partner, Weirdsley, will not be eligible to receive payment.

We are asking for an added $1200 to the cost of gifts for actors, in order to help fulfill the cost of printing and ordering our perks, which will be broken down in the "Perks" section below.

Our First Goal $4750

$10 gifted to actors in minor roles

$25 gifted to actors in major roles

$25 gifted per member to bands that allowed us to share their music as a credit track in the show.

$75 to artists who composed score for the show (in the case of bands, $75/member)

Our Second Goal $8480

$20 gifted to actors in minor roles

$50 gifted to actors in major roles

$50 gifted per member to bands that allowed us to share their music as a credit track in the show.

$100 to artists who composed score for the show (in the case of bands, $100/member)

Our Third Goal $11,715

$30 gifted to actors in minor roles

$75 gifted to actors in major roles

$75 gifted per member to bands that allowed us to share their music as a credit track in the show.

$125 to artists who composed score for the show (in the case of bands, $125/member)

Perks

$25 Donation:  A set of all  Creeping Wave Radio original episode art prints signed by artist.

$50 Donation: All prints plus seven 5x5, die cut, special edition stickers featuring Creeping Wave Radio Characters

$75 Donation: All prints, 7 stickers, plus a set of 7 exclusive, 3x3, acrylic charms featuring Creeping Wave Radio Characters

$100 Donation: All prints, stickers, charms and a comic bundle featuring Lost Bread, Lost Bread Found and Horrorgasm Summer 2020

$150 Donation: Prints, stickers, charms, comics and an exclusive oracle deck featuring characters from the show, created in cooperation with Nyxie Von Rose of Horrorgasm fame.

Recognition

As an artist myself, I realize the importance of being recognized for my work. Too often we in the creative industry are overlooked, or told that if we really loved our craft, we'd be willing to do it for free.

While I am incredibly grateful to have had so many people willing to volunteer for Creeping Wave Radio, it has always been my goal to give back in some way when I was able. I feel like this epidemic has really forced me to take a hard look at what is important to me in my life, and where I should be directing my efforts.

Without art, entertainment and music, my life would be incredibly  empty right now. My own  creative endeavors are only possible because of these talented performers, and I want to do what I can to show them my gratitude.

Spread The Word!

If you can't contribute, you can still help get the word out to others!

Use Indiegogo's share tools to let the world know what we're trying to do here!

Share links to our Indiegogo campaign, our mission video, or...

Introduce people to the Creeping Wave Radio audiodrama so they can discover our talented performers and musicians for themselves!

Get the conversation started wherever you can!

We have accumulated a sizable cast throughout these 3.5 years, and we want to make sure everybody, from day one on, is rewarded for their efforts.When you donate, you'll be rewarded yourself with exclusive creepy goodies, celebrating the show!The BreakdownWe have three goals marks, depending on the funding we are able to achieve. If we don't make our goals in full, the money we do earn will be split up and distributed to our talent regardless.The full cast list for all 3.5 seasons is available at the bottom of the page under "Cast" (the legal names of actors are not featured for privacy reasons).Roles portrayed by myself (Napoleon Doom) or my partner, Weirdsley, will not be eligible to receive payment.We are asking for an added $1200 to the cost of gifts for actors, in order to help fulfill the cost of printing and ordering our perks, which will be broken down in the "Perks" section below.Our First Goal $4750$10 gifted to actors in minor roles$25 gifted to actors in major roles$25 gifted per member to bands that allowed us to share their music as a credit track in the show.$75 to artists who composed score for the show (in the case of bands, $75/member)Our Second Goal $8480$20 gifted to actors in minor roles$50 gifted to actors in major roles$50 gifted per member to bands that allowed us to share their music as a credit track in the show.$100 to artists who composed score for the show (in the case of bands, $100/member)Our Third Goal $11,715$30 gifted to actors in minor roles$75 gifted to actors in major roles$75 gifted per member to bands that allowed us to share their music as a credit track in the show.$125 to artists who composed score for the show (in the case of bands, $125/member)Perks$25 Donation:  A set of all  Creeping Wave Radio original episode art prints signed by artist.$50 Donation: All prints plus seven 5x5, die cut, special edition stickers featuring Creeping Wave Radio Characters$75 Donation: All prints, 7 stickers, plus a set of 7 exclusive, 3x3, acrylic charms featuring Creeping Wave Radio Characters$100 Donation: All prints, stickers, charms and a comic bundle featuring Lost Bread, Lost Bread Found and Horrorgasm Summer 2020$150 Donation: Prints, stickers, charms, comics and an exclusive oracle deck featuring characters from the show, created in cooperation with Nyxie Von Rose of Horrorgasm fame.RecognitionAs an artist myself, I realize the importance of being recognized for my work. Too often we in the creative industry are overlooked, or told that if we really loved our craft, we'd be willing to do it for free.While I am incredibly grateful to have had so many people willing to volunteer for Creeping Wave Radio, it has always been my goal to give back in some way when I was able. I feel like this epidemic has really forced me to take a hard look at what is important to me in my life, and where I should be directing my efforts.Without art, entertainment and music, my life would be incredibly  empty right now. My own  creative endeavors are only possible because of these talented performers, and I want to do what I can to show them my gratitude.Spread The Word!If you can't contribute, you can still help get the word out to others!Use Indiegogo's share tools to let the world know what we're trying to do here!Share links to our Indiegogo campaign, our mission video, or...Introduce people to the Creeping Wave Radio audiodrama so they can discover our talented performers and musicians for themselves!Get the conversation started wherever you can!CastSeason 3.5Major Roles
