story:
Short Summary

Do you personally have a concept of life on this planet without war? If you do, does it seem real?

Right. That's with this radio show and its education is all about. Creating life on this planet without war, and knowing it's real. 

Click Here to listen to a 4 minute audio sample.

Generation Of Harmony integrates so many facets of life with harmony as the common factor. Life is meant to flourish! We do not have to live in conflict...there IS A DIFFERENT WAY! 

If you are interested to read a snippet of my personal story, you can find that here by clicking here. My writing, my creations, my Tools...the more I look at what I've been creating for years and years, it's clear that it's all about HARMONY! Through the course of the radio show I'll be sharing from my personal journey of being a very spiritually gifted individual on a mission to create the absence of domination and war on our fantastic planet! 

This is such an auspicious time to share the insights and the brilliance, to ask the questions that lead humanity to think differently, to relate differently to themselves and to life all around. I have those questions, and this is the platform for me to bring them forward. 

As you help fund this opportunity, you are bringing a very clear voice of unconditional love and awareness to a syndicated, public audience. You are supporting my ability to share tools and awareness that bridge consciousness with business, culture, relationships and personal wellness. Life is not limited to the segregated aspects we identify with. We now have language and ability to bring it all together on a common foundation - Harmony. 

On day 1 we are already being funded! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

To get started with the first 6 months of our professionally produced show, we need to raise at least $2400. That covers production, marketing, branding, syndication and quite a bit of personal support for the host...me! This is just flat-necessary for me to bring my awareness and voice to you. Like I said, I've tried doing it myself and it's just not of service to anyone. For me to shine I need some support - hopefully this will also be inspiration for others to receive support for their gifts as well.

My gifts to share with you are all deeply seated in my consciousness and awareness, my capacity to integrate concepts and systems, and my well-recognized innate ability to bring harmony into conversations and relationships. I listen without judgment and ask questions that might just be the perfect flavor of uncomfortable so the truth can come to the surface. That's what really creates a healing space - the unconditional truth.

We will have guests once or twice per month whose heart and direction in the world are bridging and lighting the way to a paradigm of harmony. Our guests will be from all walks of life - no one profession or area of study can encompass the beauty of our hearts coming together to create a new world. We'll get to hear from corporate facilitators, equine-assisted facilitators and therapists, moms, teachers, community leaders, Uber drivers, friends, and who knows who else will show up with a heart and a message that opens the hearts of others. This is no exclusive dance, my friends. This is about bringing harmony to humanity. 

 

The Important Stuff

This is a short campaign duration! The deadline is March 30th! So our perks are very much based in gratitude rather than physical gifts. 

For gifts of $1000 or more, you will be invited on the air with me for a 10 minute conversation about your gifts, abilities, business and/or service. Let me help you share your light with those who want to know that you are here! 

For gifts of $500 I will share a 15 second promotional announcement for your service, business or message. What an honor it will be to share so much goodness! 

For gifts of $100 or less, I will share a public thank you on air for your contribution to this collaboratively created platform. 

If you would like to be that donor who funds the whole amount, you will be invited as a guest for an entire show with me, and we'll dedicate part of the show to what your heart wants to share with the world.

When we reach our entire goal, the funds will go directly to professional production (and training the host) of the new syndicated show, Generation Of Harmony. Any funds received beyond the campaign goal will be used for marketing, promotion, communications and other expenses involved with running a show of the highest quality.

 

The Impact

We are in a new paradigm of consciousness. This show will fully include and extend beyond any niche of spirituality because hearts are opening in every realm of society. I would love to see this show become relevant in many different communities, professions, circles and walks of life. I would like to bring our common sense of harmony and kindness to one another forward as a common topic in every realm of life.

Your contribution lets me know that you see this as valuable, too. You become a collaborator in making heartful living a "common thing". You are helping provide the opportunity for a voice of unconditional listening, of kindness, of relationships without dominance into the world in a grand way.

I have been interviewed on several international and local shows over the past 4 years. Sometimes it was about my book, Listen Like A Horse: Relationships Without Dominance, other times we were speaking about sacred geometry, about communication and relationships, but each time, the conversation comes back to harmony. 

I've had my writing published in international blogs, providing unique and integrated perspectives about climate change, about pregnancy and communication beyond the physical realms. My books have an international audience and are recognized as both pragmatic and metaphorical resources for living as a peaceful human being. My work has been seen as parallel to NonViolent Communication, and the feedback I receive is that this way of being is a profoundly gentle life-changer. That said, there is plenty of everyday human to express, too! That's kind of the gold, isn't it? That we are bringing these divine levels of awareness right down into our human expression...which is sometimes a little rough around the edges!

This is what I want to share with the world! With laughter, with lightness of being, and with laser-clear courage to see the old ways of being for the obsolete anachronisms they are, call them out and provide strategies and perspectives for a new way of being human. 

It's not that I have all the answers. I'm not claiming to know anything more than the truth as it presents to me. But I do LOVE the conversation, I love asking the questions, and I love being the space that empowers others to step into their own heart and lead simply by their own presence. Sharing from my own journey goes a long way - I've been from the lowest of self-esteem to the brightest light of divine knowing. There's a lot of insight there to share.

 

Risks & Challenges

Here's the thing. I've never done this before. I'm asking for your help with funding because I know I need the help and support from people who know what they're doing! My friends who have radio shows have given me a sense of what it takes to have a topic each week, to book guests, to be "on" when you need to be on. The funding is to provide the foundation that gives me the very best chance at success that I can have. 

I would pay for this myself if I could! Again, here is where I ask for help. I don't have the funds myself to dive straight in, otherwise I would. This opportunity has come to me through friends suggesting I be on someone else's show, then that opens a door to another contact, then that contact opens the door to another opportunity. And when the timing comes together in uncanny ways, you just can't say no. So I'm going for it! 

I will love sharing the journey with everyone on the air. One of my gifts is my ability to share what's really going on in a very real way. To be honest, sharing with that level of openness is cathartic for me. Sharing bigly, sharing vulnerably brings me feedback, every single time, that this is one of my gifts, one of the gifts that when I share, others really receive it. Whatever it ends up being, you can be sure that I'm here to share the truth in a way that will hopefully help others know that it's okay for them to live full-out as well. It will be a journey of perpetual awakening and expansion for myself right along with all of our listeners.

This is my call for support financially and in production. I'm game for the ride. Are you coming with me?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute dollars but you'd like to show your support for Generation Of Harmony, you can help by suggesting topics, sharing the questions you'd like to see me address, sharing the evolution that you see in humanity, or sharing this show with others who may be interested!

Indigogo provides sharing tools - when you use them, everyone wins! And truly, where we are all headed, the way one of us wins is when everyone wins. Let's really live that way and see what life looks like from that stage!

story:
Who Is Involved

I'm producing The Dead Don't Lie as part of my MA dissertation with the help of some of my brilliant classmates at Royal Holloway.  I also feel very lucky to work with David Gaylor, former Detective Superintendent of the Sussex Police, and Annemarie Lopez, a journalist/crime writer.  In the podcast, Annemarie will interview David about his extensive career that has inspired the bestselling book series by Peter James.
 

What We Need

To make this project happen, we will need around £1000 to:

  • Transport our crew & equipment from London to Brighton and back again
  • Feed our crew throughout the day
  • Hire a sound designer to polish the recording


Other Ways You Can Help

Even a small contribution of £1 can make a big difference but as a student, I totally understand that money can be tight.  Even if you can't contribute, please share this campaign on social media to help me spread the word! :)

story:
Why Twin XL?

Laura DeVeau began working in higher education in 1989. With experience at five different colleges and universities that served very different populations, Laura considers herself a 'scholar practitioner' within the field of student development and student affairs. She is well regarded in her profession, and is looking forward to bringing some of the voices of her network to TwinXL for the benefit of the audience. 

Beth Grampetro has been working in college health and wellness since 2005. She is passionate about educating students and helping them make informed choices, and enjoys helping college parents navigate their role as a coach to their students during an exciting and challenging time.

In the fall of 2018, Laura and Beth ran a pilot program with parents of children who were embarking on their first year of college.  These conversations with parents provided Laura and Beth with an opportunity to spread their knowledge and help participants navigate the challenges and triumphs of their child's college experience.  The decision to embark on this podcast is a direct connection to those conversations with this parent program combined with the experience Laura and Beth have had working with parents on their campuses.

Laura and Beth want to help you as you prepare to send your student off to college. If you'd like to know when to get involved and when to back off and how to best prepare your student for the "outside the classroom" challenges they're sure to face, this podcast will teach you all that and more. Laura and Beth know that starting college is an important transition for parents as well, and they want to help you make that transition as smoothly as possible. 

What We Need & What You Get

To get our podcast going, we're working with the folks at Pod617 to provide professional recording, editing, and promotion. We want to offer you a high-quality listening experience. If you can help us to raise funds to pay for production costs and promotional items, you'll have access to a variety pf perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute now? You can help us by spreading the word about the podcast and this campaign.

  • Share this campaign and our podcast website on social media
  • Got a friend who's sending a kid to college? Tell them about us!
  • Want to advertise on the show? Contact us at twinxlpod@gmail.com

story:
Who's Killarney Star?

I'm a piano singer-songwriter who's been writing songs since I was three. Last year my family and I sold everything we owned, became minimalists, and hit the road as nomads. I support us with house concerts and selling merch as well as custom songs and videos. I write, play the piano, and sing as performing artist Killarney Star. 

And the best way for me to showcase and sell my custom songwriting skills is through a very unique new podcast I'm launching in January 2020, called The Three Story Song  - kind of like Song Exploder meets This American Life. I interview everyday people like you and me, find a common thread, and explain how I weave one or more of their stories into a song, all right there in the same episode.

If you're interested in songwriting, honing your writing chops, how music is made, or just hearing some really good stories shaped into art on the spot, you'll love this podcast. I've been a professional writer for over ten years, hired as a pro blogger, an ad copy specialist, a feature editor, and a custom songwriter. I'll inspire you to whittle away everything in your writing - and your life - that isn't your purest art form, and to make your creations shine with your true aura.

You can check out my songs on Spotify, Apple or any streaming service, and my song videos on Instagram @killarney_star and Facebook @killarneystar.

 

What Is Needed & What You Get

Launching a podcast isn't rocket science, but for a newbie like me, it does take funding and training. I've been handpicked for my potential and have been personally invited to attend an exclusive four-day podcasting conference, the New Media Summit, in San Diego in September.

This conference is of enormous importance to launching this podcast because it will:

  • Allow me to network with some major podcasters to get on their shows and expose my story, my podcast, and my custom songs to large audiences.
  • Train me to pitch successfully to podcasters, as well as to host and promote my own podcast.
  • By doing those things, contribute significantly to my holiday sales of custom songs so I can close out the year strong and support my family, doing what I love to do.

My conference ticket is comped, but for airfare and hotel, I need exactly $900. An additional $200 would give me a stipend for meals at $50/ day for 3 meals. (Hey - it's California, and due to an autoimmune issue I eat gluten free.)

And $300 on top of that would get me set up with a podcast editing service like Podcast Polish to help my first episodes sound great and attract more listeners!

And an additional $400 would 100% go towards promoting the podcast on Facebook and Instagram ads, to gain new subscribers as fast as possible!

So you are very generously helping me raise $1800 in total to train, network, and launch this podcast that will change lives. My heart is full!!

 

HERE'S WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:

Everyone who contributes will get one line in a song I’ll write and play on all my social media channels: Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, email, and Spotify/ all streaming platforms (when it’s recorded and released). It will be about a universal theme, and each contributor will be asked a question whose answer I'll use to craft your particular line in the song. If possible I will use your words verbatim!

You can also receive: 

  • A personalized, autographed CD
  • A high-quality Bella Canvas t-shirt with the lyrics to one of my songs
  • A 30 minute one-on-one songwriting session OR 30 minute Skype with me just to chat
  • A package of all of the above 
  • You very own entire custom song (normally $1000) - this very special award price of $500 will never be offered again, and is only available to the first taker at this level. Most custom song writers charge upwards of $1500 to $3000 for a custom song.

 

IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL

I can still use the funds you've helped me raise to attend the professional podcasting conference, and that will put me on my way towards launching the podcast in early 2020.

 

Your Impact

I'm guessing that, like more than 62 million others, you listen to podcasts often, maybe on your commute, while exercising, at work, or while caring for family. Podcasts let light into our souls where we didn't know we had cracks. That feeling when you discover someone's story is so relatable to yours... is like discovering a new song on Spotify or Apple that touches you in a new way.

Imagine being able to hear the stories and experience the songs being built right before your ears. You've discovered an amazing new song that no one knows about yet. But you've also discovered something about yourself - a tenacity, a faltering, a little laugh, an epiphany - that you hadn't realized until you heard that story. And best of all, you've discovered that we all have so many common threads, we're never alone.

Stories change lives. Stories save the world.

You can change everything by helping me create and share these stories and songs.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute or not, there are a few ways you can help. I have such a wonderful social media community of sharers and shouters I am SO grateful for every day! 

Please don't keep this campaign to yourself! Feel free to share it far and wide - it can lead to hundreds of dollars of funds. Someone can get an awesome full-length album CD that can't be found anywhere else until after this campaign; an aspiring songwriter can get my professional help to polish up their song; a few people can get my sunny company and ask me anything about my music or my life for a little while; or some lucky person can get their own song - maybe for themselves or the BEST gift for a loved one!

Simply use the Indiegogo share tools found on this page - it only takes a moment. And if one more person finds out about this podcast because of you, you've shared something priceless - the chance to have a story heard and immortalized into a song we can all relate to.

With my deepest thanks for your good energy, your belief in me, and your contributions,

Killarney Star
story_txt:
Who's Killarney Star?
I'm a piano singer-songwriter who's been writing songs since I was three. Last year my family and I sold everything we owned, became minimalists, and hit the road as nomads. I support us with house concerts and selling merch as well as custom songs and videos. I write, play the piano, and sing as performing artist Killarney Star. 
And the best way for me to showcase and sell my custom songwriting skills is through a very unique new podcast I'm launching in January 2020, called The Three Story Song  - kind of like Song Exploder meets This American Life. I interview everyday people like you and me, find a common thread, and explain how I weave one or more of their stories into a song, all right there in the same episode.
If you're interested in songwriting, honing your writing chops, how music is made, or just hearing some really good stories shaped into art on the spot, you'll love this podcast. I've been a professional writer for over ten years, hired as a pro blogger, an ad copy specialist, a feature editor, and a custom songwriter. I'll inspire you to whittle away everything in your writing - and your life - that isn't your purest art form, and to make your creations shine with your true aura.
You can check out my songs on Spotify, Apple or any streaming service, and my song videos on Instagram @killarney_star and Facebook @killarneystar.
 

What Is Needed & What You Get
Launching a podcast isn't rocket science, but for a newbie like me, it does take funding and training. I've been handpicked for my potential and have been personally invited to attend an exclusive four-day podcasting conference, the New Media Summit, in San Diego in September.
This conference is of enormous importance to launching this podcast because it will:

Allow me to network with some major podcasters to get on their shows and expose my story, my podcast, and my custom songs to large audiences.
Train me to pitch successfully to podcasters, as well as to host and promote my own podcast.
By doing those things, contribute significantly to my holiday sales of custom songs so I can close out the year strong and support my family, doing what I love to do.

My conference ticket is comped, but for airfare and hotel, I need exactly $900. An additional $200 would give me a stipend for meals at $50/ day for 3 meals. (Hey - it's California, and due to an autoimmune issue I eat gluten free.)
And $300 on top of that would get me set up with a podcast editing service like Podcast Polish to help my first episodes sound great and attract more listeners!
And an additional $400 would 100% go towards promoting the podcast on Facebook and Instagram ads, to gain new subscribers as fast as possible!
So you are very generously helping me raise $1800 in total to train, network, and launch this podcast that will change lives. My heart is full!!
 
HERE'S WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Everyone who contributes will get one line in a song I’ll write and play on all my social media channels: Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, email, and Spotify/ all streaming platforms (when it’s recorded and released). It will be about a universal theme, and each contributor will be asked a question whose answer I'll use to craft your particular line in the song. If possible I will use your words verbatim!
You can also receive: 

A personalized, autographed CD
A high-quality Bella Canvas t-shirt with the lyrics to one of my songs
A 30 minute one-on-one songwriting session OR 30 minute Skype with me just to chat
A package of all of the above 
You very own entire custom song (normally $1000) - this very special award price of $500 will never be offered again, and is only available to the first taker at this level. Most custom song writers charge upwards of $1500 to $3000 for a custom song.

 
IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL
I can still use the funds you've helped me raise to attend the professional podcasting conference, and that will put me on my way towards launching the podcast in early 2020.

Podcasts let light into our souls where we didn't know we had cracks. That feeling when you discover someone's story is so relatable to yours... is like discovering a new song on Spotify or Apple that touches you in a new way.
Imagine being able to hear the stories and experience the songs being built right before your ears. You've discovered an amazing new song that no one knows about yet. But you've also discovered something about yourself - a tenacity, a faltering, a little laugh, an epiphany - that you hadn't realized until you heard that story. And best of all, you've discovered that we all have so many common threads, we're never alone.
Stories change lives. Stories save the world.
You can change everything by helping me create and share these stories and songs.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you can contribute or not, there are a few ways you can help. I have such a wonderful social media community of sharers and shouters I am SO grateful for every day! 
Please don't keep this campaign to yourself! Feel free to share it far and wide - it can lead to hundreds of dollars of funds. Someone can get an awesome full-length album CD that can't be found anywhere else until after this campaign; an aspiring songwriter can get my professional help to polish up their song; a few people can get my sunny company and ask me anything about my music or my life for a little while; or some lucky person can get their own song - maybe for themselves or the BEST gift for a loved one!

With my deepest thanks for your good energy, your belief in me, and your contributions,
Killarney Star

story:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.

Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.

Si no nos conoces 

Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.

O suscribirte en iTunes.

O seguirlo en Spotify.

O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.

Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.

Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.

Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.

Y queremos que una de sus paradas sea la bella ciudad de Buenos Aires, en Argentina.

Qué es el No sé, dime tour BUENOS AIRES

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Buenos Aires, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de Argentina para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.

Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.

A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.

Por qué nosotros

Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.

Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 

Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 

a los Shorty Awards...

Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.

Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.

Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.

Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.

Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.

Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.

No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.

El problema

Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.

Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...

Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.

Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Buenos Aires nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.

Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 

Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.

Lo que nos hace falta

  • Al menos entre 600 y 850 superdiamantes en cada ciudad  que compren una entrada a un precio súper asequible.
  • Recaudar con la venta de esas entradas al menos $20,000 para ir a Buenos Aires.
  • Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
  • Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Cómo lo utilizaremos

  • Alquiler del Teatro (entre 30% y 50% de lo recaudado)
  • Merch
  • Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
  • Alquiler de equipos
  • Honorarios de producción
  • Mercadeo de la gira

Lo que ofrecemos

Además de entradas para que nos acompañes a dejar el corazón en un teatro de la hermosa ciudad de Buenos Aires en un show que tú mismo crearás con nosotros, tenemos perks para superdiamantes que quieran y puedan contribuir con un poquito más para obtener desde cosas súper especiales como franelas que sólo van a estás disponibles si hacemos el tour, estar en los créditos de la serie como productores, o hasta ser invitados especiales en un podcast con nosotros (¡la pizza corre por nuestra cuenta!).

Por qué te necesitamos

Hemos estado haciendo encuestas. Sé qué nos hemos puesto fastidiosos, pero necesitamos estar 100% seguros de que en las ciudades a las que vamos hay suficientes de ustedes para hacer esto.  

Te necesitamos porque no sólo no tenemos dinero para pagar la gira de nuestro bolsillo, sino porque si no logramos que esta gira pase hay muchísimas cosas que muy probable tendremos que también dejar de hacer.

El reto

Queremos arrancar la gira oficialmente después del 15 de Septiembre, por lo que necesitamos producir todo durante el verano. Por eso debemos recaudar el dinero de cada ciudad en sólo 10 días. De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.

La idea es comenzar con una ciudad y si logramos la meta, hacer otra y otra y otra hasta que podamos llegar a la mayor cantidad de ciudades posibles.

Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.

Esto es lo que queremos: si logramos hacer al menos 5 ciudades podemos seguir haciendo el podcast.

Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.

Tal vez no vives en Buenos Aires, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.

Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.

Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.

¿Contamos contigo?

Maiah y Gabriel

story:
WE NEVER STOP GROWING!

I had great plans and a timeframe for success when I was younger; what i'd do at 30 and then 40 and then 50 etc. When I got to 30 I realized life had its own tide and some things I couldn't control. But what I could control was who I was to become inside. It was a time of reflection and growth, needed at that stage in my journey. I met many women from different walks of life on the same journey, and it led to great mentor/mentee relationships as we grew together. Fast forward and I founded ALVN to merge my skill in movie making  with a desire to help women grow, believing that in relationships and gentle reflections -  as we are exposed to insightful information - do we change.

On ALVN we have short films, documentaries, personal stories and a conversation forum to bring women together,  so they feel intrinsically valuable and empowered to live their lives to their definition of success. Our newest feature to be added will complete the circle, and this campaign helps with that.

 

OUR ASK

Our technical team needs $8,000 to build a video upload feature on the website that enables our users upload their video stories straight from a smart phone. In addition, this quote will allow us to fix mobile optimization problems and minor upgrades needed on the website. Any amount raised above $8,000 will be used for marketing and PR. 

We are offering great perks, some as exciting as movie credit for you or your brand, or a chance to participate in producing our documentary street series. Check them out! 

Our short films are inspiring, with unique themes. See some of our trailers below:

 

THE PICKLE JAR, TRAILER

SAM, TRAILER
 
Latest documentary trailer, ALVN:Street Stories, Episode 1

 

The impact of this campaign will be felt by many because this feature on ALVN site will do the following:

  1. Give women a way to impact other women through their life experience or story.
  2. Give women a sense of purpose as many women want to be fruitful and give back. Their story is their gift.
  3. Help women understand themselves more, learn something new, and hopefully find solutions as needed.
  4. Give women a safe, positive space to be heard and validated.
  5. Build community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount adds up, so don't think anything is too little. In addition, you can help by spreading the word about our campaign to your circles of friends and associates. 

To find out more about ALVN, visit our website at www.alvnetwork.com 

OUR TEAM

Imeh Esen, Founder/Creative Director

Imeh is an award winning film writer and director with more than 10 years in the movie industry. Her growth in the industry started from working from the ground up to directing her own feature length film, which won three festival awards, and nominated for the 2008 African Movie Academy Awards. She is a recent business school graduate specializing in internet marketing and brand management from the University of Houston. 

 

Dr. Sam Hui, Technical Consultant

Dr. Sam Hui received his B.S. in Mathematical and Computational Science, his M.S. in Statistics from Stanford University and his Ph.D. in Marketing from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He is currently a professor at the University of Houston.

In 2009, Professor Hui co-founded homeprice.com.hk, which has become the top online real estate appraisal site in Hong Kong and has made more than 10 million+ real estate valuations to date. Canvs.tv, a patented (U.S. Patent #9430738B1) and venture-based commercialization based on Professor Hui’s research on social media listening has been named a finalist in the NYU Technology Venture Competition and 2017 ARF Innovator A-list. Canvs has raised more than $9million in seed funding and venture capital funding to date, and is currently used by major TV networks such as NBC, ABC, FOX, Sony Pictures, HBO, Viacom, Netflix, as well as Facebook Watch to track the emotional response of their TV shows. Professor Hui also developed a “player lifetime value” scoring system for Playnomics (acquired by Unity in 2014 and has since become a part of Unity Analytics), a predictive and analytic platform for mobile apps and games.

Imeh is an award winning film writer and director with more than 10 years in the movie industry. Her growth in the industry started from working from the ground up to directing her own feature length film, which won three festival awards, and nominated for the 2008 African Movie Academy Awards. She is a recent business school graduate specializing in internet marketing and brand management from the University of Houston. 
 
Dr. Sam Hui, Technical Consultant
Dr. Sam Hui received his B.S. in Mathematical and Computational Science, his M.S. in Statistics from Stanford University and his Ph.D. in Marketing from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He is currently a professor at the University of Houston.
In 2009, Professor Hui co-founded homeprice.com.hk, which has become the top online real estate appraisal site in Hong Kong and has made more than 10 million+ real estate valuations to date. Canvs.tv, a patented (U.S. Patent #9430738B1) and venture-based commercialization based on Professor Hui’s research on social media listening has been named a finalist in the NYU Technology Venture Competition and 2017 ARF Innovator A-list. Canvs has raised more than $9million in seed funding and venture capital funding to date, and is currently used by major TV networks such as NBC, ABC, FOX, Sony Pictures, HBO, Viacom, Netflix, as well as Facebook Watch to track the emotional response of their TV shows. Professor Hui also developed a “player lifetime value” scoring system for Playnomics (acquired by Unity in 2014 and has since become a part of Unity Analytics), a predictive and analytic platform for mobile apps and games.

story:
We are two sisters who are passionate about three things: stories, podcasts, and cake (but that last one isn’t super relevant). That’s why we are creating Hometown, an anthology audiodrama in which residents of a fictional town share their individual stories with Kiera, a lifelong resident of the town who seeks to find a sense of community.

Our goal in season one of Hometown is to build a strong foundation for the show, so that going forward it can become a space where other artists can contribute their work. We hope to allow other writers an easily accessible platform to share their work, and build a strong sense of community around the show, just as Kiera searches for in the story.

By contributing to our campaign, you can become a part of this community, and help us create Hometown-- a podcast about finding community, what it means to have a home, and the stories that make us who we are.

 

What We Need

It is important to us to create a high quality show, and to pay the other artists who contribute to the project. We are doing everything we can to keep the start up cost low, and 100% of the money we receive will be directly applied to the show. We do not plan on making a profit on this show at this point in time. Your contributions allow us to raise the quality of the show! A few specific expenses for season one include:

  • Pay our graphic designer for the lovely logo she designed for us
  • Pay our composer for the awesome music that he wrote for us
  • Fund the equipment we need to make our show sound great

 

What You Can Get

Depending on the amount you contribute, you can receive amazing rewards such as access to our donor only Discord server, early access to episodes, director’s notes, personalized thank you cards, and even a character named after you or a loved one in the show!

 

Risks & Challenges

If we do not meet our goal, we will still move forward with the project, but we will have to pay out of pocket for expenses. Both of us are fairly broke students, so this is less than ideal. Contributions also allow us the opportunity to create a show of a higher quality.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute to our campaign, we understand! We understand that not everyone is in a financial situation in which that is feasible. But that doesn’t mean you can’t still help! You can:

  • Follow us on Twitter or Instagram @hometowncast
  • Check out our website at www.hometowncast.wordpress.com
  • Use social media to spread the word about our show
  • Listen to our show when it comes out (Spring 2019) on RadioPublic, or wherever you get your podcasts
  • Share this campaign with others who may be interested in contributing
  • Tell people about our show! Tell your friends, your family, even that weird guy you always see at the grocery store (he might like it, you never know).

And that's all there is to it.

story:
We are re-inventing media.

Media has historically been passive. First, it was things you read---books, newspapers, magazines. Radio and television brought media you consumed. Blogs and podcasts were re-configurations of things you read or media you listened to. Social media gave us media you shared. But social media---as we soon found out---isn’t always social. There are trolls. Polarization. Misunderstandings.

So what is next? We believe it is media you actually participate in. What if you could actually talk to people---any time, from anyone in the world---about subjects that really matter? What if every day, there was a group of people you could jump on a phone call with---people who want to solve some of the most difficult problems on the planet, people who are insightful and articulate and helpful. People who want to take action.

One of the most important conversations in the world.

We started The Good Men Project seven years ago to spark an international conversation about the changing roles of men in the 21st century. We soon realized it was “the conversation no one else is having”. No one else was talking about the implications of changing gender roles---which underlies the conversation about almost everything that is important in our society today. Politics. Dads and Parenting. News. Sports. Gender and Sexuality. Racism. Ethics. Mental Health. Love, Sex, Relationships. Environmental Activism. And more. Millions of people (3 million people a month to be precise) show up every month to dive into these topics. People who are both like-minded and different-minded.

Participatory media --- You get to talk. You get to help. You get to be IN the media. With other real live people, too.

But that conversation was still in the sphere of “traditional” media---the written word. Blogs. Comments on blog posts. Social media. Videos. Podcasts.

None of those forms of media were satisfying in the way that really great conversations with real people, in real time, are actually satisfying. No media right now gives people the feeling that they get when sitting around the campfire, talking about the things that really matter to them.

The conversations are about issues YOU care about---along with conversations about the most compelling issues of our time. We are creating and organizing real communities around those social issues where we can push for real social change. 

Social Interest Groups: Like virtual campfires

In the Fall of 2016, we beta-tested an idea called “Social Interest Groups”. We held conference calls every day of the week. We talked about the difficult, provocative, fascinating topics we always do. But we really talked about them, in one-hour group phone calls moderated by trained leaders. Like the best TV shows, the leaders created calls that are both episodic and serialized---so you can easily join in any call at any time. If you attend the calls over time, you find there is a story arc, a build of momentum---and your favorite characters who keep showing up on the calls each week. Instead of mindlessly surfing through cable channels, wouldn't it be better to be able to jump on a call where you can talk to people? Where you can be a part of the media?

Here's what we learned from testing. These calls are truly "Participatory Media." Everyone on the calls gets a chance to talk. Anyone can share insights. Each group call forms its own community that is always growing and changing. You get to know the people who show up on the calls over and over---and see how they develop. But then...YOU can become one of those characters. YOU become one of the people that other callers show up again and again to listen to.

It's different than other media. The real, human, voice interactions are extraordinary. People feel compelled to really listen to others, and talk respectfully. There’s no shock value, no clickbait, no need to sensationalize what is talked about. Some people like to just listen…they often put their phones on mute so they can multi-task---wash dishes, watch their kids, exercise at the gym. It’s got the convenience of a podcast, and some of the calls get recorded so they can be listened to later. But it’s a podcast with YOU in it. You can be a part of the media you co-create with others. The recorded calls, that can later be broadcast, are called ConvoCasts. 

We are re-inventing media. But we can’t do it without you.

As always---we want you to co-create this new form of “participatory media” with us. We want you to participate on the calls, and to help us grow and scale. We want to turn this into something big. To create create a truly new form of media, including ConvoCasts, which are the recorded and broadcast conversations. That is where you come it.

The majority of funding will be used to create more Social Interest Groups and Weekly Calls, so there will be more calls about a greater variety of topics every day of the week. The calls and the conversations that YOU want to have.

Each group leader goes through a training process to become a skilled facilitator and creates topics and conversational prompts for weeks at a time. We need funding for growing and training exceptional leaders. There is also a Facebook group specific to every call, so that participants can communicate with each other, build community, create activism, and stay in touch between calls. The management of the communications all takes resources---but it is what makes the idea so powerful and robust.

The funds raised will also be used to create an app that will allow participants to get notifications by text message when the group is about to start, so they can dial in with one click. The app will also alert participates when a recording is available, so they can easily listen to it from whatever device is most convenient. We are already working on the app with the folks at ViziApps. 

If we can raise just $25,000 we will create 25 total groups. $50,000 we will create 40 groups. With our goal of $100,000---we can create 100 groups over the next year, build the app and add a robust infrastructure that will allow YOU to become leaders and doers. The funds will also help us help us with action items for each group---often the calls are not just with people who want to talk about things, but who want to create real, lasting social change. For example, some of the funds might be used for the creation of a video that talks about men and CTE in football and other collision sports---or to develop and promote a media campaign designed to erase the stigma of mental illness in men. You’ve heard Margaret Mead’s quote “Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.”

We are those groups of people changing the world.

Here are the Social Interest Groups we have now:

#StopRacism

The Disposability of Men

Political Activism

Conscious Intersectionality

Men and Mental Health

Sex, Love, Etc.

#StopSexism

Education

 

Here are the groups we will start immediately with the first wave of funding:

Environmental Activism

Invisible Disabilities

Anti-Bullying

Eating Stereotypes for Lunch: Erasing Gender Stereotypes

Say Yes to Science! Science Advocacy and Activism

Blended Families

Spiritual Fitness

Seeing Trauma and PTSD

Fighting Poverty

Masculinity and Manhood: How are they evolving?

Healthy Emotional Intimacy

Non-Heteronormative Parenting

The Leadership Salon

Caregiving those with Disabilities: Whether you are a parent or caring for a parent

Divorced Dads + Divorced Moms

Co-Creating the Future Together

Pitch Your Idea to Us, We’ll Tell You If It’s Good

Finding Love and Dating in a Changing World

If you help us raise more than $25,000---YOU can help us create the groups that are most interesting to you. And those who contribute $500 or more can co-create a group with us.

Thank you for helping us re-invent media. Thank you for your participation.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone, my name is Kwame Jackson and I am a recent graduate of Xavier University of Louisiana where I studied Biology and Neuroscience. I had the opportunity to study Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of California, Los Angeles and Brown University in my brief scientific career and from that emerged the idea that I now call FULL | DISCLOSURE: BE THE CHANGE.

This year I set off on a journey to 25+ conferences related to science and social justice! I am building a dynamic collective of scientists, activists, thought leaders and community advocates who will help to organize a simple platform that will empower people with applicable knowledge to be the change they wish to see in the world!

So far I have been to 6 conferences and hosted an event in Houston, TX where we had more than 95 in attendance! With so much success so already, someone has recommended that I document this journey on as many social media platforms as possible so that others can experience this journey along with me! In order to do that I will need to hire a partner to travel with me to all of the conferences and invest in some camera and audio equipment for video content!

One of my mentors says that there are three things that you need to do in life: STUDY PRACTICE and TEACH. 2017 is all about studying!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • $7500 will go to conference registration costs!
  • $1000 to camera equipment!
  • $2500 to compensate camera crews across the nation!
  • $2000 miscellaneous and emergencies

First 50 contributors will receive a personal visit from me along the journey for a short Q & A!

The Impact

Your contribution will provide the financial flexibility to ensure an incredible volume of content thru audio, video and written word. This will make it easy for me to share real-time, day to day experiences and perspectives with you and others in the audience. This is so important because without sufficient content, other people will not be able to truly capture the experince of this journey!

Risks & Challenges

The risks that we foresee are related to unexpected changes in conference information that would lead us to have to rearrange travel plans etc. While this is not a major problem, it could disrupt the flow of the journey and or interfere with currently scheduled events!

Other ways you can help!

If you have any quality camera equipment and would like to donate it as your contribution that would work as well! Just message me directly!

story:
Walking down the aisle in a market or bodega can be overwhelming. With so many options, brands are loading the shelves with labels like organic, non-gmo, raw and natural. This makes it difficult to really know what you’re buying, and intensifies confusion in the marketplace. And there are just SO. MANY. CHOICES.

We’re here to help. 

Sourceress takes a deep dive into sourcing with innovators and trailblazers in specialty industries. We provide well researched segments and interviews to empower you to make informed decisions with your purchasing power, from our real life experience.

Why a podcast? Because it’s the most ACCESSIBLE platform to bring you into our world. 

Music Curation 
Each week our Music Curator, and in-house ethnomusicologist, Danielle Maggio curates a playlist as well as a cultural and political music lesson based on the ingredient discussed in the interview! 

Funding

So far, we are self funded and do all recording, editing, writing, design, and music in house. A portion of the funds raised will go to support this endeavor and send the episodes off for final mixing and mastering so we deliver you the best podcast sound possible.

The funds will also go to help us cover the travel costs incurred while traveling to interview these sourcers and sourceresses in their natural environments. We believe that the best conversations happen when people are face to face in the same room and the interviews we've recorded really do reflect that. 

We understand not everyone can support with their pocketbooks, but the good news is the BEST way you can support us is by subscribing to Sourceress on iTunes and Spotify!

 

SEASON 1 - A sampling of some of the episodes we have coming up this season!

Heirloom Corn  
Jorge Gaviria Founder + CEO - Masienda - Los Angeles, CA

Cut Flowers 
Christina Stembel - Founder + CEO, Farmgirl Flowers - San Francisco, CA

Coffee
Heleanna Georgalis​ - CEO, Moplaco Trading  - Ethiopia

Uni  
Stephanie Mutz - Founder + only female sea urchin diver in California, Sea Stephanie Fish  - Santa Barbara, CA

Hemp
Kaelan Castetter - CEO, Castetter Sustainability Group - Binghamton, NY

Spices
Ethan Frisch - Co-Founder, Burlap & Barrel  - Queens, NY

Tea
Ana Dane - Partner, In Pursuit of Tea - New York, NY

Turmeric
Sana Javeri Kadri - Founder/CEO , Diaspora Co. - Oakland, CA

Chocolate
Greg D'alesandre ​- Chocolate Sourcer , Dandelion Chocolate - San Francisco, CA

Oysters
Rob Knect + Sims McCormick ​- Founders , Real Oyster Cult - Boston, MA

Cacao
Jordan Schuster ​- Founder , Fearless Chocolate - Oakland, CA 

OUR TEAM

Colleen King  - Creative Director

Raised in a predominantly Amish community, Colleen has been intimately connected to food systems from an early age. Currently, she facilitates producer and roaster relationships at Collaborative Coffee Source, a sourcing company based in Olso, Norway. Having worked in the specialty coffee industry for the last ten years, she began behind the bar at Intelligentsia, scaled Heart’s education and wholesale program, and has worked in green coffee sourcing and trade for the last four years. Her work has been featured in the International Food Studies Journal, Broccoli Magazine, Perfect Daily Grind, Daily Coffee News, Life & Thyme Magazine, the LA Times, NPR and Bon Appetit. 

Carolyn Kissick - Producer 

Carolyn's many years in the San Francisco restaurant scene comes with to deep ties to the tequila world where she leads trips to Jalisco for industry professionals who are thirsty to learn more. As the legal California cannabis market came into view, she switched her focus to the blossoming industry as a strategist for a family office investing in the intersections of media, hospitality, and greenery. Fondly known as "Kissick" or "CK" to many in her community, her goal in life is to provide everyone with the tools and insight to experience life in the best way possible. Often seen gazing at the sky, smelling pretty flowers, or lighting up a room with her storytelling, experience design is at the core of everything she does. The podcast world came naturally along her strange and wonderful journey and she hopes to bridge the world of academia and millennials one storytelling journey at a time. 

Danielle Maggio - Music Curator

Danielle Maggio is an ethnomusicologist, educator, producer, vocalist, and DJ. As a PhD Candidate in Ethnomusicology at The University of Pittsburgh, her research interests include soul and funk, music industry politics of race, gender, sex and genre, World Music, and collecting, curating, and archiving practices. She is the Associate Producer of Betty - They Say I'm Different, a feature-length documentary film about pioneering funk musician—and now feminist icon—Betty Davis. As a vocalist, she has most recently performed with the Afro Yaqui Music Collective, an anti-colonial and anti-patriarchal ensemble that brings jazz, funk and soul into dialogue with indigenous musics from around the world. An avid vinyl enthusiast, Danielle enjoys spinning deep cuts under the moniker ‘Sauce Queen.’

Because it’s the most ACCESSIBLE platform to bring you into our world. Music Curation Each week our Music Curator, and in-house ethnomusicologist, Danielle Maggio curates a playlist as well as a cultural and political music lesson based on the ingredient discussed in the interview! FundingSo far, we are self funded and do all recording, editing, writing, design, and music in house. A portion of the funds raised will go to support this endeavor and send the episodes off for final mixing and mastering so we deliver you the best podcast sound possible.The funds will also go to help us cover the travel costs incurred while traveling to interview these sourcers and sourceresses in their natural environments. We believe that the best conversations happen when people are face to face in the same room and the interviews we've recorded really do reflect that. We understand not everyone can support with their pocketbooks, but the good news is the BEST way you can support us is by subscribing to Sourceress on iTunes and Spotify! 
SEASON 1 - A sampling of some of the episodes we have coming up this season!
Heirloom Corn   Jorge Gaviria Founder + CEO - Masienda - Los Angeles, CACut Flowers Christina Stembel - Founder + CEO, Farmgirl Flowers - San Francisco, CACoffeeHeleanna Georgalis​ - CEO, Moplaco Trading  - EthiopiaUni  Stephanie Mutz - Founder + only female sea urchin diver in California, Sea Stephanie Fish  - Santa Barbara, CAHempKaelan Castetter - CEO, Castetter Sustainability Group - Binghamton, NYSpicesEthan Frisch - Co-Founder, Burlap & Barrel  - Queens, NYTeaAna Dane - Partner, In Pursuit of Tea - New York, NYTurmericSana Javeri Kadri - Founder/CEO , Diaspora Co. - Oakland, CAChocolateGreg D'alesandre ​- Chocolate Sourcer , Dandelion Chocolate - San Francisco, CAOystersRob Knect + Sims McCormick ​- Founders , Real Oyster Cult - Boston, MACacaoJordan Schuster ​- Founder , Fearless Chocolate - Oakland, CA OUR TEAMColleen King  - Creative DirectorRaised in a predominantly Amish community, Colleen has been intimately connected to food systems from an early age. Currently, she facilitates producer and roaster relationships at Collaborative Coffee Source, a sourcing company based in Olso, Norway. Having worked in the specialty coffee industry for the last ten years, she began behind the bar at Intelligentsia, scaled Heart’s education and wholesale program, and has worked in green coffee sourcing and trade for the last four years. Her work has been featured in the International Food Studies Journal, Broccoli Magazine, Perfect Daily Grind, Daily Coffee News, Life & Thyme Magazine, the LA Times, NPR and Bon Appetit. Carolyn Kissick - Producer Carolyn's many years in the San Francisco restaurant scene comes with to deep ties to the tequila world where she leads trips to Jalisco for industry professionals who are thirsty to learn more. As the legal California cannabis market came into view, she switched her focus to the blossoming industry as a strategist for a family office investing in the intersections of media, hospitality, and greenery. Fondly known as "Kissick" or "CK" to many in her community, her goal in life is to provide everyone with the tools and insight to experience life in the best way possible. Often seen gazing at the sky, smelling pretty flowers, or lighting up a room with her storytelling, experience design is at the core of everything she does. The podcast world came naturally along her strange and wonderful journey and she hopes to bridge the world of academia and millennials one storytelling journey at a time. Danielle Maggio - Music CuratorDanielle Maggio is an ethnomusicologist, educator, producer, vocalist, and DJ. As a PhD Candidate in Ethnomusicology at The University of Pittsburgh, her research interests include soul and funk, music industry politics of race, gender, sex and genre, World Music, and collecting, curating, and archiving practices. She is the Associate Producer of Betty - They Say I'm Different, a feature-length documentary film about pioneering funk musician—and now feminist icon—Betty Davis. As a vocalist, she has most recently performed with the Afro Yaqui Music Collective, an anti-colonial and anti-patriarchal ensemble that brings jazz, funk and soul into dialogue with indigenous musics from around the world. An avid vinyl enthusiast, Danielle enjoys spinning deep cuts under the moniker ‘Sauce Queen.’

story:
Friends, Family, Readers lend me your ear here.

Many of you have asked, and I would so dearly like to see this happen - audio books of the Savanoy Series.

If this fundraising goes well, I would like to expand it to all the books that I write. These stories are not just meant to be read, they are meant to be told. And who best to tell them but us?

So, on April 2, 2020, imagine my absolute delight to find my Savanoy Series being read on Facebook! I missed the family so much and was glued to the FB LIVE, reacquainting myself, reliving the joy and pain and "heat".

It reaffirmed for me just how well the story lends itself to oral delivery. The reader did a fabulous job. She hit the right notes, had the right inflections and of course, her Nation Speak was on point. I would like her to do more work like this for me ... for us.

I want to group fund some audio work, and it IS work. Please consider dipping into your pocket (only if your pocket is not in danger by this virus).

Will you help me?

I am starting small,

Collecting enough to entice the narrator to continue reading Across From Lapeyrouse on Facebook LIVE. As interest grows, we will try to get her to read the entire trilogy over a period of time. We are paying for her time, energy and effort. It isn't an easy job. I have tried it .... whoa ... not easy at all. You are not just reading, you are bringing a story to life.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, I get that, this is a weird time to do something like this. But I know you want to help:

  • Please get the word out, make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • But don't just share a link, talk to your people, tell them just what we are doing. Pass on your passion for the trilogy!

Maybe if we make enough noise, a film producer might hear us .... OOOOOoooo, let's speak it into existence!

story:
You're asking: In a crowded media environment, who needs another website? We're aiming for a new model for accessible, candid, expert journalism. Please give us five minutes of your valuable time to make the case.

Hearsay Culture to Relaunch as the Hearsay Culture Network

Building on a successful  15 year KZSU-FM (Stanford University) broadcast history covering technology and society, the newly-formed Hearsay Culture Media, LLC (HC Media) is launching a breakthrough, sustainable media publishing platform.

HC Media’s mission to increase expert information access, combat misinformation, and enable rational public discourse with transparent integrity. The purpose is to provide the public with accurate understanding that drives our future, rather than being stalled by lack of information. We elevate perspectives and voices that are often lost in media noise.

HC Media's Hearsay Culture Network (HC Network) will translate complex innovations in business, culture, and technology into easy takeaways for diverse audiences. We engage our listeners with candor and insight, both from the interviewers and the interviewees, to get into the minds of those whose thoughts and actions drive our world. We ask the hard questions from a position of transparency and expertise. We go into the "lion's den" to take on controversial issues and policy challenges, conveying clear takeaways and unique insights.

As you confront the challenges in our post-pandemic times, we can help you understand them better and tackle them more successfully. But to help, we need to build the HC Network, and we humbly ask for and need your support.

Overview

Since May 2006, Hearsay Culture (HC) has established itself as a leading outlet for high-quality content covering a range of technology issues, from the internet to robotics to artificial intelligence. Airing on Stanford University’s radio station, KZSU-FM, it is heard internationally via podcast and public programming.

HC has received praise over its 15 year history, from University of Southern California Wallis Annenberg Chair in Communication Technology and Society Manuel Castells (“[An] excellent show . . . in which people can be offered a way to reflect rather than to react”) to being named part of the Blawg 100 of 2008 by the American Bar Association (a top 100 website). Guests and listeners have remarked that it’s a favorite show; communications scholars have called it “agenda setting.” In 2016, HC celebrated its ten year anniversary with a live interview featuring Harvard Law Professor Larry Lessig. 

Over 260 interviews on, we are the podcasting world’s most enduring long-form technology interview show. 

Now it’s time for a new phase that addresses our world’s most urgent challenges. There are no established media outlets in the United States with a singular focus to transform complex societal and technological developments into clear take-aways for a diverse audience. HC Media’s goals are to provide expert curation of complex current topics (like discrimination via artificial intelligence, cryptocurrency, and the emergence of holographic technology) and serve this information in unbiased take-aways in dynamic formats through a new media publishing platform.

With candor and engagement, we will unearth unique insights that help you chart your path and your future.

Using our signature, transparent “we ask the best questions” approach, HC Media will take on the world’s most dynamic trends. Through the HC Network, expert-to-expert interviews (including new exciting interviewers), moderated debates, long-form discussions, video webinars, and curated content will translate complex information into common knowledge, accessible and understandable by all.

Importantly, HC Media’s goals are expansive, but its ethics and integrity remain the same. HC Media will not serve you with endless advertising, or sell your personal data to third parties. We are not mercenaries. Rather, we will continue to offer free programming, like the signature one-hour weekly radio show, as well as additional programming and opportunities for education and networking by paid subscription. 

Who are we?

PROF. DAVID S. LEVINE 

(https://www.elon.edu/u/directory/profile/?user=...) is a Professor at Elon University School of Law and an Affiliate Scholar at the Center for Internet and Society at Stanford Law School. From 2014-2017, he was a Visiting Research Collaborator at Princeton University’s Center for Information Technology Policy. He is also the founder and host of HC, and the co-author of INFORMATION LAW, GOVERNANCE, AND CYBERSECURITY (West Academic Publishing 2019), was a regular contributor to Slate, has addressed and advised policymakers across the political spectrum on a range of intellectual property and technology policy issues, and has been published and quoted in leading newspapers, websites, and academic journals in the US and EU.

HOWARD GREENFIELD

(https://www.linkedin.com/in/howardgreenfield1/ ) is a digital product expert and writer experienced with top Silicon Valley organizations including Apple, Sun Microsystems (Howard created Sun’s first Media Lab), Stanford University, and Xerox PARC. His multimedia background (MA, Stanford) and US and European leadership roles in corporations and start-ups alike has placed him consistently at the forefront of innovation. Howard has written over 100 news articles and books on new technology that have been published around the world. 

Why We Need Your Help 

HC has intentionally refrained from all revenue generation. We have rejected advertising and profits in pursuit of educating our listeners about cutting edge developments that shape our world. This was financially sustainable, as long as HC remained a one-show-per-week program on KZSU-FM with a limited website and platform.

Our expanded HC Network media platform is ambitious, especially in a crowded, polarized environment where media companies struggle for survival. We think our updated programming will make a difference, but we need your financial help to do it. 

We have already recorded interviews with exciting guests, like renowned jazz trumpeter Jeremy Pelt (author of Griot: Examining the Lives of Jazz’s Great Storytellers) and Georgetown’s Lorelei Kelly (one of the nation’s experts on how technology can improve the operations of the US Senate). More terrific guests and new hosts will be joining us in the coming weeks and months! With a more robust website, webinars and networking events will follow.

To sum it up, we want to drive a renewed media culture head-on by creating a sustainable new publishing platform that can be replicated by other outlets and podcasters, with the transparency and integrity that does not sell a commercial message, or your privacy, to the highest bidder. Will you help us get there? Note that by doing so, you are not just helping us, but also potentially helping other journalists and podcasters who may want to provide great content, but haven’t figured out how to make it work in our brutal media environment. You support will help us lead the way!

Where Your Money Will Go

Your donations will finance HC Media’s global release of HC Network's new website and expanded programming. To build a sustainable new media platform that forges extraordinary content, while maintaining integrity, independence, and consumer privacy, we must buy equipment, build a robust media website, and retain applications for serving content. 

The specific costs are as follows:

Website:

  • Website development by third-party developers
  • E-commerce extensions for the website
  • Content hosting and services
  • Content development of news posts and updates, interview insights, social media graphics, and previous programming highlights

Marketing:

  • Growth of marketing programs to expand reach and improve focus
    • Social media platforms
    • Partnerships with business and technology organizations
    • Connecting with outside news organizations for collaboration and syndication development
  • E-commerce business and store-front development for e-commerce and freemium model to enable continued quality and breadth of programming and events

Equipment and Staff (Content Development):

  • Computer, mixing board, microphones, and related hardware
  • Bringing on top interviewers for expanded programming

Perks

While all donors will be thanked on our existing website, for a donation of $20 or more, HC will thank you on its social media channels. For $50 or more, HC will thank you on social media channels and on the air in an upcoming show on KZSU. For a donation of $100 or more, you will receive all of the above plus a subscription to our weekly newsletter, which will have exciting news about upcoming shows and events. For a donation of $500 or more, you will receive all of the above plus a free first year of premium content (once its launched). For a donation of $1,000 or more, you will get all of the above, except instead of a free year of premium content, you will receive premium content for life.

Of course, donations of any amount are welcome, especially in these financially unstable times for so many. If you can’t donate, please share our link with others who might want to contribute.

Please email Dave at dave@hearsayculture.com with any questions or concerns, and thanks so much for reading this far and considering our request!

story:
In June 2016, we launched the Airways Podcast in an effort to bring high-quality, in-depth news and analysis to readers and subscribers of Airways Magazine in a different.

Less than one year later, our podcast has grown to include up to three segments a week: the main episode, a "network beat" segment focused on routes and a "deep dive" that covers airline, aircraft and airport-related topics from Auckland to Atlanta, and Air Seychelles to Aeroflot.  

We never imagined that our episodes would reach thousands of listeners each week, with downloads continually growing and reviews soaring on iTunes. We are very grateful for this and want to continue to build on our success as we reach our first year anniversary. 

This podcast is a joy for us to record each week, but it is also a labor of love. To date, we have funded all of the recording and production costs 100% out of our pocket, 

In order to offer higher quality recordings and better production value, we are asking our listeners for a small donation to show their support for the Airways Podcast. We will use these funds solely to grow and enhance the podcast by ordering higher-quality recording equipment, and putting together technology that allows us to bring on more guests. 

Please consider helping out in any way that you can!  We'd love a minimum donation of $5-10, but every little bit helps and counts.

Many thanks!

Vinay and Rohan

story:
Future Primitive Podcast and Community Relaunch

Dear friends of Future Primitive — it is with great joy that we share with you our plans for a new website and online community.  As divisiveness engulfs many sectors of our interconnected lives, we yearn to deepen intimacy with each other.  Over the last 10 years, this weekly podcast has been a treasure for hundreds of thousands of people, nourishing their souls with heartfelt exchanges between wisdom teachers, experienced elders, and pioneers of consciousness.  It has also been extremely rewarding for myself, as I have shared countless tender moments with our guests.

It is in this spirit that we invite you to participate on a new level as a paying member, so that our exploration into the knowledge of our ancestors can continue to pour into our visions for a hope-filled future.  

- Joanna Harcourt-Smith

The Purpose of this Campaign

The funds raised during this campaign will be used to redesign our website (http://futureprimitive.org) and craft the community offerings that will be housed within the new website.  Tasks include cataloging our archives and updating photo and bio content, new art and branding, server and hosting upgrades, community forum and services design, and last member integration and communications.  The funds will also cover the costs incurred preparing this campaign.

  • The purpose of the campaign is to jumpstart our paid subscription base and to create an exciting new community platform for us to broaden our listenership.
  • We are committed to making this happen, so come join us!

Our New Website & Community Plans

We have envisioned a new website and a community subscription model that will both sustain Future Primitive and create a whole new way for our listeners and our guests to interact with each other.  This will include a secure online forum and communications system, where our listeners, guests and hosts can share their thoughts and creativity with one another.  

For the first five years of our podcast, we were financially sustained by the Marion Institute.  After Marion shifted their assets to environmental and other educational initiatives, Future Primitive has continued through the generosity of our listeners and friends.

Golden Stupa Media (https://goldenstupa.media) will be overseeing branding and artistic upgrades, as well building the website and community forum.

Benefits of becoming a paying member of Future Primitive:

  1. Archive Access:  Logged in members will be able to play each episode in the FP archive.  Once launched, the most recent three episodes will remain available on our public podcast feed.
  2. Forum:  Logged in members will have access to a secure community forum, where previous and current guests, other subscribers and the hosts can discuss episode subject matters, current events, philosophize, and share their creative offerings and projects.
  3. Special Content and Videos:  Audiobooks (e.g. Tripping the Bardo), nuggets from previous episodes (transcripts, juicy excerpts), videos, ebooks, art and music downloads, and more!
  4. Q&A with Guests:  We will coordinate with current and previous guests to hold scheduled and publicized Q&A sessions on the community forum.  Some of these will be live streaming video events.

We have begun building the foundation for our new website and subscription system, but with your help we plan to launch in September 2017!

Rewards

All of our rewards include a community membership, with options ranging from 3 months to two years.  In addition, we offer the following perks on some rewards:

  1. The audiobook of Joanna's book "Tripping the Bardo with Timothy Leary", to be released in fall of 2017.
  2. A fine art print of inspirational poster art by Jacob Aman (https://jacobaman.com).  A preview of the art will be released soon (campaign poster example below).
  3. The paperback version of Joanna's book "Tripping the Bardo with Timothy Leary".

 

Other News - Our Team is Growing!

Joanna Harcourt-Smith and Jose Luis Gomez Soler founded Future Primitive in 2006, and now our team in growing with the addition of Jacob Aman.  Jacob is an environmental scientist, permaculture designer and artist.  Jacob will be joining in on certain podcasts now, as well as hosting shows with permaculturists and ecologists.

So, please share this news about our campaign and new community website plans with your friends and family!

 

Film Credits

Filming / Editing
Katie Teague
https://sacredlifefilms.com

Editing / Art
Jacob Aman
https://goldenstupa.media

Music
Charlie Roscoe
https://charlieroscoe.bandcamp.com/
